============================
FILE: .github\workflows\activate-ci.yml
============================
============================
     1: name: Activate CI
     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   push:
     5:     branches: [ main ]
     6:   workflow_dispatch: {}
     7: 
     8: jobs:
     9:   build:
    10:     name: Build and Test (GitHub-hosted)
    11:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    12: 
    13:     steps:
    14:       - name: Checkout
    15:         uses: actions/checkout@v4
    16: 
    17:       - name: Setup Node.js 20
    18:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
    19:         with:
    20:           node-version: '20'
    21: 
    22:       - name: Install dependencies
    23:         run: npm ci
    24: 
    25:       - name: Build
    26:         run: npx tsc -p .
    27: 
    28:       - name: Run tests (vitest)
    29:         env:
    30:           NODE_OPTIONS: "--experimental-specifier-resolution=node --enable-source-maps"
    31:         run: npx vitest --config vitest.config.mjs --run

     1: name: CI (with supervisor)
     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   push:
     5:   workflow_dispatch:
     6: 
     7: jobs:
     8:   build-and-test:
     9:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    10: 
    11:     env:
    12:       # Supervisor enabled
    13:       QFLUSH_DISABLE_SUPERVISOR: '0'
    14:       QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS: '0'
    15:       QFLUSH_DISABLE_COPILOT: '1'
    16:       QFLUSH_TELEMETRY: '0'
    17:       TAR: '/usr/bin/tar'
    18: 
    19:     steps:
    20:       - name: Checkout repo
    21:         uses: actions/checkout@v4
    22: 
    23:       - name: Ensure system tar/gzip (Linux)
    24:         if: runner.os == 'Linux'
    25:         run: |
    26:           sudo apt-get update
    27:           sudo apt-get install -y gzip tar
    28: 
    29:       - name: Install dependencies
    30:         run: npm ci --no-audit --no-fund
    31: 
    32:       - name: Build dist
    33:         run: npm run build
    34: 
    35:       - name: Start qflush daemon
    36:         run: |
    37:           node dist/daemon/qflushd.js &
    38:           echo "Daemon started on port ${QFLUSHD_PORT:-4500}"
    39: 
    40:       # Optional: wait for daemon readiness (uncomment if you want polling)
    41:       # - name: Wait for daemon
    42:       #   run: |
    43:       #     for i in {1..30}; do
    44:       #       if curl -fsS "http://127.0.0.1:${QFLUSHD_PORT:-4500}/npz/rome-index" > /dev/null 2>&1; then
    45:       #         echo "Daemon is ready"
    46:       #         exit 0
    47:       #       fi
    48:       #       echo "Waiting daemon..."
    49:       #       sleep 2
    50:       #     done
    51:       #     echo "Daemon did not become ready in time"
    52:       #     exit 1
    53: 
    54:       - name: Run tests
    55:         run: npm test

FILE: .github\workflows\ci-run-tests.yml
============================
============================
     1: name: CI Run Tests with qflushd
     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   push:
     5:     branches: [ main ]
     6:   pull_request:
     7:     branches: [ main ]
     8:   workflow_dispatch: {}
     9: 
    10: jobs:
    11:   test-with-qflushd:
    12:     runs-on: [self-hosted, Windows, X64]
    13:     timeout-minutes: 30
    14:     env:
    15:       QFLUSH_TEST_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.QFLUSH_TEST_TOKEN }}
    16:       QFLUSH_SPYDER_ADMIN_PORT: ${{ secrets.QFLUSH_SPYDER_ADMIN_PORT }}
    17: 
    18:     steps:
    19:       - name: Checkout repository
    20:         uses: actions/checkout@v4
    21: 
    22:       - name: Use Node.js 20
    23:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
    24:         with:
    25:           node-version: '20'
    26:           cache: 'npm'
    27: 
    28:       - name: Install dependencies
    29:         run: npm ci --no-audit --no-fund
    30: 
    31:       - name: Build TypeScript
    32:         run: npm run build
    33: 
    34:       - name: Run tests with qflushd helper
    35:         # this script starts qflushd and runs vitest then stops the server
    36:         run: node tools/run-tests-with-qflushd.js
    37:         env:
    38:           CI: true
    39: 
    40:       - name: Upload vitest snapshot (if any)
    41:         if: failure()
    42:         uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
    43:         with:
    44:           name: vitest-logs
    45:           path: |
    46:             ./**/vitest-debug.log
    47:             ./**/coverage

FILE: .github\workflows\ci-safe.yml
============================
============================
     1: name: CI (safe embedded services)
     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   push:
     5:   workflow_dispatch:
     6: 
     7: jobs:
     8:   build-and-test:
     9:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    10: 
    11:     env:
    12:       QFLUSH_EMBED_SERVICES: '1'
    13:       QFLUSH_SAFE_CI: '1'
    14:       QFLUSH_DISABLE_SUPERVISOR: '1'
    15:       QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS: '0'
    16:       QFLUSH_DISABLE_COPILOT: '1'
    17:       QFLUSH_TELEMETRY: '0'
    18: 
    19:     steps:
    20:       - name: Checkout repo
    21:         uses: actions/checkout@v4
    22: 
    23:       - name: Install dependencies
    24:         run: npm ci --no-audit --no-fund
    25: 
    26:       - name: Build dist
    27:         run: npm run build
    28: 
    29:       - name: Start embedded services (plomberie de test)
    30:         run: |
    31:           node dist/index.js start \
    32:             --services "bat,spyder,nezlephant,freeland" \
    33:             --verbose
    34: 
    35:       - name: Run tests
    36:         run: npm test

FILE: .github\workflows\ci-with-supervisor.yml
============================
============================
     1: name: CI (with supervisor)
     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   push:
     5:   workflow_dispatch:
     6: 
     7: jobs:
     8:   build-test-and-start-services:
     9:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    10: 
    11:     env:
    12:       # Superviseur ACTIVÉ
    13:       QFLUSH_DISABLE_SUPERVISOR: '0'
    14:       QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS: '0'
    15:       QFLUSH_DISABLE_COPILOT: '1'
    16:       QFLUSH_TELEMETRY: '0'
    17: 
    18:     steps:
    19:       - name: Checkout repo
    20:         uses: actions/checkout@v4
    21: 
    22:       - name: Install dependencies
    23:         run: npm ci --no-audit --no-fund
    24: 
    25:       - name: Build dist
    26:         run: npm run build
    27: 
    28:       - name: Start qflush daemon
    29:         run: |
    30:           node dist/daemon/qflushd.js &
    31:           echo "Daemon started on port ${QFLUSHD_PORT:-4500}"
    32: 
    33:       - name: Start selected QFLUSH services
    34:         run: |
    35:           # Use canonical service names: 'bat' and 'spyder'
    36:           node dist/index.js start \
    37:             --services "bat,spyder,nezlephant,freeland" \
    38:             --verbose
    39: 
    40:       - name: Run tests
    41:         run: npm test

FILE: .github\workflows\ci.yml
============================
============================
     1: name: CI
     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   workflow_dispatch:
     5:     inputs:
     6:       enable_supervisor:
     7:         description: "Set to '0' to enable supervisor in CI run, '1' to disable. Default disables supervisor."
     8:         default: '1'
     9:   push:
    10:     branches: [ master, main, 'fix/*' ]
    11:   pull_request:
    12:     branches: [ master, main ]
    13: 
    14: permissions:
    15:   contents: write
    16: 
    17: jobs:
    18:   build-and-test:
    19:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    20:     env:
    21:       QFLUSH_SKIP_GLOBAL_INSTALLS: '1'
    22:       # Enable embedded service manager and safe CI mode for plumbing tests
    23:       QFLUSH_EMBED_SERVICES: '1'
    24:       QFLUSH_SAFE_CI: '1'
    25:       QFLUSH_DISABLE_SUPERVISOR: '1'
    26:       QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS: '0'
    27:       QFLUSH_DISABLE_COPILOT: '1'
    28:       QFLUSH_TELEMETRY: '0'
    29:       # Provide test token to NPZ tests (populated from repo secret)
    30:       QFLUSH_TEST_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.QFLUSH_TEST_TOKEN }}
    31:       QFLUSH_SPYDER_ADMIN_PORT: ${{ secrets.QFLUSH_SPYDER_ADMIN_PORT }}
    32:       # Enable cortex bus during CI (set to '1' to start cortex bus)
    33:       QFLUSH_USE_CORTEX: '1'
    34:     steps:
    35:       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    36:         with:
    37:           fetch-depth: 0
    38:           persist-credentials: true
    39:       - name: Configure git
    40:         run: |
    41:           git config --global user.email "actions@github.com"
    42:           git config --global user.name "github-actions"
    43:           git config --global --add safe.directory "${{ github.workspace }}"
    44:       - name: Use Node.js 20
    45:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
    46:         with:
    47:           node-version: '20'
    48:       - name: Install dependencies
    49:         run: |
    50:           npm ci --no-audit --no-fund
    51:       - name: Fix alias imports (convert @utils/* → relative)
    52:         run: |
    53:           node tools/fix-utils-imports.js src/utils src/commands || true
    54:       - name: Build (tsc) and capture logs
    55:         run: |
    56:           npx tsc -p . --pretty false > tsc-output.log 2>&1 || (echo "tsc failed, printing log:" && sed -n '1,200p' tsc-output.log && exit 1)
    57:           echo "tsc succeeded"
    58:       - name: Build optional spyder and apps
    59:         run: |
    60:           if [ -f spyder/package.json ]; then
    61:             echo "Building spyder root..."
    62:             npm --prefix spyder run build || echo "spyder root build failed, continuing"
    63:           else
    64:             echo "No spyder package, skipping root build"
    65:           fi
    66:           # Build spyder apps (spyder-core) if present
    67:           if [ -d spyder/apps/spyder-core ]; then
    68:             echo "Building spyder core app..."
    69:             npm --prefix spyder/apps/spyder-core ci --no-audit --no-fund || echo "npm ci for spyder-core failed, continuing"
    70:             npm --prefix spyder/apps/spyder-core run build || echo "spyder-core build failed, continuing"
    71:           else
    72:             echo "No spyder core app, skipping"
    73:           fi
    74:       - name: Start Cortex bus (background)
    75:         if: env.QFLUSH_USE_CORTEX == '1'
    76:         run: |
    77:           # Start Cortex bus from built dist if present. If not present, attempt to build then retry.
    78:           if [ -f dist/cortex/bus.js ]; then
    79:             nohup node ./dist/cortex/bus.js > cortex.log 2>&1 & echo $! > cortex.pid
    80:             echo "CORTEX started, pid=$(cat cortex.pid)"
    81:           else
    82:             echo "dist/cortex/bus.js not found, attempting to build..."
    83:             npm run build || true
    84:             if [ -f dist/cortex/bus.js ]; then
    85:               nohup node ./dist/cortex/bus.js > cortex.log 2>&1 & echo $! > cortex.pid
    86:               echo "CORTEX started after build, pid=$(cat cortex.pid)"
    87:             else
    88:               echo "dist/cortex/bus.js still missing — attempting ts-node fallback"
    89:               # ts-node is available in devDependencies; use npx to run TypeScript directly
    90:               npx ts-node ./src/cortex/bus.ts > cortex.log 2>&1 & echo $! > cortex.pid
    91:               echo "CORTEX started via ts-node, pid=$(cat cortex.pid)"
    92:             fi
    93:           fi
    94:       - name: Show dist contents (diagnostic)
    95:         run: |
    96:           echo "dist tree:" && ls -la dist || echo "dist directory not present"
    97:       - name: Ensure .qflush config exists
    98:         run: |
    99:           mkdir -p .qflush
   100:           if [ ! -f .qflush/logic-config.json ]; then echo '{}' > .qflush/logic-config.json; fi
   101:           if [ ! -f .qflush/logic-vars.json ]; then echo '{}' > .qflush/logic-vars.json; fi
   102:       - name: Start qflush daemon (background)
   103:         env:
   104:           QFLUSHD_PORT: '43421'
   105:         run: |
   106:           nohup node ./dist/daemon/qflushd.js > qflushd.log 2>&1 & echo $! > qflushd.pid
   107:           npx wait-on -t 30000 http://localhost:${QFLUSHD_PORT}/npz/rome-index || true
   108:       - name: Start embedded services (test plumbing)
   109:         run: |
   110:           # start services via embedded service manager; SAFE_CI will skip actual starts but exercise plumbing
   111:           node dist/index.js start --services "bat,spyder,nezlephant,freeland" --verbose || true
   112:       - name: Run tests
   113:         env:
   114:           VITEST: "1"
   115:           QFLUSHD_PORT: '43421'
   116:           QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS: '0'
   117:           QFLUSH_SKIP_GLOBAL_INSTALLS: '1'
   118:         run: |
   119:           npm test
   120:       - name: Teardown qflush daemon
   121:         if: always()
   122:         run: |
   123:           if [ -f qflushd.pid ]; then kill $(cat qflushd.pid) || true; fi
   124:           if [ -f cortex.pid ]; then kill $(cat cortex.pid) || true; fi
   125:           tail -n 200 qflushd.log || true
   126: 
   127:   integration-dry-run:
   128:     needs: build-and-test
   129:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
   130:     timeout-minutes: 60
   131:     env:
   132:       REDIS_URL: ''
   133:       QFLUSH_DISABLE_SUPERVISOR: '1'
   134:     steps:
   135:       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
   136:         with:
   137:           fetch-depth: 0
   138:           persist-credentials: true
   139:       - name: Use Node.js 20
   140:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
   141:         with:
   142:           node-version: '20'
   143:       - name: Install dependencies
   144:         run: |
   145:           npm ci --no-audit --no-fund
   146:       - name: Build
   147:         run: |
   148:           npm run build
   149:       - name: Integration dry-run
   150:         run: |
   151:           node dist/index.js start --verbose --dry-run
   152: 
   153:   engine-dry-run:
   154:     needs: build-and-test
   155:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
   156:     timeout-minutes: 20
   157:     env:
   158:       REDIS_URL: ''
   159:       QFLUSH_DISABLE_SUPERVISOR: '1'
   160:     steps:
   161:       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
   162:         with:
   163:           fetch-depth: 0
   164:           persist-credentials: true
   165:       - name: Use Node.js
   166:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
   167:         with:
   168:           node-version: '20'
   169:       - name: Install
   170:         run: npm ci --no-audit --no-fund
   171:       - name: Build
   172:         run: npm run build
   173:       - name: Engine dry-run (validate rules)
   174:         run: |
   175:           node dist/index.js engine --dry-run
   176:         timeout-minutes: 10


============================
FILE: .github\workflows\create-pr-from-branch.yml
============================
============================
     1: name: Create PR from branch
     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   workflow_dispatch:
     5:     inputs:
     6:       head_branch:
     7:         description: 'Branch name to create PR from'
     8:         required: true
     9:         default: 'feat/tools-encoders'
    10:       base_branch:
    11:         description: 'Target base branch'
    12:         required: true
    13:         default: 'main'
    14:       title:
    15:         description: 'PR title'
    16:         required: true
    17:         default: 'feat(tools): add encoders and css encoder/decoder'
    18:       body:
    19:         description: 'PR body'
    20:         required: false
    21:         default: 'Add tools: tools/rgba_brotli_oc8.py, tools/css_encode.js, tools/css_decode.js.'
    22: 
    23: jobs:
    24:   create-pr:
    25:     # prevent self-dispatch loops when workflow is invoked by GitHub Actions
    26:     if: "${{ github.actor != 'github-actions[bot]' }}"
    27:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    28:     steps:
    29:       - name: Create PR via REST API
    30:         env:
    31:           GH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
    32:           GITHUB_API_URL: https://api.github.com
    33:         run: |
    34:           if [ -z "$GH_TOKEN" ]; then
    35:             echo "ERROR: GITHUB_TOKEN is not available in environment." >&2
    36:             exit 1
    37:           fi
    38:           echo "Creating PR from '${{ github.event.inputs.head_branch }}' -> '${{ github.event.inputs.base_branch }}'"
    39:           payload=$(jq -n --arg title "${{ github.event.inputs.title }}" --arg head "${{ github.event.inputs.head_branch }}" --arg base "${{ github.event.inputs.base_branch }}" --arg body "${{ github.event.inputs.body }}" '{title:$title,head:$head,base:$base,body:$body}')
    40:           echo "$payload" | jq .
    41:           resp=$(curl -s -H "Authorization: Bearer $GH_TOKEN" -H "Accept: application/vnd.github+json" -H "User-Agent: qflush-bot" "$GITHUB_API_URL/repos/${{ github.repository }}/pulls" -d @-)
    42:           echo "$resp" | jq .
    43:           url=$(echo "$resp" | jq -r .html_url)
    44:           if [ "$url" = "null" ] || [ -z "$url" ]; then
    45:             echo "Failed to create PR; response above." >&2
    46:             exit 1
    47:           fi
    48:           echo "PR created: $url"


============================
FILE: .github\workflows\get-installation-token.yml
============================
============================
     1: name: Get GitHub App Installation Token
     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   workflow_dispatch:
     5: 
     6: permissions:
     7:   contents: read
     8: 
     9: jobs:
    10:   get-token:
    11:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    12:     steps:
    13:       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    14:         with:
    15:           fetch-depth: 0
    16: 
    17:       - name: Use Node.js 20
    18:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
    19:         with:
    20:           node-version: '20'
    21: 
    22:       - name: Install @octokit/auth-app
    23:         run: |
    24:           npm install @octokit/auth-app --no-audit --no-fund
    25: 
    26:       - name: Write private key to file (from secret)
    27:         env:
    28:           PRIVATE_KEY_PEM: ${{ secrets.PRIVATE_KEY_PEM }}
    29:         run: |
    30:           set -euo pipefail
    31:           printf '%s' "$PRIVATE_KEY_PEM" > private.pem
    32:           # trim surrounding quotes if any
    33:           sed -i "1s/^['\"]//;\$s/['\"]$//" private.pem || true
    34:           echo "Private key head:"; sed -n '1,5p' private.pem || true
    35: 
    36:           # If OpenSSH format, convert to PEM
    37:           if grep -q "BEGIN OPENSSH PRIVATE KEY" private.pem; then
    38:             echo "Detected OpenSSH private key — converting to PEM"
    39:             ssh-keygen -p -f private.pem -m PEM -N "" || true
    40:           fi
    41: 
    42:           # Fail if encrypted
    43:           if grep -q "ENCRYPTED" private.pem || grep -q "Proc-Type: 4,ENCRYPTED" private.pem; then
    44:             echo "ERROR: provided private key appears to be encrypted. Provide an unencrypted PEM or convert locally."
    45:             exit 1
    46:           fi
    47: 
    48:           # export path for helper
    49:           echo "GITHUB_PRIVATE_KEY_FILE=$(pwd)/private.pem" >> $GITHUB_ENV
    50: 
    51:       - name: Obtain installation token
    52:         id: get_token
    53:         env:
    54:           APP_ID: ${{ secrets.APP_ID }}
    55:           INSTALLATION_ID: ${{ secrets.INSTALLATION_ID }}
    56:           GITHUB_APP_ID: ${{ secrets.APP_ID }}
    57:           GITHUB_INSTALLATION_ID: ${{ secrets.INSTALLATION_ID }}
    58:           GITHUB_PRIVATE_KEY_FILE: ${{ env.GITHUB_PRIVATE_KEY_FILE }}
    59:         run: |
    60:           node tools/get-installation-token.js > token.txt
    61:           echo "::add-mask::$(cat token.txt)"
    62:           echo "token=$(cat token.txt)" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
    63: 
    64:       - name: Use installation token (list installation repositories)
    65:         if: success()
    66:         env:
    67:           INSTALL_TOKEN: ${{ steps.get_token.outputs.token }}
    68:         run: |
    69:           set -euo pipefail
    70:           # mask token in logs
    71:           echo "::add-mask::$INSTALL_TOKEN"
    72:           echo "Calling GitHub API with installation token..."
    73:           curl -s -H "Authorization: Bearer $INSTALL_TOKEN" -H "Accept: application/vnd.github+json" https://api.github.com/installation/repositories > installation-repos.json || true
    74:           echo "Wrote installation-repos.json (masked token)."
    75: 
    76:       - name: Upload token artifact
    77:         if: success()
    78:         uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
    79:         with:
    80:           name: installation-token
    81:           path: |
    82:             token.txt
    83:             installation-repos.json
    84: 
    85:       - name: Show success
    86:         run: |
    87:           echo "Installation token obtained, API result and token uploaded as artifact (masked)."


============================
FILE: .github\workflows\netlify-deploy.yml
============================
============================
     1: name: Deploy to Netlify
     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   workflow_dispatch:
     5: 
     6: jobs:
     7:   build-and-deploy:
     8:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
     9:     steps:
    10:       - name: Checkout
    11:         uses: actions/checkout@v4
    12:         with:
    13:           submodules: 'false'
    14: 
    15:       - name: Setup Node
    16:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
    17:         with:
    18:           node-version: '18'
    19: 
    20:       - name: Install dependencies
    21:         run: |
    22:           npm ci
    23: 
    24:       - name: Build
    25:         run: |
    26:           npm run prebuild || true
    27:           npm run build
    28: 
    29:       - name: Install Netlify CLI
    30:         run: |
    31:           npm i -g netlify-cli
    32: 
    33:       - name: Deploy to Netlify
    34:         env:
    35:           NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN }}
    36:           NETLIFY_SITE_NAME: '"qflash-funesterie"  # suggested site name, will be adjusted'
    37:           NETLIFY_DEPLOY_DIR: "dist"
    38:         run: |
    39:           set -e
    40:           netlify sites:create --name "$NETLIFY_SITE_NAME" --json || true
    41:           SITE_ID=$(netlify sites:list --json | jq -r ".[] | select(.name==\"$NETLIFY_SITE_NAME\") | .id")
    42:           echo "SITE_ID=$SITE_ID"
    43:           netlify deploy --dir="$NETLIFY_DEPLOY_DIR" --prod --site=$SITE_ID
    44:           echo "Deployed to site $SITE_ID"


============================
FILE: .github\workflows\netlify-enable-https.yml
============================
============================
     1: name: Netlify Enable HTTPS
     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   workflow_dispatch:
     5: 
     6: jobs:
     7:   enable-https:
     8:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
     9:     steps:
    10:       - name: Checkout
    11:         uses: actions/checkout@v4
    12: 
    13:       - name: Setup tools
    14:         run: |
    15:           sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install -y jq curl
    16:           npm i -g netlify-cli
    17: 
    18:       - name: Enable HTTPS (force SSL)
    19:         env:
    20:           NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN }}
    21:           NETLIFY_SITE_NAME: "qflash-funesterie"
    22:         run: |
    23:           set -e
    24:           SITE_ID=$(netlify sites:list --json | jq -r ".[] | select(.name==\"${NETLIFY_SITE_NAME}\") | .id")
    25:           if [ -z "$SITE_ID" ] || [ "$SITE_ID" = "null" ]; then
    26:             echo "Site not found: ${NETLIFY_SITE_NAME}"
    27:             exit 1
    28:           fi
    29:           echo "Found site: $SITE_ID"
    30:           # enable force_ssl via Netlify API
    31:           echo "Enabling force_ssl for site $SITE_ID"
    32:           curl -s -X PATCH "https://api.netlify.com/api/v1/sites/$SITE_ID" \
    33:             -H "Authorization: Bearer $NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN" \
    34:             -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
    35:             -d '{"force_ssl":true}' | jq .
    36:           echo "HTTPS (force SSL) enabled (request sent)."
    37: 
    38:       - name: Ensure domain alias
    39:         env:
    40:           NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN }}
    41:           NETLIFY_SITE_NAME: "qflash-funesterie"
    42:         run: |
    43:           set -e
    44:           SITE_ID=$(netlify sites:list --json | jq -r ".[] | select(.name==\"${NETLIFY_SITE_NAME}\") | .id")
    45:           DOMAIN="qflash.funesterie.pro"
    46:           # add domain alias if not present
    47:           EXISTS=$(netlify domains:list --site $SITE_ID --json | jq -r ".[] | select(.hostname==\"$DOMAIN\") | .id" || true)
    48:           if [ -z "$EXISTS" ]; then
    49:             echo "Adding domain $DOMAIN to site $SITE_ID"
    50:             netlify domains:add $DOMAIN --site $SITE_ID || true
    51:           else
    52:             echo "Domain $DOMAIN already added"
    53:           fi
    54:           # show domain status
    55:           netlify domains:list --site $SITE_ID --json | jq .


============================
FILE: .github\workflows\netlify-set-env.yml
============================
============================
     1: name: Configure Netlify Site Env
     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   workflow_dispatch:
     5: 
     6: jobs:
     7:   set-env:
     8:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
     9:     steps:
    10:       - name: Checkout
    11:         uses: actions/checkout@v4
    12: 
    13:       - name: Setup tools
    14:         run: |
    15:           sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install -y jq
    16:           npm i -g netlify-cli
    17: 
    18:       - name: Find or create site
    19:         env:
    20:           NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN }}
    21:           NETLIFY_SITE_NAME: "qflash-funesterie"
    22:         run: |
    23:           set -e
    24:           # attempt to find site id by name
    25:           SITE_ID=$(netlify sites:list --json | jq -r ".[] | select(.name==\"${NETLIFY_SITE_NAME}\") | .id" )
    26:           if [ -z "$SITE_ID" ] || [ "$SITE_ID" = "null" ]; then
    27:             echo "site not found, creating"
    28:             netlify sites:create --name "${NETLIFY_SITE_NAME}" --json
    29:             SITE_ID=$(netlify sites:list --json | jq -r ".[] | select(.name==\"${NETLIFY_SITE_NAME}\") | .id" )
    30:           fi
    31:           echo "SITE_ID=$SITE_ID"
    32:           echo "SITE_ID=$SITE_ID" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
    33: 
    34:       - name: Set Netlify env vars
    35:         env:
    36:           NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN }}
    37:           SITE_ID: ${{ steps.find_or_create_site.outputs.SITE_ID || '' }}
    38:           APP_ID: ${{ secrets.APP_ID }}
    39:           APP_SECRET: ${{ secrets.APP_SECRET }}
    40:           GUMROAD_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GUMROAD_TOKEN }}
    41:           GUMROAD_PRODUCT_ID: ${{ secrets.GUMROAD_PRODUCT_ID }}
    42:           DAEMON_URL: "https://qflash.funesterie.pro"
    43:         run: |
    44:           set -e
    45:           # fallback: read site id via name
    46:           if [ -z "$SITE_ID" ]; then
    47:             SITE_ID=$(netlify sites:list --json | jq -r ".[] | select(.name==\"qflash-funesterie\") | .id" )
    48:           fi
    49:           echo "Using site: $SITE_ID"
    50:           # helper to set if value exists
    51:           set_env_if() {
    52:             KEY=$1; VAL=$2; if [ -n "$VAL" ] && [ "$VAL" != "null" ]; then netlify env:set $KEY "$VAL" --site $SITE_ID; fi
    53:           }
    54:           set_env_if "APP_ID" "$APP_ID"
    55:           set_env_if "APP_SECRET" "$APP_SECRET"
    56:           set_env_if "GUMROAD_TOKEN" "$GUMROAD_TOKEN"
    57:           set_env_if "GUMROAD_PRODUCT_ID" "$GUMROAD_PRODUCT_ID"
    58:           set_env_if "DAEMON_URL" "$DAEMON_URL"
    59:           echo "Env vars set"
    60: 
    61:       - name: Output site info
    62:         env:
    63:           NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN }}
    64:         run: |
    65:           netlify sites:list --json | jq -r ".[] | select(.name==\"qflash-funesterie\") | {name:.name,id:.id,ssl:.ssl,custom_domain: .custom_domain,default_domain:.default_domain}" || true


============================
FILE: .github\workflows\publish-gumroad.yml
============================
============================
     1: name: Publish VSIX to Gumroad
     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   workflow_dispatch:
     5:   release:
     6:     types: [published]
     7: 
     8: jobs:
     9:   publish-gumroad:
    10:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    11:     steps:
    12:       - name: Checkout
    13:         uses: actions/checkout@v4
    14: 
    15:       - name: Setup Node
    16:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
    17:         with:
    18:           node-version: '18'
    19: 
    20:       - name: Build extension
    21:         run: |
    22:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
    23:           npm ci --no-audit --no-fund
    24:           npm run build
    25:           npx vsce package --no-dependencies
    26: 
    27:       - name: Upload VSIX to Release
    28:         if: github.event_name == 'release'
    29:         run: |
    30:           gh release upload ${{ github.event.release.tag_name }} extensions/vscode-npz/*.vsix --clobber
    31: 
    32:       - name: Upload to Gumroad
    33:         env:
    34:           GUMROAD_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GUMROAD_TOKEN }}
    35:           GUMROAD_PRODUCT_ID: ${{ secrets.GUMROAD_PRODUCT_ID }}
    36:         run: |
    37:           VSIX=$(ls extensions/vscode-npz/*.vsix | head -n 1)
    38:           if [ -z "$VSIX" ]; then echo "No VSIX found"; exit 1; fi
    39:           echo "Uploading $VSIX to Gumroad product $GUMROAD_PRODUCT_ID"
    40:           # Use curl to upload file to Gumroad (replace endpoint as needed)
    41:           curl -s -X POST "https://api.gumroad.com/v2/products/$GUMROAD_PRODUCT_ID/attachments" \
    42:             -F "access_token=$GUMROAD_TOKEN" \
    43:             -F "file=@${VSIX}" \
    44:             -F "name=qflash-vsix" \
    45:             -F "description=VSIX for release ${{ github.ref }}" \
    46:             -o /tmp/gumroad-upload.json
    47:           cat /tmp/gumroad-upload.json


============================
FILE: .github\workflows\publish-on-release.yml
============================
============================
     1: name: Publish on Release
     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   workflow_dispatch: {}
     5:   release:
     6:     types: [published]
     7: 
     8: jobs:
     9:   CI:
    10:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    11:     steps:
    12:       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    13:         with:
    14:           submodules: false
    15:       - run: echo "CI check placeholder"
    16: 
    17:   publish:
    18:     needs: [CI]
    19:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    20:     steps:
    21:       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    22:         with:
    23:           submodules: false
    24:       - name: Use Node.js
    25:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
    26:         with:
    27:           node-version: '20.18.1'
    28:           registry-url: 'https://registry.npmjs.org'
    29:       - name: Publish to npm
    30:         env:
    31:           NODE_AUTH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NPM_TOKEN }}
    32:         run: |
    33:           npm install --no-audit --no-fund
    34:           npm run build
    35:           npm publish --access public

FILE: .github\workflows\publish-open-vsx-ci.yml
============================
============================
     1: name: Publish to Open VSX (CI)
     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   push:
     5:     tags:
     6:       - 'v*'
     7: 
     8: jobs:
     9:   publish-open-vsx:
    10:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    11:     steps:
    12:       - name: Checkout
    13:         uses: actions/checkout@v4
    14: 
    15:       - name: Setup Node
    16:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
    17:         with:
    18:           node-version: '18'
    19: 
    20:       - name: Install dependencies
    21:         run: |
    22:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
    23:           npm ci
    24: 
    25:       - name: Build extension
    26:         run: |
    27:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
    28:           npm run build
    29: 
    30:       - name: Publish to Open VSX
    31:         env:
    32:           OPEN_VSX_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.OPEN_VSX_TOKEN }}
    33:         run: |
    34:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
    35:           npx ovsx publish --pat "$OPEN_VSX_TOKEN"


============================
FILE: .github\workflows\publish-open-vsx.yml
============================
============================
     1: name: Publish to Open VSX
     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   workflow_dispatch: {}
     5:   release:
     6:     types: [published]
     7: 
     8: jobs:
     9:   publish-open-vsx:
    10:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    11:     env:
    12:       OPEN_VSX_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.OPEN_VSX_TOKEN }}
    13:       NODE_OPTIONS: "-r ${{ github.workspace }}/extensions/vscode-npz/src/polyfill-file.js"
    14:     steps:
    15:       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    16:         with:
    17:           submodules: false
    18:       - name: Setup Node
    19:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
    20:         with:
    21:           node-version: '20.18.1'
    22:       - name: Validate token (warning only)
    23:         run: |
    24:           if [ -z "${OPEN_VSX_TOKEN}" ]; then echo "OPEN_VSX_TOKEN is not set - Open VSX publish will be skipped"; else echo "OPEN_VSX_TOKEN is set"; fi
    25:       - name: Install dependencies
    26:         run: |
    27:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
    28:           if [ -f package-lock.json ]; then npm ci; else npm install --no-audit --no-fund; fi
    29:       - name: Package .vsix
    30:         run: |
    31:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
    32:           npx @vscode/vsce package
    33:       - name: Upload VSIX artifact for debugging
    34:         uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
    35:         with:
    36:           name: qflush-vsix
    37:           path: extensions/vscode-npz/*.vsix
    38:       - name: Publish to Open VSX (runtime)
    39:         run: |
    40:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
    41:           if [ -z "${OPEN_VSX_TOKEN}" ]; then echo "OPEN_VSX_TOKEN missing - skip"; exit 0; fi
    42:           npx ovsx publish *.vsix --pat $OPEN_VSX_TOKEN || echo 'Open VSX publish failed'

FILE: .github\workflows\publish-vs-marketplace.yml
============================
============================
     1: name: Publish to Visual Studio Marketplace
     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   workflow_dispatch: {}
     5:   release:
     6:     types: [published]
     7: 
     8: jobs:
     9:   publish-vs-marketplace:
    10:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    11:     env:
    12:       AZURE_PAT: ${{ secrets.AZURE_PAT }}
    13:       NODE_OPTIONS: "-r ${{ github.workspace }}/extensions/vscode-npz/src/polyfill-file.js"
    14:     steps:
    15:       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    16:         with:
    17:           submodules: false
    18:       - name: Setup Node
    19:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
    20:         with:
    21:           node-version: '20.18.1'
    22:       - name: Validate AZURE_PAT (warning)
    23:         run: |
    24:           if [ -z "${AZURE_PAT}" ]; then echo "AZURE_PAT is missing - Marketplace publish will be skipped"; else echo "AZURE_PAT is set"; fi
    25:       - name: Install deps and build extension
    26:         run: |
    27:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
    28:           if [ -f package-lock.json ]; then npm ci; else npm install --no-audit --no-fund; fi
    29:           npm run build || true
    30:       - name: Package VSIX
    31:         run: |
    32:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
    33:           npx @vscode/vsce package
    34:       - name: Upload VSIX artifact
    35:         uses: actions/upload-artifact@v3
    36:         with:
    37:           name: qflush-vsix
    38:           path: extensions/vscode-npz/*.vsix
    39:       - name: Publish to Visual Studio Marketplace (runtime)
    40:         run: |
    41:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
    42:           if [ -z "${AZURE_PAT}" ]; then echo "AZURE_PAT missing - skip"; exit 0; fi
    43:           npx @vscode/vsce publish --pat $AZURE_PAT || echo 'VSCE publish failed'

FILE: .github\workflows\publish-vsce.yml
============================
============================
     1: name: Publish VS Code Marketplace
     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   push:
     5:     tags:
     6:       - 'v*'
     7: 
     8: jobs:
     9:   publish-vsce:
    10:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    11:     steps:
    12:       - name: Checkout
    13:         uses: actions/checkout@v4
    14: 
    15:       - name: Setup Node
    16:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
    17:         with:
    18:           node-version: '18'
    19: 
    20:       - name: Validate tokens
    21:         run: |
    22:           if [ -z "${{ secrets.VSCE_TOKEN }}" ]; then echo "VSCE_TOKEN is missing"; exit 1; fi
    23: 
    24:       - name: Install and build extension
    25:         run: |
    26:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
    27:           npm ci --no-audit --no-fund
    28:           npm run build
    29: 
    30:       - name: Publish to Marketplace (VSCE)
    31:         env:
    32:           VSCE_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.VSCE_TOKEN }}
    33:         run: |
    34:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
    35:           npx vsce publish --pat "$VSCE_TOKEN" || npx vsce package

FILE: .github\workflows\publish-vscode-extension.yml
============================
============================
     1: name: Publish VS Code Extension
     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   push:
     5:     tags:
     6:       - 'v*'
     7: 
     8: jobs:
     9:   publish:
    10:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    11:     steps:
    12:       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    13:       - name: Setup Node
    14:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
    15:         with:
    16:           node-version: '18'
    17:       - name: Validate tokens
    18:         run: |
    19:           if [ -z "${{ secrets.NPM_TOKEN }}" ]; then echo "NPM_TOKEN is missing"; exit 1; fi
    20:           if [ -z "${{ secrets.VSCE_TOKEN }}" ]; then echo "VSCE_TOKEN is missing"; exit 1; fi
    21:           if [ -z "${{ secrets.GUMROAD_TOKEN }}" ]; then echo "Warning: GUMROAD_TOKEN is not set"; fi
    22:       - name: Install dependencies
    23:         run: |
    24:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
    25:           npm ci --no-audit --no-fund
    26:       - name: Build extension
    27:         run: |
    28:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
    29:           npm run build
    30:       - name: Package and publish
    31:         env:
    32:           VSCE_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.VSCE_TOKEN }}
    33:         run: |
    34:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
    35:           npx vsce publish --pat $VSCE_TOKEN || npx vsce package


============================
FILE: .github\workflows\publish-vscode.yml
============================
============================
     1: name: Publish VS Code extension
     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   workflow_dispatch:
     5:   push:
     6:     tags:
     7:       - 'v*'
     8: 
     9: jobs:
    10:   build:
    11:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    12:     env:
    13:       OPEN_VSX_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.OPEN_VSX_TOKEN }}
    14:       VSCE_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.VSCE_TOKEN }}
    15:       NODE_OPTIONS: "-r ${{ github.workspace }}/extensions/vscode-npz/src/polyfill-file.js"
    16:     steps:
    17:       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    18:       - name: Use Node.js
    19:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
    20:         with:
    21:           node-version: '20'
    22:       - name: Install dependencies
    23:         run: |
    24:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
    25:           if [ -f package-lock.json ]; then npm ci; else npm install --no-audit --no-fund; fi
    26:       - name: Build extension
    27:         run: |
    28:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
    29:           npm run build
    30:       - name: Package .vsix
    31:         run: |
    32:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
    33:           npx @vscode/vsce package
    34:       - name: Publish to Open VSX (runtime check)
    35:         run: |
    36:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
    37:           if [ -z "${OPEN_VSX_TOKEN}" ]; then echo "OPEN_VSX_TOKEN not set - skipping Open VSX publish"; exit 0; fi
    38:           npx ovsx publish --pat "$OPEN_VSX_TOKEN" || echo 'Open VSX publish failed'
    39:       - name: Publish to VS Marketplace (runtime check)
    40:         run: |
    41:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
    42:           if [ -z "${VSCE_TOKEN}" ]; then echo "VSCE_TOKEN not set - skipping VS Marketplace publish"; exit 0; fi
    43:           npx @vscode/vsce publish --pat "$VSCE_TOKEN" || echo 'VSCE publish failed'

============================
FILE: .github\workflows\publish.yml
============================
============================
     1: name: Publish Package
     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   push:
     5:     tags:
     6:       - 'v*.*.*'
     7: 
     8: jobs:
     9:   publish:
    10:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    11:     steps:
    12:       - uses: actions/checkout@v3
    13:       - uses: actions/setup-node@v4
    14:         with:
    15:           node-version: '18'
    16:           registry-url: 'https://registry.npmjs.org'
    17:       - name: Validate tokens
    18:         run: |
    19:           if [ -z "${{ secrets.NPM_TOKEN }}" ]; then echo "NPM_TOKEN is missing"; exit 1; fi
    20:           if [ -z "${{ secrets.GUMROAD_TOKEN }}" ]; then echo "Warning: GUMROAD_TOKEN is not set"; fi
    21:       - name: Install dependencies
    22:         run: |
    23:           npm ci --no-audit --no-fund
    24:       - name: Build
    25:         run: |
    26:           npm run build --if-present
    27:       - name: Publish
    28:         env:
    29:           NODE_AUTH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NPM_TOKEN }}
    30:         run: |
    31:           echo "//registry.npmjs.org/:_authToken=${NODE_AUTH_TOKEN}" > ~/.npmrc
    32:           npm publish --access public


============================
FILE: .github\workflows\refactor-funesterie.yml
============================
============================
     1: name: Refactor Funesterie Engine
     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   workflow_dispatch: {}
     5: 
     6: # avoid running multiple concurrent refactor jobs and cancel in-progress when a new one is triggered
     7: concurrency:
     8:   group: refactor-funesterie-${{ github.ref }}-${{ github.run_id }}
     9:   cancel-in-progress: true
    10: 
    11: jobs:
    12:   refactor:
    13:     # use a dedicated self-hosted runner labeled 'funesterie' to avoid contention
    14:     runs-on: [self-hosted, funesterie, Windows]
    15: 
    16:     env:
    17:       QFLUSHD_PORT: '43421'
    18:       QFLUSH_SPYDER_ADMIN_PORT: '4022'
    19:       INSTALL_SPYDER: 'true'
    20: 
    21:     steps:
    22:       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    23:         with:
    24:           fetch-depth: 0
    25: 
    26:       - name: Node setup
    27:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
    28:         with:
    29:           node-version: 20
    30: 
    31:       - run: npm ci
    32: 
    33:       - name: Build TypeScript
    34:         run: npx tsc -p .
    35: 
    36:       - name: Install qflush globally on runner (from repo tgz or npm)
    37:         shell: pwsh
    38:         run: |
    39:           Write-Host 'Installing qflush CLI for this runner (prefer published runner variant)'
    40:           $npmBin = $null
    41:           try {
    42:             # try installing published runner variant from npm first
    43:             try {
    44:               Write-Host 'Attempting to install published runner package @funeste38/qflush-runner@3.1.5-runner'
    45:               npm install -g @funeste38/qflush-runner@3.1.5-runner --no-audit --no-fund
    46:               Write-Host 'Installed @funeste38/qflush-runner from npm'
    47:               $npmBin = (npm config get prefix 2>$null).Trim()
    48:               if (-not $npmBin -or $npmBin -eq '') { $npmBin = Join-Path $env:APPDATA 'npm' }
    49:               "$([String]::Format('PATH={0};{1}', $npmBin, $env:PATH))" | Out-File -FilePath $env:GITHUB_ENV -Encoding utf8 -Append
    50:               Write-Host 'Runner variant installed and PATH updated for job'
    51:             } catch {
    52:               Write-Host 'Failed to install published runner package, falling back to local pack/install'
    53:               # create tgz from repo
    54:               npm pack
    55:               $tgz = Get-ChildItem -Path . -Filter '*.tgz' -File | Sort-Object LastWriteTime -Descending | Select-Object -First 1
    56:               if ($tgz) {
    57:                 Write-Host "Found tgz: $($tgz.FullName) - installing globally"
    58:                 # if runner-package exists, pack and install it instead
    59:                 if (Test-Path 'runner-package/package.json') {
    60:                   Write-Host 'Packaging runner-specific variant (local)'
    61:                   Push-Location runner-package
    62:                   npm pack
    63:                   $runnerTgz = Get-ChildItem -Path .. -Filter '*.tgz' -File | Sort-Object LastWriteTime -Descending | Select-Object -First 1
    64:                   Pop-Location
    65:                   if ($runnerTgz) {
    66:                     Write-Host "Installing runner variant: $($runnerTgz.FullName)"
    67:                     npm install -g $runnerTgz.FullName
    68:                     # also install main tgz for library usage
    69:                     npm install -g $tgz.FullName
    70:                     $npmBin = (npm config get prefix 2>$null).Trim() || Join-Path $env:APPDATA 'npm'
    71:                     "$([String]::Format('PATH={0};{1}', $npmBin, $env:PATH))" | Out-File -FilePath $env:GITHUB_ENV -Encoding utf8 -Append
    72:                     Write-Host 'Runner variant and main package installed and PATH updated for job'
    73:                     exit 0
    74:                   }
    75:                 }
    76:                 npm install -g $tgz.FullName
    77:                 $npmBin = (npm config get prefix 2>$null).Trim() || Join-Path $env:APPDATA 'npm'
    78:                 "$([String]::Format('PATH={0};{1}', $npmBin, $env:PATH))" | Out-File -FilePath $env:GITHUB_ENV -Encoding utf8 -Append
    79:                 Write-Host 'qflush installed and PATH updated for job'
    80:               } else {
    81:                 Write-Host 'No tgz produced by npm pack, skipping install'
    82:               }
    83:             }
    84:           } finally {
    85:             # no-op
    86:           }
    87: 
    88:       - name: Ensure Funesterie rules file
    89:         shell: pwsh
    90:         run: |
    91:           if (-not (Test-Path '.qflush')) { New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path .qflush | Out-Null }
    92:           $rules = @{ 
    93:             version = '1.0';
    94:             architecture = @{
    95:               core = 'src/core';
    96:               cortex = 'src/cortex';
    97:               utils = 'src/utils';
    98:               commands = 'src/commands';
    99:               legacy = 'src/legacy'
   100:             };
   101:             rules = @{
   102:               commands_no_logic = $true;
   103:               router_pure = $true;
   104:               apply_pure = $true;
   105:               no_direct_fs_in_cortex = $true;
   106:               logs_uniform = $true;
   107:               config_centralized = $true;
   108:               state_in_core = $true
   109:             };
   110:             refactor = @{
   111:               move_legacy = $true;
   112:               rebuild_imports = $true;
   113:               fix_paths = $true;
   114:               split_large_files = $true;
   115:               auto_generate_types = $true
   116:             }
   117:           }
   118:           $rules | ConvertTo-Json -Depth 5 | Set-Content -Path .qflush/funesterie.rules.json -Encoding UTF8
   119: 
   120:       - name: Run refactor engine (TS)
   121:         run: npx ts-node --prefer-ts-exts scripts/refactor-funesterie.ts .qflush/funesterie.rules.json
   122: 
   123:       - name: Run tests
   124:         run: npm test
   125: 
   126:       - name: Create PR
   127:         uses: peter-evans/create-pull-request@v6
   128:         with:
   129:           branch: auto/refactor-funesterie
   130:           commit-message: "refactor: applied Funesterie Rules via A11 Engine"
   131:           title: "Auto-refactor (Funesterie Engine)"
   132: 
   133:       - name: Optional: Install Spyder (from npm)
   134:         if: ${{ env.INSTALL_SPYDER == 'true' }}
   135:         shell: pwsh
   136:         env:
   137:           TAR: 'C:/Windows/System32/tar.exe'
   138:         run: |
   139:           Write-Host 'Installing @funeste38/spyder (optional)'
   140:           try { npm cache clean --force; Write-Host 'npm cache cleaned' } catch { Write-Host 'npm cache clean failed, continuing' }
   141:           $pkg = '@funeste38/spyder'
   142:           $max = 3
   143:           $installed = $false
   144:           for ($i = 1; $i -le $max; $i++) {
   145:             Write-Host "Attempt $i to install $pkg"
   146:             try {
   147:               npm i $pkg --no-audit --no-fund
   148:               Write-Host "$pkg installed successfully"
   149:               $installed = $true
   150:               break
   151:             } catch {
   152:               Write-Host "Install attempt $i failed: $_"
   153:               Start-Sleep -Seconds (2 * $i)
   154:             }
   155:           }
   156:           if (-not $installed) {
   157:             Write-Host 'Primary npm install failed — attempting GitHub fallback'
   158:             try {
   159:               npm i git+https://github.com/jEFFLEZ/spyder.git --no-audit --no-fund
   160:               Write-Host 'Installed spyder from GitHub'
   161:               $installed = $true
   162:             } catch {
   163:               Write-Host 'GitHub fallback failed: ' $_
   164:             }
   165:           }
   166:           if (-not $installed) { Write-Host 'Spyder not installed; tests may skip spyder-related behavior' }

FILE: .github\workflows\run-bridge.yml

     1: name: Run qflush bridge
     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   workflow_dispatch:
     5: 
     6: jobs:
     7:   run-bridge:
     8:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
     9:     steps:
    10:       - name: Checkout
    11:         uses: actions/checkout@v4
    12: 
    13:       - name: Setup Node
    14:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
    15:         with:
    16:           node-version: '20'
    17: 
    18:       - name: Install deps
    19:         run: npm install
    20: 
    21:       - name: Run bridge
    22:         env:
    23:           OPENAI_API_KEY: ${{ secrets.OPENAI_API_KEY }}
    24:         run: |
    25:           npm run qflush:bridge
    26: 
    27:       - name: Upload bridge-out
    28:         uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
    29:         with:
    30:           name: bridge-out
    31:           path: qflush/bridge-out.md

FILE: .github\workflows\verify-secrets.yml
============================
============================
     1: name: Verify Action Secrets
     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   workflow_dispatch: {}
     5: 
     6: jobs:
     7:   verify-secrets:
     8:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
     9:     steps:
    10:       - name: Checkout
    11:         uses: actions/checkout@v4
    12: 
    13:       - name: Setup Node
    14:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
    15:         with:
    16:           node-version: '18'
    17: 
    18:       - name: Verify AZURE_PAT
    19:         env:
    20:           AZURE_PAT: ${{ secrets.AZURE_PAT }}
    21:         run: |
    22:           if [ -z "$AZURE_PAT" ]; then echo "AZURE_PAT: MISSING"; exit 1; fi
    23:           echo "AZURE_PAT: set"
    24:           echo "Testing Azure DevOps connectivity..."
    25:           curl -sS -u :"$AZURE_PAT" https://dev.azure.com/funesterie/_apis/connectionData -o /tmp/az.json || true
    26:           if grep -q "authenticatedUser" /tmp/az.json; then echo "AZURE_PAT: OK"; else echo "AZURE_PAT: FAILED (check scopes)"; fi
    27: 
    28:       - name: Verify VSCE_TOKEN
    29:         env:
    30:           VSCE_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.VSCE_TOKEN }}
    31:         run: |
    32:           if [ -z "$VSCE_TOKEN" ]; then echo "VSCE_TOKEN: MISSING"; exit 1; fi
    33:           echo "VSCE_TOKEN: set"
    34:           # basic check: call Azure DevOps REST with token
    35:           curl -sS -u :"$VSCE_TOKEN" https://dev.azure.com/funesterie/_apis/connectionData -o /tmp/vsce.json || true
    36:           if grep -q "authenticatedUser" /tmp/vsce.json; then echo "VSCE_TOKEN: OK"; else echo "VSCE_TOKEN: FAILED (check token/scopes)"; fi
    37: 
    38:       - name: Verify NPM_TOKEN
    39:         env:
    40:           NPM_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NPM_TOKEN }}
    41:         run: |
    42:           if [ -z "$NPM_TOKEN" ]; then echo "NPM_TOKEN: MISSING"; exit 1; fi
    43:           echo "NPM_TOKEN: set"
    44:           curl -sS -H "Authorization: Bearer $NPM_TOKEN" https://registry.npmjs.org/-/whoami -o /tmp/npm.json || true
    45:           if grep -q "username" /tmp/npm.json; then echo "NPM_TOKEN: OK"; else echo "NPM_TOKEN: FAILED"; fi
    46: 
    47:       - name: Verify OPEN_VSX_TOKEN
    48:         env:
    49:           OPEN_VSX_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.OPEN_VSX_TOKEN }}
    50:         run: |
    51:           if [ -z "$OPEN_VSX_TOKEN" ]; then echo "OPEN_VSX_TOKEN: MISSING"; exit 1; fi
    52:           echo "OPEN_VSX_TOKEN: set"
    53:           npm i -g @open-vsx/ovsx@1.0.3 >/dev/null 2>&1 || true
    54:           if npx @open-vsx/ovsx whoami --pat "$OPEN_VSX_TOKEN" >/tmp/ovsx.out 2>&1; then echo "OPEN_VSX_TOKEN: OK"; else echo "OPEN_VSX_TOKEN: FAILED"; cat /tmp/ovsx.out || true; fi
    55: 
    56:       - name: Summary
    57:         run: |
    58:           echo "Verification complete. Check above step outputs for each token status."


============================
FILE: dist\cortex\a11-adapter.js
============================
============================
     1: // Lightweight adapter for A-11 usage from cortex
     2: // Keeps cortex code pure: cortex calls adapter functions which encapsulate IO via core/a11Client
     3: let a11 = null;
     4: try {
     5:     a11 = require('../core/a11Client');
     6: }
     7: catch (e) {
     8:     try {
     9:         a11 = require('../../dist/core/a11Client');
    10:     }
    11:     catch (_e) {
    12:         a11 = null;
    13:     }
    14: }
    15: export async function isA11Available() {
    16:     if (!a11 || !a11.a11Health)
    17:         return { ok: false, reason: 'client_unavailable' };
    18:     try {
    19:         const h = await a11.a11Health();
    20:         return { ok: !!(h && h.ok), detail: h };
    21:     }
    22:     catch (e) {
    23:         return { ok: false, reason: String(e) };
    24:     }
    25: }
    26: export async function askA11(prompt, opts) {
    27:     if (!a11 || !a11.a11Chat)
    28:         throw new Error('A-11 client not available');
    29:     return a11.a11Chat(prompt, opts);
    30: }


============================
FILE: dist\cortex\applyPacket.js
============================
============================
     1: import * as fs from 'fs';
     2: import * as path from 'path';
     3: import { executeAction } from '../rome/executor.js';
     4: import { safeWriteFileSync, safeAppendFileSync } from '../utils/safe-fs.js';
     5: const QFLUSH_DIR = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush');
     6: const CACHE_PATH = path.join(QFLUSH_DIR, 'spyder.cache.json');
     7: const PATCHES_DIR = path.join(QFLUSH_DIR, 'patches');
     8: const PATCH_AUDIT = path.join(PATCHES_DIR, 'audit.log');
     9: function loadCache() {
    10:     try {
    11:         if (!fs.existsSync(CACHE_PATH))
    12:             return { appliedIds: [] };
    13:         const raw = fs.readFileSync(CACHE_PATH, 'utf8') || '{}';
    14:         const obj = JSON.parse(raw);
    15:         return { appliedIds: Array.isArray(obj.appliedIds) ? obj.appliedIds : [] };
    16:     }
    17:     catch (e) {
    18:         return { appliedIds: [] };
    19:     }
    20: }
    21: function saveCache(cache) {
    22:     try {
    23:         if (!fs.existsSync(QFLUSH_DIR))
    24:             fs.mkdirSync(QFLUSH_DIR, { recursive: true });
    25:         safeWriteFileSync(CACHE_PATH, JSON.stringify(cache, null, 2), 'utf8');
    26:     }
    27:     catch (e) {
    28:         // ignore
    29:     }
    30: }
    31: function ensurePatchesDir() {
    32:     try {
    33:         if (!fs.existsSync(PATCHES_DIR))
    34:             fs.mkdirSync(PATCHES_DIR, { recursive: true });
    35:     }
    36:     catch (e) { }
    37: }
    38: function appendPatchAudit(entry) {
    39:     try {
    40:         ensurePatchesDir();
    41:         const line = JSON.stringify(entry) + "\n";
    42:         safeAppendFileSync(PATCH_AUDIT, line, 'utf8');
    43:     }
    44:     catch (e) { /* ignore */ }
    45: }
    46: function loadPatchWhitelist() {
    47:     try {
    48:         const wlFile = path.join(PATCHES_DIR, 'whitelist.json');
    49:         if (fs.existsSync(wlFile)) {
    50:             const raw = fs.readFileSync(wlFile, 'utf8') || '[]';
    51:             const arr = JSON.parse(raw);
    52:             if (Array.isArray(arr))
    53:                 return arr.map(String);
    54:         }
    55:     }
    56:     catch (e) { }
    57:     // default whitelist: allow only top-level keys considered safe
    58:     return ['routes', 'spyder', 'npz', 'telemetry', 'logic-config', 'flags', 'paths', 'services'];
    59: }
    60: function isPatchAllowed(patch) {
    61:     try {
    62:         if (!patch || typeof patch !== 'object')
    63:             return { ok: false, reason: 'invalid_patch' };
    64:         const whitelist = loadPatchWhitelist();
    65:         const keys = Object.keys(patch);
    66:         // allow when every key is in whitelist
    67:         for (const k of keys) {
    68:             if (!whitelist.includes(k))
    69:                 return { ok: false, reason: `key_not_allowed:${k}` };
    70:         }
    71:         return { ok: true };
    72:     }
    73:     catch (e) {
    74:         return { ok: false, reason: 'validation_error' };
    75:     }
    76: }
    77: export async function applyCortexPacket(packet) {
    78:     // dedupe by id
    79:     try {
    80:         const cache = loadCache();
    81:         if (packet.id && cache.appliedIds.includes(packet.id)) {
    82:             console.log('[APPLY] packet already applied (id=', packet.id, ') — skipping');
    83:             return;
    84:         }
    85:         switch (String(packet.type).toLowerCase()) {
    86:             case 'enable-spyder':
    87:             case 'cortex:enable-spyder':
    88:                 await applyEnableSpyder(packet);
    89:                 break;
    90:             case 'cortex:routes':
    91:             case 'cortex:routes:':
    92:                 await applyCortexRoutes(packet);
    93:                 break;
    94:             case 'qflush:apply':
    95:             case 'cortex:apply':
    96:                 await applyQflushConfigPatch(packet);
    97:                 break;
    98:             case 'npz-graph':
    99:             case 'npz:graph':
   100:             case 'cortex:npz-graph':
   101:                 await applyNpzGraph(packet);
   102:                 break;
   103:             case 'save-state':
   104:             case 'save:state':
   105:             case 'cortex:save-state':
   106:                 await applySaveState(packet);
   107:                 break;
   108:             case 'auto-patch':
   109:             case 'auto_patch':
   110:             case 'qflush:auto-patch':
   111:             case 'cortex:auto-patch':
   112:                 await applyAutoPatch(packet);
   113:                 break;
   114:             // new handlers
   115:             case 'cortex:oc8':
   116:             case 'oc8':
   117:                 await applyOc8(packet);
   118:                 break;
   119:             case 'cortex:qrouter':
   120:             case 'qrouter':
   121:                 await applyQrouter(packet);
   122:                 break;
   123:             case 'cortex:spyder-sound':
   124:             case 'spyder-sound':
   125:                 await applySpyderSound(packet);
   126:                 break;
   127:             case 'cortex:a11-key':
   128:             case 'a11-key':
   129:                 await applyA11Key(packet);
   130:                 break;
   131:             case 'cortex:magic':
   132:             case 'magic':
   133:                 await applyMagic(packet);
   134:                 break;
   135:             default:
   136:                 console.warn('[APPLY] Type de packet non géré:', packet.type);
   137:         }
   138:         // record applied id
   139:         try {
   140:             if (packet.id) {
   141:                 const cache2 = loadCache();
   142:                 cache2.appliedIds.push(packet.id);
   143:                 // keep unique
   144:                 cache2.appliedIds = Array.from(new Set(cache2.appliedIds));
   145:                 saveCache(cache2);
   146:             }
   147:         }
   148:         catch (e) { /* ignore */ }
   149:     }
   150:     catch (e) {
   151:         console.warn('[APPLY] applyCortexPacket failed:', String(e));
   152:     }
   153: }
   154: async function applyNpzGraph(packet) {
   155:     try {
   156:         const payload = packet.payload || {};
   157:         const filePath = payload && payload.path ? String(payload.path) : process.cwd();
   158:         console.log('[APPLY] NPZ-GRAPH ingest for', filePath);
   159:         const res = await executeAction('npz.encode', { path: filePath });
   160:         console.log('[APPLY] NPZ-GRAPH result', res);
   161:         appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'npz.encode', path: filePath, result: res, when: new Date().toISOString() });
   162:     }
   163:     catch (e) {
   164:         console.warn('[APPLY] NPZ-GRAPH failed', String(e));
   165:         appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'npz.encode', error: String(e), when: new Date().toISOString() });
   166:     }
   167: }
   168: async function applySaveState(packet) {
   169:     try {
   170:         if (!fs.existsSync(QFLUSH_DIR))
   171:             fs.mkdirSync(QFLUSH_DIR, { recursive: true });
   172:         const stateFile = path.join(QFLUSH_DIR, 'state.json');
   173:         const snapshotDir = path.join(QFLUSH_DIR, 'snapshots');
   174:         if (!fs.existsSync(snapshotDir))
   175:             fs.mkdirSync(snapshotDir, { recursive: true });
   176:         const now = new Date().toISOString().replace(/[:.]/g, '-');
   177:         const snapshotFile = path.join(snapshotDir, `state-${now}.json`);
   178:         // read current state if exists or create minimal
   179:         let current = {};
   180:         try {
   181:             if (fs.existsSync(stateFile))
   182:                 current = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(stateFile, 'utf8') || '{}');
   183:         }
   184:         catch (e) {
   185:             current = {};
   186:         }
   187:         // allow packet.payload to merge into state snapshot
   188:         const payload = packet.payload || {};
   189:         const merged = { ...current, ...payload };
   190:         safeWriteFileSync(snapshotFile, JSON.stringify(merged, null, 2), 'utf8');
   191:         // also write state.json as current
   192:         safeWriteFileSync(stateFile, JSON.stringify(merged, null, 2), 'utf8');
   193:         console.log('[APPLY] SAVE-STATE snapshot written to', snapshotFile);
   194:         appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'save-state', path: snapshotFile, when: new Date().toISOString() });
   195:     }
   196:     catch (e) {
   197:         console.warn('[APPLY] SAVE-STATE failed', String(e));
   198:         appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'save-state', error: String(e), when: new Date().toISOString() });
   199:     }
   200: }
   201: async function applyAutoPatch(packet) {
   202:     try {
   203:         const payload = packet.payload || {};
   204:         const patch = payload.patch || payload;
   205:         const approve = Boolean(payload.approve || payload.approved || false);
   206:         const dryRun = Boolean(payload.dryRun || payload.dry || true); // safer default: dryRun true
   207:         // validate patch keys
   208:         const validation = isPatchAllowed(patch);
   209:         if (!validation.ok) {
   210:             // write blocked patch for audit
   211:             try {
   212:                 ensurePatchesDir();
   213:                 const blockedFile = path.join(PATCHES_DIR, `blocked-${packet.id || Date.now()}.json`);
   214:                 safeWriteFileSync(blockedFile, JSON.stringify({ packetId: packet.id || null, reason: validation.reason, patch }, null, 2), 'utf8');
   215:                 appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'auto-patch', status: 'blocked', reason: validation.reason, when: new Date().toISOString() });
   216:             }
   217:             catch (e) { }
   218:             console.warn('[APPLY] AUTO-PATCH blocked by whitelist:', validation.reason);
   219:             return;
   220:         }
   221:         const dir = QFLUSH_DIR;
   222:         const cfgFile = path.join(dir, 'config.json');
   223:         let current = {};
   224:         try {
   225:             if (fs.existsSync(cfgFile))
   226:                 current = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(cfgFile, 'utf8') || '{}');
   227:         }
   228:         catch (e) {
   229:             current = {};
   230:         }
   231:         const merged = { ...current, ...patch };
   232:         if (dryRun || !approve) {
   233:             const outDir = path.join(dir, 'patches');
   234:             if (!fs.existsSync(outDir))
   235:                 fs.mkdirSync(outDir, { recursive: true });
   236:             const outFile = path.join(outDir, `dryrun-${packet.id || Date.now()}.json`);
   237:             safeWriteFileSync(outFile, JSON.stringify({ current, patch, merged }, null, 2), 'utf8');
   238:             appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'auto-patch', status: 'dryrun', file: outFile, when: new Date().toISOString() });
   239:             console.log('[APPLY] AUTO-PATCH dry-run saved to', outFile);
   240:             if (approve) {
   241:                 // fallthrough to apply
   242:             }
   243:             else {
   244:                 return;
   245:             }
   246:         }
   247:         // apply
   248:         safeWriteFileSync(cfgFile, JSON.stringify(merged, null, 2), 'utf8');
   249:         appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'auto-patch', status: 'applied', file: cfgFile, when: new Date().toISOString() });
   250:         console.log('[APPLY] AUTO-PATCH applied to', cfgFile);
   251:     }
   252:     catch (e) {
   253:         console.warn('[APPLY] AUTO-PATCH failed', String(e));
   254:         appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'auto-patch', status: 'error', error: String(e), when: new Date().toISOString() });
   255:     }
   256: }
   257: // existing handlers
   258: async function applyEnableSpyder(packet) {
   259:     const dir = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush');
   260:     const file = path.join(dir, 'spyder.config.json');
   261:     const current = fs.existsSync(file)
   262:         ? JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(file, 'utf8'))
   263:         : {};
   264:     const payload = packet.payload ?? {};
   265:     const spyderPayload = payload.spyder || {};
   266:     // merge existing config with payload
   267:     const spyderConfig = {
   268:         ...current,
   269:         ...spyderPayload
   270:     };
   271:     // Ensure spyder is enabled when an enable-spyder packet is applied
   272:     if (typeof spyderConfig.enabled === 'undefined')
   273:         spyderConfig.enabled = true;
   274:     // Determine admin port: payload -> env override -> default 4001
   275:     let adminPort = (spyderConfig.adminPort !== undefined) ? spyderConfig.adminPort : (process.env.QFLUSH_SPYDER_ADMIN_PORT || 4001);
   276:     // normalize to number when possible
   277:     const ap = Number(adminPort);
   278:     if (!Number.isNaN(ap) && ap > 0)
   279:         adminPort = ap;
   280:     if (!fs.existsSync(dir))
   281:         fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
   282:     safeWriteFileSync(file, JSON.stringify(spyderConfig, null, 2), 'utf8');
   283:     console.log('[APPLY] SPYDER mis à jour via packet enable-spyder');
   284:     appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'enable-spyder', when: new Date().toISOString() });
   285:     // Also write a simple env file so CI/runner steps can read the admin port reliably
   286:     try {
   287:         const envPath = path.join(dir, 'spyder.env');
   288:         const content = `SPYDER_ADMIN_PORT=${adminPort}\n`;
   289:         safeWriteFileSync(envPath, content, 'utf8');
   290:         console.log(`[APPLY] Wrote ${envPath} with SPYDER_ADMIN_PORT=${adminPort}`);
   291:         appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'write-spyder-env', file: envPath, when: new Date().toISOString() });
   292:     }
   293:     catch (e) {
   294:         console.warn('[APPLY] failed to write spyder.env', String(e));
   295:     }
   296: }
   297: async function applyCortexRoutes(packet) {
   298:     const dir = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush');
   299:     const file = path.join(dir, 'cortex.routes.json');
   300:     const payload = packet.payload ?? {};
   301:     if (!fs.existsSync(dir))
   302:         fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
   303:     safeWriteFileSync(file, JSON.stringify(payload, null, 2), 'utf8');
   304:     console.log('[APPLY] cortex.routes.json mis à jour.');
   305:     appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'cortex:routes', when: new Date().toISOString() });
   306: }
   307: async function applyQflushConfigPatch(packet) {
   308:     const dir = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush');
   309:     const file = path.join(dir, 'config.json');
   310:     const current = fs.existsSync(file)
   311:         ? JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(file, 'utf8'))
   312:         : {};
   313:     const payload = packet.payload ?? {};
   314:     const merged = {
   315:         ...current,
   316:         ...payload
   317:     };
   318:     if (!fs.existsSync(dir))
   319:         fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
   320:     safeWriteFileSync(file, JSON.stringify(merged, null, 2), 'utf8');
   321:     console.log('[APPLY] config.json mis à jour via packet qflush:apply');
   322:     appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'qflush:apply', when: new Date().toISOString() });
   323: }
   324: // new apply handlers
   325: async function applyOc8(packet) {
   326:     try {
   327:         const payload = packet.payload || {};
   328:         const metaFile = path.join(QFLUSH_DIR, 'oc8.meta.json');
   329:         const info = payload.info || { name: 'OC8', description: 'OC8 format' };
   330:         if (!fs.existsSync(QFLUSH_DIR))
   331:             fs.mkdirSync(QFLUSH_DIR, { recursive: true });
   332:         safeWriteFileSync(metaFile, JSON.stringify(info, null, 2), 'utf8');
   333:         appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'oc8:register', file: metaFile, when: new Date().toISOString() });
   334:         console.log('[APPLY] OC8 metadata written to', metaFile);
   335:     }
   336:     catch (e) {
   337:         console.warn('[APPLY] OC8 failed', String(e));
   338:     }
   339: }
   340: async function applyQrouter(packet) {
   341:     try {
   342:         const payload = packet.payload || {};
   343:         const file = path.join(QFLUSH_DIR, 'cortex.routes.json');
   344:         let current = {};
   345:         try {
   346:             if (fs.existsSync(file))
   347:                 current = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(file, 'utf8') || '{}');
   348:         }
   349:         catch (e) {
   350:             current = {};
   351:         }
   352:         const merged = { ...current, ...(payload.routes || {}) };
   353:         if (!fs.existsSync(QFLUSH_DIR))
   354:             fs.mkdirSync(QFLUSH_DIR, { recursive: true });
   355:         safeWriteFileSync(file, JSON.stringify(merged, null, 2), 'utf8');
   356:         appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'qrouter:update', file, when: new Date().toISOString() });
   357:         console.log('[APPLY] QROUTER updated', file);
   358:     }
   359:     catch (e) {
   360:         console.warn('[APPLY] QROUTER failed', String(e));
   361:     }
   362: }
   363: async function applySpyderSound(packet) {

   386: async function applyA11Key(packet) {
   387:     try {

   389:         const file = path.join(QFLUSH_DIR, 'a11.config.json');
   390:         let current = {};

   392:             if (fs.existsSync(file))
   393:                 current = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(file, 'utf8') || '{}');
   394:         }
   395:         catch (e) {
   396:             current = {};
   397:         }
   398:         // do not log apiKey in audit
   399:         const safePayload = { ...payload };
   400:         if (safePayload.apiKey)
   401:             delete safePayload.apiKey;
   402:         const merged = { ...current, ...payload };
   403:         if (!fs.existsSync(QFLUSH_DIR))
   404:             fs.mkdirSync(QFLUSH_DIR, { recursive: true });
   405:         safeWriteFileSync(file, JSON.stringify(merged, null, 2), 'utf8');
   406:         appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'a11-key', file, when: new Date().toISOString() });
   407:         console.log('[APPLY] A11 config updated (apiKey redacted in logs)');
   408:     }
   409:     catch (e) {
   410:         console.warn('[APPLY] A11 failed', String(e));
   411:     }
   412: }
   413: async function applyMagic(packet) {
   414:     try {
   415:         const entry = { id: packet.id || null, when: new Date().toISOString(), payload: packet.payload };
   416:         const file = path.join(QFLUSH_DIR, 'magic.log');
   417:         if (!fs.existsSync(QFLUSH_DIR))
   418:             fs.mkdirSync(QFLUSH_DIR, { recursive: true });
   419:         safeAppendFileSync(file, JSON.stringify(entry) + '\n', 'utf8');
   420:         appendPatchAudit({ id: packet.id || null, type: packet.type, action: 'magic', file, when: new Date().toISOString() });
   421:         console.log('[APPLY] magic recorded');
   422:     }
   423:     catch (e) {
   424:         console.warn('[APPLY] magic failed', String(e));
   425:     }
   426: }
   427: export default { applyCortexPacket };
