FILE: dist\cortex\applyPacket.spec.js
============================
============================
     1: import { describe, it, expect } from 'vitest';
     2: import { applyCortexPacket } from './applyPacket.js';
     3: import * as fs from 'fs';
     4: import * as path from 'path';
     5: describe('applyPacket handlers', () => {
     6:     it('applies oc8 metadata', async () => {
     7:         const tmp = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'test-oc8');
     8:         try {
     9:             if (!fs.existsSync(path.dirname(tmp)))
    10:                 fs.mkdirSync(path.dirname(tmp), { recursive: true });
    11:         }
    12:         catch (e) { }
    13:         const pkt = { type: 'cortex:oc8', id: 't-oc8-1', payload: { info: { name: 'OC8TEST', description: 'test' } } };
    14:         await applyCortexPacket(pkt);
    15:         const out = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'oc8.meta.json');
    16:         expect(fs.existsSync(out)).toBe(true);
    17:         const j = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(out, 'utf8'));
    18:         expect(j.name).toBe('OC8TEST');
    19:     });
    20:     it('applies auto-patch dry-run and does not write config', async () => {
    21:         const cfg = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'config.json');
    22:         try {
    23:             if (fs.existsSync(cfg))
    24:                 fs.unlinkSync(cfg);
    25:         }
    26:         catch (e) { }
    27:         const pkt = { type: 'cortex:auto-patch', id: 't-patch-1', payload: { patch: { flags: { testMode: true } }, dryRun: true } };
    28:         await applyCortexPacket(pkt);
    29:         expect(fs.existsSync(cfg)).toBe(false);
    30:     });
    31: });


============================
FILE: dist\cortex\bus.js
============================
============================
     1: import fs from 'fs';
     2: import path from 'path';
     3: import { decodeCortexPNG } from './decoder.js';
     4: import { encodeCortexCommand } from './encoder.js';
     5: import { execCommand } from '../rome/executor.js';
     6: const inbox = path.join('.qflush', 'cortex', 'inbox');
     7: const outbox = path.join('.qflush', 'cortex', 'outbox');
     8: export function startCortexBus() {
     9:     fs.mkdirSync(inbox, { recursive: true });
    10:     fs.mkdirSync(outbox, { recursive: true });
    11:     console.log('[CORTEX] Bus démarré — watching', inbox);
    12:     const processFile = async (file) => {
    13:         const full = path.join(inbox, file);
    14:         if (!file.endsWith('.png'))
    15:             return;
    16:         try {
    17:             const payload = decodeCortexPNG(full);
    18:             const result = await execCommand(payload.cmd, payload.args || []);
    19:             const response = { id: payload.id, ok: true, result, timestamp: Date.now() };
    20:             const out = path.join(outbox, file);
    21:             encodeCortexCommand(response, out);
    22:         }
    23:         catch (e) {
    24:             console.error('[CORTEX] processing error', e);
    25:             const resp = { id: path.basename(file, '.png'), ok: false, error: String(e), timestamp: Date.now() };
    26:             try {
    27:                 encodeCortexCommand(resp, path.join(outbox, file));
    28:             }
    29:             catch (e2) { /* ignore */ }
    30:         }
    31:         finally {
    32:             try {
    33:                 fs.unlinkSync(full);
    34:             }
    35:             catch (e) { /* ignore */ }
    36:         }
    37:     };
    38:     // simple poll/watch to be robust
    39:     setInterval(() => {
    40:         try {
    41:             const files = fs.readdirSync(inbox || '.');
    42:             for (const f of files) {
    43:                 processFile(f);
    44:             }
    45:         }
    46:         catch (e) {
    47:             // ignore
    48:         }
    49:     }, 500);
    50: }


============================
FILE: dist\cortex\cli.js
============================
============================
     1: import path from 'path';
     2: import { encodeCortexCommand } from './encoder.js';
     3: import fs from 'fs';
     4: export function cortexSend(cmd, args = []) {
     5:     const id = 'cortex-' + Date.now() + '-' + Math.random().toString(36).slice(2, 8);
     6:     const ner = { id, cmd, args, timestamp: Date.now() };
     7:     const out = path.join('.qflush', 'cortex', 'inbox', id + '.png');
     8:     encodeCortexCommand(ner, out);
     9:     return id;
    10: }
    11: export function cortexWaitFor(id, timeoutMs = 5000) {
    12:     const out = path.join('.qflush', 'cortex', 'outbox', id + '.png');
    13:     const start = Date.now();
    14:     return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
    15:         const iv = setInterval(() => {
    16:             if (Date.now() - start > timeoutMs) {
    17:                 clearInterval(iv);
    18:                 return reject(new Error('timeout'));
    19:             }
    20:             if (fs.existsSync(out)) {
    21:                 try {
    22:                     const dec = require('./decoder').decodeCortexPNG(out);
    23:                     try {
    24:                         fs.unlinkSync(out);
    25:                     }
    26:                     catch (e) { }
    27:                     clearInterval(iv);
    28:                     resolve(dec);
    29:                 }
    30:                 catch (e) {
    31:                     clearInterval(iv);
    32:                     reject(e);
    33:                 }
    34:             }
    35:         }, 200);
    36:     });
    37: }


============================
FILE: dist\cortex\codec.js
============================
============================
     1: import * as fs from 'fs';
     2: import * as zlib from 'zlib';
     3: import sharp from 'sharp';
     4: const brotliCompressSync = (input) => zlib.brotliCompressSync(input, { params: { [zlib.constants.BROTLI_PARAM_QUALITY]: 11 } });
     5: const brotliDecompressSync = (input) => zlib.brotliDecompressSync(input);
     6: // CRC-8 OC8 implementation
     7: export function crc8_oc8(data, poly = 0x07, init = 0x00) {
     8:     let crc = init & 0xff;
     9:     for (const b of data) {
    10:         crc ^= b;
    11:         for (let i = 0; i < 8; i++) {
    12:             if ((crc & 0x80) !== 0)
    13:                 crc = ((crc << 1) ^ poly) & 0xff;
    14:             else
    15:                 crc = (crc << 1) & 0xff;
    16:         }
    17:     }
    18:     return crc & 0xff;
    19: }
    20: export function buildCortexPacket(raw, flags = 0) {
    21:     const compressed = brotliCompressSync(raw);
    22:     const crc = crc8_oc8(compressed);
    23:     const payload = Buffer.concat([compressed, Buffer.from([crc])]);
    24:     const payloadLen = payload.length;
    25:     const totalLen = payloadLen + 16;
    26:     const header = Buffer.alloc(16);
    27:     header.writeUInt32BE(totalLen, 0);
    28:     header.writeUInt32BE(payloadLen, 4);
    29:     header.writeUInt8(flags & 0xff, 8);
    30:     // reserved 7 bytes already zero
    31:     return Buffer.concat([header, payload]);
    32: }
    33: export function parseCortexPacket(buf) {
    34:     if (buf.length < 16)
    35:         throw new Error('Stream too short for Cortex header');
    36:     const totalLen = buf.readUInt32BE(0);
    37:     const payloadLen = buf.readUInt32BE(4);
    38:     const flags = buf.readUInt8(8);
    39:     if (payloadLen < 1)
    40:         throw new Error('invalid payload length');
    41:     if (buf.length < 16 + payloadLen)
    42:         throw new Error('buffer shorter than payload');
    43:     const payloadWithCrc = buf.slice(16, 16 + payloadLen);
    44:     const compressed = payloadWithCrc.slice(0, -1);
    45:     const crc = payloadWithCrc[payloadWithCrc.length - 1];
    46:     const expected = crc8_oc8(compressed);
    47:     if (crc !== expected)
    48:         throw new Error(`CRC mismatch: expected ${expected}, got ${crc}`);
    49:     const raw = brotliDecompressSync(compressed);
    50:     return { totalLen, payloadLen, flags, raw };
    51: }
    52: function padToMultipleOf3(buf) {
    53:     const pad = (3 - (buf.length % 3)) % 3;
    54:     if (pad === 0)
    55:         return buf;
    56:     return Buffer.concat([buf, Buffer.alloc(pad)]);
    57: }
    58: export async function encodePacketToPNGs(packet, outputPrefix, maxPngBytes = 200 * 1024 * 1024) {
    59:     const rgb = padToMultipleOf3(packet);
    60:     const totalPixels = Math.floor(rgb.length / 3);
    61:     const maxPixelsPerImg = Math.max(1, Math.floor(maxPngBytes / 3));
    62:     const numImages = Math.max(1, Math.ceil(totalPixels / maxPixelsPerImg));
    63:     const outPaths = [];
    64:     let pixelOffset = 0;
    65:     for (let idx = 0; idx < numImages; idx++) {
    66:         const pixelsInChunk = Math.min(maxPixelsPerImg, totalPixels - pixelOffset);
    67:         if (pixelsInChunk <= 0)
    68:             break;
    69:         const start = pixelOffset * 3;
    70:         const end = start + pixelsInChunk * 3;
    71:         const chunk = rgb.slice(start, end);
    72:         // compute dims
    73:         const width = Math.min(4096, Math.max(1, Math.round(Math.sqrt(pixelsInChunk))));
    74:         const height = Math.ceil(pixelsInChunk / width);
    75:         const required = width * height * 3;
    76:         let data = chunk;
    77:         if (required > chunk.length)
    78:             data = Buffer.concat([chunk, Buffer.alloc(required - chunk.length)]);
    79:         const outName = `${outputPrefix}_part${idx.toString().padStart(2, '0')}.png`;
    80:         // sharp expects raw with channels=3
    81:         await sharp(data, { raw: { width, height, channels: 3 } }).png({ compressionLevel: 1 }).toFile(outName);
    82:         outPaths.push(outName);
    83:         pixelOffset += pixelsInChunk;
    84:     }
    85:     return outPaths;
    86: }
    87: export async function decodePNGsToPacket(paths) {
    88:     // read in order, extract raw RGB bytes
    89:     const parts = [];
    90:     for (const p of paths) {
    91:         const res = await sharp(p).raw().toBuffer({ resolveWithObject: true });
    92:         let { data, info } = res;
    93:         if (info.channels === 4) {
    94:             // strip alpha
    95:             const stripped = Buffer.alloc((data.length / 4) * 3);
    96:             let j = 0;
    97:             for (let i = 0; i < data.length; i += 4) {
    98:                 stripped[j++] = data[i];
    99:                 stripped[j++] = data[i + 1];
   100:                 stripped[j++] = data[i + 2];
   101:             }
   102:             data = stripped;
   103:         }
   104:         else if (info.channels === 3) {
   105:             // ok
   106:         }
   107:         else {
   108:             // attempt to convert to rgb buffer
   109:             const rgbBuf = await sharp(p).ensureAlpha().raw().toBuffer();
   110:             // then strip
   111:             const stripped = Buffer.alloc((rgbBuf.length / 4) * 3);
   112:             let j = 0;
   113:             for (let i = 0; i < rgbBuf.length; i += 4) {
   114:                 stripped[j++] = rgbBuf[i];
   115:                 stripped[j++] = rgbBuf[i + 1];
   116:                 stripped[j++] = rgbBuf[i + 2];
   117:             }
   118:             data = stripped;
   119:         }
   120:         parts.push(data);
   121:     }
   122:     const full = Buffer.concat(parts);
   123:     // no padding removal necessary: parse header and payload lengths
   124:     return full;
   125: }
   126: // Convenience helpers for file io
   127: export async function encodeFileToPNGs(inputPath, outputPrefix) {
   128:     const raw = fs.readFileSync(inputPath);
   129:     const packet = buildCortexPacket(raw, 0);
   130:     return encodePacketToPNGs(packet, outputPrefix);
   131: }
   132: export async function decodePNGsToFile(pngGlobPaths, outputPath) {
   133:     const full = await decodePNGsToPacket(pngGlobPaths);
   134:     const parsed = parseCortexPacket(full);
   135:     fs.writeFileSync(outputPath, parsed.raw);
   136: }
   137: export function decodeCortexPacket(buf) {
   138:     // parseCortexPacket already verifies CRC and decompresses
   139:     const parsed = parseCortexPacket(buf);
   140:     let payload = null;
   141:     try {
   142:         const txt = parsed.raw.toString('utf-8');
   143:         payload = JSON.parse(txt);
   144:     }
   145:     catch (e) {
   146:         payload = parsed.raw;
   147:     }
   148:     return {
   149:         totalLen: parsed.totalLen,
   150:         payloadLen: parsed.payloadLen,
   151:         flags: parsed.flags,
   152:         payload
   153:     };
   154: }
   155: export default { buildCortexPacket, parseCortexPacket, decodeCortexPacket, encodePacketToPNGs, decodePNGsToPacket };


============================
FILE: dist\cortex\codec.spec.js
============================
============================
     1: import { describe, it, expect } from 'vitest';
     2: let packet80;
     3: try {
     4:     // ESM import with json assertion
     5:     // eslint-disable-next-line @typescript-eslint/ban-ts-comment
     6:     // @ts-ignore
     7:     packet80 = (await import('../../decoded_brotli_red_80.json', { assert: { type: 'json' } })).default;
     8: }
     9: catch (e) {
    10:     // fallback for environments that don't support import assertions
    11:     // eslint-disable-next-line @typescript-eslint/no-var-requires
    12:     packet80 = require('../../decoded_brotli_red_80.json');
    13: }
    14: describe('Cortex codec', () => {
    15:     it('decodeCortexPacket should decode a valid red_80 packet', () => {
    16:         // packet80 here is the raw JSON payload; for test we reconstruct a packet using codec helpers
    17:         // For the sketch, we assert that the JSON content includes expected fields
    18:         expect(packet80).toBeDefined();
    19:         expect(packet80.cmd).toBe('enable-spyder');
    20:         expect(Array.isArray(packet80.args)).toBe(true);
    21:     });
    22: });


============================
FILE: dist\cortex\decoder.js
============================
============================
     1: import fs from 'fs';
     2: import zlib from 'zlib';
     3: import { PNG } from 'pngjs';
     4: import crypto from 'crypto';
     5: const seenIds = new Set();
     6: export function decodeCortexPNG(file) {
     7:     const buf = fs.readFileSync(file);
     8:     const png = PNG.sync.read(buf);
     9:     const bytes = [];
    10:     for (let i = 0; i < png.data.length; i += 4) {
    11:         bytes.push(png.data[i], png.data[i + 1], png.data[i + 2]);
    12:     }
    13:     // trim trailing zeros that were padding
    14:     let end = bytes.length;
    15:     while (end > 0 && bytes[end - 1] === 0)
    16:         end--;
    17:     const compressed = Buffer.from(bytes.slice(0, end));
    18:     const oc8 = png.text && png.text.oc8 ? Number(png.text.oc8) : null;
    19:     const calc = crypto.createHash('sha256').update(compressed).digest().subarray(0, 1)[0];
    20:     if (oc8 !== null && oc8 !== calc)
    21:         throw new Error('OC8 checksum mismatch');
    22:     const json = zlib.brotliDecompressSync(compressed);
    23:     const payload = JSON.parse(json.toString('utf8'));
    24:     // simple replay protection: ensure id not seen
    25:     if (payload && payload.id) {
    26:         if (seenIds.has(payload.id))
    27:             throw new Error('replay detected');
    28:         seenIds.add(payload.id);
    29:         // keep seenIds size bounded
    30:         if (seenIds.size > 10000) {
    31:             // drop oldest: convert to array (simple)
    32:             const it = seenIds.values();
    33:             const remove = it.next().value;
    34:             if (remove)
    35:                 seenIds.delete(remove);
    36:         }
    37:     }
    38:     return payload;
    39: }


============================
FILE: dist\cortex\emit.js
============================
============================
     1: import { EventEmitter } from 'events';
     2: import * as fs from 'fs';
     3: import * as path from 'path';
     4: const emitter = new EventEmitter();
     5: const QFLUSH_DIR = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush');
     6: const DRIP_LOG = path.join(QFLUSH_DIR, 'cortex', 'drip.log');
     7: export function cortexEmit(eventName, payload) {
     8:     try {
     9:         if (!fs.existsSync(path.dirname(DRIP_LOG)))
    10:             fs.mkdirSync(path.dirname(DRIP_LOG), { recursive: true });
    11:         const line = JSON.stringify({ t: new Date().toISOString(), event: eventName, payload });
    12:         fs.appendFileSync(DRIP_LOG, line + '\n', 'utf8');
    13:     }
    14:     catch (e) {
    15:         // ignore
    16:     }
    17:     try {
    18:         emitter.emit(eventName, payload);
    19:     }
    20:     catch (e) { }
    21: }
    22: export function onCortexEvent(eventName, cb) {
    23:     emitter.on(eventName, cb);
    24: }
    25: export default { cortexEmit, onCortexEvent };


============================
FILE: dist\cortex\encoder.js
============================
============================
     1: import fs from 'fs';
     2: import path from 'path';
     3: import zlib from 'zlib';
     4: import { PNG } from 'pngjs';
     5: import crypto from 'crypto';
     6: export function encodeCortexCommand(ner, outPath) {
     7:     const json = Buffer.from(JSON.stringify(ner), 'utf8');
     8:     const compressed = zlib.brotliCompressSync(json, { params: { [zlib.constants.BROTLI_PARAM_QUALITY]: 11 } });
     9:     const pixelsCount = Math.ceil(compressed.length / 3);
    10:     const width = Math.ceil(Math.sqrt(pixelsCount));
    11:     const height = width;
    12:     const png = new PNG({ width, height });
    13:     let byteIndex = 0;
    14:     for (let y = 0; y < height; y++) {
    15:         for (let x = 0; x < width; x++) {
    16:             const k = (width * y + x) << 2;
    17:             const r = compressed[byteIndex++] ?? 0;
    18:             const g = compressed[byteIndex++] ?? 0;
    19:             const b = compressed[byteIndex++] ?? 0;
    20:             png.data[k] = r;
    21:             png.data[k + 1] = g;
    22:             png.data[k + 2] = b;
    23:             png.data[k + 3] = 255;
    24:         }
    25:     }
    26:     // OC8: first byte of sha256 of compressed payload (simple integrity tag)
    27:     const oc8 = crypto.createHash('sha256').update(compressed).digest().subarray(0, 1)[0];
    28:     // store as tEXt chunk
    29:     // @ts-ignore png.text exists on PNG
    30:     png.text = png.text || {};
    31:     // store numeric oc8 as string
    32:     // @ts-ignore
    33:     png.text.oc8 = String(oc8);
    34:     // ensure parent dir
    35:     fs.mkdirSync(path.dirname(outPath), { recursive: true });
    36:     const ws = fs.createWriteStream(outPath + '.tmp');
    37:     png.pack().pipe(ws);
    38:     ws.on('finish', () => {
    39:         try {
    40:             fs.renameSync(outPath + '.tmp', outPath);
    41:         }
    42:         catch (e) {
    43:             // best effort
    44:             if (fs.existsSync(outPath + '.tmp'))
    45:                 fs.unlinkSync(outPath + '.tmp');
    46:         }
    47:     });
    48: }


============================
FILE: dist\cortex\listener.js
============================
============================
     1: // Cortex listener: watch a folder for PNG packets and dispatch decoded JSON to router
     2: import * as fs from 'fs';
     3: import * as path from 'path';
     4: import { decodePNGsToPacket, parseCortexPacket } from './codec.js';
     5: import { routeCortexPacket } from './router.js';
     6: import { getServiceClients } from '../services.js';
     7: const WATCH_DIR = path.join(process.cwd(), 'canal');
     8: export function startCortexListener() {
     9:     try {
    10:         if (!fs.existsSync(WATCH_DIR))
    11:             fs.mkdirSync(WATCH_DIR, { recursive: true });
    12:     }
    13:     catch (e) { }
    14:     console.log('[CORTEX] listener watching', WATCH_DIR);
    15:     const pending = new Set();
    16:     // initialize service clients once
    17:     const services = getServiceClients();
    18:     fs.watch(WATCH_DIR, { persistent: false }, async (ev, filename) => {
    19:         if (!filename)
    20:             return;
    21:         const full = path.join(WATCH_DIR, filename);
    22:         if (!filename.endsWith('.png'))
    23:             return;
    24:         if (pending.has(full))
    25:             return;
    26:         pending.add(full);
    27:         // give the file a moment to be fully written
    28:         setTimeout(async () => {
    29:             try {
    30:                 // find all matching parts for this prefix
    31:                 const prefix = filename.replace(/_part\d+\.png$/, '');
    32:                 const glob = fs.readdirSync(WATCH_DIR).filter(f => f.startsWith(prefix) && f.endsWith('.png')).map(f => path.join(WATCH_DIR, f)).sort();
    33:                 if (!glob.length) {
    34:                     pending.delete(full);
    35:                     return;
    36:                 }
    37:                 const fullBuf = await decodePNGsToPacket(glob);
    38:                 const parsed = parseCortexPacket(fullBuf);
    39:                 // attempt to decode payload to JSON where possible
    40:                 let payload = null;
    41:                 try {
    42:                     const txt = parsed.raw.toString('utf-8');
    43:                     payload = JSON.parse(txt);
    44:                 }
    45:                 catch (e) {
    46:                     payload = parsed.raw;
    47:                 }
    48:                 const routed = await routeCortexPacket({ totalLen: parsed.totalLen, payloadLen: parsed.payloadLen, flags: parsed.flags, payload }, services);
    49:                 console.log('[CORTEX] routed packet result', routed);
    50:             }
    51:             catch (e) {
    52:                 console.warn('[CORTEX] decode failed', e);
    53:             }
    54:             finally {
    55:                 pending.delete(full);
    56:             }
    57:         }, 200);
    58:     });
    59: }

     1: import { describe, it, expect, beforeEach, afterEach } from 'vitest';
     2: import * as fs from 'fs';

     5: // Sketch: simulate placing a decoded JSON packet file (already extracted) into canal
     6: describe('Cortex listener (integration sketch)', () => {

     8:     const SPY_CFG = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'spyder.config.json');

    11:             fs.mkdirSync(CANAL, { recursive: true });
    12:         if (fs.existsSync(SPY_CFG))

    14:     });

    16:         try {
    17:             if (fs.existsSync(SPY_CFG))
    18:                 fs.unlinkSync(SPY_CFG);
    19:         }
    20:         catch (e) { }
    21:     });
    22:     it('should create spyder config when receiving enable-spyder packet (sketch)', async () => {

    24:         // For now assert that listener function exists and can be started
    25:         expect(typeof startCortexListener).toBe('function');
    26:     });
    27: });


============================
FILE: dist\cortex\pngCodec.js
============================
============================
     1: import { PNG } from 'pngjs';
     2: import * as fs from 'fs';
     3: import * as zlib from 'zlib';
     4: const MAGIC = Buffer.from('CXPK');
     5: const HEADER_SIZE = 12; // 4 + 1 +3 +4
     6: export function encodeCortexPacketToPng(packet, outputPath, options = {}) {
     7:     return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
     8:         try {
     9:             const json = JSON.stringify(packet);
    10:             const payload = zlib.brotliCompressSync(Buffer.from(json, 'utf8'));
    11:             const header = Buffer.alloc(HEADER_SIZE);
    12:             MAGIC.copy(header, 0); // 0..3
    13:             header.writeUInt8(1, 4); // version
    14:             header.writeUInt8(0, 5);
    15:             header.writeUInt8(0, 6);
    16:             header.writeUInt8(0, 7);
    17:             header.writeUInt32BE(payload.length, 8);
    18:             const rawData = Buffer.concat([header, payload]);
    19:             const redCurtainMode = options.redCurtainMode ?? false;
    20:             const bytesPerPixel = redCurtainMode ? 1 : 4;
    21:             const totalPixels = Math.ceil(rawData.length / bytesPerPixel);
    22:             const width = options.width ?? 8;
    23:             const height = Math.ceil(totalPixels / width);
    24:             const png = new PNG({ width, height });
    25:             const data = png.data;
    26:             for (let i = 0; i < totalPixels; i++) {
    27:                 const pxIndex = i * 4;
    28:                 const byteIndex = i * bytesPerPixel;
    29:                 if (redCurtainMode) {
    30:                     const value = rawData[byteIndex] ?? 0;
    31:                     data[pxIndex] = value;
    32:                     data[pxIndex + 1] = 0;
    33:                     data[pxIndex + 2] = 0;
    34:                     data[pxIndex + 3] = 255;
    35:                 }
    36:                 else {
    37:                     data[pxIndex] = rawData[byteIndex] ?? 0;
    38:                     data[pxIndex + 1] = rawData[byteIndex + 1] ?? 0;
    39:                     data[pxIndex + 2] = rawData[byteIndex + 2] ?? 0;
    40:                     data[pxIndex + 3] = rawData[byteIndex + 3] ?? 0;
    41:                 }
    42:             }
    43:             // padding
    44:             for (let i = totalPixels * 4; i < data.length; i++)
    45:                 data[i] = data[i] || 0;
    46:             const ws = fs.createWriteStream(outputPath);
    47:             png.pack().pipe(ws);
    48:             ws.on('finish', () => resolve());
    49:             ws.on('error', reject);
    50:         }
    51:         catch (e) {
    52:             reject(e);
    53:         }
    54:     });
    55: }
    56: export function decodeCortexPacketFromPng(inputPath) {
    57:     return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
    58:         try {
    59:             const rs = fs.createReadStream(inputPath);
    60:             // pngjs types may not match stream typings in TS env; cast to any for pipe
    61:             rs.pipe(new PNG())
    62:                 .on('parsed', function () {
    63:                 try {
    64:                     const data = this.data; // RGBA
    65:                     // attempt red-curtain detection: many pixels with G=B=0 and A=255
    66:                     let redCurtain = true;
    67:                     for (let i = 0; i < data.length; i += 4) {
    68:                         if (!(data[i + 1] === 0 && data[i + 2] === 0 && data[i + 3] === 255)) {
    69:                             redCurtain = false;
    70:                             break;
    71:                         }
    72:                     }
    73:                     let rawData;
    74:                     if (redCurtain) {
    75:                         const bytes = data.length / 4;
    76:                         rawData = Buffer.alloc(bytes);
    77:                         for (let i = 0; i < bytes; i++)
    78:                             rawData[i] = data[i * 4];
    79:                     }
    80:                     else {
    81:                         // take raw RGBA stream
    82:                         rawData = Buffer.from(data);
    83:                     }
    84:                     const magic = rawData.subarray(0, 4);
    85:                     if (!magic.equals(MAGIC))
    86:                         return reject(new Error('Invalid CORTEX PNG, bad MAGIC'));
    87:                     const version = rawData.readUInt8(4);
    88:                     const length = rawData.readUInt32BE(8);
    89:                     const headerSize = HEADER_SIZE;
    90:                     const payloadBytes = rawData.subarray(headerSize, headerSize + length);
    91:                     const decompressed = zlib.brotliDecompressSync(payloadBytes);
    92:                     const jsonString = decompressed.toString('utf8');
    93:                     const packet = JSON.parse(jsonString);
    94:                     if (packet.kind !== 'cortex-packet')
    95:                         return reject(new Error('Invalid cortex packet kind'));
    96:                     resolve(packet);
    97:                 }
    98:                 catch (e) {
    99:                     reject(e);
   100:                 }
   101:             })
   102:                 .on('error', reject);
   103:         }
   104:         catch (e) {
   105:             reject(e);
   106:         }
   107:     });
   108: }

FILE: dist\cortex\pngCodec.more.spec.js
============================
============================
     1: import { describe, it, expect } from 'vitest';
     2: import { encodeCortexPacketToPng, decodeCortexPacketFromPng } from './pngCodec.js';
     3: import * as fs from 'fs';
     4: import * as path from 'path';
     5: describe('pngCodec additional tests', () => {
     6:     it('redCurtain mode encodes and decodes payload correctly', async () => {
     7:         const tmpDir = path.join(process.cwd(), 'tmp');
     8:         try {
     9:             if (!fs.existsSync(tmpDir))
    10:                 fs.mkdirSync(tmpDir);
    11:         }
    12:         catch (e) { }
    13:         const out = path.join(tmpDir, 'test_cxpk_red.png');
    14:         const packet = {
    15:             version: 1,
    16:             kind: 'cortex-packet',
    17:             type: 'cortex:spyder-vision',
    18:             id: 'test-red-456',
    19:             payload: { cmd: 'red', data: [9, 8, 7], note: 'redCurtain' }
    20:         };
    21:         await encodeCortexPacketToPng(packet, out, { width: 8, redCurtainMode: true });
    22:         expect(fs.existsSync(out)).toBe(true);
    23:         const decoded = await decodeCortexPacketFromPng(out);
    24:         expect(decoded).toBeDefined();
    25:         expect(decoded.kind).toBe('cortex-packet');
    26:         expect(decoded.type).toBe(packet.type);
    27:         // payload should match at least 'cmd'
    28:         expect(decoded.payload.cmd || decoded.payload.payload?.cmd).toEqual('red');
    29:         try {
    30:             fs.unlinkSync(out);
    31:         }
    32:         catch (e) { }
    33:     });
    34:     it('multi-pixel output handles larger payloads', async () => {
    35:         const tmpDir = path.join(process.cwd(), 'tmp');
    36:         try {
    37:             if (!fs.existsSync(tmpDir))
    38:                 fs.mkdirSync(tmpDir);
    39:         }
    40:         catch (e) { }
    41:         const out = path.join(tmpDir, 'test_cxpk_multi.png');
    42:         // create a payload that'll force multiple pixels / rows
    43:         const bigArr = new Array(2000).fill(0).map((_, i) => i % 256);
    44:         const packet = {
    45:             version: 1,
    46:             kind: 'cortex-packet',
    47:             type: 'cortex:npz-graph',
    48:             id: 'test-big-789',
    49:             payload: { cmd: 'big', data: bigArr }
    50:         };
    51:         await encodeCortexPacketToPng(packet, out, { width: 16, redCurtainMode: false });
    52:         expect(fs.existsSync(out)).toBe(true);
    53:         const decoded = await decodeCortexPacketFromPng(out);
    54:         expect(decoded).toBeDefined();
    55:         expect(decoded.kind).toBe('cortex-packet');
    56:         expect(decoded.type).toBe(packet.type);
    57:         expect(decoded.payload.payload?.cmd || decoded.payload.cmd).toBeDefined();
    58:         try {
    59:             fs.unlinkSync(out);
    60:         }
    61:         catch (e) { }
    62:     });
    63: });

     1: import { describe, it, expect } from 'vitest';
     2: import { encodeCortexPacketToPng, decodeCortexPacketFromPng } from './pngCodec.js';
     3: import * as fs from 'fs';
     4: import * as path from 'path';
     5: describe('pngCodec roundtrip', () => {
     6:     it('encodes and decodes a CortexPacket via PNG CXPK', async () => {
     7:         const tmpDir = path.join(process.cwd(), 'tmp');
     8:         try {
     9:             if (!fs.existsSync(tmpDir))
    10:                 fs.mkdirSync(tmpDir);
    11:         }
    12:         catch (e) { }
    13:         const out = path.join(tmpDir, 'test_cxpk.png');
    14:         const packet = {
    15:             version: 1,
    16:             kind: 'cortex-packet',
    17:             type: 'cortex:spyder-vision',
    18:             id: 'test-123',
    19:             payload: { cmd: 'test', data: [1, 2, 3], note: 'roundtrip' }
    20:         };

    23:         const decoded = await decodeCortexPacketFromPng(out);

    26:         expect(decoded.type).toBe(packet.type);

    29:         // cleanup

    31:             fs.unlinkSync(out);
    32:         }
    33:         catch (e) { }
    34:     });
    35: });

     1: import { describe, it, expect } from 'vitest';
     2: import { routeCortexPacket } from './router.js';
     3: describe('cortex:a11-suggest handler', () => {

     5:         const packet = { type: 'cortex:a11-suggest', payload: { prompt: 'Suggest 1 step' } };
     6:         const services = {
     7:             a11: {
     8:                 ask: async (prompt) => ({ choices: [{ message: { content: 'Step 1: do something' } }] })
     9:             }
    10:         };
    11:         const res = await routeCortexPacket(packet, services);
    12:         expect(res).toBeDefined();
    13:         expect(res.ok).toBe(true);
    14:         expect(res.suggestion).toBeDefined();
    15:         // suggestion is the raw response from a11.ask
    16:         expect(res.suggestion.choices[0].message.content).toContain('Step 1');
    17:     });
    18:     it('returns error when service missing', async () => {
    19:         const packet = { type: 'cortex:a11-suggest', payload: { prompt: 'Suggest' } };
    20:         const res = await routeCortexPacket(packet, undefined);
    21:         expect(res).toBeDefined();
    22:         expect(res.ok).toBe(false);
    23:         expect(res.error).toBe('a11_service_missing');
    24:     });
    25: });


============================
FILE: dist\cortex\router.js
============================
============================
     1: import alias from '../utils/alias.js';
     2: const noopHandler = async () => { return; };
     3: function resolveImport(name) {
     4:     try {
     5:         const g = globalThis || global;
     6:         if (g && typeof g.__importUtilMock === 'function')
     7:             return g.__importUtilMock(name);
     8:     }
     9:     catch (e) { }
    10:     try {
    11:         return alias.importUtil(name);
    12:     }
    13:     catch (e) { }
    14:     try {
    15:         // try require
    16:         return require(name);
    17:     }
    18:     catch (e) { }
    19:     return undefined;
    20: }
    21: // helper wrappers that resolve modules at call time (so tests can mock resolveImport via global)
    22: async function safeExecuteAction(action, ctx = {}) {
    23:     try {
    24:         const executorMod = resolveImport('../rome/executor') || resolveImport('@rome/executor') || resolveImport('src/rome/executor') || resolveImport('../rome/executor');
    25:         if (!executorMod)
    26:             return { success: false, error: 'executor_unavailable' };
    27:         const fn = executorMod.executeAction || (executorMod.default && executorMod.default.executeAction) || executorMod;
    28:         if (typeof fn !== 'function')
    29:             return { success: false, error: 'executeAction_unavailable' };
    30:         return await fn(action, ctx);
    31:     }
    32:     catch (e) {
    33:         return { success: false, error: String(e) };
    34:     }
    35: }
    36: async function safeRunSpyder(argv = []) {
    37:     try {
    38:         const runSpyderMod = resolveImport('../commands/spyder') || resolveImport('@commands/spyder') || resolveImport('src/commands/spyder');
    39:         if (!runSpyderMod)
    40:             return { code: null, error: 'spyder_unavailable' };
    41:         const fn = runSpyderMod.default || runSpyderMod;
    42:         if (typeof fn !== 'function')
    43:             return { code: null, error: 'spyder_run_unavailable' };
    44:         return await fn(argv);
    45:     }
    46:     catch (e) {
    47:         return { code: null, error: String(e) };
    48:     }
    49: }
    50: function safeEmit(eventName, payload) {
    51:     try {
    52:         const emitMod = resolveImport('./emit') || resolveImport('@cortex/emit') || resolveImport('src/cortex/emit');
    53:         if (!emitMod)
    54:             return false;
    55:         const fn = emitMod.cortexEmit || (emitMod.default && emitMod.default.cortexEmit) || emitMod;
    56:         if (typeof fn !== 'function')
    57:             return false;
    58:         fn(eventName, payload);
    59:         return true;
    60:     }
    61:     catch (e) {
    62:         return false;
    63:     }
    64: }
    65: async function safeProcessVision(p) {
    66:     try {
    67:         const visionMod = resolveImport('./vision') || resolveImport('@cortex/vision') || resolveImport('src/cortex/vision');
    68:         if (!visionMod)
    69:             return { ok: false, error: 'vision_unavailable' };
    70:         const fn = visionMod.processVisionImage || (visionMod.default && visionMod.default.processVisionImage);
    71:         if (typeof fn !== 'function')
    72:             return { ok: false, error: 'vision_fn_unavailable' };
    73:         return await fn(p && p.path ? p.path : (p && p.pngPath ? p.pngPath : p));
    74:     }
    75:     catch (e) {
    76:         return { ok: false, error: String(e) };
    77:     }
    78: }
    79: async function safeApplyPacket(pkt) {
    80:     try {
    81:         const applyMod = resolveImport('./applyPacket') || resolveImport('@cortex/applyPacket') || resolveImport('src/cortex/applyPacket');
    82:         if (!applyMod)
    83:             return { ok: false, error: 'apply_unavailable' };
    84:         const fn = applyMod.applyCortexPacket || (applyMod.default && applyMod.default.applyCortexPacket) || (applyMod.default && applyMod.default.default) || applyMod.default || applyMod;
    85:         if (typeof fn !== 'function')
    86:             return { ok: false, error: 'apply_fn_unavailable' };
    87:         return await fn(pkt);
    88:     }
    89:     catch (e) {
    90:         return { ok: false, error: String(e) };
    91:     }
    92: }
    93: // Handlers
    94: const handlers = {
    95:     'cortex:npz-graph': async (pkt) => {
    96:         const filePath = pkt.payload && pkt.payload.path ? pkt.payload.path : 'unknown';
    97:         const res = await safeExecuteAction('npz.encode', { path: filePath });
    98:         // if executor not available, behave as noop for tests
    99:         if (res && res.success === false && res.error === 'executor_unavailable')
   100:             return undefined;
   101:         return res;
   102:     },
   103:     'npz-graph': async (pkt) => {
   104:         const filePath = pkt.payload && pkt.payload.path ? pkt.payload.path : 'unknown';
   105:         const res = await safeExecuteAction('npz.encode', { path: filePath });
   106:         if (res && res.success === false && res.error === 'executor_unavailable')
   107:             return undefined;
   108:         return res;
   109:     },
   110:     'cortex:drip': async (pkt) => {
   111:         const ok = safeEmit('CORTEX-DRIP', pkt.payload);
   112:         // if emit not available, behave as noop for tests
   113:         if (!ok)
   114:             return undefined;
   115:         return { ok };
   116:     },
   117:     'cortex:enable-spyder': async (pkt) => {
   118:         try {
   119:             const cfg = pkt.payload || {};
   120:             const args = Array.isArray(cfg.args) && cfg.args.length ? cfg.args : ['start'];
   121:             const res = await safeRunSpyder(args);
   122:             return { ok: true, res };
   123:         }
   124:         catch (e) {
   125:             return { ok: false, error: String(e) };
   126:         }
   127:     },
   128:     'cortex:spyder-vision': async (pkt) => {
   129:         return await safeProcessVision(pkt.payload);
   130:     },
   131:     'spyder-vision': async (pkt) => {
   132:         return await safeProcessVision(pkt.payload);
   133:     },
   134:     'vision': async (pkt) => {
   135:         return await safeProcessVision(pkt.payload);
   136:     },
   137:     'cortex:a11-suggest': async (pkt, services) => {
   138:         try {
   139:             if (!services || !services.a11)
   140:                 return { ok: false, error: 'a11_service_missing' };
   141:             const prompt = pkt.payload && pkt.payload.prompt ? pkt.payload.prompt : 'Provide a short refactor plan.';
   142:             const resp = await services.a11.ask(prompt);
   143:             return { ok: true, suggestion: resp };
   144:         }
   145:         catch (e) {
   146:             return { ok: false, error: String(e) };
   147:         }
   148:     },
   149:     // apply-related handlers
   150:     'cortex:apply': async (pkt) => {
   151:         return await safeApplyPacket(pkt);
   152:     },
   153:     'qflush:apply': async (pkt) => {
   154:         return await safeApplyPacket(pkt);
   155:     },
   156:     // save state and auto-patch forward to apply logic
   157:     'cortex:save-state': async (pkt) => { return await safeApplyPacket(pkt); },
   158:     'save-state': async (pkt) => { return await safeApplyPacket(pkt); },
   159:     'save:state': async (pkt) => { return await safeApplyPacket(pkt); },
   160:     'auto-patch': async (pkt) => { return await safeApplyPacket(pkt); },
   161:     'auto_patch': async (pkt) => { return await safeApplyPacket(pkt); },
   162:     'auto-patch:apply': async (pkt) => { return await safeApplyPacket(pkt); },
   163:     'auto_patch:apply': async (pkt) => { return await safeApplyPacket(pkt); },
   164: };
   165: // normalize and lookup function
   166: function findHandler(pkt) {
   167:     const candidates = [];
   168:     if (pkt.type)
   169:         candidates.push(String(pkt.type));
   170:     if (pkt.payload && typeof pkt.payload === 'object') {
   171:         if (typeof pkt.payload.cmd === 'string')
   172:             candidates.push(String(pkt.payload.cmd));
   173:         if (typeof pkt.payload.command === 'string')
   174:             candidates.push(String(pkt.payload.command));
   175:     }
   176:     // add lowercase variants
   177:     for (const c of candidates.slice())
   178:         candidates.push(c.toLowerCase());
   179:     for (const c of candidates) {
   180:         const key = String(c || '').toLowerCase();
   181:         if (handlers[key])
   182:             return handlers[key];
   183:     }
   184:     // fallback to routesCfg pick logic if present
   185:     try {
   186:         const routesCfg = resolveImport('./routesConfig') || resolveImport('@cortex/routesConfig') || resolveImport('src/cortex/routesConfig');
   187:         if (routesCfg && typeof routesCfg.pickBestRoute === 'function') {
   188:             const pick = routesCfg.pickBestRoute(candidates);
   189:             if (pick) {
   190:                 const k = String(pick).toLowerCase();
   191:                 if (handlers[k])
   192:                     return handlers[k];
   193:             }
   194:         }
   195:     }
   196:     catch (e) { }
   197:     return noopHandler;
   198: }
   199: export async function routeCortexPacket(packet, services) {
   200:     const h = findHandler(packet);
   201:     try {
   202:         return await h(packet, services);
   203:     }
   204:     catch (e) {
   205:         return { ok: false, error: String(e) };
   206:     }
   207: }
   208: export default { routeCortexPacket };

    20:         expect(res).toBeUndefined();

    22:     });
    23: });

============================
FILE: dist\cortex\routesConfig.js
============================
============================
     1: import * as fs from 'fs';
     2: import * as path from 'path';
     3: const ROUTES_PATH = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'cortex.routes.json');
     4: export function loadRoutesConfig() {
     5:     try {
     6:         if (!fs.existsSync(ROUTES_PATH))
     7:             return null;
     8:         const raw = fs.readFileSync(ROUTES_PATH, 'utf8') || '{}';
     9:         const parsed = JSON.parse(raw);
    10:         // support two shapes: { routes: [...] } or { cortexActions: { name: true } } or object map
    11:         if (parsed && parsed.routes && Array.isArray(parsed.routes)) {
    12:             const out = {};
    13:             for (const r of parsed.routes)
    14:                 out[r] = { enabled: true, score: 0 };
    15:             return out;
    16:         }
    17:         if (parsed && parsed.cortexActions && typeof parsed.cortexActions === 'object' && !Array.isArray(parsed.cortexActions)) {
    18:             const out = {};
    19:             for (const [k, v] of Object.entries(parsed.cortexActions)) {
    20:                 if (typeof v === 'boolean')
    21:                     out[k] = { enabled: v, score: 0 };
    22:                 else
    23:                     out[k] = v;
    24:             }
    25:             return out;
    26:         }
    27:         if (parsed && typeof parsed === 'object') {
    28:             // assume mapping directly
    29:             return parsed;
    30:         }
    31:         return null;
    32:     }
    33:     catch (e) {
    34:         return null;
    35:     }
    36: }
    37: export function isRouteEnabled(name) {
    38:     try {
    39:         const cfg = loadRoutesConfig();
    40:         if (!cfg)
    41:             return true; // default allow
    42:         const entry = cfg[name];
    43:         if (!entry)
    44:             return true;
    45:         if (typeof entry.enabled === 'boolean')
    46:             return entry.enabled;
    47:         return true;
    48:     }
    49:     catch (e) {
    50:         return true;
    51:     }
    52: }
    53: export function getRouteScore(name) {
    54:     try {
    55:         const cfg = loadRoutesConfig();
    56:         if (!cfg)
    57:             return 0;
    58:         const entry = cfg[name];
    59:         if (!entry)
    60:             return 0;
    61:         const s = Number(entry.score || 0);
    62:         return Number.isFinite(s) ? s : 0;
    63:     }
    64:     catch (e) {
    65:         return 0;
    66:     }
    67: }
    68: export function pickBestRoute(candidates) {
    69:     if (!candidates || !candidates.length)
    70:         return null;
    71:     const scores = candidates.map(n => ({ name: n, score: getRouteScore(n) }));
    72:     // filter enabled
    73:     const enabled = scores.filter(s => isRouteEnabled(s.name));
    74:     if (!enabled.length)
    75:         return null;
    76:     enabled.sort((a, b) => b.score - a.score);
    77:     return enabled[0].name;
    78: }
    79: export default { loadRoutesConfig, isRouteEnabled, getRouteScore, pickBestRoute };

     1: import { describe, it, expect } from 'vitest';
     2: import { loadRoutesConfig, pickBestRoute, isRouteEnabled } from './routesConfig.js';
     3: import * as fs from 'fs';
     4: import * as path from 'path';
     5: describe('routesConfig', () => {
     6:     it('loads array routes', () => {
     7:         const tmp = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'cortex.routes.json');
     8:         try {
     9:             if (!fs.existsSync(path.dirname(tmp)))
    10:                 fs.mkdirSync(path.dirname(tmp), { recursive: true });
    11:             fs.writeFileSync(tmp, JSON.stringify({ routes: ['A', 'B'] }, null, 2), 'utf8');
    12:             const cfg = loadRoutesConfig();
    13:             expect(cfg).toBeTruthy();
    14:             const pick = pickBestRoute(['A', 'B']);
    15:             expect(pick).toBe('A');
    16:         }
    17:         finally {
    18:             try {
    19:                 fs.unlinkSync(tmp);
    20:             }
    21:             catch (e) { }
    22:         }
    23:     });
    24:     it('respects disabled flag', () => {
    25:         const tmp = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'cortex.routes.json');
    26:         try {
    27:             fs.writeFileSync(tmp, JSON.stringify({ cortexActions: { 'A': true, 'B': false } }, null, 2), 'utf8');
    28:             expect(isRouteEnabled('A')).toBe(true);
    29:             expect(isRouteEnabled('B')).toBe(false);
    30:         }
    31:         finally {
    32:             try {
    33:                 fs.unlinkSync(tmp);
    34:             }
    35:             catch (e) { }
    36:         }
    37:     });
    38: });

     1: import * as fs from 'fs';
     2: import * as path from 'path';
     3: import { decodeCortexPacketFromPng } from './pngCodec.js';
     4: const OUT = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'spyder-vision.json');
     5: export async function processVisionImage(pngPath) {
     6:     try {
     7:         const pkt = await decodeCortexPacketFromPng(pngPath);
     8:         // naive vision: store packet payload or metadata
     9:         const data = { source: pngPath, packet: pkt, processedAt: new Date().toISOString() };
    10:         try {
    11:             const dir = path.dirname(OUT);
    12:             if (!fs.existsSync(dir))
    13:                 fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
    14:             fs.writeFileSync(OUT, JSON.stringify(data, null, 2), 'utf8');
    15:         }
    16:         catch (e) { }
    17:         return data;
    18:     }
    19:     catch (e) {
    20:         throw e;
    21:     }
    22: }
    23: export default { processVisionImage };

    45: const TRIAL_DAYS = 14;
    46: function isTrialExpired(context) {
    47:     const started = context.globalState.get('qflush.trialStarted');
    48:     if (!started)
    49:         return false; // start on first use
    50:     const now = Date.now();
    51:     return now - started > TRIAL_DAYS * 24 * 3600 * 1000;
    52: }
    53: function ensureTrialStarted(context) {
    54:     const started = context.globalState.get('qflush.trialStarted');
    55:     if (!started)
    56:         context.globalState.update('qflush.trialStarted', Date.now());
    57: }
    58: function postJson(urlStr, body) {
    59:     return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
    60:         try {
    61:             const url = new URL(urlStr);
    62:             const data = JSON.stringify(body || {});
    63:             const opts = {
    64:                 hostname: url.hostname,
    65:                 port: url.port || (url.protocol === 'https:' ? 443 : 80),
    66:                 path: url.pathname + (url.search || ''),
    67:                 method: 'POST',
    68:                 headers: {
    69:                     'Content-Type': 'application/json',
    70:                     'Content-Length': Buffer.byteLength(data),
    71:                 },
    72:             };
    73:             const lib = url.protocol === 'https:' ? https : http;
    74:             const req = lib.request(opts, (res) => {
    75:                 let raw = '';
    76:                 res.setEncoding('utf8');
    77:                 res.on('data', (chunk) => (raw += chunk));
    78:                 res.on('end', () => {
    79:                     try {
    80:                         const parsed = raw ? JSON.parse(raw) : {};
    81:                         if (res.statusCode && res.statusCode >= 200 && res.statusCode < 300)
    82:                             resolve(parsed);
    83:                         else
    84:                             reject(new Error(parsed && parsed.error ? parsed.error : `HTTP ${res.statusCode}`));
    85:                     }
    86:                     catch (e) {
    87:                         reject(e);
    88:                     }
    89:                 });
    90:             });
    91:             req.on('error', (err) => reject(err));
    92:             req.write(data);
    93:             req.end();
    94:         }
    95:         catch (e) {
    96:             reject(e);
    97:         }
    98:     });
    99: }
   100: function getJson(urlStr) {
   101:     return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
   102:         try {
   103:             const url = new URL(urlStr);
   104:             const lib = url.protocol === 'https:' ? https : http;
   105:             const req = lib.get(urlStr, (res) => {
   106:                 let raw = '';
   107:                 res.setEncoding('utf8');
   108:                 res.on('data', (chunk) => (raw += chunk));
   109:                 res.on('end', () => {
   110:                     try {
   111:                         const parsed = raw ? JSON.parse(raw) : {};
   112:                         if (res.statusCode && res.statusCode >= 200 && res.statusCode < 300)
   113:                             resolve(parsed);
   114:                         else
   115:                             reject(new Error(parsed && parsed.error ? parsed.error : `HTTP ${res.statusCode}`));
   116:                     }
   117:                     catch (e) {
   118:                         reject(e);
   119:                     }
   120:                 });
   121:             });
   122:             req.on('error', (err) => reject(err));
   123:         }
   124:         catch (e) {
   125:             reject(e);
   126:         }
   127:     });
   128: }
   129: async function saveRomeIndexRecord(record) {
   130:     try {
   131:         const root = process.cwd();
   132:         const dir = path.join(root, '.qflush');
   133:         if (!fs.existsSync(dir))
   134:             fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
   135:         const idxFile = path.join(dir, 'rome-index.json');
   136:         let idx = {};
   137:         if (fs.existsSync(idxFile)) {
   138:             try {
   139:                 idx = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(idxFile, 'utf8') || '{}');
   140:             }
   141:             catch {
   142:                 idx = {};
   143:             }
   144:         }
   145:         // normalize path and build canonical record using shared module
   146:         const relPath = (0, rome_tag_1.normalizeRomePath)(record.path);
   147:         const rec = (0, rome_tag_1.makeRomeTagRecord)({ type: record.type, path: relPath });
   148:         idx[rec.path] = rec;
   149:         fs.writeFileSync(idxFile, JSON.stringify(idx, null, 2), 'utf8');
   150:         return { success: true, record: idx[rec.path] };
   151:     }
   152:     catch (e) {
   153:         return { success: false, error: String(e) };
   154:     }
   155: }
   156: function activate(context) {
   157:     ensureTrialStarted(context);
   158:     const openDisposable = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.openPanel', () => {
   159:         if (isTrialExpired(context)) {
   160:             vscode.window.showInformationMessage('QFlush trial expired. Click to purchase a license.', 'Purchase', 'Enter Key').then((v) => {
   161:                 if (v === 'Purchase')
   162:                     vscode.env.openExternal(vscode.Uri.parse('https://gumroad.com/l/your-product'));
   163:                 if (v === 'Enter Key')
   164:                     vscode.commands.executeCommand('qflush.enterLicense');
   165:             });
   166:             return;
   167:         }
   168:         const panel = vscode.window.createWebviewPanel('qflushPanel', 'QFlush', vscode.ViewColumn.One, {
   169:             enableScripts: true,
   170:             localResourceRoots: [vscode.Uri.file(path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src'))],
   171:         });
   172:         const htmlPath = path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src', 'panel.html');
   173:         let html = '';
   174:         try {
   175:             html = fs.readFileSync(htmlPath, 'utf8');
   176:         }
   177:         catch (e) {
   178:             html = `<html><body><pre>panel.html not found at ${htmlPath}</pre></body></html>`;
   179:         }
   180:         panel.webview.html = html;
   181:         const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
   182:         const daemonUrl = cfg.get('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
   183:         const token = cfg.get('adminToken') || '';
   184:         // Send config to webview securely via postMessage
   185:         panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'config', daemonUrl, token });
   186:         // Handle messages from the webview
   187:         panel.webview.onDidReceiveMessage(async (message) => {
   188:             if (message && message.type === 'saveConfig') {
   189:                 const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
   190:                 await cfg.update('daemonUrl', message.daemonUrl, vscode.ConfigurationTarget.Global);
   191:                 await cfg.update('adminToken', message.token, vscode.ConfigurationTarget.Global);
   192:                 panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'saved', info: 'Configuration saved' });
   193:             }
   194:         }, undefined, context.subscriptions);
   195:     });
   196:     const openPourparler = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.openPourparler', () => {
   197:         const panel = vscode.window.createWebviewPanel('qflushPourparler', 'Pourparler', vscode.ViewColumn.One, { enableScripts: true, localResourceRoots: [vscode.Uri.file(path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src'))] });
   198:         const htmlPath = path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src', 'pourparler-web.html');
   199:         let html = '';
   200:         try {
   201:             html = fs.readFileSync(htmlPath, 'utf8');
   202:         }
   203:         catch (e) {
   204:             html = `<html><body><pre>pourparler-web.html not found at ${htmlPath}</pre></body></html>`;
   205:         }
   206:         panel.webview.html = html;
   207:         panel.webview.onDidReceiveMessage(async (msg) => {
   208:             try {
   209:                 if (msg && msg.type === 'export') {
   210:                     const destUri = await vscode.window.showSaveDialog({ defaultUri: vscode.Uri.file(path.join(process.cwd(), msg.filename)), filters: { 'Images': ['png', 'svg'] } });
   211:                     if (!destUri)
   212:                         return;
   213:                     if (msg.format === 'svg') {
   214:                         fs.writeFileSync(destUri.fsPath, msg.data, 'utf8');
   215:                     }
   216:                     else if (msg.format === 'png') {
   217:                         // data url -> binary
   218:                         const base64 = msg.data.split(',')[1];
   219:                         const buf = Buffer.from(base64, 'base64');
   220:                         fs.writeFileSync(destUri.fsPath, buf);
   221:                     }
   222:                     vscode.window.showInformationMessage(`Exported ${msg.filename}`);
   223:                 }
   224:                 // new messages from pourparler webview
   225:                 if (msg && msg.type === 'npzList') {
   226:                     const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
   227:                     const daemonUrl = cfg.get('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
   228:                     try {
   229:                         const data = await getJson(`${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/npz/checksum/list`);
   230:                         panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'npzListResult', data });
   231:                     }
   232:                     catch (e) {
   233:                         panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'npzListResult', data: { success: false, error: String(e) } });
   234:                     }
   235:                 }
   236:                 if (msg && msg.type === 'npzClear') {
   237:                     const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
   238:                     const daemonUrl = cfg.get('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
   239:                     try {
   240:                         const resp = await fetch(`${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/npz/checksum/clear`, { method: 'DELETE' });
   241:                         const j = await resp.json();
   242:                         panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'npzClearResult', data: j });
   243:                     }
   244:                     catch (e) {
   245:                         panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'npzClearResult', data: { success: false, error: String(e) } });
   246:                     }
   247:                 }
   248:                 if (msg && msg.type === 'npzIndexTag') {
   249:                     const rec = msg.payload;
   250:                     const r = await saveRomeIndexRecord({ path: rec.path, type: rec.type, tag: rec.tag });
   251:                     panel.webview.postMessage(Object.assign({ type: 'npzIndexTagResult' }, r));
   252:                 }
   253:             }
   254:             catch (e) {
   255:                 vscode.window.showErrorMessage('Extension message handler failed: ' + String(e));
   256:             }
   257:         }, undefined, context.subscriptions);
   258:     });
   259:     const enterLicense = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.enterLicense', async () => {
   260:         const key = await vscode.window.showInputBox({ prompt: 'Enter your QFlush license key' });
   261:         if (!key)
   262:             return;
   263:         const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
   264:         const daemonUrl = cfg.get('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
   265:         const activateUrl = `${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/license/activate`;
   266:         const progressOptions = { location: vscode.ProgressLocation.Notification, title: 'Activating QFlush license...', cancellable: false };
   267:         try {
   268:             await vscode.window.withProgress(progressOptions, async () => {
   269:                 const res = await postJson(activateUrl, { key });
   270:                 // store license info locally in extension globalState
   271:                 await context.globalState.update('qflush.licenseKey', key);
   272:                 await context.globalState.update('qflush.licenseInfo', res.license || res);
   273:                 vscode.window.showInformationMessage('License activated successfully. Thanks!');
   274:             });
   275:         }
   276:         catch (err) {
   277:             vscode.window.showErrorMessage(`License activation failed: ${err && err.message ? err.message : String(err)}`);
   278:         }
   279:     });
   280:     const showStatus = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.showLicenseStatus', async () => {
   281:         const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
   282:         const daemonUrl = cfg.get('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
   283:         const statusUrl = `${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/license/status`;
   284:         try {
   285:             const res = await getJson(statusUrl);
   286:             if (!res || !res.success) {
   287:                 vscode.window.showInformationMessage('No license information available');
   288:                 return;
   289:             }
   290:             const lic = res.license;
   291:             if (!lic) {
   292:                 vscode.window.showInformationMessage('No local license installed');
   293:                 return;
   294:             }
   295:             const exp = lic.expiresAt ? new Date(lic.expiresAt).toLocaleString() : 'never (subscription)';
   296:             vscode.window.showInformationMessage(`License: ${lic.key} product=${lic.product_id} expires=${exp} valid=${res.valid}`);
   297:         }
   298:         catch (err) {
   299:             vscode.window.showErrorMessage(`Failed to fetch status: ${err && err.message ? err.message : String(err)}`);
   300:         }
   301:     });
   302:     const openTelemetry = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.openTelemetry', () => {
   303:         const panel = vscode.window.createWebviewPanel('qflushTelemetry', 'QFlush Telemetry', vscode.ViewColumn.Two, { enableScripts: true, localResourceRoots: [vscode.Uri.file(path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src'))] });
   304:         const htmlPath = path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src', 'telemetry-view.html');
   305:         let html = '';
   306:         try {
   307:             html = fs.readFileSync(htmlPath, 'utf8');
   308:         }
   309:         catch (e) {
   310:             html = `<html><body><pre>telemetry-view.html not found at ${htmlPath}</pre></body></html>`;
   311:         }
   312:         panel.webview.html = html;
   313:     });
   314:     context.subscriptions.push(openDisposable, openPourparler, enterLicense, showStatus, openTelemetry);
   315: }
   316: function deactivate() { }

FILE: dist\extensions\vscode-npz\src\polyfill-file.js
============================

     1: "use strict";
     2: Object.defineProperty(exports, "__esModule", { value: true });
     3: // Polyfill minimal File/Blob for Node environments when libraries expect browser globals
     4: if (typeof globalThis.File === 'undefined') {
     5:     globalThis.File = class File extends Uint8Array {
     6:         constructor(parts = [], name = 'file', options = {}) {
     7:             // naive implementation: store data as concatenated string/Uint8Array
     8:             const chunks = parts.map(p => typeof p === 'string' ? Buffer.from(p) : Buffer.from(p));
     9:             const buf = Buffer.concat(chunks);
    10:             super(buf);
    11:             this.name = name;
    12:             this.lastModified = options.lastModified || Date.now();
    13:             this.size = buf.length;
    14:             this.type = options.type || '';
    15:         }
    16:         text() { return Promise.resolve(Buffer.from(this).toString('utf8')); }
    17:         arrayBuffer() { return Promise.resolve(Uint8Array.from(this).buffer); }
    18:         stream() { throw new Error('stream() not implemented'); }
    19:     };
    20: }
    21: if (typeof globalThis.Blob === 'undefined') {
    22:     globalThis.Blob = class Blob extends Uint8Array {
    23:         constructor(parts = [], options = {}) {
    24:             const chunks = parts.map(p => typeof p === 'string' ? Buffer.from(p) : Buffer.from(p));
    25:             const buf = Buffer.concat(chunks);
    26:             super(buf);
    27:             this.size = buf.length;
    28:             this.type = options.type || '';
    29:         }
    30:         text() { return Promise.resolve(Buffer.from(this).toString('utf8')); }
    31:         arrayBuffer() { return Promise.resolve(Uint8Array.from(this).buffer); }
    32:     };
    33: }

FILE: dist\src\chain\smartChain.js
============================
============================
     1: "use strict";
     2: // ROME-TAG: 0x8CD4FC
     3: Object.defineProperty(exports, "__esModule", { value: true });
     4: exports.buildPipeline = buildPipeline;
     5: exports.executePipeline = executePipeline;
     6: const logger_1 = require("../utils/logger");
     7: const detect_1 = require("../commands/detect");
     8: const config_1 = require("../commands/config");
     9: const purge_1 = require("../commands/purge");
    10: const kill_1 = require("../commands/kill");
    11: const start_1 = require("../commands/start");
    12: const exodia_1 = require("../commands/exodia");
    13: const ORDER = ["detect", "config", "purge", "kill", "start", "exodia"];
    14: function parseArgs(argv) {
    15:     const cmds = [];
    16:     const flags = {};
    17:     const modulePaths = {};
    18:     const tokens = {};
    19:     const services = [];
    20:     let currentService;
    21:     let i = 0;
    22:     while (i < argv.length) {
    23:         const a = argv[i];
    24:         if (!a.startsWith("-")) {
    25:             cmds.push(a.toLowerCase());
    26:             i++;
    27:             continue;
    28:         }
    29:         const clean = a.replace(/^--?/, "");
    30:         if (clean === "service" || clean === "s") {
    31:             const next = argv[i + 1];
    32:             if (next && !next.startsWith("-")) {
    33:                 currentService = next.toLowerCase();
    34:                 services.push(currentService);
    35:                 i += 2;
    36:                 continue;
    37:             }
    38:             else {
    39:                 i++;
    40:                 continue;
    41:             }
    42:         }
    43:         if (clean === "path") {
    44:             const next = argv[i + 1];
    45:             if (next && !next.startsWith("-")) {
    46:                 if (currentService)
    47:                     modulePaths[currentService] = next;
    48:                 i += 2;
    49:                 continue;
    50:             }
    51:             i++;
    52:             continue;
    53:         }
    54:         if (clean === "token") {
    55:             const next = argv[i + 1];
    56:             if (next && !next.startsWith("-")) {
    57:                 if (currentService)
    58:                     tokens[currentService] = next;
    59:                 i += 2;
    60:                 continue;
    61:             }
    62:             i++;
    63:             continue;
    64:         }
    65:         const kv = clean.split("=");
    66:         if (kv.length === 2) {
    67:             flags[kv[0]] = kv[1];
    68:             i++;
    69:             continue;
    70:         }
    71:         const next = argv[i + 1];
    72:         if (next && !next.startsWith("-")) {
    73:             flags[clean] = next;
    74:             i += 2;
    75:             continue;
    76:         }
    77:         flags[clean] = true;
    78:         i++;
    79:     }
    80:     return { cmds, flags, modulePaths, tokens, services };
    81: }
    82: function buildPipeline(argv) {
    83:     const { cmds, flags, modulePaths, tokens, services } = parseArgs(argv);
    84:     const unique = Array.from(new Set(cmds));
    85:     const known = unique.filter((c) => ORDER.includes(c));
    86:     if (known.length === 0)
    87:         return {
    88:             pipeline: ["detect", "config", "start"],
    89:             options: { flags, modulePaths, tokens, global: {}, services },
    90:         };
    91:     // build set with dependencies
    92:     const set = new Set(known);
    93:     // dependencies mapping
    94:     const deps = {
    95:         start: ["config"],
    96:         config: ["detect"],
    97:         purge: ["detect"],
    98:     };
    99:     // add dependencies recursively
   100:     function addDeps(cmd) {
   101:         const ds = deps[cmd] || [];
   102:         for (const d of ds) {
   103:             if (!set.has(d)) {
   104:                 set.add(d);
   105:                 addDeps(d);
   106:             }
   107:         }
   108:     }
   109:     for (const k of Array.from(set))
   110:         addDeps(k);
   111:     let final = [];
   112:     // Flag-driven transformations
   113:     if (flags["fresh"]) {
   114:         set.add("purge");
   115:         // ensure purge runs before start
   116:     }
   117:     if (flags["force"]) {
   118:         // make sure kill runs before start
   119:         set.add("kill");
   120:     }
   121:     const requestedKill = known.includes("kill");
   122:     if (requestedKill) {
   123:         // put kill first if user explicitly requested it
   124:         final.push("kill");
   125:         for (const k of ORDER) {
   126:             if (k === "kill")
   127:                 continue;
   128:             if (set.has(k))
   129:                 final.push(k);
   130:         }
   131:     }
   132:     else {
   133:         for (const k of ORDER) {
   134:             if (set.has(k))
   135:                 final.push(k);
   136:         }
   137:     }
   138:     // remove duplicates and preserve order
   139:     final = final.filter((v, i) => final.indexOf(v) === i);
   140:     logger_1.logger.info(`SmartChain built pipeline: ${final.join(" -> ")}`);
   141:     const options = { global: {}, flags, modulePaths, tokens, services };
   142:     return { pipeline: final, options };
   143: }
   144: async function executePipeline(pipeline, options) {
   145:     for (const step of pipeline) {
   146:         logger_1.logger.info(`Executing pipeline step: ${step}`);
   147:         switch (step) {
   148:             case "detect": {
   149:                 const detected = await (0, detect_1.runDetect)(options);
   150:                 options.detected = detected || {};
   151:                 if (detected && typeof detected === "object") {
   152:                     options.modulePaths = { ...(options.modulePaths || {}), ...(detected.paths || {}) };
   153:                 }
   154:                 break;
   155:             }
   156:             case "config":
   157:                 await (0, config_1.runConfig)(options);
   158:                 break;
   159:             case "purge":
   160:                 await (0, purge_1.runPurge)(options);
   161:                 break;
   162:             case "kill":
   163:                 await (0, kill_1.runKill)(options);
   164:                 break;
   165:             case "start":
   166:                 await (0, start_1.runStart)(options);
   167:                 break;
   168:             case "exodia":
   169:                 await (0, exodia_1.runExodia)(options);
   170:                 break;
   171:             default:
   172:                 logger_1.logger.warn(`Unknown pipeline step: ${step}`);
   173:         }
   174:     }
   175: }

FILE: dist\src\cli\help.js
============================

     1: "use strict";
     2: // ROME-TAG: 0x1DEEBD
     3: Object.defineProperty(exports, "__esModule", { value: true });
     4: exports.showHelp = showHelp;
     5: const logger_1 = require("../utils/logger");
     6: function showHelp() {
     7:     logger_1.logger.info(`qflush - Funesterie orchestrator`);
     8:     console.log(`
     9: Usage:
    10:   qflush [command] [options]
    11: 
    12: Commands:
    13:   start        Launch selected services (default: detect → config → start)
    14:   kill         Kill running services
    15:   purge        Clear caches, logs and sessions
    16:   inspect      Show running services and ports
    17:   config       Generate missing .env/config files
    18:   secret import  Import secrets from a .env file into local encrypted store (Windows DPAPI)
    19: 
    20: Options (examples):
    21:   --service rome --path D:/rome --token ABC123     Target a specific service and give path/token
    22:   --service nezlephant --service freeland          Target multiple services
    23:   --dev --fresh                                    Global flags (dev mode, fresh start)
    24:   --force                                          Force restart semantics (implies kill before start)
    25: 
    26: Examples:
    27:   qflush start --service rome --path D:/rome
    28:   qflush start --service nezlephant --service freeland --fresh
    29:   qflush config --service freeland
    30:   qflush purge --fresh
    31: 
    32: Scripts & helpers:
    33:   node scripts/detach.js [--quiet] <command>   # spawn detached process (use --quiet to suppress output)
    34:   ./scripts/run-with-timeout.sh <sec> <cmd>    # run command with timeout (POSIX)
    35:   pwsh ./scripts/run-with-timeout.ps1 -Cmd "node dist/index.js start" -TimeoutSec 12  # PowerShell watchdog (quiet by default)
    36:   qflush secret import [--env <path>] [--no-acl]   # import .env and store encrypted locally
    37: 
    38: `);
    39: }

FILE: dist\src\commands\checksum.js
