     1: "use strict";
     2: // ROME-TAG: 0xA0F9B4
     3: var __importDefault = (this && this.__importDefault) || function (mod) {
     4:     return (mod && mod.__esModule) ? mod : { "default": mod };
     5: };
     6: Object.defineProperty(exports, "__esModule", { value: true });
     7: exports.default = runChecksum;
     8: const fetch_1 = __importDefault(require("../utils/fetch"));
     9: const logger_1 = __importDefault(require("../utils/logger"));
    10: const DAEMON = process.env.QFLUSH_DAEMON || 'http://localhost:4500';
    11: async function postJson(url, body) {
    12:     const res = await (0, fetch_1.default)(url, { method: 'POST', headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' }, body: JSON.stringify(body) });
    13:     const json = await res.json();
    14:     return json;
    15: }
    16: async function getJson(url) {
    17:     const res = await (0, fetch_1.default)(url);
    18:     const json = await res.json();
    19:     return json;
    20: }
    21: async function runChecksum(argv = []) {
    22:     const sub = argv[0];
    23:     if (!sub) {
    24:         logger_1.default.info('Usage: qflush checksum <store|verify|list|clear>');
    25:         return 1;
    26:     }
    27:     if (sub === 'store') {
    28:         const id = argv[1];
    29:         const checksum = argv[2];
    30:         const ttlArg = argv.find((a) => a.startsWith('--ttl='));
    31:         const ttlMs = ttlArg ? Number(ttlArg.split('=')[1]) : undefined;
    32:         if (!id || !checksum) {
    33:             logger_1.default.error('Usage: qflush checksum store <id> <checksum> [--ttl=ms]');
    34:             return 1;
    35:         }
    36:         const body = { id, checksum };
    37:         if (ttlMs)
    38:             body.ttlMs = ttlMs;
    39:         const res = await postJson(`${DAEMON.replace(/\/$/, '')}/npz/checksum/store`, body);
    40:         logger_1.default.info(`store => ${JSON.stringify(res)}`);
    41:         return 0;
    42:     }
    43:     if (sub === 'verify') {
    44:         const id = argv[1];
    45:         const checksum = argv[2];
    46:         if (!id || !checksum) {
    47:             logger_1.default.error('Usage: qflush checksum verify <id> <checksum>');
    48:             return 1;
    49:         }
    50:         const res = await postJson(`${DAEMON.replace(/\/$/, '')}/npz/checksum/verify`, { id, checksum });
    51:         if (res && res.success) {
    52:             logger_1.default.success('verify: OK');
    53:             return 0;
    54:         }
    55:         logger_1.default.error(`verify failed: ${JSON.stringify(res)}`);
    56:         return 2;
    57:     }
    58:     if (sub === 'list') {
    59:         const res = await getJson(`${DAEMON.replace(/\/$/, '')}/npz/checksum/list`);
    60:         logger_1.default.info(JSON.stringify(res, null, 2));
    61:         return 0;
    62:     }
    63:     if (sub === 'clear') {
    64:         const res = await (0, fetch_1.default)(`${DAEMON.replace(/\/$/, '')}/npz/checksum/clear`, { method: 'DELETE' });
    65:         const j = await res.json();
    66:         logger_1.default.info(JSON.stringify(j));
    67:         return 0;
    68:     }
    69:     logger_1.default.error('Unknown checksum command');

FILE: dist\src\commands\compose.js
============================

     1: "use strict";
     2: // ROME-TAG: 0xD0CF40
     3: var __importDefault = (this && this.__importDefault) || function (mod) {
     4:     return (mod && mod.__esModule) ? mod : { "default": mod };
     5: };
     6: Object.defineProperty(exports, "__esModule", { value: true });
     7: exports.runCompose = runCompose;
     8: const parser_1 = require("../compose/parser");
     9: const logger_1 = require("../utils/logger");
    10: const start_1 = require("./start");
    11: const supervisor_1 = require("../supervisor");
    12: const purge_1 = require("./purge");
    13: const fs_1 = __importDefault(require("fs"));
    14: const tail_1 = require("tail");
    15: async function runCompose(argv) {
    16:     const sub = argv[0];
    17:     const compose = (0, parser_1.readCompose)();
    18:     if (!compose) {
    19:         logger_1.logger.error('No funesterie.yml or funesterie.fcl found');
    20:         return;
    21:     }
    22:     if (sub === 'up') {
    23:         // support --background flag
    24:         const bg = argv.includes('--background') || argv.includes('-b');
    25:         const modules = Object.keys(compose.modules);
    26:         for (const m of modules) {
    27:             const def = compose.modules[m];
    28:             logger_1.logger.info(`Bringing up ${m} from ${def.path || 'package'}`);
    29:             if (bg) {
    30:                 // start in background using supervisor
    31:                 const logPath = `${process.cwd()}/.qflush/logs/${m}.log`;
    32:                 (0, supervisor_1.startProcess)(m, def.path || m, [], { cwd: def.path || process.cwd(), detached: true, logPath });
    33:             }
    34:             else {
    35:                 await (0, start_1.runStart)({ services: [m], modulePaths: { [m]: def.path }, flags: {} });
    36:             }
    37:         }
    38:         return;
    39:     }
    40:     if (sub === 'down') {
    41:         logger_1.logger.info('Bringing down all modules');
    42:         await (0, purge_1.runPurge)();
    43:         return;
    44:     }
    45:     if (sub === 'restart') {
    46:         const name = argv[1];
    47:         if (!name) {
    48:             logger_1.logger.info('Specify module to restart');
    49:             return;
    50:         }
    51:         // naive: stop and start
    52:         const running = (0, supervisor_1.listRunning)();
    53:         if (running.find(r => r.name === name)) {
    54:             // stop
    55:             await (0, supervisor_1.stopProcess)(name);
    56:         }
    57:         const def = compose.modules[name];
    58:         if (!def) {
    59:             logger_1.logger.info('Unknown module');
    60:             return;
    61:         }
    62:         await (0, start_1.runStart)({ services: [name], modulePaths: { [name]: def.path }, flags: {} });
    63:         return;
    64:     }
    65:     if (sub === 'logs') {
    66:         const name = argv[1];
    67:         if (!name) {
    68:             logger_1.logger.info('Specify module name');
    69:             return;
    70:         }
    71:         const logFile = `${process.cwd()}/.qflush/logs/${name}.log`;
    72:         if (!fs_1.default.existsSync(logFile)) {
    73:             logger_1.logger.info('No log file found');
    74:             return;
    75:         }
    76:         const t = new tail_1.Tail(logFile, { fromBeginning: false });
    77:         t.on('line', (data) => console.log(data));
    78:         t.on('error', (err) => console.error(err));
    79:         return;
    80:     }
    81:     logger_1.logger.info('Usage: qflush compose [up|down|restart|logs]');
    82: }

FILE: dist\src\commands\config.js

     1: "use strict";
     2: // ROME-TAG: 0x130555
     3: Object.defineProperty(exports, "__esModule", { value: true });
     4: exports.runConfig = runConfig;
     5: const fs_1 = require("fs");
     6: const logger_1 = require("../utils/logger");
     7: const paths_1 = require("../utils/paths");
     8: async function runConfig(opts) {
     9:     logger_1.logger.info("qflush: generating default configs...");
    10:     const detected = opts?.detected || {};
    11:     const paths = (0, paths_1.resolvePaths)(detected);
    12:     for (const key of Object.keys(paths)) {
    13:         const p = paths[key];
    14:         if (!p)
    15:             continue;
    16:         const envFile = `${p}/.env`;
    17:         try {
    18:             await fs_1.promises.access(envFile);
    19:             logger_1.logger.info(`${key}: .env already exists`);
    20:         }
    21:         catch {
    22:             const content = `# ${key} default env\nPORT=3000\nTOKEN=changeme\n`;
    23:             await fs_1.promises.mkdir(p, { recursive: true });
    24:             await fs_1.promises.writeFile(envFile, content, { encoding: "utf8" });
    25:             logger_1.logger.success(`Created ${envFile}`);
    26:         }
    27:     }
    28: }

    61:         return 0;
    62:     }

    64:     rl.question('message> ', async (answer) => { await postMessage(answer); rl.close(); process.exit(0); });
    65:     return 0;
    66: }

     4: const supervisor_1 = require("../supervisor");
     5: async function runFreeze(argv = []) {
     6:     // parse --health=<url>
     7:     let healthUrl = null;
     8:     for (const a of argv) {
     9:         if (a.startsWith('--health=')) {
    10:             healthUrl = a.split('=')[1];
    11:             break;
    12:         }
    13:         if (a === '--health') {
    14:             const idx = argv.indexOf(a);
    15:             if (idx >= 0 && idx < argv.length - 1)
    16:                 healthUrl = argv[idx + 1];
    17:             break;
    18:         }
    19:     }
    20:     if (!healthUrl) {
    21:         (0, supervisor_1.freezeAll)('manual');
    22:         console.log('QFLUSH frozen (manual)');
    23:         return 0;
    24:     }
    25:     (0, supervisor_1.freezeAll)('manual', {
    26:         autoResume: true,
    27:         resumeCheck: {
    28:             url: healthUrl,
    29:             intervalMs: 3000,
    30:             timeoutMs: 120000,
    31:         },
    32:     });
    33:     console.log(`QFLUSH frozen + auto-resume active (health=${healthUrl})`);
    34:     return 0;
    35: }

    11: async function runLicense(argv = []) {
    12:     const sub = argv[0];
    13:     if (!sub) {

    16:     }

    23:         // parse optional --product=ID
    24:         const prodArg = argv.find((a) => a.startsWith('--product='));
    25:         const productId = prodArg ? prodArg.split('=')[1] : process.env.GUMROAD_PRODUCT_ID || process.env.GUMROAD_PRODUCT_YEARLY || process.env.GUMROAD_PRODUCT_MONTHLY;
    26:         const token = (0, secrets_1.getSecret)('GUMROAD_TOKEN', { fileEnv: 'GUMROAD_TOKEN_FILE' });
    27:         if (!token) {
    28:             logger_1.default.error('GUMROAD_TOKEN not set (env or file). Set it to perform activation.');
    29:             return 1;
    30:         }
    31:         if (!productId) {
    32:             logger_1.default.warn('No product id provided, continuing with provided key verification (Gumroad may accept product lookup).');
    33:         }
    34:         try {
    35:             const rec = await gumroad_license_1.default.activateLicense(productId, key, token);
    36:             logger_1.default.success(`License activated. Expires: ${rec.expiresAt ? new Date(rec.expiresAt).toISOString() : 'subscription/never'}`);
    37:             return 0;
    38:         }
    39:         catch (err) {
    40:             logger_1.default.error(`License activation failed: ${err.message || err}`);
    41:             return 2;
    42:         }
    43:     }
    44:     if (sub === 'status') {
    45:         const rec = gumroad_license_1.default.loadLicense();
    46:         if (!rec) {
    47:             logger_1.default.info('No local license found');
    48:             return 0;
    49:         }
    50:         logger_1.default.info(`Local license: key=${rec.key} product=${rec.product_id} expires=${rec.expiresAt ? new Date(rec.expiresAt).toISOString() : 'never'}`);
    51:         return 0;
    52:     }
    53:     if (sub === 'clear') {
    54:         gumroad_license_1.default.clearLicense();
    55:         logger_1.default.info('Local license cleared');
    56:         return 0;
    57:     }
    58:     logger_1.default.info('Unknown license command');
    59:     return 1;
    60: }

     1: "use strict";
     2: // ROME-TAG: 0x263C6D
     3: Object.defineProperty(exports, "__esModule", { value: true });
     4: exports.runPurge = runPurge;
     5: const logger_1 = require("../utils/logger");
     6: const paths_1 = require("../utils/paths");
     7: const exec_1 = require("../utils/exec");
     8: const supervisor_1 = require("../supervisor");
     9: async function runPurge(opts) {
    10:     logger_1.logger.info("qflush: purging caches, logs, sessions and supervisor state...");
    11:     const paths = (0, paths_1.resolvePaths)(opts?.detected || {});
    12:     const targets = [];
    13:     for (const key of Object.keys(paths)) {
    14:         const p = paths[key];
    15:         if (!p)
    16:             continue;
    17:         targets.push(`${p}/.cache`);
    18:         targets.push(`${p}/logs`);
    19:         targets.push(`${p}/tmp`);
    20:         targets.push(`${p}/sessions`);
    21:     }
    22:     for (const t of targets) {
    23:         try {
    24:             (0, exec_1.rimrafSync)(t);
    25:             logger_1.logger.success(`Removed ${t}`);
    26:         }
    27:         catch (err) {
    28:             logger_1.logger.warn(`Failed to remove ${t}: ${err}`);
    29:         }
    30:     }
    31:     // clear supervisor state
    32:     (0, supervisor_1.clearState)();
    33:     logger_1.logger.info("Purge complete.");
    34: }

FILE: dist\src\commands\safe-run.js
============================
============================
     1: "use strict";
     2: Object.defineProperty(exports, "__esModule", { value: true });
     3: exports.default = runSafeRun;
     4: const child_process_1 = require("child_process");
     5: async function runSafeRun(argv = []) {
     6:     // parse options
     7:     let timeoutSec = 10;
     8:     let detach = false;
     9:     const args = [];
    10:     for (let i = 0; i < argv.length; i++) {
    11:         const a = argv[i];
    12:         if (a === '--detach') {
    13:             detach = true;
    14:             continue;
    15:         }
    16:         if (a === '--timeout' && i < argv.length - 1) {
    17:             const v = Number(argv[i + 1]);
    18:             if (!Number.isNaN(v) && v > 0)
    19:                 timeoutSec = Math.max(1, Math.floor(v));
    20:             i++;
    21:             continue;
    22:         }
    23:         // collect remaining as command args
    24:         args.push(a);
    25:     }
    26:     if (args.length === 0) {
    27:         console.log('usage: qflush safe-run [--detach] [--timeout N] <qflush-subcommand> [args...]');
    28:         console.log('example: qflush safe-run --detach start --service rome');
    29:         return 1;
    30:     }
    31:     // Default behavior: run the built daemon CLI: node dist/index.js <args...>
    32:     const node = process.execPath;
    33:     const childArgs = ['dist/index.js', ...args];
    34:     if (detach) {
    35:         try {
    36:             const c = (0, child_process_1.spawn)(node, childArgs, { detached: true, stdio: 'ignore' });
    37:             c.unref();
    38:             console.log(`qflush safe-run: started detached pid=${c.pid}`);
    39:             return 0;
    40:         }
    41:         catch (e) {
    42:             console.error('safe-run detach failed', e);
    43:             return 2;
    44:         }
    45:     }
    46:     // Not detached: run with watchdog timeout
    47:     return await new Promise((resolve) => {
    48:         const child = (0, child_process_1.spawn)(node, childArgs, { stdio: 'inherit' });
    49:         let finished = false;
    50:         const onExit = (code) => {
    51:             if (finished)
    52:                 return;
    53:             finished = true;
    54:             resolve(code === null ? 0 : code);
    55:         };
    56:         child.on('exit', onExit);
    57:         child.on('error', (err) => {
    58:             if (finished)
    59:                 return;
    60:             finished = true;
    61:             console.error('safe-run child error', err);
    62:             resolve(3);
    63:         });
    64:         const timer = setTimeout(() => {
    65:             if (finished)
    66:                 return;
    67:             console.warn(`[safe-run] timeout ${timeoutSec}s reached — sending SIGINT to pid=${child.pid}`);
    68:             try {
    69:                 child.kill('SIGINT');
    70:             }
    71:             catch (e) { /* ignore */ }
    72:             // wait short then force kill
    73:             setTimeout(() => {
    74:                 if (finished)
    75:                     return;
    76:                 console.warn(`[safe-run] still running — forcing kill pid=${child.pid}`);
    77:                 try {
    78:                     child.kill('SIGTERM');
    79:                 }
    80:                 catch (e) {
    81:                     try {
    82:                         child.kill();
    83:                     }
    84:                     catch { }
    85:                 }
    86:             }, 2000);
    87:         }, timeoutSec * 1000);
    88:         // clear timer on finish
    89:         child.once && child.once('exit', () => { clearTimeout(timer); });
    90:     });
    91: }

FILE: dist\src\commands\secret-import.js
============================

     1: "use strict";
     2: var __importDefault = (this && this.__importDefault) || function (mod) {
     3:     return (mod && mod.__esModule) ? mod : { "default": mod };
     4: };
     5: Object.defineProperty(exports, "__esModule", { value: true });
     6: exports.default = runSecretImport;
     7: const child_process_1 = require("child_process");
     8: const path_1 = __importDefault(require("path"));
     9: async function runSecretImport(argv = []) {
    10:     // usage: qflush secret import [--env <path>] [--no-acl]
    11:     let envPath;
    12:     let restrictAcl = true;
    13:     for (let i = 0; i < argv.length; i++) {
    14:         const a = argv[i];
    15:         if ((a === '--env' || a === '-e') && i < argv.length - 1) {
    16:             envPath = argv[i + 1];
    17:             i++;
    18:             continue;
    19:         }
    20:         if (a === '--no-acl') {
    21:             restrictAcl = false;
    22:             continue;
    23:         }
    24:     }
    25:     // default envPath to Desktop .env
    26:     if (!envPath) {
    27:         const home = process.env.USERPROFILE || process.env.HOME || '';
    28:         envPath = path_1.default.join(home, 'Desktop', '.env');
    29:     }
    30:     const script = path_1.default.join(process.cwd(), 'scripts', 'import-env-to-secrets.ps1');
    31:     const pwsh = process.env.PWSH || 'pwsh';
    32:     const args = ['-NoProfile', '-ExecutionPolicy', 'Bypass', '-File', script, '-EnvPath', envPath];
    33:     if (restrictAcl)
    34:         args.push('-RestrictFileAcl');
    35:     console.log('Running import script:', pwsh, args.join(' '));
    36:     const res = (0, child_process_1.spawnSync)(pwsh, args, { stdio: 'inherit' });
    37:     if (res.error) {
    38:         console.error('Failed to execute import script:', res.error);
    39:         return 2;
    40:     }
    41:     return res.status ?? 0;
    42: }

FILE: dist\src\commands\start.js
============================
============================
     1: "use strict";
     2: // ROME-TAG: 0xF73710
     3: var __importDefault = (this && this.__importDefault) || function (mod) {
     4:     return (mod && mod.__esModule) ? mod : { "default": mod };
     5: };
     6: Object.defineProperty(exports, "__esModule", { value: true });
     7: exports.runStart = runStart;
     8: const detect_1 = require("../utils/detect");
     9: const logger_1 = __importDefault(require("../utils/logger"));
    10: const exec_1 = require("../utils/exec");
    11: const paths_1 = require("../utils/paths");
    12: const package_1 = require("../utils/package");
    13: const supervisor_1 = require("../supervisor");
    14: const health_1 = require("../utils/health");
    15: const npz_customs_1 = require("../utils/npz-customs");
    16: const npz_1 = __importDefault(require("../utils/npz"));
    17: async function runStart(opts) {
    18:     logger_1.default.info("qflush: starting modules...");
    19:     const detected = opts?.detected || (await (0, detect_1.detectModules)());
    20:     const paths = (0, paths_1.resolvePaths)(detected);
    21:     const services = opts?.services && opts.services.length ? opts.services : Object.keys(paths_1.SERVICE_MAP);
    22:     const flags = opts?.flags || {};
    23:     const waitForStart = Boolean(flags["wait"] || flags["--wait"] || false);
    24:     const doRestart = Boolean(flags["restart"] || flags["--restart"] || flags["force"] || false);
    25:     const maxRestarts = typeof flags["restartCount"] === "number" ? flags["restartCount"] : 3;
    26:     const procs = [];
    27:     async function startWithCustoms(modName) {
    28:         const p = (opts?.modulePaths && opts.modulePaths[modName]) || paths[modName];
    29:         const pkg = paths_1.SERVICE_MAP[modName] && paths_1.SERVICE_MAP[modName].pkg;
    30:         const modDesc = { name: modName, pkg, cwd: p || process.cwd() };
    31:         // run customs
    32:         const report = await (0, npz_customs_1.runCustomsCheck)(modDesc);
    33:         if ((0, npz_customs_1.hasBlockingIssues)(report)) {
    34:             logger_1.default.warn(`supervisor: ${modName} blocked at customs, not starting.`);
    35:             return;
    36:         }
    37:         // if an explicit path is provided, prefer to run it directly
    38:         if (p) {
    39:             try {
    40:                 const pkgJson = (0, package_1.readPackageJson)(p);
    41:                 if (pkgJson && pkgJson.bin) {
    42:                     const binEntry = typeof pkgJson.bin === "string" ? pkgJson.bin : Object.values(pkgJson.bin)[0];
    43:                     const binPath = require("path").join(p, binEntry);
    44:                     const runCmd = (0, exec_1.pathExists)(binPath) && binPath.endsWith('.js') ? { cmd: process.execPath, args: [binPath], cwd: p } : { cmd: binPath, args: [], cwd: p };
    45:                     logger_1.default.info(`Launching ${modName} -> ${runCmd.cmd} ${runCmd.args.join(" ")}`);
    46:                     (0, supervisor_1.startProcess)(modName, runCmd.cmd, runCmd.args, { cwd: runCmd.cwd });
    47:                     return;
    48:                 }
    49:             }
    50:             catch (e) {
    51:                 logger_1.default.warn(`Failed to run local path for ${modName}: ${e}`);
    52:             }
    53:         }
    54:         // otherwise, use NPZ resolver as primary
    55:         if (pkg) {
    56:             const resolved = npz_1.default.npzResolve(pkg, { cwd: p || process.cwd() });
    57:             if (!resolved || resolved.gate === 'fail') {
    58:                 logger_1.default.warn(`${modName} path and package not found or NPZ failed to resolve, skipping`);
    59:                 return;
    60:             }
    61:             if (resolved.gate === 'dlx') {
    62:                 const ok = (0, exec_1.ensurePackageInstalled)(pkg);
    63:                 if (!ok) {
    64:                     logger_1.default.warn(`${modName} not found and failed to install ${pkg}, skipping`);
    65:                     return;
    66:                 }
    67:             }
    68:             const runCmd = { cmd: resolved.cmd, args: resolved.args || [], cwd: resolved.cwd };
    69:             logger_1.default.info(`Launching ${modName} -> ${runCmd.cmd} ${runCmd.args.join(" ")}`);
    70:             (0, supervisor_1.startProcess)(modName, runCmd.cmd, runCmd.args, { cwd: runCmd.cwd });
    71:             return;
    72:         }
    73:         logger_1.default.warn(`${modName} has no runnable entry, skipping`);
    74:     }
    75:     for (const mod of services) {
    76:         const promise = (async () => {
    77:             // Use enhanced master flow which handles missing local bins and robust spawn
    78:             const p = (opts?.modulePaths && opts.modulePaths[mod]) || paths[mod];
    79:             const pkg = paths_1.SERVICE_MAP[mod] && paths_1.SERVICE_MAP[mod].pkg;
    80:             // resolve package path (local node_modules or provided path)
    81:             let pkgPath = p;
    82:             if (!pkgPath && pkg)
    83:                 pkgPath = (0, package_1.resolvePackagePath)(pkg);
    84:             if (!pkgPath && pkg) {
    85:                 const ok = (0, exec_1.ensurePackageInstalled)(pkg);
    86:                 if (!ok) {
    87:                     logger_1.default.warn(`${mod} not found and failed to install ${pkg}, skipping`);
    88:                     return;
    89:                 }
    90:                 pkgPath = (0, package_1.resolvePackagePath)(pkg);
    91:             }
    92:             if (!pkgPath) {
    93:                 // fallback to customs+npz flow
    94:                 await startWithCustoms(mod);
    95:                 return;
    96:             }
    97:             const pkgJson = (0, package_1.readPackageJson)(pkgPath);
    98:             // choose how to run: package bin if present, else npz resolver
    99:             let runCmd = null;
   100:             if (pkgJson && pkgJson.bin) {
   101:                 const binEntry = typeof pkgJson.bin === "string" ? pkgJson.bin : Object.values(pkgJson.bin)[0];
   102:                 const binPath = require("path").join(pkgPath, binEntry);
   103:                 // prefer running via node when bin is a JS file inside package
   104:                 if (binPath.endsWith(".js") && (0, exec_1.pathExists)(binPath)) {
   105:                     runCmd = { cmd: process.execPath, args: [binPath], cwd: pkgPath };
   106:                 }
   107:                 else if ((0, exec_1.pathExists)(binPath)) {
   108:                     runCmd = { cmd: binPath, args: [], cwd: pkgPath };
   109:                 }
   110:                 else {
   111:                     logger_1.default.warn(`${mod} bin entry not found at ${binPath}. ${(0, exec_1.rebuildInstructionsFor)(pkgPath)}`);
   112:                     return;
   113:                 }
   114:             }
   115:             else if (pkg) {
   116:                 // fallback to npz resolver
   117:                 const resolved = npz_1.default.npzResolve(pkg, { cwd: pkgPath });
   118:                 if (!resolved || resolved.gate === 'fail') {
   119:                     logger_1.default.warn(`${mod} has no runnable entry, skipping`);
   120:                     return;
   121:                 }
   122:                 runCmd = { cmd: resolved.cmd, args: resolved.args || [], cwd: resolved.cwd };
   123:             }
   124:             if (!runCmd) {
   125:                 logger_1.default.warn(`${mod} has no runnable entry, skipping`);
   126:                 return;
   127:             }
   128:             const restarts = 0;
   129:             const spawnOnce = () => {
   130:                 return new Promise((resolve) => {
   131:                     logger_1.default.info(`Launching ${mod} -> ${runCmd.cmd} ${runCmd.args.join(" ")}`);
   132:                     // use supervisor to manage and persist process
   133:                     const child = (0, supervisor_1.startProcess)(mod, runCmd.cmd, runCmd.args, { cwd: runCmd.cwd });
   134:                     if (waitForStart) {
   135:                         // try to wait for a health endpoint if provided in flags
   136:                         const svcUrl = flags["health-url"] || flags["health"];
   137:                         const svcPort = flags["health-port"] || undefined;
   138:                         if (svcUrl) {
   139:                             (0, health_1.waitForService)(svcUrl, svcPort).then((ok) => {
   140:                                 if (ok)
   141:                                     logger_1.default.success(`${mod} passed health check`);
   142:                                 else
   143:                                     logger_1.default.warn(`${mod} failed health check`);
   144:                                 resolve();
   145:                             });
   146:                         }
   147:                         else {
   148:                             // wait for spawn via PID persistence
   149:                             setTimeout(() => {
   150:                                 logger_1.default.info(`${mod} started (delayed wait).`);
   151:                                 resolve();
   152:                             }, 2000);
   153:                         }
   154:                     }
   155:                     else {
   156:                         resolve();
   157:                     }
   158:                     // child exit handled by supervisor
   159:                 });
   160:             };
   161:             // start the first time and optionally wait
   162:             await spawnOnce();
   163:             // restart logic handled by supervisor-level events, keep simple here
   164:         })();
   165:         procs.push(promise);
   166:     }
   167:     await Promise.all(procs);
   168:     logger_1.default.success("qflush: start sequence initiated for selected modules");
   169: }

     1: "use strict";
     2: // ROME-TAG: 0x5D80DC
     3: var __importDefault = (this && this.__importDefault) || function (mod) {
     4:     return (mod && mod.__esModule) ? mod : { "default": mod };
     5: };
     6: Object.defineProperty(exports, "__esModule", { value: true });
     7: exports.readFCL = readFCL;
     8: const fs_1 = __importDefault(require("fs"));
     9: function parseValue(raw) {
    10:     const v = raw.trim();
    11:     if (v.startsWith('[') && v.endsWith(']')) {
    12:         // simple list parser
    13:         const inside = v.slice(1, -1).trim();
    14:         if (!inside)
    15:             return [];
    16:         return inside.split(',').map(x => x.trim().replace(/^"|"$/g, ''));
    17:     }
    18:     if (/^\d+$/.test(v))
    19:         return Number(v);
    20:     return v.replace(/^"|"$/g, '');
    21: }
    22: function readFCL(file = 'funesterie.fcl') {
    23:     try {
    24:         const raw = fs_1.default.readFileSync(file, 'utf8');
    25:         const lines = raw.split(/\r?\n/);
    26:         const out = { project: {}, env: {}, service: {}, pipeline: {} };
    27:         let current = {};
    28:         for (let line of lines) {
    29:             line = line.trim();
    30:             if (!line || line.startsWith('#') || line.startsWith('//'))
    31:                 continue;
    32:             if (line.startsWith('@')) {
    33:                 const parts = line.split(/	|\s+/).filter(Boolean);
    34:                 const sec = parts[0].slice(1);
    35:                 const name = parts[1] || undefined;
    36:                 current = { section: sec, name };
    37:                 if (name) {
    38:                     if (!out[sec])
    39:                         out[sec] = {};
    40:                     out[sec][name] = out[sec][name] || {};
    41:                 }
    42:                 continue;
    43:             }
    44:             const eq = line.indexOf('=');
    45:             if (eq === -1)
    46:                 continue;
    47:             const key = line.slice(0, eq).trim();
    48:             const val = parseValue(line.slice(eq + 1));
    49:             if (current.section) {
    50:                 if (current.name) {
    51:                     out[current.section][current.name][key] = val;
    52:                 }
    53:                 else {
    54:                     out[current.section][key] = val;
    55:                 }
    56:             }
    57:         }
    58:         return out;
    59:     }
    60:     catch (err) {
    61:         return null;
    62:     }
    63: }

     1: "use strict";
     2: // ROME-TAG: 0x15FDE1
     3: var __importDefault = (this && this.__importDefault) || function (mod) {
     4:     return (mod && mod.__esModule) ? mod : { "default": mod };
     5: };
     6: Object.defineProperty(exports, "__esModule", { value: true });
     7: exports.readCompose = readCompose;
     8: const fs_1 = __importDefault(require("fs"));
     9: const js_yaml_1 = __importDefault(require("js-yaml"));
    10: const fclParser_1 = require("./fclParser");
    11: function readCompose(file = 'funesterie.yml') {
    12:     try {
    13:         if (fs_1.default.existsSync('funesterie.fcl')) {
    14:             const fcl = (0, fclParser_1.readFCL)('funesterie.fcl');
    15:             if (fcl && fcl.service) {
    16:                 const modules = {};
    17:                 for (const k of Object.keys(fcl.service)) {
    18:                     const s = fcl.service[k];
    19:                     modules[k] = { path: s.path, port: s.port, token: s.token, env: s.env };
    20:                 }
    21:                 return { modules };
    22:             }
    23:         }
    24:         if (!fs_1.default.existsSync(file))
    25:             return null;
    26:         const raw = fs_1.default.readFileSync(file, 'utf8');
    27:         const doc = js_yaml_1.default.load(raw);
    28:         if (!doc || !doc.modules)
    29:             return null;
    30:         return { modules: doc.modules };
    31:     }
    32:     catch (err) {
    33:         return null;
    34:     }
    35: }

     1: "use strict";
     2: // ROME-TAG: 0x92EED4
     3: Object.defineProperty(exports, "__esModule", { value: true });
     4: exports.requireQflushToken = requireQflushToken;
     5: function requireQflushToken(req, res, next) {
     6:     const token = process.env.QFLUSH_TOKEN || '';
     7:     if (!token)
     8:         return res.status(401).json({ success: false, error: 'QFLUSH_TOKEN not configured on server' });
     9:     const header = req.headers['x-qflush-token'];
    10:     if (!header || header !== token)
    11:         return res.status(403).json({ success: false, error: 'invalid token' });
    12:     return next();
    13: }

   149: const checksumCache = new Map();
   150: // Insert checksum handlers here (before pourparler endpoints)
   151: app.post('/npz/checksum/store', async (req, res) => {
   152:     const { id, checksum, ttlMs } = req.body || {};
   153:     console.log('/npz/checksum/store called with', req.body);
   154:     if (!id || !checksum)
   155:         return res.status(400).json({ success: false, error: 'missing id or checksum' });
   156:     const ttl = typeof ttlMs === 'number' && ttlMs > 0 ? ttlMs : CHECKSUM_DEFAULT_TTL_MS;
   157:     checksumCache.set(String(id), { checksum: String(checksum), expiresAt: Date.now() + ttl });
   158:     audit({ t: Date.now(), event: 'checksum_stored_mem', id: String(id) });
   159:     console.log('stored in memory', id);
   160:     return res.json({ success: true, id: String(id), ttlMs: ttl, backend: 'memory' });
   161: });
   162: app.post('/npz/checksum/verify', async (req, res) => {
   163:     const { id, checksum } = req.body || {};
   164:     if (!id || !checksum)
   165:         return res.status(400).json({ success: false, error: 'missing id or checksum' });
   166:     const entry = checksumCache.get(String(id));
   167:     if (!entry)
   168:         return res.status(404).json({ success: false, error: 'checksum not found or expired' });
   169:     if (entry.checksum !== String(checksum)) {
   170:         audit({ t: Date.now(), event: 'checksum_mismatch_mem', id: String(id), provided: String(checksum), expected: entry.checksum });
   171:         return res.status(400).json({ success: false, error: 'checksum mismatch' });
   172:     }
   173:     // match: remove and return success
   174:     checksumCache.delete(String(id));
   175:     audit({ t: Date.now(), event: 'checksum_verified_mem', id: String(id) });
   176:     return res.json({ success: true, id: String(id), backend: 'memory' });
   177: });
   178: app.get('/npz/checksum/list', async (_req, res) => {
   179:     const now = Date.now();

   182:         results.push({ id, expiresInMs: Math.max(0, entry.expiresAt - now) });
   183:     }
   184:     return res.json({ success: true, count: results.length, items: results, backend: 'memory' });
   185: });

   294:         console.log(`qflush running on http://localhost:${p}`);

   298: function stopServer() {
   299:     try {
   300:         if (server) {
   301:             server.close();

   319:     catch (e) {
   320:         console.warn('daemon reload failed', String(e));
   321:     }
   322: });

   324: if (require.main === module) {
   325:     startServer();
   326: }

    86:         // Pass `--no-detach` to run in-process explicitly.
    87:         const detached = argv.includes('--detached') || !argv.includes('--no-detach');

    90:         }
    91:         if (detached) {

    99:                     process.exit(0);
   100:                 }
   101:             }
   102:             catch (e) {

   104:                 try {

   106:                     child.unref();

   108:                     process.exit(0);
   109:                 }
   110:                 catch (err) {
   111:                     console.error('failed to spawn detached daemon', err);
   112:                     process.exit(1);
   113:                 }
   114:             }
   115:         }
   116:         // start qflushd in-process
   117:         void import("./daemon/qflushd.js").then(() => {
   118:             // module starts itself and logs

    54: const DEFAULT_CONFIG = {
    55:     enabled: false,
    56:     telemetryVersion: 1,
    57:     transports: ['file'],
    58:     filePath: '.qflush/telemetry.json',
    59:     allowedData: ['engineState', 'ruleEvent', 'diagnostic', 'contextSnapshot'],
    60:     samplingRate: 1.0,
    61:     maxPayloadSize: 200000
    62: };
    63: let cfg = DEFAULT_CONFIG;
    64: const emitter = new events_1.EventEmitter();
    65: // Respect environment flags to forcibly disable Copilot/telemetry
    66: const ENV_DISABLE_COPILOT = process.env.QFLUSH_DISABLE_COPILOT === '1' ||
    67:     String(process.env.QFLUSH_DISABLE_COPILOT).toLowerCase() === 'true' ||
    68:     process.env.QFLUSH_TELEMETRY === '0';
    69: function loadCfg() {
    70:     try {
    71:         const p = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'copilot.json');
    72:         if (fs.existsSync(p)) {
    73:             const raw = fs.readFileSync(p, 'utf8');
    74:             cfg = Object.assign({}, DEFAULT_CONFIG, JSON.parse(raw));
    75:         }
    76:         else {
    77:             cfg = Object.assign({}, DEFAULT_CONFIG);
    78:         }
    79:     }
    80:     catch (e) {
    81:         cfg = Object.assign({}, DEFAULT_CONFIG);
    82:     }
    83:     if (ENV_DISABLE_COPILOT) {
    84:         cfg.enabled = false;
    85:     }
    86: }
    87: function signPayload(payload) {
    88:     try {
    89:         if (!cfg.hmacSecretEnv)
    90:             return null;
    91:         const secret = process.env[cfg.hmacSecretEnv || ''];
    92:         if (!secret)
    93:             return null;
    94:         const h = crypto_1.default.createHmac('sha256', secret).update(payload).digest('hex');
    95:         return h;
    96:     }
    97:     catch (e) {
    98:         return null;
    99:     }
   100: }
   101: async function sendWebhook(event) {
   102:     if (!cfg.enabled)
   103:         return;
   104:     if (!cfg.webhookUrl)
   105:         return;
   106:     try {
   107:         const payload = JSON.stringify(event);
   108:         const headers = { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' };
   109:         const sig = signPayload(payload);
   110:         if (sig)
   111:             headers['X-Copilot-Signature'] = `sha256=${sig}`;
   112:         await (0, node_fetch_1.default)(cfg.webhookUrl, { method: 'POST', body: payload, headers });
   113:     }
   114:     catch (e) {
   115:         // best-effort
   116:     }
   117: }
   118: function writeFileEvent(event) {
   119:     try {
   120:         if (!cfg.enabled)
   121:             return;
   122:         const p = path.join(process.cwd(), cfg.filePath || '.qflush/telemetry.json');
   123:         const dir = path.dirname(p);
   124:         if (!fs.existsSync(dir))
   125:             fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
   126:         const tmp = p + '.tmp';
   127:         const arr = fs.existsSync(p) ? JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(p, 'utf8') || '[]') : [];
   128:         arr.push(event);
   129:         fs.writeFileSync(tmp, JSON.stringify(arr, null, 2), 'utf8');
   130:         fs.renameSync(tmp, p);
   131:     }
   132:     catch (e) {
   133:         // ignore
   134:     }
   135: }
   136: function initCopilotBridge() {
   137:     loadCfg();
   138:     if (!cfg.enabled)
   139:         return;
   140: }
   141: async function emitEngineState(state) {
   142:     if (!cfg.enabled)
   143:         return;
   144:     const ev = { type: 'engine_state', telemetryVersion: cfg.telemetryVersion, timestamp: new Date().toISOString(), payload: state };
   145:     if (cfg.transports.includes('webhook'))
   146:         await sendWebhook(ev);
   147:     if (cfg.transports.includes('file'))
   148:         writeFileEvent(ev);
   149:     try {
   150:         (0, storage_1.saveTelemetryEvent)('engine-' + Date.now(), 'engine_state', Date.now(), state);
   151:     }
   152:     catch (e) { }
   153:     emitter.emit('telemetry', ev);
   154: }
   155: async function emitRuleEvent(ev) {
   156:     if (!cfg.enabled)
   157:         return;

   161:     if (cfg.transports.includes('file'))
   162:         writeFileEvent(event);
   163:     try {
   164:         (0, storage_1.saveTelemetryEvent)('rule-' + Date.now(), 'rule_event', Date.now(), ev);
   165:     }
   166:     catch (e) { }
   167:     emitter.emit('telemetry', event);
   168: }
   169: async function emitDiagnostic(diag) {
   170:     if (!cfg.enabled)
   171:         return;
   172:     const event = { type: 'diagnostic', telemetryVersion: cfg.telemetryVersion, timestamp: new Date().toISOString(), payload: diag };

   179:     }
   180:     catch (e) { }
   181:     emitter.emit('telemetry', event);
   182: }

   187:     }

   190:     }
   191: }

     8:     reloadHandler = fn;
     9: }

    11:     try {
    12:         if (reloadHandler)

    15:     }

FILE: dist\src\rome\engine.js

     1: "use strict";
     2: // ROME-TAG: 0xD8C57D
     3: Object.defineProperty(exports, "__esModule", { value: true });
     4: exports.computeEngineActions = void 0;
     5: exports.evaluateIndex = evaluateIndex;
     6: exports.computeEngineActionsSafe = computeEngineActionsSafe;
     7: /**
     8:  * Simple rule engine for Rome index v1.
     9:  * Rules are evaluated in order and produce a list of actions.
    10:  */
    11: function evaluateIndex(index) {
    12:     const actions = [];
    13:     const records = Object.values(index || {});
    14:     for (const r of records) {
    15:         // Basic rules:
    16:         // - any type === 'daemon' => start-service if matches known daemon files
    17:         // - type === 'command' => watch + start-service 'cli'
    18:         // - type === 'test' => noop (skip)
    19:         // - type === 'asset' or ext === 'png'|'jpg' => encode-npz
    20:         // - otherwise watch
    21:         try {
    22:             if (!r || !r.type || !r.path) {
    23:                 actions.push({ action: 'noop' });
    24:                 continue;
    25:             }
    26:             const t = r.type;
    27:             const ext = r.ext ? r.ext.toLowerCase() : '';
    28:             if (t === 'daemon') {
    29:                 actions.push({ action: 'start-service', service: 'qflush-daemon', path: r.path });
    30:                 continue;
    31:             }
    32:             if (t === 'command') {
    33:                 actions.push({ action: 'watch', path: r.path, reason: 'cli-command' });
    34:                 actions.push({ action: 'start-service', service: 'cli-dispatcher', path: r.path });
    35:                 continue;
    36:             }
    37:             if (t === 'test') {
    38:                 actions.push({ action: 'noop', path: r.path });
    39:                 continue;
    40:             }
    41:             if (t === 'asset' || ['png', 'jpg', 'jpeg', 'gif', 'svg'].includes(ext)) {
    42:                 actions.push({ action: 'encode-npz', path: r.path, codec: 'oc8-rgba' });
    43:                 continue;
    44:             }
    45:             // default: watch files for changes
    46:             actions.push({ action: 'watch', path: r.path });
    47:         }
    48:         catch (e) {
    49:             actions.push({ action: 'noop', path: r.path });
    50:         }
    51:     }
    52:     return actions;
    53: }
    54: // Safe wrapper used by daemon to compute actions without throwing
    55: function computeEngineActionsSafe(index) {
    56:     try {
    57:         const idx = index || {};
    58:         return evaluateIndex(idx);
    59:     }
    60:     catch (e) {
    61:         // don't throw in daemon context; return empty actions and let caller log
    62:         try {
    63:             console.warn('computeEngineActionsSafe failed', String(e));
    64:         }
    65:         catch { }
    66:         return [];
    67:     }
    68: }
    69: // Backwards-compatible alias: some callers use `computeEngineActions`
    70: exports.computeEngineActions = computeEngineActionsSafe;

    45: let lastStatMs = 0;
    46: function getEmitter() { return emitter; }
    47: function startIndexWatcher(intervalMs = 5000) {
    48:     try {
    49:         if (!fs.existsSync(INDEX_PATH))
    50:             return;
    51:         // simple poll to avoid fs.watch platform issues
    52:         setInterval(() => {
    53:             try {
    54:                 const st = fs.statSync(INDEX_PATH);
    55:                 if (st.mtimeMs > lastStatMs) {
    56:                     lastStatMs = st.mtimeMs;
    57:                     // load file
    58:                     const raw = fs.readFileSync(INDEX_PATH, 'utf8') || '{}';
    59:                     let json = {};
    60:                     try {
    61:                         json = JSON.parse(raw);
    62:                     }
    63:                     catch (e) {
    64:                         json = {};
    65:                     }
    66:                     emitter.emit('rome.index.file.changed', { path: INDEX_PATH, index: json });
    67:                 }
    68:             }
    69:             catch (e) {
    70:                 // ignore
    71:             }
    72:         }, intervalMs).unref();
    73:     }
    74:     catch (e) {
    75:         // ignore
    76:     }
    77: }
    78: function emitRomeIndexUpdated(oldIndex, newIndex) {
    79:     // compute changed paths: tag changed or new/removed
    80:     const changed = [];
    81:     const all = new Set([...Object.keys(oldIndex || {}), ...Object.keys(newIndex || {})]);
    82:     for (const k of all) {
    83:         const a = oldIndex && oldIndex[k];
    84:         const b = newIndex && newIndex[k];
    85:         if (!a && b) {
    86:             changed.push(k);
    87:             continue;
    88:         }
    89:         if (a && !b) {
    90:             changed.push(k);
    91:             continue;
    92:         }
    93:         if (a && b) {
    94:             if (a.tag !== b.tag)
    95:                 changed.push(k);
    96:         }
    97:     }
    98:     emitter.emit('rome.index.updated', { oldIndex, newIndex, changedPaths: changed });
    99: }

    48: function loadConfig() {
    49:     try {
    50:         const p = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'logic-config.json');
    51:         if (fs.existsSync(p))
    52:             return JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(p, 'utf8'));

    57: function safeExecFile(cmd, cwd, timeoutMs) {
    58:     return new Promise((resolve) => {
    59:         const parts = cmd.split(' ').filter(Boolean);
    60:         if (parts.length === 0)
    61:             return resolve({ code: 1, stdout: '', stderr: 'empty command' });
    62:         // if simple executable with args, prefer execFile
    63:         if (/^[\w@.\-\/\\]+$/.test(parts[0])) {
    64:             const child = (0, child_process_1.execFile)(parts[0], parts.slice(1), { cwd, env: { PATH: process.env.PATH || '' }, timeout: timeoutMs }, (err, stdout, stderr) => {
    65:                 if (err && err.code === 'ENOENT') {
    66:                     // fallback to shell when executable not found (e.g. shell built-ins like echo)
    67:                     const sh = (0, child_process_1.spawn)(cmd, { cwd, env: { PATH: process.env.PATH || '' }, shell: true });
    68:                     let out = '';
    69:                     let er = '';
    70:                     sh.stdout?.on('data', (d) => out += d.toString());
    71:                     sh.stderr?.on('data', (d) => er += d.toString());
    72:                     let finished = false;
    73:                     const to = setTimeout(() => { try {
    74:                         sh.kill();
    75:                     }
    76:                     catch (e) { } }, timeoutMs);
    77:                     sh.on('close', (code) => { if (!finished) {
    78:                         finished = true;
    79:                         clearTimeout(to);
    80:                         resolve({ code, stdout: out, stderr: er });
    81:                     } });
    82:                     sh.on('error', (e) => { if (!finished) {
    83:                         finished = true;
    84:                         clearTimeout(to);
    85:                         resolve({ code: 1, stdout: out, stderr: String(e) });
    86:                     } });
    87:                     return;
    88:                 }
    89:                 if (err && err.code && err.signal === undefined) {
    90:                     resolve({ code: err.code, stdout: stdout?.toString?.() || String(stdout), stderr: stderr?.toString?.() || String(stderr) });
    91:                 }
    92:                 else if (err) {
    93:                     resolve({ code: 1, stdout: stdout?.toString?.() || String(stdout), stderr: (err && err.message) || String(stderr) });
    94:                 }
    95:                 else {
    96:                     resolve({ code: 0, stdout: stdout?.toString?.() || String(stdout), stderr: stderr?.toString?.() || String(stderr) });
    97:                 }
    98:             });
    99:             return;
   100:         }
   101:         // fallback to shell spawn
   102:         const child = (0, child_process_1.spawn)(cmd, { cwd, env: { PATH: process.env.PATH || '' }, shell: true });
   103:         let out = '';
   104:         let err = '';
   105:         child.stdout.on('data', (d) => out += d.toString());
   106:         child.stderr.on('data', (d) => err += d.toString());
   107:         let finished = false;
   108:         const to = setTimeout(() => { try {
   109:             child.kill();
   110:         }
   111:         catch (e) { } }, timeoutMs);
   112:         child.on('close', (code) => { if (!finished) {
   113:             finished = true;
   114:             clearTimeout(to);
   115:             resolve({ code, stdout: out, stderr: err });
   116:         } });
   117:         child.on('error', (e) => { if (!finished) {
   118:             finished = true;
   119:             clearTimeout(to);
   120:             resolve({ code: 1, stdout: out, stderr: String(e) });
   121:         } });
   122:     });
   123: }
   124: function suspicious(cmd) {
   125:     // reject characters that allow shell expansions redirections or chaining
   126:     return /[;&|<>$`]/.test(cmd);
   127: }
   128: function writeNpzMetadata(record) {
   129:     try {
   130:         const dir = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'npz');
   131:         if (!fs.existsSync(dir))
   132:             fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
   133:         const idxPath = path.join(dir, 'index.json');
   134:         let idx = {};
   135:         if (fs.existsSync(idxPath)) {
   136:             try {
   137:                 idx = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(idxPath, 'utf8') || '{}');
   138:             }
   139:             catch {
   140:                 idx = {};
   141:             }
   142:         }
   143:         idx[record.id] = record;
   144:         fs.writeFileSync(idxPath, JSON.stringify(idx, null, 2), 'utf8');
   145:     }
   146:     catch (e) {
   147:         // ignore
   148:     }
   149: }
   150: async function executeAction(action, ctx = {}) {
   151:     const cfg = loadConfig();
   152:     if (!action)
   153:         return { success: false, error: 'empty' };
   154:     try {
   155:         if (action.startsWith('run ')) {
   156:             const m = /run\s+"([^"]+)"(?:\s+in\s+"([^"]+)")?/.exec(action);
   157:             if (!m)
   158:                 return { success: false, error: 'invalid run syntax' };
   159:             const cmd = m[1];
   160:             const dir = m[2] ? path.resolve(m[2]) : process.cwd();
   161:             if (suspicious(cmd))
   162:                 return { success: false, error: 'command contains suspicious characters' };
   163:             // exact allowlist first
   164:             if (cfg.allowedCommands && cfg.allowedCommands.length && !cfg.allowedCommands.includes(cmd)) {
   165:                 return { success: false, error: 'command not in allowedCommands' };
   166:             }
   167:             // fallback substring check
   168:             const ok = cfg.allowedCommandSubstrings.some((s) => cmd.includes(s));
   169:             if (!ok)
   170:                 return { success: false, error: 'command not allowed by policy' };
   171:             if (ctx.dryRun) {
   172:                 return { success: true, dryRun: true, cmd };
   173:             }
   174:             const result = await safeExecFile(cmd, dir, cfg.commandTimeoutMs || 15000);
   175:             const res = { success: result.code === 0, stdout: result.stdout, stderr: result.stderr, code: result.code };
   176:             // webhook notify
   177:             if (cfg.webhookUrl) {
   178:                 try {
   179:                     await (0, node_fetch_1.default)(cfg.webhookUrl, { method: 'POST', body: JSON.stringify({ action: cmd, path: ctx.path || null, result: res }), headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' } });
   180:                 }
   181:                 catch (e) { }
   182:             }
   183:             // persist execution history
   184:             try {
   185:                 (0, storage_1.saveEngineHistory)('exec-' + Date.now(), Date.now(), ctx.path || '', cmd, res);
   186:             }
   187:             catch (e) { }
   188:             return res;
   189:         }
   190:         if (action.startsWith('npz.encode')) {
   191:             const filePath = ctx.path || 'unknown';
   192:             if (ctx.dryRun) {
   193:                 return { success: true, dryRun: true, note: 'would encode ' + filePath };
   194:             }
   195:             const id = 'npz-' + Math.random().toString(36).slice(2, 10);
   196:             const outDir = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'npz');
   197:             try {
   198:                 if (!fs.existsSync(outDir))
   199:                     fs.mkdirSync(outDir, { recursive: true });
   200:             }
   201:             catch (e) { }
   202:             const outFile = path.join(outDir, id + '.bin');
   203:             // write a simple placeholder binary (could be real encoding later)
   204:             try {
   205:                 fs.writeFileSync(outFile, Buffer.from(`encoded:${filePath}`));
   206:             }
   207:             catch (e) { }
   208:             const metadata = { id, source: filePath, createdAt: new Date().toISOString(), path: outFile };
   209:             writeNpzMetadata(metadata);
   210:             const res = { success: true, id, path: outFile, metadata };
   211:             if (cfg.webhookUrl) {
   212:                 try {
   213:                     await (0, node_fetch_1.default)(cfg.webhookUrl, { method: 'POST', body: JSON.stringify({ action: 'npz.encode', path: filePath, result: res }), headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' } });
   214:                 }
   215:                 catch (e) { }
   216:             }
   217:             try {
   218:                 (0, storage_1.saveEngineHistory)('npz-' + Date.now(), Date.now(), filePath, 'npz.encode', res);
   219:             }
   220:             catch (e) { }
   221:             return res;
   222:         }
   223:         if (action.startsWith('daemon.reload')) {
   224:             // trigger reload via daemon-control
   225:             const ok = await (0, daemon_control_1.callReload)();
   226:             const res = { success: ok };
   227:             try {
   228:                 (0, storage_1.saveEngineHistory)('reload-' + Date.now(), Date.now(), ctx.path || '', 'daemon.reload', res);
   229:             }
   230:             catch (e) { }
   231:             return res;
   232:         }
   233:         return { success: false, error: 'unknown action' };
   234:     }
   235:     catch (e) {
   236:         return { success: false, error: e && e.message ? e.message : String(e) };
   237:     }
   238: }

    45: let cachedIndex = {};
    46: let lastIndexRaw = '';
    47: function loadRomeIndexFromDisk() {
    48:     try {
    49:         if (!fs.existsSync(INDEX_PATH)) {
    50:             cachedIndex = {};
    51:             return cachedIndex;
    52:         }
    53:         const raw = fs.readFileSync(INDEX_PATH, 'utf8') || '{}';
    54:         // compare raw to detect changes
    55:         const parsed = JSON.parse(raw);
    56:         const old = cachedIndex || {};
    57:         cachedIndex = parsed;
    58:         // emit update if changed
    59:         if (lastIndexRaw && lastIndexRaw !== raw) {
    60:             (0, events_1.emitRomeIndexUpdated)(old, cachedIndex);
    61:         }
    62:         lastIndexRaw = raw;
    63:         return cachedIndex;
    64:     }
    65:     catch (e) {
    66:         // on error return empty
    67:         cachedIndex = {};
    68:         return cachedIndex;
    69:     }
    70: }
    71: function getCachedRomeIndex() {
    72:     return cachedIndex;
    73: }
    74: function startRomeIndexAutoRefresh(intervalMs = 30 * 1000) {
    75:     // initial load
    76:     loadRomeIndexFromDisk();
    77:     try {
    78:         setInterval(() => {
    79:             loadRomeIndexFromDisk();
    80:         }, intervalMs).unref();
    81:     }
    82:     catch (e) {
    83:         // ignore
    84:     }
    85:     // start external watcher too
    86:     (0, events_1.startIndexWatcher)(Math.max(2000, Math.floor(intervalMs / 10)));
    87: }

    89:     (0, events_1.getEmitter)().on('rome.index.updated', cb);
    90: }

     1: "use strict";
     2: Object.defineProperty(exports, "__esModule", { value: true });
     3: exports.romeLinksEmitter = void 0;
     4: exports.computeRomeLinks = computeRomeLinks;
     5: exports.computeRomeLinksForFiles = computeRomeLinksForFiles;

     7: exports.writeRomeLinks = writeRomeLinks;
     8: exports.readExistingLinks = readExistingLinks;
     9: exports.mergeAndWrite = mergeAndWrite;
    10: // auto-generated linker for Rome index references
    11: const fs_1 = require("fs");
    12: const path_1 = require("path");
    13: const index_loader_1 = require("./index-loader");
    14: const events_1 = require("events");
    15: exports.romeLinksEmitter = new events_1.EventEmitter();
    16: function walkDir(dir, filelist = []) {
    17:     const entries = (0, fs_1.readdirSync)(dir, { withFileTypes: true });
    18:     for (const e of entries) {
    19:         const full = (0, path_1.join)(dir, e.name);
    20:         if (e.isDirectory()) {
    21:             walkDir(full, filelist);
    22:         }
    23:         else {
    24:             filelist.push(full);
    25:         }
    26:     }
    27:     return filelist;
    28: }
    29: const tokenRe = /\[\[([a-zA-Z0-9_\-]+)\]\]/g;
    30: function computeRomeLinks(projectRoot) {
    31:     const srcDir = (0, path_1.join)(projectRoot, 'src');
    32:     let files = [];
    33:     try {
    34:         files = walkDir(srcDir);
    35:     }
    36:     catch (e) {
    37:         return [];
    38:     }
    39:     return computeRomeLinksForFiles(projectRoot, files);
    40: }
    41: function computeRomeLinksForFiles(projectRoot, absFiles) {
    42:     const idx = (0, index_loader_1.loadRomeIndexFromDisk)();
    43:     const indexFiles = idx && idx.files ? idx.files : idx;
    44:     const links = [];
    45:     for (const abs of absFiles) {
    46:         if (!abs.endsWith('.ts') && !abs.endsWith('.js') && !abs.endsWith('.tsx') && !abs.endsWith('.jsx'))
    47:             continue;
    48:         let content;
    49:         try {
    50:             content = (0, fs_1.readFileSync)(abs, 'utf8');
    51:         }
    52:         catch (e) {
    53:             continue;
    54:         }
    55:         const rel = (0, path_1.relative)(projectRoot, abs).replace(/\\/g, '/');
    56:         const lines = content.split(/\r?\n/);
    57:         for (let i = 0; i < lines.length; i++) {
    58:             const line = lines[i];
    59:             let m;
    60:             tokenRe.lastIndex = 0;
    61:             while ((m = tokenRe.exec(line)) !== null) {
    62:                 const token = m[1];
    63:                 const resolved = resolveTokenToFile(token, indexFiles, rel);
    64:                 links.push({ from: rel, line: i + 1, token, target: resolved ? resolved.path : null, score: resolved ? resolved.score : 0 });
    65:             }
    66:         }
    67:     }
    68:     return links;
    69: }
    70: function resolveTokenToFile(token, idx, fromPath) {
    71:     let best = null;
    72:     for (const [p, info] of Object.entries(idx || {})) {
    73:         try {
    74:             let score = 0;
    75:             const base = p.split('/').pop() || '';
    76:             const nameOnly = base.replace(/\.(ts|js|tsx|jsx)$/, '');
    77:             if (nameOnly === token)
    78:                 score += 50;
    79:             if (nameOnly.toLowerCase() === token.toLowerCase())
    80:                 score += 20;
    81:             const fromRoot = fromPath.split('/')[1] || '';
    82:             if (p.startsWith(`src/${fromRoot}`))
    83:                 score += 10;
    84:             if (p.includes(token))
    85:                 score += 5;
    86:             // fuzzy: shorter edit distance => higher score
    87:             const dist = levenshtein(nameOnly.toLowerCase(), token.toLowerCase());
    88:             if (dist >= 0 && dist <= Math.max(1, Math.floor(nameOnly.length * 0.4)))
    89:                 score += Math.max(0, 8 - dist);
    90:             // type matching heuristic
    91:             if (info && info.type && token.toLowerCase().includes(info.type))
    92:                 score += 3;
    93:             if (score <= 0)
    94:                 continue;
    95:             if (!best || score > best.score)
    96:                 best = { path: p, score };
    97:         }
    98:         catch (e) {
    99:             continue;
   100:         }
   101:     }
   102:     return best;
   103: }
   104: // simple Levenshtein distance - small implementation
   105: function levenshtein(a, b) {
   106:     if (a === b)
   107:         return 0;
   108:     const m = a.length;
   109:     const n = b.length;
   110:     if (m === 0)
   111:         return n;
   112:     if (n === 0)
   113:         return m;
   114:     const v0 = new Array(n + 1);
   115:     const v1 = new Array(n + 1);
   116:     for (let j = 0; j <= n; j++)
   117:         v0[j] = j;
   118:     for (let i = 0; i < m; i++) {
   119:         v1[0] = i + 1;
   120:         for (let j = 0; j < n; j++) {
   121:             const cost = a[i] === b[j] ? 0 : 1;
   122:             v1[j + 1] = Math.min(v1[j] + 1, v0[j + 1] + 1, v0[j] + cost);
   123:         }
   124:         for (let j = 0; j <= n; j++)
   125:             v0[j] = v1[j];
   126:     }
   127:     return v0[n];
   128: }
   129: function resolveRomeToken(projectRoot, fromPath, token) {
   130:     const idx = (0, index_loader_1.loadRomeIndexFromDisk)();
   131:     const indexFiles = idx && idx.files ? idx.files : idx;
   132:     const res = resolveTokenToFile(token, indexFiles, fromPath);
   133:     return res ? { path: res.path, score: res.score } : { path: null, score: 0 };
   134: }
   135: function writeRomeLinks(projectRoot, links) {
   136:     const outPath = (0, path_1.join)(projectRoot, '.qflush', 'rome-links.json');
   137:     try {
   138:         (0, fs_1.writeFileSync)(outPath, JSON.stringify({ refs: links }, null, 2), 'utf8');
   139:     }
   140:     catch (e) {
   141:         // ignore write errors
   142:     }
   143: }
   144: function readExistingLinks(projectRoot) {
   145:     const p = (0, path_1.join)(projectRoot, '.qflush', 'rome-links.json');
   146:     try {
   147:         if (!(0, fs_1.existsSync)(p))
   148:             return [];
   149:         const raw = (0, fs_1.readFileSync)(p, 'utf8');
   150:         const obj = JSON.parse(raw);
   151:         return obj && obj.refs ? obj.refs : [];
   152:     }
   153:     catch (e) {
   154:         return [];
   155:     }
   156: }
   157: function mergeAndWrite(projectRoot, newLinks) {
   158:     const existing = readExistingLinks(projectRoot);
   159:     // remove existing refs from same files as newLinks
   160:     const modifiedFiles = new Set(newLinks.map((l) => l.from));
   161:     const filtered = existing.filter((r) => !modifiedFiles.has(r.from));
   162:     const merged = [...filtered, ...newLinks];
   163:     writeRomeLinks(projectRoot, merged);
   164:     // notify listeners that links updated
   165:     try {
   166:         exports.romeLinksEmitter.emit('updated', merged);
   167:     }
   168:     catch (e) {
   169:         // ignore
   170:     }
   171: }

    41: const path = __importStar(require("path"));

    44: const LOGIC_PATH = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'logic.qfl');
    45: const VARS_PATH = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'logic-vars.json');
    46: let rules = [];
    47: let vars = {};
    48: function loadVars() {
    49:     try {
    50:         if (fs.existsSync(VARS_PATH)) {
    51:             vars = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(VARS_PATH, 'utf8') || '{}');
    52:         }
    53:     }
    54:     catch (e) {
    55:         vars = {};
    56:     }
    57: }
    58: function substitute(s) {
    59:     if (!s)
    60:         return s;
    61:     // ${VAR} substitution from vars then from process.env
    62:     return s.replace(/\$\{([A-Za-z0-9_]+)\}/g, (_, name) => {
    63:         if (vars && typeof vars[name] !== 'undefined')
    64:             return vars[name];
    65:         if (process.env[name])
    66:             return process.env[name];
    67:         return '';
    68:     });
    69: }
    70: function loadLogicRules() {
    71:     // prefer .qflush/logic.qfl then src/rome/logic/logic.qfl
    72:     const alt = path.join(process.cwd(), 'src', 'rome', 'logic', 'logic.qfl');
    73:     const p = fs.existsSync(LOGIC_PATH) ? LOGIC_PATH : alt;
    74:     if (!fs.existsSync(p)) {
    75:         rules = [];
    76:         return rules;
    77:     }
    78:     try {
    79:         loadVars();
    80:         const parsed = (0, logic_parser_1.parseLogicFile)(p);
    81:         // apply substitutions and keep schedule/version/priority
    82:         rules = parsed.map(r => ({ ...r, when: substitute(r.when), do: substitute(r.do) }));
    83:     }
    84:     catch (e) {
    85:         rules = [];
    86:     }
    87:     return rules;
    88: }
    89: function evaluateRulesForRecord(index, rec, changedPaths = []) {
    90:     const matched = [];
    91:     for (const r of rules) {
    92:         const cond = r.when || '';
    93:         try {
    94:             const ast = (0, logic_parser_1.buildConditionAst)(cond);
    95:             const ctx = { file: rec, romeIndexUpdated: (changedPaths && changedPaths.length > 0) };
    96:             const ok = (0, logic_parser_1.evaluateConditionExprAST)(ast, ctx);
    97:             if (ok)
    98:                 matched.push({ rule: r.name, actions: [r.do] });
    99:         }
   100:         catch (e) {
   101:             // ignore parse/eval errors per-rule
   102:         }
   103:     }
   104:     return matched;
   105: }
   106: function evaluateAllRules(index, changedPaths = []) {
   107:     const actions = [];
   108:     for (const rec of Object.values(index)) {
   109:         const a = evaluateRulesForRecord(index, rec, changedPaths);
   110:         for (const m of a)
   111:             actions.push({ path: rec.path, actions: m.actions, rule: m.rule });
   112:     }
   113:     // future: sort by priority/version
   114:     return actions;
   115: }
   116: function getRules() { return rules; }

    40: exports.evaluateConditionExpr = evaluateConditionExpr;
    41: const fs = __importStar(require("fs"));
    42: function parseLogicFile(filePath) {
    43:     const raw = fs.readFileSync(filePath, 'utf8');
    44:     const lines = raw.split(/\r?\n/).map(l => l.trim()).filter(l => l && !l.startsWith('#'));
    45:     const rules = [];
    46:     let i = 0;
    47:     while (i < lines.length) {
    48:         const l = lines[i];
    49:         if (l.startsWith('rule ')) {
    50:             const m = /^rule\s+(\w+)\s*\{/.exec(l);
    51:             if (!m) {
    52:                 i++;
    53:                 continue;
    54:             }
    55:             const name = m[1];
    56:             i++;
    57:             let when = '';
    58:             let action = '';
    59:             let version = undefined;
    60:             let priority = undefined;
    61:             let schedule = undefined;
    62:             while (i < lines.length && !lines[i].startsWith('}')) {
    63:                 const ln = lines[i];
    64:                 if (ln.startsWith('when '))
    65:                     when = ln.slice('when '.length).trim();
    66:                 if (ln.startsWith('do '))
    67:                     action = ln.slice('do '.length).trim();
    68:                 if (ln.startsWith('version ')) {
    69:                     const v = Number(ln.slice('version '.length).trim());
    70:                     if (!isNaN(v))
    71:                         version = v;
    72:                 }
    73:                 if (ln.startsWith('priority ')) {
    74:                     const p = Number(ln.slice('priority '.length).trim());
    75:                     if (!isNaN(p))
    76:                         priority = p;
    77:                 }
    78:                 if (ln.startsWith('schedule ')) {
    79:                     schedule = ln.slice('schedule '.length).trim();
    80:                 }
    81:                 i++;
    82:             }
    83:             i++;
    84:             rules.push({ name, when, do: action, version, priority, schedule });
    85:         }
    86:         else {
    87:             i++;
    88:         }
    89:     }
    90:     return rules;
    91: }
    92: // Very small expression parser for when expressions supporting variables and precedence
    93: // grammar: expr := orExpr
    94: // orExpr := andExpr ('or' andExpr)*
    95: // andExpr := notExpr ('and' notExpr)*
    96: // notExpr := 'not' notExpr | primary
    97: // primary := '(' expr ')' | comparison
    98: // comparison := identifier '==' string | identifier
    99: function tokenize(s) {
   100:     const tokens = [];
   101:     const re = /\s*(=>|==|\(|\)|\band\b|\bor\b|\bnot\b|[\w.]+|"[^"]*")\s*/gi;
   102:     let m;
   103:     while ((m = re.exec(s)) !== null)
   104:         tokens.push(m[1]);
   105:     return tokens;
   106: }
   107: function parseExpr(tokens) {
   108:     let i = 0;
   109:     function peek() { return tokens[i]; }
   110:     function consume() { return tokens[i++]; }
   111:     function parsePrimary() {
   112:         const t = peek();
   113:         if (t === '(') {
   114:             consume();
   115:             const node = parseOr();
   116:             if (peek() === ')')
   117:                 consume();
   118:             return node;
   119:         }
   120:         const id = consume();
   121:         if (peek() === '==') {
   122:             consume();
   123:             const val = consume();
   124:             return { type: 'cmp', left: id, op: '==', right: val.replace(/^"|"$/g, '') };
   125:         }
   126:         return { type: 'id', name: id };
   127:     }
   128:     function parseNot() {
   129:         if (peek() === 'not') {
   130:             consume();
   131:             return { type: 'not', expr: parseNot() };
   132:         }
   133:         return parsePrimary();
   134:     }
   135:     function parseAnd() {
   136:         let left = parseNot();
   137:         while (peek() === 'and') {
   138:             consume();
   139:             const right = parseNot();
   140:             left = { type: 'and', left, right };
   141:         }
   142:         return left;
   143:     }
   144:     function parseOr() {
   145:         let left = parseAnd();
   146:         while (peek() === 'or') {
   147:             consume();
   148:             const right = parseAnd();
   149:             left = { type: 'or', left, right };
   150:         }
   151:         return left;
   152:     }
   153:     const ast = parseOr();
   154:     return ast;
   155: }
   156: function evaluateConditionExprAST(ast, ctx) {
   157:     if (!ast)
   158:         return false;
   159:     switch (ast.type) {
   160:         case 'cmp': {
   161:             const left = ast.left;
   162:             const right = ast.right;
   163:             const val = resolveIdentifier(left, ctx);
   164:             return String(val) === right;
   165:         }
   166:         case 'id': return !!resolveIdentifier(ast.name, ctx);
   167:         case 'not': return !evaluateConditionExprAST(ast.expr, ctx);
   168:         case 'and': return evaluateConditionExprAST(ast.left, ctx) && evaluateConditionExprAST(ast.right, ctx);
   169:         case 'or': return evaluateConditionExprAST(ast.left, ctx) || evaluateConditionExprAST(ast.right, ctx);
   170:         default: return false;
   171:     }
   172: }
   173: function resolveIdentifier(id, ctx) {
   174:     // support file.type, file.tagChanged, rome.index.updated
   175:     if (id.startsWith('file.')) {
   176:         const k = id.slice('file.'.length);
   177:         return ctx.file ? ctx.file[k] : undefined;
   178:     }
   179:     if (id === 'rome.index.updated')
   180:         return ctx.romeIndexUpdated;
   181:     return undefined;
   182: }
   183: function buildConditionAst(expr) {
   184:     const tokens = tokenize(expr);
   185:     return parseExpr(tokens);
   186: }
   187: function evaluateConditionExpr(expr, ctx) {
   188:     try {
   189:         const ast = buildConditionAst(expr);
   190:         return evaluateConditionExprAST(ast, ctx);
   191:     }
   192:     catch (e) {
   193:         return false;
   194:     }
   195: }

    48: const path = __importStar(require("path"));
    49: exports.ROME_TAG_VERSION = 1;
    50: exports.ROME_TAG_COMMENT_PREFIX = '// ROME-TAG:';
    51: function normalizeRomePath(p) {
    52:     let normalized = p.replace(/\\/g, '/');
    53:     normalized = normalized.replace(/^\.?\//, '');
    54:     normalized = normalized.replace(/\/+/g, '/');
    55:     return normalized;
    56: }
    57: function extractExt(p) {
    58:     const ext = path.extname(p);
    59:     return ext ? ext.slice(1) : undefined;
    60: }
    61: function fnv1a24(str) {
    62:     let hash = 0x811c9dc5;
    63:     for (let i = 0; i < str.length; i++) {
    64:         hash ^= str.charCodeAt(i);
    65:         hash = (hash * 0x01000193) >>> 0;
    66:     }
    67:     return hash & 0xffffff;
    68: }
    69: function computeRomeTag(meta) {
    70:     const type = meta.type || 'file';
    71:     const p = normalizeRomePath(meta.path);
    72:     const input = `${type}|${p}`;
    73:     return fnv1a24(input);
    74: }
    75: function toRomeTagHex(tag) {
    76:     return '0x' + (tag & 0xffffff).toString(16).padStart(6, '0').toUpperCase();
    77: }
    78: function fromRomeTagHex(hex) {
    79:     const m = /^0x([0-9a-fA-F]{6})$/.exec(hex.trim());
    80:     if (!m)
    81:         return null;
    82:     return parseInt(m[1], 16) & 0xffffff;
    83: }
    84: function makeRomeTagRecord(meta, date = new Date()) {
    85:     const pathNorm = normalizeRomePath(meta.path);
    86:     const ext = meta.ext ?? extractExt(pathNorm);
    87:     const tag = computeRomeTag({ ...meta, path: pathNorm, ext });
    88:     return {
    89:         type: meta.type,
    90:         path: pathNorm,
    91:         ext,
    92:         tag,
    93:         tagHex: toRomeTagHex(tag),
    94:         savedAt: date.toISOString(),
    95:         version: exports.ROME_TAG_VERSION,
    96:     };
    97: }
    98: function getOrCreateRomeTag(index, meta, date = new Date()) {
    99:     const pathNorm = normalizeRomePath(meta.path);
   100:     const existing = index[pathNorm];
   101:     if (existing)
   102:         return existing;
   103:     const record = makeRomeTagRecord({ ...meta, path: pathNorm }, date);
   104:     index[pathNorm] = record;
   105:     return record;
   106: }
   107: function buildRomeTagComment(tag) {
   108:     return `${exports.ROME_TAG_COMMENT_PREFIX} ${toRomeTagHex(tag)}`;
   109: }
   110: function parseRomeTagComment(line) {
   111:     const idx = line.indexOf(exports.ROME_TAG_COMMENT_PREFIX);
   112:     if (idx === -1)
   113:         return null;
   114:     const rest = line.slice(idx + exports.ROME_TAG_COMMENT_PREFIX.length).trim();
   115:     const maybeTag = rest.split(/\s+/)[0];
   116:     return fromRomeTagHex(maybeTag);
   117: }

     1: "use strict";
     2: // ROME-TAG: 0x75DEC5
     3: var __createBinding = (this && this.__createBinding) || (Object.create ? (function(o, m, k, k2) {
     4:     if (k2 === undefined) k2 = k;
     5:     var desc = Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptor(m, k);
     6:     if (!desc || ("get" in desc ? !m.__esModule : desc.writable || desc.configurable)) {

     8:     }
     9:     Object.defineProperty(o, k2, desc);
    10: }) : (function(o, m, k, k2) {

    12:     o[k2] = m[k];
    13: }));

    16: }) : function(o, v) {
