    36: Object.defineProperty(exports, "__esModule", { value: true });
    37: exports.saveTelemetryEvent = saveTelemetryEvent;
    38: exports.getRecentTelemetry = getRecentTelemetry;
    39: exports.saveEngineHistory = saveEngineHistory;
    40: exports.getEngineHistory = getEngineHistory;
    41: const fs = __importStar(require("fs"));
    42: const path = __importStar(require("path"));
    43: // Lightweight storage helper: prefer sqlite (better-sqlite3) if available,
    44: // otherwise fallback to a JSON file under .qflush/storage.json
    45: const DEFAULT_DIR = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush');
    46: const JSON_PATH = path.join(DEFAULT_DIR, 'storage.json');
    47: let db = null;
    48: let useSqlite = false;
    49: function ensureDir() {
    50:     try {
    51:         if (!fs.existsSync(DEFAULT_DIR))
    52:             fs.mkdirSync(DEFAULT_DIR, { recursive: true });
    53:     }
    54:     catch (e) { }
    55: }
    56: try {
    57:     // attempt to use better-sqlite3 if installed
    58:     const Database = require('better-sqlite3');
    59:     const dbPath = path.join(DEFAULT_DIR, 'qflush.db');
    60:     db = new Database(dbPath);
    61:     // initialize tables
    62:     db.exec(`CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS telemetry (id TEXT PRIMARY KEY, type TEXT, ts INTEGER, payload TEXT);
    63:             CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS engine_history (id TEXT PRIMARY KEY, ts INTEGER, path TEXT, action TEXT, result TEXT);
    64:             `);
    65:     useSqlite = true;
    66: }
    67: catch (e) {
    68:     // fallback to JSON
    69:     useSqlite = false;
    70: }
    71: function writeJsonFile(obj) {
    72:     ensureDir();
    73:     try {
    74:         fs.writeFileSync(JSON_PATH + '.tmp', JSON.stringify(obj, null, 2), 'utf8');
    75:         fs.renameSync(JSON_PATH + '.tmp', JSON_PATH);
    76:     }
    77:     catch (e) { }
    78: }
    79: function readJsonFile() {
    80:     try {
    81:         if (!fs.existsSync(JSON_PATH))
    82:             return { telemetry: [], engine_history: [] };
    83:         const raw = fs.readFileSync(JSON_PATH, 'utf8') || '{}';
    84:         return JSON.parse(raw);
    85:     }
    86:     catch (e) {
    87:         return { telemetry: [], engine_history: [] };
    88:     }
    89: }
    90: function saveTelemetryEvent(id, type, timestamp, payload) {
    91:     if (useSqlite && db) {
    92:         try {
    93:             const stmt = db.prepare('INSERT OR REPLACE INTO telemetry (id,type,ts,payload) VALUES (?,?,?,?)');
    94:             stmt.run(id, type, timestamp, JSON.stringify(payload));
    95:             return true;
    96:         }
    97:         catch (e) {
    98:             return false;
    99:         }
   100:     }
   101:     // json fallback
   102:     const obj = readJsonFile();
   103:     obj.telemetry = obj.telemetry || [];
   104:     obj.telemetry.push({ id, type, ts: timestamp, payload });
   105:     writeJsonFile(obj);
   106:     return true;
   107: }
   108: function getRecentTelemetry(limit = 100) {
   109:     if (useSqlite && db) {
   110:         try {
   111:             const stmt = db.prepare('SELECT id,type,ts,payload FROM telemetry ORDER BY ts DESC LIMIT ?');
   112:             const rows = stmt.all(limit);
   113:             return rows.map((r) => ({ id: r.id, type: r.type, ts: r.ts, payload: JSON.parse(r.payload) }));
   114:         }
   115:         catch (e) {
   116:             return [];
   117:         }
   118:     }
   119:     const obj = readJsonFile();
   120:     const arr = obj.telemetry || [];
   121:     return arr.slice(-limit).reverse();
   122: }
   123: function saveEngineHistory(id, timestamp, pathVal, action, result) {
   124:     if (useSqlite && db) {
   125:         try {
   126:             const stmt = db.prepare('INSERT OR REPLACE INTO engine_history (id,ts,path,action,result) VALUES (?,?,?,?,?)');
   127:             stmt.run(id, timestamp, pathVal, action, JSON.stringify(result));
   128:             return true;
   129:         }
   130:         catch (e) {
   131:             return false;
   132:         }
   133:     }
   134:     const obj = readJsonFile();
   135:     obj.engine_history = obj.engine_history || [];
   136:     obj.engine_history.push({ id, ts: timestamp, path: pathVal, action, result });
   137:     writeJsonFile(obj);
   138:     return true;
   139: }
   140: function getEngineHistory(limit = 100) {
   141:     if (useSqlite && db) {
   142:         try {
   143:             const stmt = db.prepare('SELECT id,ts,path,action,result FROM engine_history ORDER BY ts DESC LIMIT ?');
   144:             const rows = stmt.all(limit);
   145:             return rows.map((r) => ({ id: r.id, ts: r.ts, path: r.path, action: r.action, result: JSON.parse(r.result) }));
   146:         }
   147:         catch (e) {
   148:             return [];
   149:         }
   150:     }
   151:     const obj = readJsonFile();
   152:     const arr = obj.engine_history || [];
   153:     return arr.slice(-limit).reverse();
   154: }

    12: const child_process_1 = require("child_process");
    13: const fs_1 = require("fs");
    14: const path_1 = require("path");
    15: const logger_1 = require("../utils/logger");
    16: // Use canonical state dir '.qflush'
    17: const STATE_DIR = (0, path_1.join)(process.cwd(), '.qflush');
    18: const LOGS_DIR = (0, path_1.join)(STATE_DIR, 'logs');
    19: const STATE_FILE = (0, path_1.join)(STATE_DIR, 'services.json');
    20: let procs = {};
    21: const managed = new Map();
    22: function ensureStateDir() {
    23:     if (!(0, fs_1.existsSync)(STATE_DIR))
    24:         (0, fs_1.mkdirSync)(STATE_DIR, { recursive: true });
    25:     if (!(0, fs_1.existsSync)(LOGS_DIR))
    26:         (0, fs_1.mkdirSync)(LOGS_DIR, { recursive: true });
    27: }
    28: function persist() {
    29:     try {
    30:         ensureStateDir();
    31:         (0, fs_1.writeFileSync)(STATE_FILE, JSON.stringify(procs, null, 2), 'utf8');
    32:     }
    33:     catch (err) {
    34:         logger_1.logger.warn(`Failed to persist supervisor state: ${err}`);
    35:     }
    36: }
    37: function load() {
    38:     try {
    39:         if ((0, fs_1.existsSync)(STATE_FILE)) {
    40:             const raw = (0, fs_1.readFileSync)(STATE_FILE, 'utf8');
    41:             procs = JSON.parse(raw);
    42:         }
    43:     }
    44:     catch (err) {
    45:         logger_1.logger.warn(`Failed to load supervisor state: ${err}`);
    46:     }
    47: }
    48: load();
    49: function listRunning() {
    50:     return Object.values(procs);
    51: }
    52: function safeCloseStream(s) {
    53:     if (!s)
    54:         return;
    55:     try {
    56:         try {
    57:             s.end(() => { });
    58:         }
    59:         catch {
    60:             try {
    61:                 s.destroy && s.destroy();
    62:             }
    63:             catch { }
    64:         }
    65:     }
    66:     catch { }
    67: }
    68: function isAlive(mp) {
    69:     if (!mp || !mp.child || !mp.child.pid)
    70:         return false;
    71:     try {
    72:         process.kill(mp.child.pid, 0);
    73:         return true;
    74:     }
    75:     catch {
    76:         return false;
    77:     }
    78: }
    79: let freezeMode = 'none';
    80: function getFreezeMode() {
    81:     return freezeMode;
    82: }
    83: function resumeAll() {
    84:     if (freezeMode === 'none') {
    85:         logger_1.logger.info('[supervisor] resumeAll: already normal');
    86:         return;
    87:     }
    88:     freezeMode = 'none';
    89:     logger_1.logger.info('[supervisor] resumeAll: supervisor back to normal mode (spawns allowed)');
    90: }
    91: // Simple health watcher (HTTP GET 2xx => healthy)
    92: function startHealthWatch(url, onHealthy, intervalMs = 3000) {
    93:     let stopped = false;
    94:     const tick = async () => {
    95:         if (stopped)
    96:             return;
    97:         try {
    98:             const u = new URL(url);
    99:             const mod = u.protocol === 'https:' ? require('https') : require('http');
   100:             const req = mod.request(url, { method: 'GET', timeout: 4000 }, (res) => {
   101:                 const ok = res.statusCode && res.statusCode >= 200 && res.statusCode < 300;
   102:                 // consume body
   103:                 res.on('data', () => { });
   104:                 res.on('end', () => {
   105:                     if (ok) {
   106:                         try {
   107:                             onHealthy();
   108:                         }
   109:                         catch (e) {
   110:                             logger_1.logger.warn(`[supervisor] healthWatch onHealthy failed: ${e}`);
   111:                         }
   112:                         stopped = true;
   113:                         return;
   114:                     }
   115:                     if (!stopped)
   116:                         setTimeout(tick, intervalMs);
   117:                 });
   118:             });
   119:             req.on('error', () => { if (!stopped)
   120:                 setTimeout(tick, intervalMs); });
   121:             req.on('timeout', () => { try {
   122:                 req.abort();
   123:             }
   124:             catch { } if (!stopped)
   125:                 setTimeout(tick, intervalMs); });
   126:             req.end();
   127:         }
   128:         catch (e) {
   129:             if (!stopped)
   130:                 setTimeout(tick, intervalMs);
   131:         }
   132:     };
   133:     tick();
   134:     return () => { stopped = true; };
   135: }
   136: // Non-blocking safe kill: fire-and-forget watchdog to ensure no blocking on kill
   137: function safeKillAsync(child, timeoutMs = 3000) {
   138:     if (!child || !child.pid)
   139:         return;
   140:     const IS_WINDOWS = process.platform === 'win32';
   141:     let finished = false;
   142:     const done = (label) => {
   143:         if (finished)
   144:             return;
   145:         finished = true;
   146:         logger_1.logger.info(`[supervisor] safeKill: ${label} (pid=${child && child.pid})`);
   147:     };
   148:     const onExit = () => done('process exited');
   149:     try {
   150:         child.once && child.once('exit', onExit);
   151:     }
   152:     catch { }
   153:     // soft kill
   154:     try {
   155:         if (IS_WINDOWS)
   156:             child.kill();
   157:         else
   158:             child.kill('SIGTERM');
   159:     }
   160:     catch (e) {
   161:         logger_1.logger.warn(`[supervisor] safeKill soft kill failed: ${String(e)}`);
   162:     }
   163:     // watchdog
   164:     setTimeout(() => {
   165:         if (finished)
   166:             return;
   167:         logger_1.logger.warn('[supervisor] safeKill: timeout, trying hard kill');
   168:         if (IS_WINDOWS) {
   169:             try {
   170:                 const tk = (0, child_process_1.spawn)('taskkill', ['/PID', String(child.pid), '/T', '/F'], { windowsHide: true });
   171:                 tk.on('exit', () => done('hard-killed via taskkill'));
   172:                 tk.on('error', (err) => { logger_1.logger.warn('[supervisor] taskkill failed: ' + String(err)); done('gave up after taskkill error'); });
   173:             }
   174:             catch (e) {
   175:                 logger_1.logger.warn('[supervisor] taskkill spawn failed: ' + String(e));
   176:                 done('gave up after taskkill spawn error');
   177:             }
   178:         }
   179:         else {
   180:             try {
   181:                 process.kill(child.pid, 'SIGKILL');
   182:                 done('hard-killed via SIGKILL');
   183:             }
   184:             catch (e) {
   185:                 logger_1.logger.warn('[supervisor] SIGKILL failed: ' + String(e));
   186:                 done('gave up after SIGKILL error');
   187:             }
   188:         }
   189:     }, timeoutMs);
   190: }
   191: function startProcess(name, cmd, args = [], opts = {}) {
   192:     if (freezeMode === 'frozen') {
   193:         logger_1.logger.warn(`[supervisor] startProcess: ${name} skipped because supervisor is frozen`);
   194:         return null;
   195:     }
   196:     ensureStateDir();
   197:     logger_1.logger.info(`supervisor: starting ${name} -> ${cmd} ${args.join(' ')}`);
   198:     const logFile = opts.logPath || (0, path_1.join)(LOGS_DIR, `${name}.log`);
   199:     const outStream = (0, fs_1.createWriteStream)(logFile, { flags: 'a' });
   200:     const spawnOpts = { cwd: opts.cwd || process.cwd(), shell: true };
   201:     spawnOpts.stdio = ['ignore', 'pipe', 'pipe'];
   202:     if (opts.detached)
   203:         spawnOpts.detached = true;
   204:     const existing = managed.get(name);
   205:     if (isAlive(existing)) {
   206:         logger_1.logger.info(`supervisor: ${name} is already running (pid=${existing.child.pid}), skipping start`);
   207:         return existing.child;
   208:     }
   209:     managed.set(name, { name, child: null, info: { name, pid: null, cmd, args, cwd: opts.cwd, log: logFile, detached: !!spawnOpts.detached }, outStream });
   210:     const child = (0, child_process_1.spawn)(cmd, args, spawnOpts);
   211:     if (child.stdout)
   212:         child.stdout.pipe(outStream);
   213:     if (child.stderr)
   214:         child.stderr.pipe(outStream);
   215:     child.on('error', (err) => logger_1.logger.error(`supervisor: ${name} process error ${err.message}`));
   216:     child.on('exit', (code) => {
   217:         logger_1.logger.warn(`supervisor: ${name} exited with ${code}`);
   218:         const m = managed.get(name);
   219:         if (m) {
   220:             m.child = null;
   221:             safeCloseStream(m.outStream);
   222:             m.outStream = null;
   223:         }
   224:         if (procs[name])
   225:             delete procs[name];
   226:         persist();
   227:     });
   228:     if (spawnOpts.detached) {
   229:         try {
   230:             child.unref();
   231:         }
   232:         catch { }
   233:     }
   234:     const record = { name, pid: child.pid || null, cmd, args, cwd: opts.cwd, log: logFile, detached: !!spawnOpts.detached };
   235:     procs[name] = record;
   236:     managed.set(name, { name, child, info: record, outStream });
   237:     persist();
   238:     return child;
   239: }
   240: function stopProcess(name) {
   241:     const entry = procs[name];
   242:     const m = managed.get(name);
   243:     if (!entry && !m)
   244:         return false;
   245:     try {
   246:         if (m && m.child) {
   247:             // non-blocking safe kill
   248:             safeKillAsync(m.child, 3000);
   249:             m.child = null;
   250:         }
   251:         else if (entry && entry.pid) {
   252:             // best-effort taskkill for pid without managed child
   253:             try {
   254:                 (0, child_process_1.spawn)('taskkill', ['/PID', String(entry.pid), '/T', '/F'], { windowsHide: true });
   255:             }
   256:             catch { }
   257:         }
   258:         safeCloseStream(m?.outStream ?? null);
   259:         if (procs[name])
   260:             delete procs[name];
   261:         if (managed.has(name))
   262:             managed.delete(name);
   263:         persist();
   264:         return true;
   265:     }
   266:     catch (err) {
   267:         logger_1.logger.warn(`supervisor: failed to kill ${name} pid=${entry?.pid} (${err})`);
   268:         return false;
   269:     }
   270: }
   271: function stopAll() {
   272:     const names = Array.from(managed.keys());
   273:     for (const n of names) {
   274:         stopProcess(n);
   275:     }
   276:     try {
   277:         if ((0, fs_1.existsSync)(STATE_FILE))
   278:             (0, fs_1.unlinkSync)(STATE_FILE);
   279:     }
   280:     catch { }
   281: }
   282: function clearState() {
   283:     procs = {};
   284:     for (const [, m] of managed)
   285:         safeCloseStream(m.outStream);
   286:     managed.clear();
   287:     try {
   288:         if ((0, fs_1.existsSync)(STATE_FILE))
   289:             (0, fs_1.unlinkSync)(STATE_FILE);
   290:     }
   291:     catch { }
   292: }
   293: function freezeAll(reason, opts) {
   294:     if (freezeMode === 'frozen') {
   295:         logger_1.logger.info('[supervisor] freezeAll: already frozen');
   296:         return;
   297:     }
   298:     freezeMode = 'frozen';
   299:     logger_1.logger.warn(`supervisor: entering frozen mode${reason ? ` - ${reason}` : ''}`);
   300:     // close streams and persist minimal state
   301:     for (const [, m] of managed) {
   302:         safeCloseStream(m.outStream);
   303:         m.outStream = null;
   304:         if (m.child && m.child.pid && procs[m.name])
   305:             procs[m.name].pid = m.child.pid;
   306:     }
   307:     persist();
   308:     if (opts && opts.autoResume && opts.resumeCheck && opts.resumeCheck.url) {
   309:         const intervalMs = opts.resumeCheck.intervalMs || 3000;
   310:         const timeoutMs = opts.resumeCheck.timeoutMs || 5 * 60 * 1000;
   311:         const stopWatch = startHealthWatch(opts.resumeCheck.url, () => {
   312:             logger_1.logger.info('[supervisor] healthWatch detected healthy -> resuming');
   313:             resumeAll();
   314:             stopWatch();
   315:         }, intervalMs);
   316:         // optional overall timeout to stop watcher
   317:         setTimeout(() => { try {
   318:             stopWatch();
   319:         }
   320:         catch { } }, timeoutMs);
   321:     }
   322: }
   323: exports.default = {
   324:     startProcess,
   325:     stopProcess,
   326:     stopAll,
   327:     clearState,
   328:     listRunning,
   329:     freezeAll,
   330:     resumeAll,
   331:     getFreezeMode,
   332: };

    14: let daemonProc = null;
    15: function wait(ms) { return new Promise((r) => setTimeout(r, ms)); }
    16: function getFreePort() {

    18:         const srv = net_1.default.createServer();

    27: async function startDaemon() {
    28:     // build first
    29:     await new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
    30:         const t = (0, child_process_1.spawn)(process.execPath, [path_1.default.join(process.cwd(), 'node_modules', 'typescript', 'lib', 'tsc.js'), '-p', '.']);
    31:         t.on('close', (code) => code === 0 ? resolve() : reject(new Error('tsc failed')));
    32:     });
    33:     DAEMON_PORT = await getFreePort();
    34:     daemonProc = (0, child_process_1.spawn)(process.execPath, [path_1.default.join(process.cwd(), 'dist', 'daemon', 'qflushd.js')], { env: { ...process.env, QFLUSHD_PORT: String(DAEMON_PORT) }, stdio: 'inherit' });
    35:     await wait(400);
    36: }
    37: async function stopDaemon() {
    38:     if (daemonProc) {
    39:         daemonProc.kill();
    40:         daemonProc = null;
    41:         await wait(200);
    42:     }
    43: }
    44: async function runTests() {
    45:     try {
    46:         await startDaemon();
    47:         // store
    48:         let res = await (0, fetch_1.default)(`${DAEMON_URL()}/npz/checksum/store`, { method: 'POST', headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' }, body: JSON.stringify({ id: 't1', checksum: 'abc', ttlMs: 2000 }) });
    49:         let j = await res.json();
    50:         if (!j.success)
    51:             throw new Error('store failed');
    52:         res = await (0, fetch_1.default)(`${DAEMON_URL()}/npz/checksum/list`);
    53:         j = await res.json();
    54:         if (!j.success || j.count === 0)
    55:             throw new Error('list failed');
    56:         // verify mismatch
    57:         res = await (0, fetch_1.default)(`${DAEMON_URL()}/npz/checksum/verify`, { method: 'POST', headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' }, body: JSON.stringify({ id: 't1', checksum: 'wrong' }) });
    58:         if (res.status === 200)
    59:             throw new Error('mismatch should fail');
    60:         // verify correct
    61:         res = await (0, fetch_1.default)(`${DAEMON_URL()}/npz/checksum/verify`, { method: 'POST', headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' }, body: JSON.stringify({ id: 't1', checksum: 'abc' }) });
    62:         j = await res.json();
    63:         if (!j.success)
    64:             throw new Error('verify failed');
    65:         // clear
    66:         res = await (0, fetch_1.default)(`${DAEMON_URL()}/npz/checksum/clear`, { method: 'DELETE' });
    67:         j = await res.json();
    68:         if (!j.success)
    69:             throw new Error('clear failed');
    70:         console.log('tests PASSED');
    71:     }
    72:     catch (e) {
    73:         console.error('tests FAILED', e);
    74:         throw e;
    75:     }
    76:     finally {
    77:         await stopDaemon();
    78:     }
    79: }

    40: const fs = __importStar(require("fs"));
    41: const path = __importStar(require("path"));
    42: async function runTests() {
    43:     // start webhook server
    44:     const calls = [];
    45:     const srv = http.createServer((req, res) => {
    46:         let raw = '';
    47:         req.on('data', d => raw += d.toString());
    48:         req.on('end', () => { try {
    49:             calls.push(JSON.parse(raw));
    50:         }
    51:         catch (e) { } res.end('ok'); });
    52:     }).listen(0);
    53:     const port = srv.address().port;
    54:     const cfgPath = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'logic-config.json');
    55:     const cfg = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(cfgPath, 'utf8'));
    56:     cfg.webhookUrl = `http://localhost:${port}`;
    57:     fs.writeFileSync(cfgPath, JSON.stringify(cfg, null, 2), 'utf8');
    58:     // disallowed command
    59:     const res1 = await (0, executor_1.executeAction)('run "rm -rf /" in "./"');
    60:     if (res1.success) {
    61:         console.error('dangerous command should not be allowed');
    62:         throw new Error('dangerous command should not be allowed');
    63:     }
    64:     // allowed echo
    65:     const res2 = await (0, executor_1.executeAction)('run "echo hello" in "./"');
    66:     if (!res2.success) {
    67:         console.error('echo should be allowed', res2);
    68:         throw new Error('echo should be allowed');
    69:     }
    70:     // npz encode triggers webhook
    71:     const res3 = await (0, executor_1.executeAction)('npz.encode file', { path: 'assets/banner.png' });
    72:     if (!res3.success) {
    73:         console.error('npz should succeed', res3);
    74:         throw new Error('npz should succeed');
    75:     }
    76:     // wait a moment for webhook calls
    77:     await new Promise(r => setTimeout(r, 400));
    78:     if (calls.length === 0) {
    79:         console.error('webhook not called');
    80:         throw new Error('webhook not called');
    81:     }
    82:     srv.close();
    83:     console.log('executor tests passed');
    84: }

     9: const PORT = process.env.QFLUSHD_PORT ? Number(process.env.QFLUSHD_PORT) : 4500;
    10: const BASE = `http://localhost:${PORT}`;
    11: async function waitForJson(path, attempts = 20, delayMs = 250) {
    12:     for (let i = 0; i < attempts; i++) {
    13:         try {
    14:             const res = await (0, fetch_1.default)(`${BASE}${path}`);
    15:             if (!res.ok)
    16:                 throw new Error(`status ${res.status}`);
    17:             const j = await res.json();
    18:             return j;
    19:         }
    20:         catch (e) {
    21:             // wait and retry
    22:             await new Promise((r) => setTimeout(r, delayMs));
    23:         }
    24:     }
    25:     throw new Error(`failed to fetch JSON ${path} after ${attempts} attempts`);
    26: }

    29:     try {

    34:         }

    36:         await new Promise((r) => setTimeout(r, 400));
    37:         const res = await (0, fetch_1.default)('http://localhost:4500/npz/rome-index');
    38:         const j = await res.json();

    42:             console.error('invalid index response', all);

    48:         if (!byDaemon || !Array.isArray(byDaemon.items)) {
    49:             console.error('invalid filtered response', byDaemon);
    50:             throw new Error('invalid filtered response');
    51:         }
    52:         console.log('rome-index daemon count=', byDaemon.count);

FILE: dist\src\utils\auth.js
============================
============================
     1: "use strict";
     2: // ROME-TAG: 0xC8C1C0
     3: Object.defineProperty(exports, "__esModule", { value: true });
     4: exports.isAdminAuthorized = isAdminAuthorized;
     5: function isAdminAuthorized(req) {
     6:     const token = process.env.NPZ_ADMIN_TOKEN;
     7:     const user = process.env.NPZ_ADMIN_USER;
     8:     const pass = process.env.NPZ_ADMIN_PASS;
     9:     const allowIps = (process.env.NPZ_ADMIN_ALLOW_IPS || '').split(',').map(s => s.trim()).filter(Boolean);
    10:     // IP allowlist
    11:     if (allowIps.length > 0) {
    12:         const ip = req.headers['x-forwarded-for'] || req.socket.remoteAddress || '';
    13:         for (const a of allowIps) {
    14:             if (ip && ip.includes(a))
    15:                 return true;
    16:         }
    17:     }
    18:     // x-admin-token header
    19:     const providedToken = req.headers['x-admin-token'] || (req.query && req.query.token);
    20:     if (token && providedToken && providedToken === token)
    21:         return true;
    22:     // Authorization: Bearer <token>
    23:     const auth = req.headers['authorization'];
    24:     if (auth && auth.startsWith('Bearer ')) {
    25:         const b = auth.slice(7).trim();
    26:         if (token && b === token)
    27:             return true;
    28:     }
    29:     // Basic auth
    30:     if (auth && auth.startsWith('Basic ')) {
    31:         try {
    32:             const payload = Buffer.from(auth.slice(6), 'base64').toString('utf8');
    33:             const [u, p] = payload.split(':');
    34:             if (user && pass && u === user && p === pass)
    35:                 return true;
    36:         }
    37:         catch (e) {
    38:             // ignore
    39:         }
    40:     }
    41:     return false;
    42: }
    43: exports.default = { isAdminAuthorized };

    24:     blackHex: '#000000',
    25: };
    26: function clamp(v, a = 0, b = 255) {
    27:     return Math.max(a, Math.min(b, Math.round(v)));
    28: }
    29: function hexToRgb(hex) {
    30:     const h = hex.replace('#', '');
    31:     if (h.length === 3) {
    32:         const r = parseInt(h[0] + h[0], 16);
    33:         const g = parseInt(h[1] + h[1], 16);
    34:         const b = parseInt(h[2] + h[2], 16);
    35:         return { r, g, b };
    36:     }
    37:     const r = parseInt(h.slice(0, 2), 16);
    38:     const g = parseInt(h.slice(2, 4), 16);
    39:     const b = parseInt(h.slice(4, 6), 16);
    40:     return { r, g, b };
    41: }
    42: function rgbToHex(r, g, b) {
    43:     return `#${[r, g, b].map((n) => clamp(n).toString(16).padStart(2, '0')).join('')}`;
    44: }
    45: function rgba(hex, alpha = 1) {
    46:     const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);
    47:     return `rgba(${r}, ${g}, ${b}, ${alpha})`;
    48: }
    49: function lighten(hex, percent = 0.1) {
    50:     const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);
    51:     const nr = clamp(r + (255 - r) * percent);
    52:     const ng = clamp(g + (255 - g) * percent);
    53:     const nb = clamp(b + (255 - b) * percent);
    54:     return rgbToHex(nr, ng, nb);
    55: }
    56: function darken(hex, percent = 0.1) {
    57:     const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);
    58:     const nr = clamp(r * (1 - percent));
    59:     const ng = clamp(g * (1 - percent));
    60:     const nb = clamp(b * (1 - percent));
    61:     return rgbToHex(nr, ng, nb);
    62: }
    63: function relativeLuminance(hex) {
    64:     const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);
    65:     const srgb = [r / 255, g / 255, b / 255].map((c) => (c <= 0.03928 ? c / 12.92 : Math.pow((c + 0.055) / 1.055, 2.4)));
    66:     return 0.2126 * srgb[0] + 0.7152 * srgb[1] + 0.0722 * srgb[2];
    67: }
    68: function contrastRatio(hexA, hexB) {
    69:     const L1 = relativeLuminance(hexA) + 0.05;
    70:     const L2 = relativeLuminance(hexB) + 0.05;
    71:     return Math.max(L1, L2) / Math.min(L1, L2);
    72: }
    73: function readableTextColor(backgroundHex, prefer = exports.NEZLEPHANT.whiteHex) {
    74:     // return white or black depending on contrast
    75:     const whiteContrast = contrastRatio(backgroundHex, exports.NEZLEPHANT.whiteHex);
    76:     const blackContrast = contrastRatio(backgroundHex, exports.NEZLEPHANT.blackHex);
    77:     return whiteContrast >= blackContrast ? exports.NEZLEPHANT.whiteHex : exports.NEZLEPHANT.blackHex;
    78: }
    79: function cssVariables(prefix = 'nez') {
    80:     const base = exports.NEZLEPHANT.baseHex;
    81:     const j = exports.NEZLEPHANT.jokerHex;
    82:     return `:root {\n  --${prefix}-base: ${base};\n  --${prefix}-base-90: ${rgba(base, 0.9)};\n  --${prefix}-base-80: ${rgba(base, 0.8)};\n  --${prefix}-base-60: ${rgba(base, 0.6)};\n  --${prefix}-base-30: ${rgba(base, 0.3)};\n  --${prefix}-light: ${lighten(base, 0.18)};\n  --${prefix}-dark: ${darken(base, 0.18)};\n  --${prefix}-joker: ${j};\n  --${prefix}-bg: ${exports.NEZLEPHANT.neutralHex};\n  --${prefix}-text: ${readableTextColor(exports.NEZLEPHANT.neutralHex)};\n}`;
    83: }
    84: // Terminal ANSI truecolor helpers (supports modern terminals)
    85: function ansiFg(hex) {
    86:     const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);
    87:     return `\x1b[38;2;${r};${g};${b}m`;
    88: }
    89: function ansiBg(hex) {
    90:     const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);
    91:     return `\x1b[48;2;${r};${g};${b}m`;
    92: }
    93: exports.ansiReset = '\x1b[0m';
    94: // Preset styled log helpers for Joker + Nezlephant
    95: function styledLog(title, msg, opts) {
    96:     const accent = opts?.accent === 'joker' ? exports.NEZLEPHANT.jokerHex : opts?.accent === 'neutral' ? exports.NEZLEPHANT.neutralHex : exports.NEZLEPHANT.baseHex;
    97:     const bg = ansiBg(darken(accent, 0.15));
    98:     const fg = ansiFg(readableTextColor(darken(accent, 0.15)));
    99:     const accentFg = ansiFg(accent);
   100:     process.stdout.write(`${bg}${fg} [${title}] ${exports.ansiReset} ${accentFg}${msg}${exports.ansiReset}\n`);
   101: }
   102: exports.default = {
   103:     NEZLEPHANT: exports.NEZLEPHANT,
   104:     hexToRgb,
   105:     rgbToHex,
   106:     rgba,
   107:     lighten,
   108:     darken,
   109:     readableTextColor,
   110:     cssVariables,
   111:     ansiFg,
   112:     ansiBg,
   113:     ansiReset: exports.ansiReset,
   114:     styledLog,
   115: };

     1: "use strict";
     2: // ROME-TAG: 0x29A73C
     3: Object.defineProperty(exports, "__esModule", { value: true });
     4: exports.detectModules = detectModules;
     5: exports.findAndKill = findAndKill;
     6: const child_process_1 = require("child_process");
     7: const logger_1 = require("./logger");
     8: const paths_1 = require("./paths");
     9: const package_1 = require("./package");
    10: async function detectModules() {
    11:     const out = {};
    12:     for (const name of Object.keys(paths_1.SERVICE_MAP))
    13:         out[name] = { running: false, installed: false, path: undefined, bin: undefined };
    14:     for (const name of Object.keys(paths_1.SERVICE_MAP)) {
    15:         try {
    16:             const pkgPath = (0, package_1.resolvePackagePath)(paths_1.SERVICE_MAP[name].pkg);
    17:             if (pkgPath) {
    18:                 out[name].installed = true;
    19:                 out[name].path = pkgPath;
    20:                 try {
    21:                     const pkgJson = require(require('path').join(pkgPath, 'package.json'));
    22:                     if (pkgJson && pkgJson.bin) {
    23:                         out[name].bin = typeof pkgJson.bin === 'string' ? pkgJson.bin : Object.values(pkgJson.bin)[0];
    24:                     }
    25:                 }
    26:                 catch { }
    27:             }
    28:         }
    29:         catch { }
    30:     }
    31:     await new Promise((resolve) => {
    32:         (0, child_process_1.exec)(process.platform === "win32" ? "tasklist" : "ps aux", (err, stdout) => {
    33:             if (err) {
    34:                 logger_1.logger.warn(`Failed to list processes: ${err.message}`);
    35:                 return resolve();
    36:             }
    37:             const s = stdout.toString();
    38:             for (const name of Object.keys(paths_1.SERVICE_MAP)) {
    39:                 const regex = new RegExp(name, "i");
    40:                 if (regex.test(s)) {
    41:                     out[name].running = true;
    42:                 }
    43:             }
    44:             resolve();
    45:         });
    46:     });
    47:     return out;
    48: }
    49: async function findAndKill() {
    50:     const names = Object.keys(paths_1.SERVICE_MAP);
    51:     const killed = [];
    52:     for (const n of names) {
    53:         try {
    54:             if (process.platform === "win32") {
    55:                 (0, child_process_1.exec)(`taskkill /IM ${n}.exe /F`, (err) => { });
    56:             }
    57:             else {
    58:                 (0, child_process_1.exec)(`pkill -f ${n}`, (err) => { });
    59:             }
    60:         }
    61:         catch (err) {
    62:             // ignore
    63:         }
    64:     }
    65:     return killed;
    66: }

    14: function spawnSafe(command, args = [], opts = {}) {
    15:     try {
    16:         const proc = (0, child_process_1.spawn)(command, args, { stdio: "inherit", shell: true, ...opts });
    17:         proc.on("error", (err) => logger_1.logger.error(`Process error: ${err.message}`));
    18:         return proc;
    19:     }
    20:     catch (err) {
    21:         logger_1.logger.error(`Failed to spawn ${command}: ${err.message}`);
    22:         throw err;
    23:     }
    24: }
    25: function rimrafSync(path) {
    26:     if (!path)
    27:         return;
    28:     if (!(0, fs_1.existsSync)(path))
    29:         return;
    30:     try {
    31:         (0, fs_1.rmSync)(path, { recursive: true, force: true });
    32:     }
    33:     catch (err) {
    34:         // fallback
    35:         try {
    36:             (0, fs_1.unlinkSync)(path);
    37:         }
    38:         catch { }
    39:     }
    40: }
    41: function isPackageInstalled(pkgName) {
    42:     try {
    43:         (0, child_process_2.execSync)(`npm ls ${pkgName} --depth=0`, { stdio: "ignore" });
    44:         return true;
    45:     }
    46:     catch {
    47:         return false;
    48:     }
    49: }
    50: function ensurePackageInstalled(pkgName) {
    51:     if (isPackageInstalled(pkgName))
    52:         return true;
    53:     logger_1.logger.info(`Installing missing package ${pkgName}...`);
    54:     try {
    55:         (0, child_process_2.execSync)(`npm install -g ${pkgName}`, { stdio: "inherit" });
    56:         return true;
    57:     }
    58:     catch (err) {
    59:         logger_1.logger.warn(`Failed to install ${pkgName}: ${err.message}`);
    60:         return false;
    61:     }
    62: }
    63: // Helpers for CLI pre-launch checks
    64: function pathExists(pathStr) {
    65:     return !!pathStr && (0, fs_1.existsSync)(pathStr);
    66: }
    67: function rebuildInstructionsFor(pkgPath) {
    68:     if (!pkgPath)
    69:         return `Rebuild the package (cd <pkg> && npm install && npm run build && npm install -g .)`;
    70:     return `Rebuild the package:\n  cd ${pkgPath}\n  npm install\n  npm run build\n  npm install -g .`;
    71: }

    37: exports.fetchWrapper = fetchWrapper;
    38: // small wrapper around available fetch implementations
    39: // tries global fetch, then undici, otherwise falls back to node's http(s) for simple requests
    40: const http = __importStar(require("http"));
    41: const https = __importStar(require("https"));
    42: async function simpleFetch(url, init = {}) {
    43:     return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
    44:         try {
    45:             const u = new URL(url);
    46:             const isHttps = u.protocol === 'https:';
    47:             const lib = isHttps ? https : http;
    48:             const opts = { method: init.method || 'GET', headers: init.headers || {}, hostname: u.hostname, port: u.port || (isHttps ? 443 : 80), path: u.pathname + (u.search || '') };
    49:             const req = lib.request(opts, (res) => {
    50:                 const bufs = [];
    51:                 res.on('data', (d) => bufs.push(d));
    52:                 res.on('end', () => {
    53:                     const txt = Buffer.concat(bufs).toString('utf8');
    54:                     resolve({ ok: res.statusCode >= 200 && res.statusCode < 400, status: res.statusCode, statusText: res.statusMessage, text: () => Promise.resolve(txt), json: () => Promise.resolve(JSON.parse(txt)), headers: res.headers });
    55:                 });
    56:             });
    57:             req.on('error', (e) => reject(e));
    58:             if (init.body)
    59:                 req.write(typeof init.body === 'string' ? init.body : JSON.stringify(init.body));
    60:             req.end();
    61:         }
    62:         catch (e) {
    63:             reject(e);
    64:         }
    65:     });
    66: }
    67: async function fetchWrapper(url, init) {
    68:     if (typeof globalThis.fetch === 'function')
    69:         return globalThis.fetch(url, init);
    70:     try {
    71:         // try undici
    72:         const undici = require('undici');
    73:         if (undici && typeof undici.fetch === 'function')
    74:             return undici.fetch(url, init);
    75:     }
    76:     catch (e) {
    77:         // ignore
    78:     }
    79:     return simpleFetch(url, init || {});
    80: }
    81: exports.default = fetchWrapper;

    47: const fs = __importStar(require("fs"));
    48: const path = __importStar(require("path"));
    49: const node_fetch_1 = __importDefault(require("node-fetch"));
    50: const DEFAULT_STORAGE = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'license.json');
    51: function getStoragePath() {
    52:     return process.env.GUMROAD_LICENSE_PATH || DEFAULT_STORAGE;
    53: }
    54: function ensureDir(storagePath) {
    55:     const dir = path.dirname(storagePath);
    56:     if (!fs.existsSync(dir))
    57:         fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
    58: }
    59: function saveLicense(rec) {
    60:     const storage = getStoragePath();
    61:     ensureDir(storage);
    62:     fs.writeFileSync(storage, JSON.stringify(rec, null, 2), 'utf8');
    63: }
    64: function loadLicense() {
    65:     try {
    66:         const storage = getStoragePath();
    67:         if (!fs.existsSync(storage))
    68:             return null;
    69:         const raw = fs.readFileSync(storage, 'utf8');
    70:         return JSON.parse(raw);
    71:     }
    72:     catch (e) {
    73:         return null;
    74:     }
    75: }
    76: function readTokenFromFile() {
    77:     const p = process.env.GUMROAD_TOKEN_FILE;
    78:     if (!p)
    79:         return null;
    80:     try {
    81:         if (!fs.existsSync(p))
    82:             return null;
    83:         return fs.readFileSync(p, 'utf8').trim();
    84:     }
    85:     catch (e) {
    86:         return null;
    87:     }
    88: }
    89: async function verifyWithGumroad(product_id, licenseKey, token) {
    90:     // Gumroad license verify endpoint
    91:     const url = 'https://api.gumroad.com/v2/licenses/verify';
    92:     const body = { product_id, license_key: licenseKey };
    93:     const res = await (0, node_fetch_1.default)(url, {
    94:         method: 'POST',
    95:         headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json', Authorization: `Bearer ${token}` },
    96:         body: JSON.stringify(body),
    97:     });
    98:     if (!res.ok)
    99:         throw new Error(`Gumroad API returned ${res.status}`);
   100:     const json = await res.json();
   101:     return json;
   102: }
   103: function isLicenseValid(rec) {
   104:     if (!rec)
   105:         return false;
   106:     if (rec.expiresAt && Date.now() > rec.expiresAt)
   107:         return false;
   108:     return true;
   109: }
   110: async function activateLicense(product_id, licenseKey, token) {
   111:     const data = await verifyWithGumroad(product_id, licenseKey, token);
   112:     if (data && data.success) {
   113:         const purchase = data.purchase || {};
   114:         const now = Date.now();
   115:         const recurring = !!purchase.subscription_ended_at || !!purchase.subscription_cancelled_at ? false : !!purchase.subscription_id;
   116:         const expiresAt = recurring ? null : now + 365 * 24 * 3600 * 1000; // 1 year default
   117:         const rec = {
   118:             key: licenseKey,
   119:             product_id,
   120:             createdAt: now,
   121:             expiresAt,
   122:             recurring,
   123:             lastVerified: now,
   124:             metadata: purchase,
   125:         };
   126:         saveLicense(rec);
   127:         return rec;
   128:     }
   129:     throw new Error('License verification failed');
   130: }
   131: function clearLicense() {
   132:     try {
   133:         const storage = getStoragePath();
   134:         if (fs.existsSync(storage))
   135:             fs.unlinkSync(storage);
   136:     }
   137:     catch (e) { }
   138: }
   139: exports.default = { saveLicense, loadLicense, verifyWithGumroad, activateLicense, isLicenseValid, clearLicense, readTokenFromFile };

     1: "use strict";
     2: // ROME-TAG: 0x1CA919
     3: var __importDefault = (this && this.__importDefault) || function (mod) {
     4:     return (mod && mod.__esModule) ? mod : { "default": mod };
     5: };
     6: Object.defineProperty(exports, "__esModule", { value: true });
     7: exports.httpProbe = httpProbe;
     8: exports.tcpProbe = tcpProbe;
     9: exports.waitForService = waitForService;
    10: const http_1 = __importDefault(require("http"));
    11: const net_1 = __importDefault(require("net"));
    12: async function httpProbe(url, timeout = 2000) {
    13:     return new Promise((resolve) => {
    14:         const req = http_1.default.get(url, (res) => {
    15:             res.resume();
    16:             resolve(Boolean(res.statusCode && res.statusCode < 400));
    17:         });
    18:         req.on('error', () => resolve(false));
    19:         req.setTimeout(timeout, () => {
    20:             req.destroy();
    21:             resolve(false);
    22:         });
    23:     });
    24: }
    25: async function tcpProbe(host, port, timeout = 2000) {
    26:     return new Promise((resolve) => {
    27:         const s = new net_1.default.Socket();
    28:         let done = false;
    29:         s.setTimeout(timeout);
    30:         s.on('connect', () => {
    31:             done = true;
    32:             s.destroy();
    33:             resolve(true);
    34:         });
    35:         s.on('error', () => { if (!done) {
    36:             done = true;
    37:             resolve(false);
    38:         } });
    39:         s.on('timeout', () => { if (!done) {
    40:             done = true;
    41:             s.destroy();
    42:             resolve(false);
    43:         } });
    44:         s.connect(port, host);
    45:     });
    46: }
    47: async function waitForService(urlOrHost, port, timeout = 5000) {
    48:     const start = Date.now();
    49:     while (Date.now() - start < timeout) {
    50:         let ok = false;
    51:         if (typeof port === 'number') {
    52:             ok = await tcpProbe(urlOrHost, port, 1000);
    53:         }
    54:         else if (urlOrHost.startsWith('http')) {
    55:             ok = await httpProbe(urlOrHost, 1000);
    56:         }
    57:         if (ok)
    58:             return true;
    59:         await new Promise((r) => setTimeout(r, 500));
    60:     }
    61:     return false;
    62: }

FILE: dist\src\utils\hmac.js
============================
============================
     1: "use strict";
     2: Object.defineProperty(exports, "__esModule", { value: true });
     3: exports.computeContentHash = computeContentHash;
     4: exports.computeHmacSignature = computeHmacSignature;
     5: exports.buildHmacHeaders = buildHmacHeaders;
     6: const crypto_1 = require("crypto");
     7: // Computes base64-encoded SHA256 of UTF-8 content (x-ms-content-sha256 style)
     8: function computeContentHash(content) {
     9:     const hash = (0, crypto_1.createHash)('sha256');
    10:     hash.update(Buffer.from(content || '', 'utf8'));
    11:     return hash.digest('base64');
    12: }
    13: // Compute HMAC-SHA256 signature from a base64-encoded secret key
    14: function computeHmacSignature(stringToSign, base64Secret) {
    15:     // secret is expected base64-encoded (like Azure resource key)
    16:     const key = Buffer.from(base64Secret, 'base64');
    17:     const h = (0, crypto_1.createHmac)('sha256', key);
    18:     h.update(Buffer.from(stringToSign, 'utf8'));
    19:     return h.digest('base64');
    20: }
    21: // Build authorization header and required signed headers for Azure-style HMAC-SHA256
    22: function buildHmacHeaders(opts) {
    23:     const date = opts.date || new Date().toUTCString();
    24:     const content = opts.body || '';
    25:     const contentHash = computeContentHash(content);
    26:     // string to sign format: "VERB\n{pathWithQuery}\n{date};{host};{contentHash}"
    27:     const stringToSign = `${opts.method.toUpperCase()}\n${opts.pathWithQuery}\n${date};${opts.host};${contentHash}`;
    28:     const signature = computeHmacSignature(stringToSign, opts.secretBase64);
    29:     const authorization = `HMAC-SHA256 SignedHeaders=x-ms-date;host;x-ms-content-sha256&Signature=${signature}`;
    30:     return {
    31:         'Authorization': authorization,
    32:         'x-ms-date': date,
    33:         'x-ms-content-sha256': contentHash,
    34:         // host header is normally set by HTTP client, include for completeness
    35:         'host': opts.host,
    36:     };
    37: }
    38: // Example usage (not executed here):
    39: // const headers = buildHmacHeaders({
    40: //   method: 'POST',
    41: //   pathWithQuery: '/identities?api-version=2021-03-07',
    42: //   host: 'myendpoint.communication.azure.com',
    43: //   body: JSON.stringify({ createTokenWithScopes: ['chat'] }),
    44: //   secretBase64: process.env.AZURE_RESOURCE_ACCESS_KEY_BASE64!
    45: // });
    46: // fetch(url, { method: 'POST', headers: { ...headers, 'Content-Type': 'application/json' }, body });

    44: const path = __importStar(require("path"));
    45: const node_fetch_1 = __importDefault(require("node-fetch"));
    46: const STORE = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'license.json');
    47: function ensureDir() {
    48:     const dir = path.dirname(STORE);
    49:     if (!fs.existsSync(dir))
    50:         fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
    51: }
    52: function readLicense() {
    53:     try {
    54:         if (!fs.existsSync(STORE))
    55:             return null;
    56:         const raw = fs.readFileSync(STORE, 'utf8');
    57:         return JSON.parse(raw);
    58:     }
    59:     catch (e) {
    60:         return null;
    61:     }
    62: }
    63: function saveLicense(rec) {
    64:     try {
    65:         ensureDir();
    66:         fs.writeFileSync(STORE, JSON.stringify(rec, null, 2), 'utf8');
    67:         return true;
    68:     }
    69:     catch (e) {
    70:         return false;
    71:     }
    72: }
    73: async function verifyWithGumroad(key, productId) {
    74:     const token = process.env.GUMROAD_TOKEN;
    75:     if (!token)
    76:         throw new Error('GUMROAD_TOKEN not configured');
    77:     const url = `https://api.gumroad.com/v2/licenses/verify`;
    78:     const body = new URLSearchParams();
    79:     body.append('product_permalink', productId || '');
    80:     body.append('license_key', key);
    81:     const res = await (0, node_fetch_1.default)(url, { method: 'POST', body, headers: { Authorization: `Bearer ${token}` } });
    82:     const json = await res.json();
    83:     return json;
    84: }
    85: async function activateLicense(key, productId) {
    86:     const resp = await verifyWithGumroad(key, productId);
    87:     if (resp && resp.success) {
    88:         const purchase = resp.purchase || {};
    89:         const lic = { key, product_id: purchase.product_id || productId, valid: true, expires_at: purchase ? purchase.license_expires_at : null, verifiedAt: Date.now() };
    90:         saveLicense(lic);
    91:         return { ok: true, license: lic, raw: resp };
    92:     }
    93:     // failure
    94:     const lic = { key, product_id: productId, valid: false, verifiedAt: Date.now() };
    95:     saveLicense(lic);
    96:     return { ok: false, error: resp };
    97: }
    98: exports.default = { readLicense, saveLicense, activateLicense };

FILE: dist\src\utils\npz-config.js

     1: "use strict";
     2: // ROME-TAG: 0x925520
     3: var __importDefault = (this && this.__importDefault) || function (mod) {
     4:     return (mod && mod.__esModule) ? mod : { "default": mod };
     5: };
     6: Object.defineProperty(exports, "__esModule", { value: true });
     7: exports.getNpzNamespace = getNpzNamespace;
     8: const crypto_1 = __importDefault(require("crypto"));
     9: function getNpzNamespace() {
    10:     // allow override
    11:     const env = process.env.NPZ_NAMESPACE;
    12:     if (env && env.trim().length > 0)
    13:         return env.trim();
    14:     const seed = 'npz';
    15:     try {
    16:         // try to require the nezlephant package directly to avoid loading the whole lib index
    17:         // which may pull packages that are not compatible in the runner.
    18:         const nez = require('@funeste38/nezlephant');
    19:         if (nez) {
    20:             if (typeof nez.encode === 'function') {
    21:                 const out = nez.encode(seed);
    22:                 if (typeof out === 'string' && out.length >= 8)
    23:                     return out.slice(0, 8);
    24:             }
    25:             if (typeof nez.hash === 'function') {
    26:                 const h = nez.hash(seed);
    27:                 if (typeof h === 'string' && h.length >= 8)
    28:                     return h.slice(0, 8);
    29:             }
    30:         }
    31:     }
    32:     catch (e) {
    33:         // ignore and fallback
    34:     }
    35:     // fallback: sha256(seed) and take first 4 bytes (8 hex chars)
    36:     const hash = crypto_1.default.createHash('sha256').update(seed).digest('hex').slice(0, 8);
    37:     return hash;
    38: }
    39: exports.default = { getNpzNamespace };

    48: const envScanner = async (mod) => {
    49:     const issues = [];
    50:     const required = mod.requiredEnv || [];
    51:     for (const key of required) {
    52:         if (!process.env[key]) {
    53:             issues.push({ level: 'block', code: 'MISSING_ENV', message: `Missing env var: ${key}` });
    54:         }
    55:     }
    56:     return issues;
    57: };
    58: exports.envScanner = envScanner;
    59: const fileScanner = async (mod) => {
    60:     const issues = [];
    61:     const required = mod.requiredFiles || [];
    62:     for (const rel of required) {
    63:         const full = path.join(mod.cwd, rel);
    64:         if (!fs.existsSync(full)) {
    65:             issues.push({ level: 'warning', code: 'MISSING_FILE', message: `Config file not found: ${rel}` });
    66:         }
    67:     }
    68:     return issues;
    69: };
    70: exports.fileScanner = fileScanner;
    71: function checkPortInUse(port) {
    72:     return new Promise((resolve) => {
    73:         const server = net.createServer();
    74:         server.once('error', () => resolve(true));
    75:         server.once('listening', () => {
    76:             server.close(() => resolve(false));
    77:         });
    78:         server.listen(port, '127.0.0.1');
    79:     });
    80: }
    81: const portScanner = async (mod) => {
    82:     const issues = [];
    83:     const ports = mod.requiredPorts || [];
    84:     for (const port of ports) {
    85:         if (await checkPortInUse(port)) {
    86:             issues.push({ level: 'block', code: 'PORT_IN_USE', message: `Port ${port} already in use` });
    87:         }
    88:     }
    89:     return issues;
    90: };
    91: exports.portScanner = portScanner;
    92: const SCANNERS = [exports.envScanner, exports.fileScanner, exports.portScanner];
    93: async function runCustomsCheck(mod) {
    94:     const issues = [];
    95:     for (const scanner of SCANNERS) {
    96:         try {
    97:             const res = await scanner(mod);
    98:             if (res && res.length)
    99:                 issues.push(...res);
   100:         }
   101:         catch (err) {
   102:             logger_1.logger.warn(`customs: scanner error for ${mod.name} ${err}`);
   103:         }
   104:     }
   105:     if (issues.length === 0) {
   106:         logger_1.logger.info(`[NPZ][CUSTOMS][PASS] ${mod.name} - all clear`);
   107:     }
   108:     else {
   109:         for (const issue of issues) {
   110:             const tag = issue.level.toUpperCase();
   111:             if (issue.level === 'block')
   112:                 logger_1.logger.warn(`[NPZ][CUSTOMS][${tag}] ${mod.name} - ${issue.message}`);
   113:             else
   114:                 logger_1.logger.info(`[NPZ][CUSTOMS][${tag}] ${mod.name} - ${issue.message}`);
   115:         }
   116:     }
   117:     return { module: mod.name, issues };
   118: }
   119: function hasBlockingIssues(report) {
   120:     return report.issues.some((i) => i.level === 'block');
   121: }
   122: exports.default = {
   123:     MODULES: exports.MODULES,
   124:     runCustomsCheck,
   125:     hasBlockingIssues,
   126: };


============================
FILE: dist\src\utils\npz-engine.js
============================
============================
     1: "use strict";
     2: // ROME-TAG: 0x043BA9
     3: var __importDefault = (this && this.__importDefault) || function (mod) {
     4:     return (mod && mod.__esModule) ? mod : { "default": mod };
     5: };
     6: Object.defineProperty(exports, "__esModule", { value: true });
     7: exports.scoreLane = scoreLane;
     8: exports.getLaneScore = getLaneScore;
     9: exports.orderLanesByScore = orderLanesByScore;
    10: exports.resetScores = resetScores;
    11: exports.getStore = getStore;
    12: const npz_config_1 = require("./npz-config");
    13: const fs_1 = __importDefault(require("fs"));
    14: const path_1 = __importDefault(require("path"));
    15: const NS = (0, npz_config_1.getNpzNamespace)();
    16: const ENGINE_FILE = path_1.default.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', `${NS}-npz-engine.json`);
    17: let store = {};
    18: // decay parameters
    19: const DECAY_INTERVAL_MS = 60 * 1000; // every minute
    20: const DECAY_FACTOR = 0.9; // multiply score by this every decay interval (towards 0)
    21: function ensureDir() {
    22:     const dir = path_1.default.dirname(ENGINE_FILE);
    23:     if (!fs_1.default.existsSync(dir))
    24:         fs_1.default.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
    25: }
    26: function load() {
    27:     try {
    28:         if (fs_1.default.existsSync(ENGINE_FILE)) {
    29:             const raw = fs_1.default.readFileSync(ENGINE_FILE, 'utf8');
    30:             store = JSON.parse(raw);
    31:         }
    32:     }
    33:     catch (e) {
    34:         store = {};
    35:     }
    36: }
    37: function persist() {
    38:     try {
    39:         ensureDir();
    40:         fs_1.default.writeFileSync(ENGINE_FILE, JSON.stringify(store, null, 2), 'utf8');
    41:     }
    42:     catch (e) { }
    43: }
    44: function applyDecay() {
    45:     const now = Date.now();
    46:     let changed = false;
    47:     for (const k of Object.keys(store)) {
    48:         const id = Number(k);
    49:         const rec = store[id];
    50:         if (!rec)
    51:             continue;
    52:         // compute how many intervals since lastSuccess/lastFailure (use lastFailure as activity reference)
    53:         const ref = rec.lastFailure || rec.lastSuccess || now;
    54:         const intervals = Math.floor((now - ref) / DECAY_INTERVAL_MS);
    55:         if (intervals <= 0)
    56:             continue;
    57:         const factor = Math.pow(DECAY_FACTOR, intervals);
    58:         const newScore = rec.score * factor;
    59:         if (Math.abs(newScore - rec.score) > 1e-6) {
    60:             rec.score = newScore;
    61:             changed = true;
    62:         }
    63:     }
    64:     if (changed)
    65:         persist();
    66: }
    67: load();
    68: // schedule periodic decay in-memory (best-effort)
    69: setInterval(() => {
    70:     try {
    71:         applyDecay();
    72:     }
    73:     catch (e) { }
    74: }, DECAY_INTERVAL_MS);
    75: /**
    76:  * Adjust lane score.
    77:  * delta: positive increases penalty (worse), negative decreases (better).
    78:  * latencyMs: optional latency observed to weight the delta.
    79:  */
    80: function scoreLane(laneId, delta, latencyMs) {
    81:     let rec = store[laneId];
    82:     if (!rec)
    83:         rec = { laneId, score: 0 };
    84:     // weight delta by latency (if provided): normalized over 1000ms
    85:     let weight = 1;
    86:     if (latencyMs && latencyMs > 0)
    87:         weight += Math.min(5, latencyMs / 1000); // cap weight
    88:     rec.score = (rec.score || 0) + delta * weight;
    89:     if (delta < 0)
    90:         rec.lastSuccess = Date.now();
    91:     if (delta > 0)
    92:         rec.lastFailure = Date.now();
    93:     store[laneId] = rec;
    94:     persist();
    95: }
    96: function getLaneScore(laneId) {
    97:     const rec = store[laneId];
    98:     if (!rec)
    99:         return 0;
   100:     // apply decay relative to now on read (non-persistent)
   101:     const now = Date.now();
   102:     const ref = rec.lastFailure || rec.lastSuccess || now;
   103:     const intervals = Math.floor((now - ref) / DECAY_INTERVAL_MS);
   104:     const factor = Math.pow(DECAY_FACTOR, intervals);
   105:     return rec.score * factor;
   106: }
   107: function orderLanesByScore(lanes) {
   108:     // return copy sorted by score asc
   109:     const out = lanes.slice();
   110:     out.sort((a, b) => getLaneScore(a.id) - getLaneScore(b.id));
   111:     return out;
   112: }
   113: function resetScores() {
   114:     store = {};
   115:     persist();
   116: }
   117: function getStore() {
   118:     return store;
   119: }
   120: exports.default = { scoreLane, getLaneScore, orderLanesByScore, resetScores, getStore };

    14:             res.set('Content-Type', registry.contentType);
    15:             res.send(await registry.metrics());
    16:             return;

     1: "use strict";

     3: var __importDefault = (this && this.__importDefault) || function (mod) {
     4:     return (mod && mod.__esModule) ? mod : { "default": mod };
     5: };
     6: Object.defineProperty(exports, "__esModule", { value: true });
     7: exports.npzMiddleware = npzMiddleware;
     8: const uuid_1 = require("uuid");
     9: const npz_router_1 = require("./npz-router");
    10: const npz_store_1 = __importDefault(require("./npz-store"));
    11: const logger_1 = __importDefault(require("./logger"));
    12: const prom_client_1 = __importDefault(require("prom-client"));
    13: const npz_config_1 = require("./npz-config");
    14: const NS = (0, npz_config_1.getNpzNamespace)();
    15: const requestDuration = new prom_client_1.default.Histogram({
    16:     name: `${NS}_request_duration_seconds`,
    17:     help: 'Duration of NPZ handled requests',
    18:     labelNames: ['gate', 'lane', 'npz_id', 'namespace'],
    19: });
    20: function npzMiddleware(opts = {}) {
    21:     const cookieName = opts.cookieName || `${NS}_lane`;
    22:     const lanes = opts.lanes || undefined;
    23:     const maxAge = opts.cookieMaxAge || 24 * 3600; // seconds
    24:     return async function (req, res, next) {
    25:         const start = process.hrtime();
    26:         try {
    27:             // assign npz_id
    28:             const npz_id = req.headers['x-npz-id'] || req.cookies?.['npz_id'] || (0, uuid_1.v4)();
    29:             res.cookie('npz_id', npz_id, { maxAge: maxAge * 1000, httpOnly: true });
    30:             await npz_store_1.default.createRequestRecord(npz_id, { path: req.path, method: req.method });
    31:             const fullUrl = req.protocol + '://' + req.get('host') + req.originalUrl;
    32:             const report = await (0, npz_router_1.npzRoute)({ method: req.method, url: fullUrl, headers: req.headers, body: req.body });
    33:             if (report && (report.status || report.body || report.error)) {
    34:                 // update record with lane if stored via router
    35:                 const rec = await npz_store_1.default.getRequestRecord(npz_id);
    36:                 const lane = rec?.laneId;
    37:                 if (lane !== undefined) {
    38:                     res.cookie(cookieName, String(lane), { maxAge: maxAge * 1000 });
    39:                 }
    40:                 // metrics
    41:                 const diff = process.hrtime(start);
    42:                 const duration = diff[0] + diff[1] / 1e9;
    43:                 const gate = report.gate || 'unknown';
    44:                 const laneId = report.laneId !== undefined ? String(report.laneId) : String(lane || 'unknown');
    45:                 requestDuration.labels(gate, laneId, npz_id, NS).observe(duration);
    46:                 logger_1.default.nez('NPZ', `npz_id=${npz_id} gate=${gate} lane=${laneId} duration=${duration.toFixed(3)}s`);
    47:                 if (report.status)
    48:                     res.status(report.status);
    49:                 // set headers (careful with set-cookie)
    50:                 if (report.headers) {
    51:                     try {
    52:                         for (const [k, v] of Object.entries(report.headers)) {
    53:                             if (k.toLowerCase() === 'set-cookie')
    54:                                 continue;
    55:                             res.setHeader(k, v);
    56:                         }
    57:                     }
    58:                     catch (e) { }
    59:                 }
    60:                 res.send(report.body || (report.error ? String(report.error) : ''));
    61:                 return;
    62:             }
    63:             next();
    64:         }
    65:         catch (err) {
    66:             logger_1.default.warn(`npz-middleware: error ${err}`);
    67:             next();
    68:         }
    69:     };
    70: }
    71: exports.default = npzMiddleware;

     1: "use strict";
     2: // ROME-TAG: 0x94B7C0

     9: exports.getHistory = getHistory;

    12: exports.colorizeAscii4 = colorizeAscii4;
    13: const crypto_1 = __importDefault(require("crypto"));
    14: const SESSIONS = new Map();
    15: function id() { return Math.random().toString(36).slice(2, 10); }
    16: function startSession(systemPrompt = '') {
    17:     const sid = 's_' + id();
    18:     const s = { id: sid, messages: [], createdAt: Date.now() };
    19:     if (systemPrompt)
    20:         s.messages.push({ id: 'm_' + id(), role: 'system', text: systemPrompt, t: Date.now() });
    21:     SESSIONS.set(sid, s);
    22:     return s;
    23: }
    24: function sendMessage(sessionId, role, text) {
    25:     const s = SESSIONS.get(sessionId);
    26:     if (!s)
    27:         throw new Error('session not found');
    28:     const m = { id: 'm_' + id(), role, text, t: Date.now() };
    29:     s.messages.push(m);
    30:     return m;
    31: }
    32: function getHistory(sessionId) {
    33:     const s = SESSIONS.get(sessionId);
    34:     if (!s)
    35:         return [];
    36:     return s.messages.slice();
    37: }
    38: function endSession(sessionId) {
    39:     return SESSIONS.delete(sessionId);
    40: }
    41: // --- New: ASCII 4-byte encoding + colorize helpers ---
    42: function md5First4BytesHex(ch) {
    43:     // return first 4 bytes (8 hex chars) of md5 of the char
    44:     const h = crypto_1.default.createHash('md5').update(ch).digest('hex');
    45:     return h.slice(0, 8);
    46: }
    47: function encodeAscii4(text) {
    48:     const out = [];
    49:     for (const ch of text) {
    50:         out.push({ ch, hex4: md5First4BytesHex(ch) });
    51:     }
    52:     return out;
    53: }
    54: function hexToRgb(hex) {
    55:     const h = hex.replace('#', '');
    56:     const r = parseInt(h.slice(0, 2), 16);
    57:     const g = parseInt(h.slice(2, 4), 16);
    58:     const b = parseInt(h.slice(4, 6), 16);
    59:     return { r, g, b };
    60: }
    61: function byteToColor(b) {
    62:     // map single byte [0..255] to a color by expanding into RGB via simple transform
    63:     const r = (b * 3) % 256;
    64:     const g = (b * 7) % 256;
    65:     const b2 = (b * 13) % 256;
    66:     return { r, g, b: b2 };
    67: }
    68: function colorizeAscii4(text) {
    69:     // returns ANSI colored string: for each char produce a colored block based on its 4-byte hex
    70:     const parts = [];
    71:     for (const ch of text) {
    72:         const hex4 = md5First4BytesHex(ch); // 8 hex chars
    73:         // split into 4 bytes
    74:         const bytes = [];
    75:         for (let i = 0; i < 8; i += 2)
    76:             bytes.push(parseInt(hex4.slice(i, i + 2), 16));
    77:         // pick a representative color from bytes
    78:         const col = byteToColor(bytes[0]);
    79:         const ansi = `\x1b[48;2;${col.r};${col.g};${col.b}m\x1b[38;2;0;0;0m ${ch} \x1b[0m`;
    80:         parts.push(ansi);
    81:     }
    82:     return parts.join('');
    83: }
    84: exports.default = { startSession, sendMessage, getHistory, endSession, encodeAscii4, colorizeAscii4 };
