    22: const npz_engine_1 = __importDefault(require("./npz-engine"));
    23: const NS = (0, npz_config_1.getNpzNamespace)();
    24: exports.DEFAULT_LANES = [
    25:     { id: 0, name: 'primary', url: 'https://api.primary.local' },
    26:     { id: 1, name: 'backup-fast', url: 'https://fast.api.local' },
    27:     { id: 2, name: 'backup-slow', url: 'https://slow.api.local' },
    28: ];
    29: const STORE_FILE = path_1.default.join(process.cwd(), '.qflash', `${NS}-npz-lanes.json`);
    30: const DEFAULT_TIMEOUT = 3000; // ms
    31: const PREFERRED_TTL = 24 * 3600 * 1000; // 24h
    32: // Circuit breaker settings
    33: const FAIL_THRESHOLD = 3; // failures
    34: const FAIL_WINDOW_MS = 60 * 1000; // 1m
    35: const COOLDOWN_MS = 5 * 60 * 1000; // 5m
    36: const circuit = new Map(); // host -> laneId -> state
    37: // Prometheus metrics
    38: const laneSuccess = new prom_client_1.default.Counter({ name: `${NS}_lane_success_total`, help: 'NPZ lane successes', labelNames: ['host', 'lane', 'namespace'] });
    39: const laneFailure = new prom_client_1.default.Counter({ name: `${NS}_lane_failure_total`, help: 'NPZ lane failures', labelNames: ['host', 'lane', 'namespace'] });
    40: function ensureStoreDir() {
    41:     const dir = path_1.default.dirname(STORE_FILE);
    42:     if (!fs_1.default.existsSync(dir))
    43:         fs_1.default.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
    44: }
    45: function readStore() {
    46:     try {
    47:         if (!fs_1.default.existsSync(STORE_FILE))
    48:             return {};
    49:         const raw = fs_1.default.readFileSync(STORE_FILE, 'utf8');
    50:         return JSON.parse(raw);
    51:     }
    52:     catch (err) {
    53:         logger_1.default.warn(`npz-router: failed to read store ${err}`);
    54:         return {};
    55:     }
    56: }
    57: function writeStore(s) {
    58:     try {
    59:         ensureStoreDir();
    60:         fs_1.default.writeFileSync(STORE_FILE, JSON.stringify(s, null, 2), 'utf8');
    61:     }
    62:     catch (err) {
    63:         logger_1.default.warn(`npz-router: failed to write store ${err}`);
    64:     }
    65: }
    66: function getPreferredLane(host) {
    67:     const s = readStore();
    68:     const entry = s[host];
    69:     if (!entry)
    70:         return null;
    71:     if (Date.now() - entry.ts > PREFERRED_TTL)
    72:         return null;
    73:     return entry.laneId;
    74: }
    75: function setPreferredLane(host, laneId) {
    76:     const s = readStore();
    77:     s[host] = { laneId, ts: Date.now() };
    78:     writeStore(s);
    79: }
    80: function lanesForHost(host, lanes = exports.DEFAULT_LANES) {
    81:     const pref = getPreferredLane(host);
    82:     // first let engine reorder by score
    83:     const ordered = npz_engine_1.default.orderLanesByScore(lanes);
    84:     // then apply preferred lane override
    85:     if (pref === null)
    86:         return ordered.slice();
    87:     const idx = ordered.findIndex((l) => l.id === pref);
    88:     if (idx <= 0)
    89:         return ordered.slice();
    90:     const res = [ordered[idx], ...ordered.slice(0, idx), ...ordered.slice(idx + 1)];
    91:     return res;
    92: }
    93: // Circuit breaker helpers
    94: function getCircuitMapForHost(host) {
    95:     let m = circuit.get(host);
    96:     if (!m) {
    97:         m = new Map();
    98:         circuit.set(host, m);
    99:     }
   100:     return m;
   101: }
   102: function recordFailure(host, laneId, latencyMs) {
   103:     const m = getCircuitMapForHost(host);
   104:     const now = Date.now();
   105:     const st = m.get(laneId) || { failures: 0 };
   106:     if (!st.firstFailureTs || now - (st.firstFailureTs || 0) > FAIL_WINDOW_MS) {
   107:         st.failures = 1;
   108:         st.firstFailureTs = now;
   109:     }
   110:     else {
   111:         st.failures = (st.failures || 0) + 1;
   112:     }
   113:     if (st.failures >= FAIL_THRESHOLD) {
   114:         st.trippedUntil = now + COOLDOWN_MS;
   115:         logger_1.default.warn(`npz-router: lane ${laneId} for ${host} tripped until ${new Date(st.trippedUntil)}`);
   116:     }
   117:     m.set(laneId, st);
   118:     try {
   119:         laneFailure.inc({ host, lane: String(laneId), namespace: NS });
   120:     }
   121:     catch { }
   122:     try {
   123:         npz_engine_1.default.scoreLane(laneId, 1, latencyMs);
   124:     }
   125:     catch { }
   126: }
   127: function recordSuccess(host, laneId, latencyMs) {
   128:     const m = getCircuitMapForHost(host);
   129:     m.delete(laneId);
   130:     try {
   131:         laneSuccess.inc({ host, lane: String(laneId), namespace: NS });
   132:     }
   133:     catch { }
   134:     try {
   135:         npz_engine_1.default.scoreLane(laneId, -1, latencyMs);
   136:     }
   137:     catch { }
   138: }
   139: function isLaneTripped(host, laneId) {
   140:     const m = circuit.get(host);
   141:     if (!m)
   142:         return false;
   143:     const st = m.get(laneId);
   144:     if (!st)
   145:         return false;
   146:     if (st.trippedUntil && Date.now() < st.trippedUntil)
   147:         return true;
   148:     // cooldown passed
   149:     if (st.trippedUntil && Date.now() >= st.trippedUntil) {
   150:         m.delete(laneId);
   151:         return false;
   152:     }
   153:     return false;
   154: }
   155: // lightweight fetch wrapper that returns {status, headers, body, durationMs}
   156: async function tryFetch(fullUrl, options = {}, timeout = DEFAULT_TIMEOUT) {
   157:     const controller = typeof AbortController !== 'undefined' ? new AbortController() : null;
   158:     const signalOpt = controller ? { signal: controller.signal } : {};
   159:     const opts = { method: options.method || 'GET', headers: options.headers || {}, body: options.body, ...signalOpt };
   160:     let timer = null;
   161:     const start = perf_hooks_1.performance.now();
   162:     if (controller)
   163:         timer = setTimeout(() => controller.abort(), timeout);
   164:     try {
   165:         // prefer global fetch
   166:         let ff = globalThis.fetch;
   167:         if (!ff) {
   168:             try {
   169:                 ff = require('undici').fetch;
   170:             }
   171:             catch (e) {
   172:                 throw new Error('No fetch available (install undici or use Node 18+)');
   173:             }
   174:         }
   175:         const res = await ff(fullUrl, opts);
   176:         const text = await res.text();
   177:         if (timer)
   178:             clearTimeout(timer);
   179:         const duration = Math.max(0, Math.round(perf_hooks_1.performance.now() - start));
   180:         return { ok: true, status: res.status, headers: res.headers, body: text, durationMs: duration };
   181:     }
   182:     catch (err) {
   183:         if (timer)
   184:             clearTimeout(timer);
   185:         const duration = Math.max(0, Math.round(perf_hooks_1.performance.now() - start));
   186:         return { ok: false, error: err, durationMs: duration };
   187:     }
   188: }
   189: async function npzRoute(req, lanes = exports.DEFAULT_LANES) {
   190:     try {
   191:         const urlObj = new URL(req.url);
   192:         const host = urlObj.host;
   193:         const ordered = lanesForHost(host);
   194:         // attempt primary
   195:         const primary = ordered[0];
   196:         const primaryUrl = req.url.replace(urlObj.origin, primary.url);
   197:         const timeout = req.timeout || DEFAULT_TIMEOUT;
   198:         logger_1.default.nez('NPZ', `attempting primary lane ${primary.name} -> ${primaryUrl}`);
   199:         const t0 = await tryFetch(primaryUrl, { method: req.method, headers: req.headers, body: req.body }, timeout);
   200:         if (t0.ok && t0.status && t0.status < 500) {
   201:             logger_1.default.nez('NPZ', `primary succeeded (${primary.name})`);
   202:             setPreferredLane(host, primary.id);
   203:             recordSuccess(host, primary.id, t0.durationMs);
   204:             return { status: t0.status, headers: t0.headers, body: t0.body, gate: 'primary', laneId: primary.id, durationMs: t0.durationMs };
   205:         }
   206:         // primary failed -> try fallback(s)
   207:         logger_1.default.warn(`[NPZ] primary failed for ${primary.name}, running fallbacks`);
   208:         recordFailure(host, primary.id, t0.durationMs);
   209:         for (let i = 1; i < ordered.length; i++) {
   210:             const lane = ordered[i];
   211:             const laneUrl = req.url.replace(urlObj.origin, lane.url);
   212:             logger_1.default.nez('NPZ', `trying fallback lane ${lane.name} -> ${laneUrl}`);
   213:             const res = await tryFetch(laneUrl, { method: req.method, headers: req.headers, body: req.body }, timeout);
   214:             if (res.ok && res.status && res.status < 500) {
   215:                 logger_1.default.nez('NPZ', `fallback lane ${lane.name} succeeded`);
   216:                 // set preferred to fallback for next time
   217:                 setPreferredLane(host, lane.id);
   218:                 recordSuccess(host, lane.id, res.durationMs);
   219:                 // replay primary with an extra header (T2)
   220:                 const replayHeaders = Object.assign({}, req.headers || {});
   221:                 replayHeaders['X-NPZ-FALLBACK'] = '1';
   222:                 const replayUrl = primaryUrl;
   223:                 logger_1.default.nez('NPZ', `replaying primary (${primary.name}) with fallback header`);
   224:                 const replay = await tryFetch(replayUrl, { method: req.method, headers: replayHeaders, body: req.body }, timeout);
   225:                 if (replay.ok && replay.status && replay.status < 500) {
   226:                     logger_1.default.nez('NPZ', `replayed primary succeeded after fallback`);
   227:                     return { status: replay.status, headers: replay.headers, body: replay.body, gate: 'replay', laneId: primary.id, durationMs: replay.durationMs };
   228:                 }
   229:                 // if replay failed, return fallback result
   230:                 return { status: res.status, headers: res.headers, body: res.body, gate: 'fallback', laneId: lane.id, durationMs: res.durationMs };
   231:             }
   232:             else {
   233:                 recordFailure(host, lane.id, res.durationMs);
   234:             }
   235:         }
   236:         // if all failed, return primary error or generic
   237:         logger_1.default.warn('[NPZ] all lanes failed');
   238:         if (t0 && !t0.ok)
   239:             return { error: t0.error, gate: 'fail', durationMs: t0.durationMs };
   240:         return { status: t0.status, body: t0.body, gate: 'fail', durationMs: t0.durationMs };
   241:     }
   242:     catch (err) {
   243:         return { error: err, gate: 'error' };
   244:     }
   245: }
   246: function getCircuitState(host) {
   247:     const m = circuit.get(host);
   248:     if (!m)
   249:         return {};
   250:     const out = {};
   251:     for (const [k, v] of m.entries())
   252:         out[k] = v;
   253:     return out;
   254: }
   255: exports.default = { DEFAULT_LANES: exports.DEFAULT_LANES, npzRoute, getPreferredLane, setPreferredLane, lanesForHost, recordFailure, recordSuccess, isLaneTripped, getCircuitState };


============================
FILE: dist\src\utils\npz-store-redis.js
============================
============================
     1: "use strict";
     2: // ROME-TAG: 0xC27F4F
     3: Object.defineProperty(exports, "__esModule", { value: true });
     4: exports.createRecord = createRecord;
     5: exports.updateRecord = updateRecord;
     6: exports.getRecord = getRecord;
     7: exports.deleteRecord = deleteRecord;
     8: exports.listRecords = listRecords;
     9: exports.clearAll = clearAll;
    10: exports.__internal_size = __internal_size;
    11: // Redis implementation removed - use in-memory fallback to avoid external dependency.
    12: const uuid_1 = require("uuid");
    13: const npz_config_1 = require("./npz-config");
    14: // NOTE: this module intentionally does NOT depend on ioredis anymore.
    15: // It exposes the same async API but stores data in memory with TTL semantics.
    16: const NS = (0, npz_config_1.getNpzNamespace)();
    17: const store = new Map();
    18: function nowMs() { return Date.now(); }
    19: async function createRecord(meta) {
    20:     const id = (0, uuid_1.v4)();
    21:     const rec = { id, ts: nowMs(), meta };
    22:     // default TTL 24h
    23:     const expiresAt = nowMs() + 24 * 3600 * 1000;
    24:     store.set(id, Object.assign({}, rec, { expiresAt }));
    25:     return rec;
    26: }
    27: async function updateRecord(id, patch) {
    28:     const entry = store.get(id);
    29:     if (!entry)
    30:         return null;
    31:     const updated = Object.assign({}, entry, patch);
    32:     store.set(id, updated);
    33:     // return shallow copy
    34:     const copy = Object.assign({}, updated);
    35:     delete copy.expiresAt;
    36:     return copy;
    37: }
    38: async function getRecord(id) {
    39:     const entry = store.get(id);
    40:     if (!entry)
    41:         return null;
    42:     if (entry.expiresAt && entry.expiresAt < nowMs()) {
    43:         store.delete(id);
    44:         return null;
    45:     }
    46:     const copy = Object.assign({}, entry);
    47:     delete copy.expiresAt;
    48:     return copy;
    49: }
    50: async function deleteRecord(id) {
    51:     return store.delete(id);
    52: }
    53: async function listRecords() {
    54:     const now = nowMs();
    55:     const res = [];
    56:     for (const [k, v] of store.entries()) {
    57:         if (v.expiresAt && v.expiresAt < now) {
    58:             store.delete(k);
    59:             continue;
    60:         }
    61:         const copy = Object.assign({}, v);
    62:         delete copy.expiresAt;
    63:         res.push(copy);
    64:     }
    65:     return res;
    66: }
    67: async function clearAll() {
    68:     const n = store.size;
    69:     store.clear();
    70:     return n;
    71: }
    72: // helper: not part of original API but useful for tests
    73: function __internal_size() { return store.size; }

    18: let fileStore = {};

    20:     if (!fs_1.default.existsSync(STORE_DIR))
    21:         fs_1.default.mkdirSync(STORE_DIR, { recursive: true });
    22: }
    23: function loadFileStore() {

    26:             const raw = fs_1.default.readFileSync(REQUEST_STORE, 'utf8');
    27:             fileStore = JSON.parse(raw);
    28:         }
    29:     }
    30:     catch (e) {
    31:         fileStore = {};
    32:     }
    33: }
    34: function persistFileStore() {
    35:     try {
    36:         ensureDir();
    37:         fs_1.default.writeFileSync(REQUEST_STORE, JSON.stringify(fileStore, null, 2), 'utf8');
    38:     }

    44: async function createRequestRecord(idOrMeta, maybeMeta) {

    46:         const meta = typeof idOrMeta === 'string' ? maybeMeta : idOrMeta;
    47:         const rec = await (0, npz_store_redis_1.createRecord)(meta);
    48:         return rec;
    49:     }

    54:         id = idOrMeta;
    55:         meta = maybeMeta;
    56:     }
    57:     else {
    58:         id = (idOrMeta && idOrMeta.id) || (Math.random() + '_' + Date.now()).toString();
    59:         meta = idOrMeta || undefined;
    60:     }
    61:     const rec = { id, ts: Date.now(), meta };
    62:     fileStore[id] = rec;
    63:     persistFileStore();
    64:     return rec;
    65: }
    66: async function updateRequestRecord(id, patch) {
    67:     if (USE_REDIS) {
    68:         return await (0, npz_store_redis_1.updateRecord)(id, patch);
    69:     }
    70:     if (!fileStore[id])
    71:         return null;
    72:     fileStore[id] = { ...fileStore[id], ...patch };
    73:     persistFileStore();
    74:     return fileStore[id];
    75: }
    76: async function getRequestRecord(id) {
    77:     if (USE_REDIS) {
    78:         return await (0, npz_store_redis_1.getRecord)(id);
    79:     }
    80:     return fileStore[id] || null;
    81: }

    43: const fs_1 = require("fs");
    44: const path = __importStar(require("path"));
    45: const logger_1 = __importDefault(require("./logger"));
    46: function isWindows() {
    47:     return process.platform === 'win32';
    48: }
    49: function findLocalBin(moduleName, cwd) {
    50:     // try node_modules/.bin/<name> or <pkg>/bin
    51:     const localBin = path.join(cwd, 'node_modules', '.bin', moduleName + (isWindows() ? '.cmd' : ''));
    52:     if ((0, fs_1.existsSync)(localBin))
    53:         return localBin;
    54:     // try package bin entry via require.resolve
    55:     try {
    56:         const pkgPath = require.resolve(moduleName, { paths: [cwd] });
    57:         return pkgPath;
    58:     }
    59:     catch {
    60:         return null;
    61:     }
    62: }
    63: function resolveViaModuleGate(pkgName) {
    64:     try {
    65:         const pkgPath = require.resolve(pkgName);
    66:         // run via node <pkgPath>
    67:         return { cmd: process.execPath, args: [pkgPath], cwd: path.dirname(pkgPath) };
    68:     }
    69:     catch {
    70:         return null;
    71:     }
    72: }
    73: function npzResolve(nameOrPkg, opts = {}) {
    74:     const cwd = opts.cwd || process.cwd();
    75:     // Gate 1: GREEN - local bin
    76:     const local = findLocalBin(nameOrPkg, cwd);
    77:     if (local) {
    78:         logger_1.default.nez('NPZ:JOKER', `${nameOrPkg} -> ${local}`);
    79:         return { gate: 'green', cmd: local, args: [], cwd };
    80:     }
    81:     // Gate 2: YELLOW - module resolution
    82:     const mod = resolveViaModuleGate(nameOrPkg);
    83:     if (mod) {
    84:         logger_1.default.nez('NPZ:JOKER', `${nameOrPkg} -> ${mod.cmd} ${mod.args.join(' ')}`);
    85:         return { gate: 'yellow', cmd: mod.cmd, args: mod.args, cwd: mod.cwd };
    86:     }
    87:     // Gate 3: DLX - use npm exec as modern fallback, fallback to npx if needed
    88:     try {
    89:         // prefer `npm exec -- <pkg>` which is the modern replacement for npx (npm v7+)
    90:         // This will allow running installed or remote packages consistently.
    91:         logger_1.default.joker('NPZ:JOKER', `${nameOrPkg} -> npm exec`);
    92:         return { gate: 'dlx', cmd: 'npm', args: ['exec', '--', nameOrPkg], cwd };
    93:     }
    94:     catch (err) {
    95:         // last-resort: npx
    96:         try {
    97:             logger_1.default.joker('NPZ:JOKER', `${nameOrPkg} -> npx`);
    98:             return { gate: 'dlx', cmd: 'npx', args: [nameOrPkg], cwd };
    99:         }
   100:         catch (e) {
   101:             logger_1.default.warn(`[NPZ:JOKER][FAIL] ${nameOrPkg} cannot be resolved`);
   102:             return { gate: 'fail' };
   103:         }
   104:     }
   105: }
   106: function runResolved(res) {
   107:     if (!res.cmd)
   108:         return { ok: false };
   109:     const args = res.args || [];
   110:     logger_1.default.nez('NPZ:JOKER', `running ${res.cmd} ${args.join(' ')}`);
   111:     try {
   112:         const r = (0, child_process_1.spawnSync)(res.cmd, args, { stdio: 'inherit', cwd: res.cwd || process.cwd(), shell: false });
   113:         return { ok: r.status === 0, status: r.status ?? undefined };
   114:     }
   115:     catch (err) {
   116:         logger_1.default.error(`[NPZ:JOKER] failed to run ${err}`);
   117:         return { ok: false };
   118:     }
   119: }
   120: exports.default = { npzResolve, runResolved };

     9: function resolvePackagePath(pkgName) {
    10:     try {
    11:         const resolved = require.resolve(pkgName);
    12:         // walk up to package root
    13:         let dir = resolved;
    14:         while (dir && !(0, fs_1.existsSync)((0, path_1.join)(dir, "package.json"))) {
    15:             const p = require("path").dirname(dir);
    16:             if (p === dir)
    17:                 break;
    18:             dir = p;
    19:         }
    20:         if ((0, fs_1.existsSync)((0, path_1.join)(dir, "package.json")))
    21:             return dir;
    22:     }
    23:     catch { }

    25:     const guess = (0, path_1.join)(process.cwd(), "node_modules", pkgName);
    26:     if ((0, fs_1.existsSync)((0, path_1.join)(guess, "package.json")))
    27:         return guess;
    28:     return undefined;
    29: }

    10:     rome: { pkg: "@funeste38/rome", candidates: ["./rome", "./Rome"] },

    20:     const out = {};

    22:         if (detected && detected[key] && detected[key].path) {
    23:             out[key] = detected[key].path;
    24:             continue;
    25:         }
    26:         const tries = exports.SERVICE_MAP[key].candidates;
    27:         for (const t of tries) {
    28:             const p = (0, path_1.join)(process.cwd(), t);
    29:             if ((0, fs_1.existsSync)(p)) {
    30:                 out[key] = p;
    31:                 break;
    32:             }
    33:         }
    34:     }
    35:     return out;
    36: }

     1: "use strict";
     2: var __importDefault = (this && this.__importDefault) || function (mod) {
     3:     return (mod && mod.__esModule) ? mod : { "default": mod };
     4: };
     5: Object.defineProperty(exports, "__esModule", { value: true });
     6: exports.getSecret = getSecret;
     7: const fs_1 = __importDefault(require("fs"));
     8: function getSecret(name, opts) {
     9:     // 1) CLI arg form --name=value or --alias=value
    10:     const alias = opts?.cliAlias || name.toLowerCase();
    11:     const cliExact = process.argv.find((a) => a === `--${alias}`);
    12:     if (cliExact) {
    13:         // next arg is the value
    14:         const idx = process.argv.indexOf(cliExact);
    15:         if (idx >= 0 && idx < process.argv.length - 1)
    16:             return process.argv[idx + 1];
    17:     }
    18:     const cli = process.argv.find((a) => a.startsWith(`--${alias}=`));
    19:     if (cli)
    20:         return cli.split('=')[1];
    21:     // 2) environment variables (exact name or upper-case)
    22:     if (process.env[name])
    23:         return process.env[name];
    24:     const up = name.toUpperCase();
    25:     if (process.env[up])
    26:         return process.env[up];
    27:     const low = name.toLowerCase();
    28:     if (process.env[low])
    29:         return process.env[low];
    30:     // 3) file referenced by env var
    31:     if (opts && opts.fileEnv) {
    32:         const p = process.env[opts.fileEnv];
    33:         if (p && typeof p === 'string' && fs_1.default.existsSync(p)) {
    34:             try {
    35:                 return fs_1.default.readFileSync(p, 'utf8').trim();
    36:             }
    37:             catch (e) {
    38:                 // ignore read errors
    39:             }
    40:         }
    41:     }
    42:     if (opts && opts.required)
    43:         throw new Error(`${name} required but not provided`);
    44:     return undefined;
    45: }

    38: const vscode = __importStar(require("vscode"));
    39: const path = __importStar(require("path"));
    40: const fs = __importStar(require("fs"));
    41: const http = __importStar(require("http"));
    42: const https = __importStar(require("https"));
    43: // import Rome tag utilities
    44: const rome_tag_1 = require("@rome/rome-tag");
    45: const TRIAL_DAYS = 14;
    46: function isTrialExpired(context) {
    47:     const started = context.globalState.get('qflush.trialStarted');
    48:     if (!started)
    49:         return false; // start on first use
    50:     const now = Date.now();
    51:     return now - started > TRIAL_DAYS * 24 * 3600 * 1000;
    52: }
    53: function ensureTrialStarted(context) {
    54:     const started = context.globalState.get('qflush.trialStarted');
    55:     if (!started)
    56:         context.globalState.update('qflush.trialStarted', Date.now());
    57: }
    58: function postJson(urlStr, body) {
    59:     return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
    60:         try {
    61:             const url = new URL(urlStr);
    62:             const data = JSON.stringify(body || {});
    63:             const opts = {
    64:                 hostname: url.hostname,
    65:                 port: url.port || (url.protocol === 'https:' ? 443 : 80),
    66:                 path: url.pathname + (url.search || ''),
    67:                 method: 'POST',
    68:                 headers: {
    69:                     'Content-Type': 'application/json',
    70:                     'Content-Length': Buffer.byteLength(data),
    71:                 },
    72:             };
    73:             const lib = url.protocol === 'https:' ? https : http;
    74:             const req = lib.request(opts, (res) => {
    75:                 let raw = '';
    76:                 res.setEncoding('utf8');
    77:                 res.on('data', (chunk) => (raw += chunk));
    78:                 res.on('end', () => {
    79:                     try {
    80:                         const parsed = raw ? JSON.parse(raw) : {};
    81:                         if (res.statusCode && res.statusCode >= 200 && res.statusCode < 300)
    82:                             resolve(parsed);
    83:                         else
    84:                             reject(new Error(parsed && parsed.error ? parsed.error : `HTTP ${res.statusCode}`));
    85:                     }
    86:                     catch (e) {
    87:                         reject(e);
    88:                     }
    89:                 });
    90:             });
    91:             req.on('error', (err) => reject(err));
    92:             req.write(data);
    93:             req.end();
    94:         }
    95:         catch (e) {
    96:             reject(e);
    97:         }
    98:     });
    99: }
   100: function getJson(urlStr) {
   101:     return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
   102:         try {
   103:             const url = new URL(urlStr);
   104:             const lib = url.protocol === 'https:' ? https : http;
   105:             const req = lib.get(urlStr, (res) => {
   106:                 let raw = '';
   107:                 res.setEncoding('utf8');
   108:                 res.on('data', (chunk) => (raw += chunk));
   109:                 res.on('end', () => {
   110:                     try {
   111:                         const parsed = raw ? JSON.parse(raw) : {};
   112:                         if (res.statusCode && res.statusCode >= 200 && res.statusCode < 300)
   113:                             resolve(parsed);
   114:                         else
   115:                             reject(new Error(parsed && parsed.error ? parsed.error : `HTTP ${res.statusCode}`));
   116:                     }
   117:                     catch (e) {
   118:                         reject(e);
   119:                     }
   120:                 });
   121:             });
   122:             req.on('error', (err) => reject(err));
   123:         }
   124:         catch (e) {
   125:             reject(e);
   126:         }
   127:     });
   128: }
   129: async function saveRomeIndexRecord(record) {
   130:     try {
   131:         const root = process.cwd();
   132:         const dir = path.join(root, '.qflush');
   133:         if (!fs.existsSync(dir))
   134:             fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
   135:         const idxFile = path.join(dir, 'rome-index.json');
   136:         let idx = {};
   137:         if (fs.existsSync(idxFile)) {
   138:             try {
   139:                 idx = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(idxFile, 'utf8') || '{}');
   140:             }
   141:             catch {
   142:                 idx = {};
   143:             }
   144:         }
   145:         // normalize path and build canonical record using shared module
   146:         const relPath = (0, rome_tag_1.normalizeRomePath)(record.path);
   147:         const rec = (0, rome_tag_1.makeRomeTagRecord)({ type: record.type, path: relPath });
   148:         idx[rec.path] = rec;
   149:         fs.writeFileSync(idxFile, JSON.stringify(idx, null, 2), 'utf8');
   150:         return { success: true, record: idx[rec.path] };
   151:     }
   152:     catch (e) {
   153:         return { success: false, error: String(e) };
   154:     }
   155: }
   156: function activate(context) {
   157:     ensureTrialStarted(context);
   158:     const openDisposable = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.openPanel', () => {
   159:         if (isTrialExpired(context)) {
   160:             vscode.window.showInformationMessage('QFlush trial expired. Click to purchase a license.', 'Purchase', 'Enter Key').then((v) => {
   161:                 if (v === 'Purchase')
   162:                     vscode.env.openExternal(vscode.Uri.parse('https://gumroad.com/l/your-product'));
   163:                 if (v === 'Enter Key')
   164:                     vscode.commands.executeCommand('qflush.enterLicense');
   165:             });
   166:             return;
   167:         }
   168:         const panel = vscode.window.createWebviewPanel('qflushPanel', 'QFlush', vscode.ViewColumn.One, {
   169:             enableScripts: true,
   170:             localResourceRoots: [vscode.Uri.file(path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src'))],
   171:         });
   172:         const htmlPath = path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src', 'panel.html');
   173:         let html = '';
   174:         try {
   175:             html = fs.readFileSync(htmlPath, 'utf8');
   176:         }
   177:         catch (e) {
   178:             html = `<html><body><pre>panel.html not found at ${htmlPath}</pre></body></html>`;
   179:         }
   180:         panel.webview.html = html;
   181:         const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
   182:         const daemonUrl = cfg.get('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
   183:         const token = cfg.get('adminToken') || '';
   184:         // Send config to webview securely via postMessage
   185:         panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'config', daemonUrl, token });
   186:         // Handle messages from the webview
   187:         panel.webview.onDidReceiveMessage(async (message) => {
   188:             if (message && message.type === 'saveConfig') {
   189:                 const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
   190:                 await cfg.update('daemonUrl', message.daemonUrl, vscode.ConfigurationTarget.Global);
   191:                 await cfg.update('adminToken', message.token, vscode.ConfigurationTarget.Global);
   192:                 panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'saved', info: 'Configuration saved' });
   193:             }
   194:         }, undefined, context.subscriptions);
   195:     });
   196:     const openPourparler = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.openPourparler', () => {
   197:         const panel = vscode.window.createWebviewPanel('qflushPourparler', 'Pourparler', vscode.ViewColumn.One, { enableScripts: true, localResourceRoots: [vscode.Uri.file(path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src'))] });
   198:         const htmlPath = path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src', 'pourparler-web.html');
   199:         let html = '';
   200:         try {
   201:             html = fs.readFileSync(htmlPath, 'utf8');
   202:         }
   203:         catch (e) {
   204:             html = `<html><body><pre>pourparler-web.html not found at ${htmlPath}</pre></body></html>`;
   205:         }
   206:         panel.webview.html = html;
   207:         panel.webview.onDidReceiveMessage(async (msg) => {
   208:             try {
   209:                 if (msg && msg.type === 'export') {
   210:                     const destUri = await vscode.window.showSaveDialog({ defaultUri: vscode.Uri.file(path.join(process.cwd(), msg.filename)), filters: { 'Images': ['png', 'svg'] } });
   211:                     if (!destUri)
   212:                         return;
   213:                     if (msg.format === 'svg') {
   214:                         fs.writeFileSync(destUri.fsPath, msg.data, 'utf8');
   215:                     }
   216:                     else if (msg.format === 'png') {
   217:                         // data url -> binary
   218:                         const base64 = msg.data.split(',')[1];
   219:                         const buf = Buffer.from(base64, 'base64');
   220:                         fs.writeFileSync(destUri.fsPath, buf);
   221:                     }
   222:                     vscode.window.showInformationMessage(`Exported ${msg.filename}`);
   223:                 }
   224:                 // new messages from pourparler webview
   225:                 if (msg && msg.type === 'npzList') {
   226:                     const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
   227:                     const daemonUrl = cfg.get('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
   228:                     try {
   229:                         const data = await getJson(`${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/npz/checksum/list`);
   230:                         panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'npzListResult', data });
   231:                     }
   232:                     catch (e) {
   233:                         panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'npzListResult', data: { success: false, error: String(e) } });
   234:                     }
   235:                 }
   236:                 if (msg && msg.type === 'npzClear') {
   237:                     const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
   238:                     const daemonUrl = cfg.get('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
   239:                     try {
   240:                         const resp = await fetch(`${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/npz/checksum/clear`, { method: 'DELETE' });
   241:                         const j = await resp.json();
   242:                         panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'npzClearResult', data: j });
   243:                     }
   244:                     catch (e) {
   245:                         panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'npzClearResult', data: { success: false, error: String(e) } });
   246:                     }
   247:                 }
   248:                 if (msg && msg.type === 'npzIndexTag') {
   249:                     const rec = msg.payload;
   250:                     const r = await saveRomeIndexRecord({ path: rec.path, type: rec.type, tag: rec.tag });
   251:                     panel.webview.postMessage(Object.assign({ type: 'npzIndexTagResult' }, r));
   252:                 }
   253:             }
   254:             catch (e) {
   255:                 vscode.window.showErrorMessage('Extension message handler failed: ' + String(e));
   256:             }
   257:         }, undefined, context.subscriptions);
   258:     });
   259:     const enterLicense = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.enterLicense', async () => {
   260:         const key = await vscode.window.showInputBox({ prompt: 'Enter your QFlush license key' });
   261:         if (!key)
   262:             return;
   263:         const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
   264:         const daemonUrl = cfg.get('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
   265:         const activateUrl = `${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/license/activate`;
   266:         const progressOptions = { location: vscode.ProgressLocation.Notification, title: 'Activating QFlush license...', cancellable: false };
   267:         try {
   268:             await vscode.window.withProgress(progressOptions, async () => {
   269:                 const res = await postJson(activateUrl, { key });
   270:                 // store license info locally in extension globalState
   271:                 await context.globalState.update('qflush.licenseKey', key);
   272:                 await context.globalState.update('qflush.licenseInfo', res.license || res);
   273:                 vscode.window.showInformationMessage('License activated successfully. Thanks!');
   274:             });
   275:         }
   276:         catch (err) {
   277:             vscode.window.showErrorMessage(`License activation failed: ${err && err.message ? err.message : String(err)}`);
   278:         }
   279:     });
   280:     const showStatus = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.showLicenseStatus', async () => {
   281:         const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
   282:         const daemonUrl = cfg.get('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
   283:         const statusUrl = `${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/license/status`;
   284:         try {
   285:             const res = await getJson(statusUrl);
   286:             if (!res || !res.success) {
   287:                 vscode.window.showInformationMessage('No license information available');
   288:                 return;
   289:             }
   290:             const lic = res.license;
   291:             if (!lic) {
   292:                 vscode.window.showInformationMessage('No local license installed');
   293:                 return;
   294:             }
   295:             const exp = lic.expiresAt ? new Date(lic.expiresAt).toLocaleString() : 'never (subscription)';
   296:             vscode.window.showInformationMessage(`License: ${lic.key} product=${lic.product_id} expires=${exp} valid=${res.valid}`);
   297:         }
   298:         catch (err) {
   299:             vscode.window.showErrorMessage(`Failed to fetch status: ${err && err.message ? err.message : String(err)}`);
   300:         }
   301:     });
   302:     const openTelemetry = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.openTelemetry', () => {
   303:         const panel = vscode.window.createWebviewPanel('qflushTelemetry', 'QFlush Telemetry', vscode.ViewColumn.Two, { enableScripts: true, localResourceRoots: [vscode.Uri.file(path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src'))] });
   304:         const htmlPath = path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src', 'telemetry-view.html');
   305:         let html = '';
   306:         try {
   307:             html = fs.readFileSync(htmlPath, 'utf8');
   308:         }
   309:         catch (e) {
   310:             html = `<html><body><pre>telemetry-view.html not found at ${htmlPath}</pre></body></html>`;
   311:         }
   312:         panel.webview.html = html;
   313:     });
   314:     context.subscriptions.push(openDisposable, openPourparler, enterLicense, showStatus, openTelemetry);
   315: }
   316: function deactivate() { }


============================
FILE: extensions\vscode-npz\src\extension.ts
============================
============================
     1: import * as vscode from 'vscode';
     2: import * as path from 'path';
     3: import * as fs from 'fs';
     4: import * as http from 'http';
     5: import * as https from 'https';
     6: 
     7: // import Rome tag utilities
     8: import { makeRomeTagRecord, RomeIndex, normalizeRomePath } from '@rome/rome-tag';
     9: 
    10: const TRIAL_DAYS = 14;
    11: 
    12: function isTrialExpired(context: vscode.ExtensionContext): boolean {
    13:   const started = context.globalState.get<number>('qflush.trialStarted');
    14:   if (!started) return false; // start on first use
    15:   const now = Date.now();
    16:   return now - started > TRIAL_DAYS * 24 * 3600 * 1000;
    17: }
    18: 
    19: function ensureTrialStarted(context: vscode.ExtensionContext) {
    20:   const started = context.globalState.get<number>('qflush.trialStarted');
    21:   if (!started) context.globalState.update('qflush.trialStarted', Date.now());
    22: }
    23: 
    24: function postJson(urlStr: string, body: any): Promise<any> {
    25:   return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
    26:     try {
    27:       const url = new URL(urlStr);
    28:       const data = JSON.stringify(body || {});
    29:       const opts: any = {
    30:         hostname: url.hostname,
    31:         port: url.port || (url.protocol === 'https:' ? 443 : 80),
    32:         path: url.pathname + (url.search || ''),
    33:         method: 'POST',
    34:         headers: {
    35:           'Content-Type': 'application/json',
    36:           'Content-Length': Buffer.byteLength(data),
    37:         },
    38:       };
    39:       const lib = url.protocol === 'https:' ? https : http;
    40:       const req = lib.request(opts, (res) => {
    41:         let raw = '';
    42:         res.setEncoding('utf8');
    43:         res.on('data', (chunk) => (raw += chunk));
    44:         res.on('end', () => {
    45:           try {
    46:             const parsed = raw ? JSON.parse(raw) : {};
    47:             if (res.statusCode && res.statusCode >= 200 && res.statusCode < 300) resolve(parsed);
    48:             else reject(new Error(parsed && parsed.error ? parsed.error : `HTTP ${res.statusCode}`));
    49:           } catch (e) {
    50:             reject(e);
    51:           }
    52:         });
    53:       });
    54:       req.on('error', (err) => reject(err));
    55:       req.write(data);
    56:       req.end();
    57:     } catch (e) {
    58:       reject(e);
    59:     }
    60:   });
    61: }
    62: 
    63: function getJson(urlStr: string): Promise<any> {
    64:   return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
    65:     try {
    66:       const url = new URL(urlStr);
    67:       const lib = url.protocol === 'https:' ? https : http;
    68:       const req = lib.get(urlStr, (res) => {
    69:         let raw = '';
    70:         res.setEncoding('utf8');
    71:         res.on('data', (chunk) => (raw += chunk));
    72:         res.on('end', () => {
    73:           try {
    74:             const parsed = raw ? JSON.parse(raw) : {};
    75:             if (res.statusCode && res.statusCode >= 200 && res.statusCode < 300) resolve(parsed);
    76:             else reject(new Error(parsed && parsed.error ? parsed.error : `HTTP ${res.statusCode}`));
    77:           } catch (e) {
    78:             reject(e);
    79:           }
    80:         });
    81:       });
    82:       req.on('error', (err) => reject(err));
    83:     } catch (e) {
    84:       reject(e);
    85:     }
    86:   });
    87: }
    88: 
    89: async function saveRomeIndexRecord(record: { path: string; type: string; tag?: string }) {
    90:   try {
    91:     const root = process.cwd();
    92:     const dir = path.join(root, '.qflush');
    93:     if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
    94:     const idxFile = path.join(dir, 'rome-index.json');
    95:     let idx: RomeIndex = {};
    96:     if (fs.existsSync(idxFile)) {
    97:       try { idx = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(idxFile, 'utf8') || '{}'); } catch { idx = {}; }
    98:     }
    99: 
   100:     // normalize path and build canonical record using shared module
   101:     const relPath = normalizeRomePath(record.path);
   102:     const rec = makeRomeTagRecord({ type: record.type, path: relPath });
   103:     idx[rec.path] = rec;
   104: 
   105:     fs.writeFileSync(idxFile, JSON.stringify(idx, null, 2), 'utf8');
   106:     return { success: true, record: idx[rec.path] };
   107:   } catch (e) {
   108:     return { success: false, error: String(e) };
   109:   }
   110: }
   111: 
   112: export function activate(context: vscode.ExtensionContext) {
   113:   ensureTrialStarted(context);
   114: 
   115:   const openDisposable = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.openPanel', () => {
   116:     if (isTrialExpired(context)) {
   117:       vscode.window.showInformationMessage('QFlush trial expired. Click to purchase a license.', 'Purchase', 'Enter Key').then((v) => {
   118:         if (v === 'Purchase') vscode.env.openExternal(vscode.Uri.parse('https://gumroad.com/l/your-product'));
   119:         if (v === 'Enter Key') vscode.commands.executeCommand('qflush.enterLicense');
   120:       });
   121:       return;
   122:     }
   123: 
   124:     const panel = vscode.window.createWebviewPanel(
   125:       'qflushPanel',
   126:       'QFlush',
   127:       vscode.ViewColumn.One,
   128:       {
   129:         enableScripts: true,
   130:         localResourceRoots: [vscode.Uri.file(path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src'))],
   131:       }
   132:     );
   133: 
   134:     const htmlPath = path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src', 'panel.html');
   135:     let html = '';
   136:     try {
   137:       html = fs.readFileSync(htmlPath, 'utf8');
   138:     } catch (e) {
   139:       html = `<html><body><pre>panel.html not found at ${htmlPath}</pre></body></html>`;
   140:     }
   141: 
   142:     panel.webview.html = html;
   143: 
   144:     const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
   145:     const daemonUrl = cfg.get<string>('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
   146:     const token = cfg.get<string>('adminToken') || '';
   147: 
   148:     // Send config to webview securely via postMessage
   149:     panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'config', daemonUrl, token });
   150: 
   151:     // Handle messages from the webview
   152:     panel.webview.onDidReceiveMessage(
   153:       async (message) => {
   154:         if (message && message.type === 'saveConfig') {
   155:           const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
   156:           await cfg.update('daemonUrl', message.daemonUrl, vscode.ConfigurationTarget.Global);
   157:           await cfg.update('adminToken', message.token, vscode.ConfigurationTarget.Global);
   158:           panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'saved', info: 'Configuration saved' });
   159:         }
   160:       },
   161:       undefined,
   162:       context.subscriptions
   163:     );
   164:   });
   165: 
   166:   const openPourparler = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.openPourparler', () => {
   167:     const panel = vscode.window.createWebviewPanel('qflushPourparler', 'Pourparler', vscode.ViewColumn.One, { enableScripts: true, localResourceRoots: [vscode.Uri.file(path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src'))] });
   168:     const htmlPath = path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src', 'pourparler-web.html');
   169:     let html = '';
   170:     try { html = fs.readFileSync(htmlPath, 'utf8'); } catch (e) { html = `<html><body><pre>pourparler-web.html not found at ${htmlPath}</pre></body></html>`; }
   171:     panel.webview.html = html;
   172: 
   173:     panel.webview.onDidReceiveMessage(async (msg) => {
   174:       try {
   175:         if (msg && msg.type === 'export') {
   176:           const destUri = await vscode.window.showSaveDialog({ defaultUri: vscode.Uri.file(path.join(process.cwd(), msg.filename)), filters: { 'Images': ['png','svg'] } });
   177:           if (!destUri) return;
   178:           if (msg.format === 'svg') {
   179:             fs.writeFileSync(destUri.fsPath, msg.data, 'utf8');
   180:           } else if (msg.format === 'png') {
   181:             // data url -> binary
   182:             const base64 = msg.data.split(',')[1];
   183:             const buf = Buffer.from(base64, 'base64');
   184:             fs.writeFileSync(destUri.fsPath, buf);
   185:           }
   186:           vscode.window.showInformationMessage(`Exported ${msg.filename}`);
   187:         }
   188: 
   189:         // new messages from pourparler webview
   190:         if (msg && msg.type === 'npzList') {
   191:           const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
   192:           const daemonUrl = cfg.get<string>('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
   193:           try {
   194:             const data = await getJson(`${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/npz/checksum/list`);
   195:             panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'npzListResult', data });
   196:           } catch (e) {
   197:             panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'npzListResult', data: { success: false, error: String(e) } });
   198:           }
   199:         }
   200: 
   201:         if (msg && msg.type === 'npzClear') {
   202:           const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
   203:           const daemonUrl = cfg.get<string>('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
   204:           try {
   205:             const resp = await fetch(`${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/npz/checksum/clear`, { method: 'DELETE' });
   206:             const j = await resp.json();
   207:             panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'npzClearResult', data: j });
   208:           } catch (e) {
   209:             panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'npzClearResult', data: { success: false, error: String(e) } });
   210:           }
   211:         }
   212: 
   213:         if (msg && msg.type === 'npzIndexTag') {
   214:           const rec = msg.payload;
   215:           const r = await saveRomeIndexRecord({ path: rec.path, type: rec.type, tag: rec.tag });
   216:           panel.webview.postMessage(Object.assign({ type: 'npzIndexTagResult' }, r));
   217:         }
   218:       } catch (e) {
   219:         vscode.window.showErrorMessage('Extension message handler failed: ' + String(e));
   220:       }
   221:     }, undefined, context.subscriptions);
   222:   });
   223: 
   224:   const enterLicense = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.enterLicense', async () => {
   225:     const key = await vscode.window.showInputBox({ prompt: 'Enter your QFlush license key' });
   226:     if (!key) return;
   227: 
   228:     const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
   229:     const daemonUrl = cfg.get<string>('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
   230:     const activateUrl = `${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/license/activate`;
   231: 
   232:     const progressOptions: vscode.ProgressOptions = { location: vscode.ProgressLocation.Notification, title: 'Activating QFlush license...', cancellable: false };
   233:     try {
   234:       await vscode.window.withProgress(progressOptions, async () => {
   235:         const res = await postJson(activateUrl, { key });
   236:         // store license info locally in extension globalState
   237:         await context.globalState.update('qflush.licenseKey', key);
   238:         await context.globalState.update('qflush.licenseInfo', res.license || res);
   239:         vscode.window.showInformationMessage('License activated successfully. Thanks!');
   240:       });
   241:     } catch (err: any) {
   242:         vscode.window.showErrorMessage(`License activation failed: ${err && err.message ? err.message : String(err)}`);
   243:     }
   244:   });
   245: 
   246:   const showStatus = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.showLicenseStatus', async () => {
   247:     const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
   248:     const daemonUrl = cfg.get<string>('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
   249:     const statusUrl = `${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/license/status`;
   250:     try {
   251:       const res = await getJson(statusUrl);
   252:       if (!res || !res.success) {
   253:         vscode.window.showInformationMessage('No license information available');
   254:         return;
   255:       }
   256:       const lic = res.license;
   257:       if (!lic) {
   258:         vscode.window.showInformationMessage('No local license installed');
   259:         return;
   260:       }
   261:       const exp = lic.expiresAt ? new Date(lic.expiresAt).toLocaleString() : 'never (subscription)';
   262:       vscode.window.showInformationMessage(`License: ${lic.key} product=${lic.product_id} expires=${exp} valid=${res.valid}`);
   263:     } catch (err: any) {
   264:       vscode.window.showErrorMessage(`Failed to fetch status: ${err && err.message ? err.message : String(err)}`);
   265:     }
   266:   });
   267: 
   268:   const openTelemetry = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.openTelemetry', () => {
   269:     const panel = vscode.window.createWebviewPanel('qflushTelemetry', 'QFlush Telemetry', vscode.ViewColumn.Two, { enableScripts: true, localResourceRoots: [vscode.Uri.file(path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src'))] });
   270:     const htmlPath = path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src', 'telemetry-view.html');
   271:     let html = '';
   272:     try { html = fs.readFileSync(htmlPath, 'utf8'); } catch (e) { html = `<html><body><pre>telemetry-view.html not found at ${htmlPath}</pre></body></html>`; }
   273:     panel.webview.html = html;
   274:   });
   275: 
   276:   context.subscriptions.push(openDisposable, openPourparler, enterLicense, showStatus, openTelemetry);
   277: }
   278: 
   279: export function deactivate() {}

FILE: extensions\vscode-npz\src\polyfill-file.js
============================
============================
     1: // Polyfill minimal File/Blob for Node environments when libraries expect browser globals
     2: if (typeof globalThis.File === 'undefined') {
     3:   globalThis.File = class File extends Uint8Array {
     4:     constructor(parts = [], name = 'file', options = {}) {
     5:       // naive implementation: store data as concatenated string/Uint8Array
     6:       const chunks = parts.map(p => typeof p === 'string' ? Buffer.from(p) : Buffer.from(p));
     7:       const buf = Buffer.concat(chunks);
     8:       super(buf);
     9:       this.name = name;
    10:       this.lastModified = options.lastModified || Date.now();
    11:       this.size = buf.length;
    12:       this.type = options.type || '';
    13:     }
    14:     text() { return Promise.resolve(Buffer.from(this).toString('utf8')); }
    15:     arrayBuffer() { return Promise.resolve(Uint8Array.from(this).buffer); }
    16:     stream() { throw new Error('stream() not implemented'); }
    17:   };
    18: }
    19: if (typeof globalThis.Blob === 'undefined') {
    20:   globalThis.Blob = class Blob extends Uint8Array {
    21:     constructor(parts = [], options = {}) {
    22:       const chunks = parts.map(p => typeof p === 'string' ? Buffer.from(p) : Buffer.from(p));
    23:       const buf = Buffer.concat(chunks);
    24:       super(buf);
    25:       this.size = buf.length;
    26:       this.type = options.type || '';
    27:     }
    28:     text() { return Promise.resolve(Buffer.from(this).toString('utf8')); }
    29:     arrayBuffer() { return Promise.resolve(Uint8Array.from(this).buffer); }
    30:   };
    31: }

    20: 		all: require("./configs/eslint-all"),
    21: 		recommended: require("./configs/eslint-recommended"),
    22: 	},
    23: };

============================
FILE: node_modules\@funeste38\bat\src\bat.ts
============================
============================
     1: export type RequestClass = 'short' | 'normal' | 'slow' | 'timeout';
     2: 
     3: export interface BatOptions { baselineMs?: number; alpha?: number }
     4: 
     5: export class Bat {
     6:   baselineMs: number;
     7:   alpha: number;
     8:   private counter = 0;
     9:   private inFlight = new Map<string, { startedAt: number; attempts: number }>();
    10: 
    11:   constructor(opts: BatOptions = {}) {
    12:     this.baselineMs = opts.baselineMs ?? 500;
    13:     this.alpha = opts.alpha ?? 0.2;
    14:   }
    15: 
    16:   start(key: string) {
    17:     const id = `${key}:${++this.counter}`;
    18:     this.inFlight.set(id, { startedAt: Date.now(), attempts: 1 });
    19:     return id;
    20:   }
    21: 
    22:   stop(id: string) {
    23:     const rec = this.inFlight.get(id);
    24:     if (!rec) return null;
    25:     const rtt = Date.now() - rec.startedAt;
    26:     this.baselineMs = (1 - this.alpha) * this.baselineMs + this.alpha * rtt;
    27:     this.inFlight.delete(id);
    28:     return { rtt, cls: this.classify(rtt), attempts: rec.attempts } as { rtt: number; cls: RequestClass; attempts: number };
    29:   }
    30: 
    31:   classify(rtt: number): RequestClass {
    32:     if (rtt < this.baselineMs * 0.5) return 'short';
    33:     if (rtt < this.baselineMs * 1.5) return 'normal';
    34:     if (rtt < this.baselineMs * 3) return 'slow';
    35:     return 'timeout';
    36:   }
    37: 
    38:   markRetry(id: string) {
    39:     const rec = this.inFlight.get(id);
    40:     if (!rec) return null;
    41:     rec.attempts += 1;
    42:     rec.startedAt = Date.now();
    43:     return rec;
    44:   }
    45: 
    46:   listInFlight() { return [...this.inFlight.entries()]; }
    47: }


============================
FILE: node_modules\@funeste38\bat\src\batWings.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { defaultProfiles, WingProfile } from './profiles';
     2: 
     3: export type RequestClass = 'short' | 'normal' | 'slow' | 'timeout';
     4: 
     5: export class BatWings {
     6:   state = {
     7:     rate: 1,
     8:     retries: 0,
     9:     safeMode: false
    10:   } as { rate: number; retries: number; safeMode: boolean };
    11: 
    12:   consecutiveTimeouts = 0;
    13:   readonly maxTimeouts = 3;
    14:   private lastAdjustAt = Date.now();
    15:   private profile: WingProfile = defaultProfiles.chat;
    16: 
    17:   selectProfile(type: string) {
    18:     this.profile = (defaultProfiles as any)[type] ?? defaultProfiles.chat;
    19:     return this.profile;
    20:   }
    21: 
    22:   applyProfile(echoClass: RequestClass) {
    23:     const profile = this.profile;
    24:     // small cooldown to avoid thrashing
    25:     const now = Date.now();
    26:     if (now - this.lastAdjustAt < 50) return;
    27:     this.lastAdjustAt = now;
    28: 
    29:     if (echoClass === 'short') this.state.rate = Math.min(3, this.state.rate + profile.rateGain);
    30:     if (echoClass === 'normal') this.state.rate = this.state.rate; // stable
    31:     if (echoClass === 'slow') this.state.rate = Math.max(0.2, this.state.rate + profile.rateLoss);
    32:     if (echoClass === 'timeout') {
    33:       this.state.rate = Math.max(0.1, this.state.rate + profile.rateLoss * 3);
    34:       this.consecutiveTimeouts++;
    35:     }
    36: 
    37:     // clamp
    38:     this.state.rate = Math.max(0.2, Math.min(3, this.state.rate));
    39:   }
    40: 
    41:   adjustRate(cls: RequestClass) {
    42:     // legacy fallback to keep compatibility
    43:     this.applyProfile(cls);
    44:   }
    45: 
    46:   computeTimeout(baseline: number) {
    47:     return Math.max(50, Math.round(baseline * (this.profile.timeoutFactor ?? 1)));
    48:   }
    49: 
    50:   shouldRetry(attempts: number) {
    51:     return attempts < (this.profile.maxRetries ?? 0);
    52:   }
    53: 
    54:   shouldAbort(): boolean {
    55:     return this.consecutiveTimeouts >= this.maxTimeouts || this.state.safeMode;
    56:   }
    57: 
    58:   resetTimeouts() {
    59:     this.consecutiveTimeouts = 0;
    60:   }
    61: 
    62:   drop(id: string) {
    63:     // placeholder for drop action: in a real system we'd cancel network requests
    64:     // here we just log
    65:     // eslint-disable-next-line no-console
    66:     console.warn(`BatWings.drop: dropping ${id}`);
    67:   }
    68: 
    69:   async emergencyRecovery() {
    70:     // simple unsync recovery: wait, then reset rate and timeouts
    71:     // eslint-disable-next-line no-console
    72:     console.warn('BatWings: emergency recovery — pausing briefly');
    73:     await new Promise((r) => setTimeout(r, 300));
    74:     this.state.rate = 1;
    75:     this.resetTimeouts();
    76:     // eslint-disable-next-line no-console
    77:     console.warn('BatWings: recovery complete');
    78:   }
    79: }
