FILE: node_modules\@funeste38\bat\src\demo.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { EchoRadar, wrapEcho, BatWings, Instinct } from './index';
     2: import { Fangs, Channel } from './fangs';
     3: 
     4: const types = ['chat', 'heavy', 'critical', 'echo', 'file', 'system'];
     5: 
     6: async function fakeCall(text: string) {
     7:   // random delay between 10ms and 2000ms
     8:   const delay = 10 + Math.random() * 1990;
     9:   await new Promise((res) => setTimeout(res, delay));
    10:   if (Math.random() < 0.1) throw { status: 502, message: 'random fail' };
    11:   // random short payloads sometimes
    12:   if (Math.random() < 0.15) return '';
    13:   const gen = Array.from({ length: Math.floor(Math.random() * 200) + 5 }, () => 'x').join('');
    14:   return { echoed: text, delay, gen };
    15: }
    16: 
    17: function formatError(err: unknown): string | undefined {
    18:   if (!err) return undefined;
    19:   if (typeof err === 'string') return err;
    20:   if (err instanceof Error) return err.message;
    21:   if (typeof err === 'object') {
    22:     try {
    23:       const anyErr = err as any;
    24:       return anyErr && (anyErr.message ? String(anyErr.message) : JSON.stringify(anyErr));
    25:     } catch {
    26:       return String(err);
    27:     }
    28:   }
    29:   return String(err);
    30: }
    31: 
    32: async function demoFangs() {
    33:   // demonstrate Instinct first
    34:   const instinct = new Instinct({
    35:     defaults: { A11_PATH: 'D:/A11', API_TOKEN: 'DEV_TOKEN' },
    36:     config: { API_HOST: 'api.funesterie.me' }
    37:   });
    38: 
    39:   const sampleCmd = 'start-server --path={A11_PATH} --host={API_HOST} --token={API_TOKEN}';
    40:   console.log('Slots detected:', instinct.detectSlots(sampleCmd));
    41:   const filled = instinct.fill(sampleCmd);
    42:   console.log('Filled command:', filled.cmd);
    43:   if (filled.missing.length) console.log('Missing slots:', filled.missing);
    44: 
    45:   const channels: Channel[] = [
    46:     { id: 'local', kind: 'local', endpoint: 'http://127.0.0.1:3000', weight: 2, stats: { rttAvg: 300, errors: 0, inFlight: 0 } },
    47:     { id: 'tunnel', kind: 'proxy', endpoint: 'https://api.funesterie.me', weight: 1, stats: { rttAvg: 800, errors: 0, inFlight: 0 } }
    48:   ];
    49:   const fangs = new Fangs({ maxConcurrency: 4, channels });
    50: 
    51:   // mock bridge that uses channel info
    52:   const bridge = {
    53:     askA11Raw: async (channel: any, text: string) => {
    54:       // simulate network time influenced by channel rttAvg
    55:       await new Promise((r) => setTimeout(r, Math.max(10, channel.stats.rttAvg / 10)));
    56:       if (Math.random() < 0.05) throw { status: 502 };
    57:       return { from: channel.id, text };
    58:     }
    59:   };
    60: 
    61:   for (let i = 0; i < 20; i++) {
    62:     const type = types[i % types.length] as any;
    63:     try {
    64:       const { channel, result } = await fangs.run(type, async (ch) => bridge.askA11Raw(ch, `hello ${i}`));
    65:       console.log(i, 'used', channel.id, 'result', result);
    66:     } catch (e) {
    67:       console.warn(i, 'failed', formatError(e));
    68:     }
    69:   }
    70: }
    71: 
    72: async function main() {
    73:   await demoFangs();
    74: }
    75: 
    76: main().catch((e) => console.error(e));


============================
FILE: node_modules\@funeste38\bat\src\ears.ts
============================
============================
     1: export type OriginGuess = 'local' | 'remote' | 'cached' | 'error';
     2: 
     3: export interface EarsResult { signalStrength: number; origin: OriginGuess; isNoise: boolean }
     4: 
     5: export class Ears {
     6:   ignoreShortBytes = 5;
     7: 
     8:   ignore(result: any, error?: any) {
     9:     if (error) {
    10:       const status = (error && ((error as any).status || (error as any).statusCode)) as number | undefined;
    11:       if (status && [429, 502, 503].includes(status)) return true;
    12:       return false;
    13:     }
    14:     if (result == null) return true;
    15:     if (typeof result === 'string') {
    16:       const s = result.trim();
    17:       if (s === '' || s === 'null' || s === 'undefined') return true;
    18:       if (s.length < this.ignoreShortBytes) return true;
    19:     }
    20:     if (typeof result === 'object') {
    21:       try {
    22:         const str = JSON.stringify(result);
    23:         if (str === '{}' || str === '[]' || str.length < this.ignoreShortBytes) return true;
    24:       } catch { return false; }
    25:     }
    26:     return false;
    27:   }
    28: 
    29:   evaluate(result: any, rtt: number, error?: any): EarsResult {
    30:     const isNoise = this.ignore(result, error);
    31:     if (error) return { signalStrength: 0, origin: 'error', isNoise: true };
    32: 
    33:     let len = 0;
    34:     if (typeof result === 'string') len = result.length;
    35:     else if (result && typeof result === 'object') {
    36:       try { len = JSON.stringify(result).length; } catch { len = 0; }
    37:     }
    38: 
    39:     let score = Math.max(0, Math.min(100, 50 + Math.min(40, Math.round((len / 1000) * 40)) - (rtt > 1500 ? 30 : (rtt > 500 ? 10 : 0))));
    40:     if (len < 20) score = Math.max(0, score - 20);
    41: 
    42:     const origin = error ? 'error' : (len < 50 && rtt < 100 ? 'cached' : (rtt < 200 ? 'local' : (rtt < 1000 ? 'remote' : 'remote')));
    43:     return { signalStrength: score, origin, isNoise };
    44:   }
    45: }


============================
FILE: node_modules\@funeste38\bat\src\fangs.ts
============================
============================
     1: export type RequestType = 'chat' | 'heavy' | 'critical' | 'echo' | 'file' | 'system';
     2: export type ChannelKind = 'local' | 'proxy' | 'remote' | 'mock';
     3: 
     4: export interface ChannelStats { rttAvg: number; errors: number; inFlight: number }
     5: export interface Channel { id: string; kind: ChannelKind; endpoint: string; proxy?: string; weight: number; stats: ChannelStats }
     6: export interface FangsOptions { maxConcurrency?: number; channels: Channel[] }
     7: 
     8: export class Fangs {
     9:   private channels: Channel[];
    10:   private maxConcurrency: number;
    11:   private semaphore = 0;
    12:   private rr = 0;
    13: 
    14:   constructor(opts: FangsOptions) { this.channels = opts.channels.slice(); this.maxConcurrency = opts.maxConcurrency ?? 4; }
    15: 
    16:   chooseChannel(type: RequestType): Channel {
    17:     const live = this.channels.filter(c => c.stats.errors < 5);
    18:     if (!live.length) throw new Error('No available channel');
    19:     if (type === 'echo') return live.reduce((best, c) => c.stats.rttAvg < best.stats.rttAvg ? c : best);
    20:     if (type === 'heavy') return live.reduce((best, c) => c.stats.inFlight < best.stats.inFlight ? c : best);
    21:     const total = live.reduce((s, c) => s + (c.weight || 1), 0);
    22:     let pick = this.rr % total;
    23:     for (const c of live) { const w = c.weight || 1; if (pick < w) { this.rr = (this.rr + 1) % total; return c; } pick -= w; }
    24:     return live[0];
    25:   }
    26: 
    27:   trackStart(channelId: string) { const ch = this.channels.find(c => c.id === channelId); if (ch) ch.stats.inFlight++; }
    28:   trackEnd(channelId: string, rtt: number, ok: boolean) { const ch = this.channels.find(c => c.id === channelId); if (!ch) return; ch.stats.inFlight = Math.max(0, ch.stats.inFlight - 1); ch.stats.rttAvg = ch.stats.rttAvg === 0 ? rtt : (0.8 * ch.stats.rttAvg + 0.2 * rtt); if (!ok) ch.stats.errors++; }
    29: 
    30:   async run<T>(type: RequestType, fn: (channel: Channel) => Promise<T>): Promise<{ channel: Channel; result: T }> {
    31:     while (this.semaphore >= this.maxConcurrency) await new Promise(r => setTimeout(r, 10));
    32:     this.semaphore++;
    33:     const channel = this.chooseChannel(type);
    34:     this.trackStart(channel.id);
    35:     try { const res = await fn(channel); this.trackEnd(channel.id, 0, true); return { channel, result: res }; }
    36:     catch (e) { this.trackEnd(channel.id, 0, false); throw e; }
    37:     finally { this.semaphore = Math.max(0, this.semaphore - 1); }
    38:   }
    39: }


============================
FILE: node_modules\@funeste38\bat\src\heart.ts
============================
============================
     1: export type HeartCallback = () => void;
     2: 
     3: export class Heart {
     4:   intervalMs: number;
     5:   private timer: any = null;
     6:   private callbacks: HeartCallback[] = [];
     7:   running = false;
     8: 
     9:   constructor(intervalMs = 1000) { this.intervalMs = intervalMs; }
    10:   start() { if (this.running) return; this.running = true; this.timer = setInterval(() => this.tick(), this.intervalMs); }
    11:   stop() { if (!this.running) return; clearInterval(this.timer); this.timer = null; this.running = false; }
    12:   onTick(cb: HeartCallback) { this.callbacks.push(cb); }
    13:   private tick() { for (const cb of this.callbacks) { try { cb(); } catch {} } }
    14:   reset() { this.stop(); this.start(); }
    15: }


============================
FILE: node_modules\@funeste38\bat\src\hormones.ts
============================
============================
     1: export class Hormones {
     2:   stress = 0; private decayMs = 5000; private lastUpdate = Date.now();
     3:   inc(amount = 5) { this.updateDecay(); this.stress = Math.min(100, this.stress + amount); return this.stress; }
     4:   dec(amount = 5) { this.updateDecay(); this.stress = Math.max(0, this.stress - amount); return this.stress; }
     5:   private updateDecay() { const now = Date.now(); const delta = now - this.lastUpdate; if (delta > this.decayMs) { const steps = Math.floor(delta / this.decayMs); this.stress = Math.max(0, this.stress - steps * 2); this.lastUpdate = now; } }
     6:   setStress(v:number){ this.stress = Math.max(0, Math.min(100, v)); }
     7: }


============================
FILE: node_modules\@funeste38\bat\src\immune.ts
============================
============================
     1: export class Immune {
     2:   private blacklist = new Map<string, number>();
     3:   private penaltyMs = 30000;
     4:   isBlacklisted(channelId: string) { const until = this.blacklist.get(channelId); if (!until) return false; if (Date.now() > until) { this.blacklist.delete(channelId); return false; } return true; }
     5:   blacklistChannel(channelId: string, durationMs?: number) { const until = Date.now() + (durationMs ?? this.penaltyMs); this.blacklist.set(channelId, until); }
     6:   unblacklist(channelId: string) { this.blacklist.delete(channelId); }
     7:   prune() { for (const [k, until] of this.blacklist.entries()) if (Date.now() > until) this.blacklist.delete(k); }
     8:   list() { return Array.from(this.blacklist.entries()).map(([id, until]) => ({ id, until })); }
     9: }


============================
FILE: node_modules\@funeste38\bat\src\index.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { BatWings } from './batWings';
     2: 
     3: export type RequestClass = 'short' | 'normal' | 'slow' | 'timeout';
     4: export type OriginGuess = 'local' | 'remote' | 'cached' | 'error';
     5: 
     6: export interface EchoRadarOptions {
     7:   baselineMs?: number;
     8:   alpha?: number;
     9:   maxAttempts?: number;
    10:   noiseFilter?: NoiseFilter;
    11: }
    12: 
    13: export interface NoiseFilter {
    14:   ignore(result: any, error?: any): boolean;
    15: }
    16: 
    17: interface InFlight {
    18:   id: string;
    19:   key: string;
    20:   startedAt: number;
    21:   attempts: number;
    22: }
    23: 
    24: const defaultNoiseFilter: NoiseFilter = {
    25:   ignore(result: any, error?: any) {
    26:     if (error) {
    27:       const status = (error && ((error as any).status || (error as any).statusCode)) as number | undefined;
    28:       if (status && [429, 502, 503].includes(status)) return true;
    29:       return false;
    30:     }
    31:     if (result == null) return true;
    32:     if (typeof result === 'string') {
    33:       const s = result.trim();
    34:       if (s === '' || s === 'null' || s === 'undefined') return true;
    35:       if (s.length < 5) return true;
    36:     }
    37:     if (typeof result === 'object') {
    38:       try {
    39:         const str = JSON.stringify(result);
    40:         if (str === '{}' || str === '[]' || str.length < 5) return true;
    41:       } catch {
    42:         return false;
    43:       }
    44:     }
    45:     return false;
    46:   }
    47: };
    48: 
    49: function computeSignalStrength(result: any, error: any, rtt: number): number {
    50:   if (error) return 0;
    51:   let score = 50;
    52:   let len = 0;
    53:   if (typeof result === 'string') len = result.length;
    54:   else if (result && typeof result === 'object') {
    55:     try { len = JSON.stringify(result).length; } catch { len = 0; }
    56:   } else if (typeof result === 'number' || typeof result === 'boolean') len = 1;
    57: 
    58:   // reward longer meaningful payloads
    59:   score += Math.min(40, Math.round((len / 1000) * 40));
    60:   if (len < 20) score -= 20;
    61: 
    62:   // penalize high latency
    63:   if (rtt > 1500) score -= 30;
    64:   else if (rtt > 500) score -= 10;
    65: 
    66:   score = Math.max(0, Math.min(100, score));
    67:   return score;
    68: }
    69: 
    70: function guessOrigin(rtt: number, len: number, error: any): OriginGuess {
    71:   if (error) return 'error';
    72:   if (len < 50 && rtt < 100) return 'cached';
    73:   if (rtt < 200) return 'local';
    74:   if (rtt < 1000) return 'remote';
    75:   return 'remote';
    76: }
    77: 
    78: function timeoutPromise<T>(p: Promise<T>, ms: number): Promise<T> {
    79:   let timer: any;
    80:   return Promise.race([
    81:     p,
    82:     new Promise<T>((_, rej) => {
    83:       timer = setTimeout(() => rej(new Error('timeout')), ms);
    84:     })
    85:   ]).finally(() => clearTimeout(timer));
    86: }
    87: 
    88: export class EchoRadar {
    89:   baselineMs: number;
    90:   alpha: number;
    91:   maxAttempts: number;
    92:   noiseFilter: NoiseFilter;
    93:   private inFlight = new Map<string, InFlight>();
    94:   private counter = 0;
    95: 
    96:   constructor(opts: EchoRadarOptions = {}) {
    97:     this.baselineMs = opts.baselineMs ?? 500;
    98:     this.alpha = opts.alpha ?? 0.2;
    99:     this.maxAttempts = opts.maxAttempts ?? 2;
   100:     this.noiseFilter = opts.noiseFilter ?? defaultNoiseFilter;
   101:   }
   102: 
   103:   start(key: string): string {
   104:     const id = `${key}:${++this.counter}`;
   105:     this.inFlight.set(id, {
   106:       id,
   107:       key,
   108:       startedAt: Date.now(),
   109:       attempts: 1
   110:     });
   111:     return id;
   112:   }
   113: 
   114:   stop(id: string): { rtt: number; cls: RequestClass; attempts: number } | null {
   115:     const rec = this.inFlight.get(id);
   116:     if (!rec) return null;
   117:     const rtt = Date.now() - rec.startedAt;
   118: 
   119:     this.baselineMs =
   120:       (1 - this.alpha) * this.baselineMs + this.alpha * rtt;
   121: 
   122:     this.inFlight.delete(id);
   123:     return { rtt, cls: this.classify(rtt), attempts: rec.attempts };
   124:   }
   125: 
   126:   classify(rtt: number): RequestClass {
   127:     if (rtt < this.baselineMs * 0.5) return 'short';
   128:     if (rtt < this.baselineMs * 1.5) return 'normal';
   129:     if (rtt < this.baselineMs * 3) return 'slow';
   130:     return 'timeout';
   131:   }
   132: 
   133:   getTimeoutThreshold(): number {
   134:     return this.baselineMs * 3;
   135:   }
   136: 
   137:   listInFlight() {
   138:     return [...this.inFlight.values()];
   139:   }
   140: 
   141:   markRetry(id: string): InFlight | null {
   142:     const rec = this.inFlight.get(id);
   143:     if (!rec) return null;
   144:     rec.attempts += 1;
   145:     rec.startedAt = Date.now();
   146:     if (rec.attempts > this.maxAttempts) {
   147:       this.inFlight.delete(id);
   148:     }
   149:     return rec;
   150:   }
   151: }
   152: 
   153: // Helper pour wrapper une fonction async
   154: export function wrapEcho<TArgs extends any[], TResult>(
   155:   key: string,
   156:   radar: EchoRadar,
   157:   fn: (...args: TArgs) => Promise<TResult>,
   158:   wings?: BatWings,
   159:   requestType?: string
   160: ) {
   161:   return async (...args: TArgs): Promise<{
   162:     result: TResult | null;
   163:     rtt: number;
   164:     cls: RequestClass;
   165:     attempts: number;
   166:     error?: unknown;
   167:     isNoise: boolean;
   168:     signalStrength: number;
   169:     originGuess: OriginGuess;
   170:     dropped?: boolean;
   171:   }> => {
   172:     if (wings && requestType) wings.selectProfile(requestType);
   173: 
   174:     const id = radar.start(key);
   175:     let result: TResult | null = null;
   176:     let error: any = undefined;
   177:     let attempts = 0;
   178:     let dropped = false;
   179: 
   180:     while (true) {
   181:       attempts++;
   182:       try {
   183:         const timeoutMs = wings ? wings.computeTimeout(radar.baselineMs) : radar.getTimeoutThreshold();
   184:         result = await timeoutPromise(fn(...args), timeoutMs) as TResult;
   185:         const echo = radar.stop(id)!;
   186:         const isNoise = radar.noiseFilter.ignore(result, undefined);
   187:         const len = typeof result === 'string' ? result.length : (result ? JSON.stringify(result).length : 0);
   188:         const signalStrength = computeSignalStrength(result, undefined, echo.rtt);
   189:         const originGuess = guessOrigin(echo.rtt, len, undefined);
   190: 
   191:         if (wings) {
   192:           wings.applyProfile(echo.cls);
   193:           if (wings.shouldAbort()) {
   194:             wings.drop(id);
   195:             dropped = true;
   196:             return { result, ...echo, isNoise, signalStrength, originGuess, dropped };
   197:           }
   198:         }
   199: 
   200:         return { result, ...echo, isNoise, signalStrength, originGuess, attempts };
   201:       } catch (err) {
   202:         error = err;
   203:         // if wings suggest retry based on profile
   204:         attempts = Math.max(1, attempts);
   205:         const shouldRetry = wings ? wings.shouldRetry(attempts) : attempts < radar.maxAttempts;
   206:         const echo = radar.stop(id) || { rtt: 0, cls: 'timeout' as RequestClass, attempts };
   207:         const isNoise = radar.noiseFilter.ignore(null, error);
   208:         const signalStrength = computeSignalStrength(null, error, echo.rtt);
   209:         const originGuess = guessOrigin(echo.rtt, 0, error);
   210: 
   211:         if (wings) {
   212:           wings.applyProfile(echo.cls);
   213:           if (wings.shouldAbort()) {
   214:             wings.drop(id);
   215:             // fire recovery asynchronously
   216:             // eslint-disable-next-line @typescript-eslint/no-floating-promises
   217:             wings.emergencyRecovery();
   218:             return { result: null, error, ...echo, isNoise, signalStrength, originGuess, dropped: true };
   219:           }
   220:         }
   221: 
   222:         if (!shouldRetry) {
   223:           return { result: null, error, ...echo, isNoise, signalStrength, originGuess };
   224:         }
   225: 
   226:         // prepare for next attempt
   227:         if (wings) wings.state.retries = attempts;
   228:         radar.markRetry(id);
   229:         // small backoff
   230:         await new Promise((r) => setTimeout(r, 50 * attempts));
   231:         continue;
   232:       }
   233:     }
   234:   };
   235: }
   236: 
   237: export { BatWings };
   238: export { Bat } from './bat';
   239: export { Ears } from './ears';
   240: export { Wings } from './wings';
   241: export { Fangs } from './fangs';
   242: export { Inversion } from './inversion';
   243: export { Heart } from './heart';
   244: export { Memory } from './memory';
   245: export { Hormones } from './hormones';
   246: export { Immune } from './immune';
   247: export { Sleep } from './sleep';
   248: export { Instinct } from './instinct';
   249: export * from './types';
   250: export * from './profiles';

FILE: node_modules\@funeste38\bat\src\instinct.ts
============================
============================
     1: export interface InstinctOptions {
     2:   defaults?: Record<string, string>;
     3:   config?: Record<string, string>;
     4:   envPriority?: ('env'|'config'|'defaults')[];
     5: }
     6: 
     7: export class Instinct {
     8:   defaults: Record<string,string>;
     9:   config: Record<string,string>;
    10:   envPriority: ('env'|'config'|'defaults')[];
    11: 
    12:   constructor(opts: InstinctOptions = {}){
    13:     this.defaults = opts.defaults ?? {};
    14:     this.config = opts.config ?? {};
    15:     this.envPriority = opts.envPriority ?? ['env','config','defaults'];
    16:   }
    17: 
    18:   detectSlots(cmd: string): string[] {
    19:     const re = /\{([A-Z0-9_\-]+)\}/g;
    20:     const out: string[] = [];
    21:     let m: RegExpExecArray | null;
    22:     while ((m = re.exec(cmd)) !== null) {
    23:       out.push(m[1]);
    24:     }
    25:     return Array.from(new Set(out));
    26:   }
    27: 
    28:   resolveSlot(name: string): string | undefined {
    29:     for (const src of this.envPriority) {
    30:       if (src === 'env' && (process.env as any)[name]) return (process.env as any)[name];
    31:       if (src === 'config' && this.config[name]) return this.config[name];
    32:       if (src === 'defaults' && this.defaults[name]) return this.defaults[name];
    33:     }
    34:     return undefined;
    35:   }
    36: 
    37:   fill(cmd: string): { cmd: string; missing: string[] } {
    38:     const slots = this.detectSlots(cmd);
    39:     const missing: string[] = [];
    40:     let filled = cmd;
    41:     for (const s of slots) {
    42:       const val = this.resolveSlot(s);
    43:       if (val === undefined) { missing.push(s); continue; }
    44:       const re = new RegExp(`\\{${s}\\}`,'g');
    45:       filled = filled.replace(re, val);
    46:     }
    47:     return { cmd: filled, missing };
    48:   }
    49: }

FILE: node_modules\@funeste38\bat\src\integrations\spyderAdapter.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { EchoRadar, BatWings } from '../index';
     2: import { Fangs, Channel } from '../fangs';
     3: 
     4: export interface SpyderBridge {
     5:   askA11Raw: (channel: Channel, text: string) => Promise<any>;
     6:   type?: string; // request type for wings profiles
     7: }
     8: 
     9: export function createSpyderAdapter(bridge: SpyderBridge, fangs?: Fangs) {
    10:   const radar = new EchoRadar();
    11:   const wings = new BatWings();
    12: 
    13:   async function callA11(text: string) {
    14:     const directChannel: Channel = { id: 'direct', kind: 'local', endpoint: '', weight: 1, stats: { rttAvg: 0, errors: 0, inFlight: 0 } };
    15:     // simple passthrough to the provided bridge
    16:     return bridge.askA11Raw(directChannel, text);
    17:   }
    18: 
    19:   async function askA11Multi(type: string, text: string) {
    20:     if (!fangs) throw new Error('Fangs instance required for multi-channel calls');
    21:     const { channel, result } = await fangs.run(type as any, async (ch) => {
    22:       // askA11Raw expects (channel, text)
    23:       return bridge.askA11Raw(ch, text);
    24:     });
    25:     return { channel, result };
    26:   }
    27: 
    28:   return { callA11, askA11Multi, radar, wings };
    29: }

FILE: node_modules\@funeste38\bat\src\memory.ts
============================
============================
     1: export interface MemorySignal { time: number; id?: string; cls?: string; rtt?: number; signal?: number; origin?: string; err?: any }
     2: 
     3: export class Memory {
     4:   private size: number;
     5:   private ring: MemorySignal[] = [];
     6:   constructor(size = 50) { this.size = Math.max(1, size); }
     7:   push(sig: MemorySignal) { this.ring.push(sig); if (this.ring.length > this.size) this.ring.shift(); }
     8:   last(n = 10) { return this.ring.slice(Math.max(0, this.ring.length - n)); }
     9:   clear() { this.ring = []; }
    10:   find(predicate: (s: MemorySignal) => boolean) { return this.ring.find(predicate); }
    11: }

FILE: node_modules\@funeste38\bat\src\profiles.ts
============================
============================
     1: export interface WingProfile {
     2:   rateGain: number;
     3:   rateLoss: number;
     4:   maxRetries: number;
     5:   timeoutFactor: number;
     6:   aggressiveness?: number; // 0..1
     7: }
     8: 
     9: export const defaultProfiles: Record<string, WingProfile> = {
    10:   echo:     { rateGain: 0.3,  rateLoss: -0.3, maxRetries: 0, timeoutFactor: 0.5, aggressiveness: 1 },
    11:   chat:     { rateGain: 0.1,  rateLoss: -0.1, maxRetries: 2, timeoutFactor: 1.0, aggressiveness: 0.5 },
    12:   heavy:    { rateGain: 0.2,  rateLoss: -0.05,maxRetries: 3, timeoutFactor: 2.0, aggressiveness: 0.8 },
    13:   critical: { rateGain: 0.05, rateLoss: -0.4, maxRetries: 0, timeoutFactor: 0.8, aggressiveness: 0.1 },
    14:   file:     { rateGain: 0.05, rateLoss: -0.05,maxRetries: 1, timeoutFactor: 3.0, aggressiveness: 0.3 },
    15:   system:   { rateGain: 0,    rateLoss: -0.3, maxRetries: 0, timeoutFactor: 0.6, aggressiveness: 0.2 }
    16: };

FILE: node_modules\@funeste38\bat\src\sleep.ts

============================
     1: export class Sleep {
     2:   sleeping = false;
     3:   async sleep(ms = 2000) { if (this.sleeping) return; this.sleeping = true; await new Promise((r) => setTimeout(r, ms)); this.sleeping = false; }
     4:   async sleepAndReset(ms = 2000, resetFn?: () => void) { await this.sleep(ms); if (resetFn) resetFn(); }
     5: }

FILE: node_modules\@funeste38\bat\src\wings.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { defaultProfiles } from './profiles';
     2: import { RequestClass } from './bat';
     3: 
     4: export class Wings {
     5:   state = { rate: 1, retries: 0, safeMode: false } as { rate: number; retries: number; safeMode: boolean };
     6:   consecutiveTimeouts = 0;
     7:   readonly maxTimeouts = 3;
     8:   private lastAdjustAt = Date.now();
     9:   private profile: any = defaultProfiles.chat;
    10: 
    11:   selectProfile(type: string) { this.profile = (defaultProfiles as any)[type] ?? defaultProfiles.chat; return this.profile; }
    12: 
    13:   applyProfile(echoClass: RequestClass) {
    14:     const profile = this.profile;
    15:     const now = Date.now();
    16:     if (now - this.lastAdjustAt < 50) return;
    17:     this.lastAdjustAt = now;
    18: 
    19:     if (echoClass === 'short') this.state.rate = Math.min(3, this.state.rate + profile.rateGain);
    20:     if (echoClass === 'normal') this.state.rate = this.state.rate;
    21:     if (echoClass === 'slow') this.state.rate = Math.max(0.2, this.state.rate + profile.rateLoss);
    22:     if (echoClass === 'timeout') { this.state.rate = Math.max(0.1, this.state.rate + profile.rateLoss * 3); this.consecutiveTimeouts++; }
    23: 
    24:     this.state.rate = Math.max(0.2, Math.min(3, this.state.rate));
    25:   }
    26: 
    27:   computeTimeout(baseline: number) { return Math.max(50, Math.round(baseline * (this.profile.timeoutFactor ?? 1))); }
    28:   shouldRetry(attempts: number) { return attempts < (this.profile.maxRetries ?? 0); }
    29:   shouldAbort() { return this.consecutiveTimeouts >= this.maxTimeouts || this.state.safeMode; }
    30:   resetTimeouts() { this.consecutiveTimeouts = 0; }
    31:   reset() { this.state.rate = 1; this.resetTimeouts(); this.state.retries = 0; this.state.safeMode = false; }
    32: }

============================
FILE: node_modules\@funeste38\freeland\src\index.ts
============================
============================
     1: export type Decoder = (input: string) => Promise<string> | string;
     2: 
     3: const registry = new Map<string, Decoder>();
     4: 
     5: export function registerSystem(prefix: string, decoder: Decoder) {
     6:   registry.set(prefix, decoder);
     7: }
     8: 
     9: export async function decodeSystemValue(raw: string): Promise<string> {
    10:   for (const [prefix, decoder] of registry) {
    11:     if (raw.startsWith(prefix)) {
    12:       const tail = raw.slice(prefix.length);
    13:       const res = decoder(tail);
    14:       return res instanceof Promise ? await res : res;
    15:     }
    16:   }
    17:   // fallback: return raw
    18:   return raw;
    19: }
    20: 
    21: // built-ins
    22: registerSystem('json:', (s) => JSON.parse(s));
    23: registerSystem('b64:', (s) => Buffer.from(s, 'base64').toString('utf8'));
    24: registerSystem('file:', (s) => {
    25:   // simple sync read
    26:   const fs = require('fs');
    27:   const path = require('path');
    28:   const p = path.resolve(s);
    29:   return fs.readFileSync(p, 'utf8');
    30: });
    31: registerSystem('nez:', (s) => `nez:${s}`);

FILE: node_modules\@funeste38\nezlephant\src\index.js

     1: exports.decodeNezlephantBuffer = function (buf) {
     2:   // Very small stub: assume the buffer is utf8 text and return it
     3:   try {
     4:     return buf.toString('utf8');
     5:   } catch (e) {
     6:     return '';
     7:   }
     8: };
     9: 
    10: var oc8 = require('./oc8.cjs');
    11: exports.encodeToOC8Png = oc8.encodeToOC8Png;
    12: exports.decodeFromOC8Png = oc8.decodeFromOC8Png;
    13: exports.crc8 = oc8.crc8;
    14: 
    15: var rubik = require('./rubik.cjs');
    16: exports.scramblePngBlocks = rubik.scramblePngBlocks;
    17: exports.unscramblePngBlocks = rubik.unscramblePngBlocks;
    18: exports.makePermutation = rubik.makePermutation;


============================
FILE: node_modules\@funeste38\nezlephant\src\oc8.cjs
============================
============================
     1: const { PNG } = require('pngjs');
     2: 
     3: function crc8(buf) {
     4:   let crc = 0;
     5:   for (let i = 0; i < buf.length; i++) {
     6:     crc ^= buf[i];
     7:     for (let j = 0; j < 8; j++) {
     8:       crc = (crc & 0x80) ? ((crc << 1) ^ 0x07) & 0xff : (crc << 1) & 0xff;
     9:     }
    10:   }
    11:   return crc & 0xff;
    12: }
    13: 
    14: function encodeToOC8Png(payload, width = 0, height = 0) {
    15:   const len = payload.length;
    16:   if (width === 0 || height === 0) {
    17:     const pixels = Math.ceil(len / 3);
    18:     width = Math.ceil(Math.sqrt(pixels));
    19:     height = Math.ceil(pixels / width);
    20:   }
    21:   const pixelCount = width * height;
    22:   const pixels = Buffer.alloc(pixelCount * 4, 0);
    23:   for (let i = 0; i < pixelCount; i++) {
    24:     const offPayload = i * 3;
    25:     const r = payload[offPayload] || 0;
    26:     const g = payload[offPayload + 1] || 0;
    27:     const b = payload[offPayload + 2] || 0;
    28:     const c = crc8(Buffer.from([r, g, b]));
    29:     const po = i * 4;
    30:     pixels[po] = r;
    31:     pixels[po + 1] = g;
    32:     pixels[po + 2] = b;
    33:     pixels[po + 3] = c;
    34:   }
    35:   const png = new PNG({ width, height });
    36:   png.data = pixels;
    37:   return PNG.sync.write(png);
    38: }
    39: 
    40: function decodeFromOC8Png(pngBuf) {
    41:   const png = PNG.sync.read(pngBuf);
    42:   const data = png.data;
    43:   const out = [];
    44:   for (let i = 0; i < data.length; i += 4) {
    45:     const r = data[i];
    46:     const g = data[i + 1];
    47:     const b = data[i + 2];
    48:     const c = data[i + 3];
    49:     if (crc8(Buffer.from([r, g, b])) !== c) break;
    50:     out.push(r, g, b);
    51:   }
    52:   while (out.length && out[out.length - 1] === 0) out.pop();
    53:   return Buffer.from(out);
    54: }
    55: 
    56: module.exports = { crc8, encodeToOC8Png, decodeFromOC8Png };

     1: module.exports = require('./oc8.cjs');

     2: export const crc8 = c.crc8;
     3: export const encodeToOC8Png = c.encodeToOC8Png;
     4: export const decodeFromOC8Png = c.decodeFromOC8Png;


============================
FILE: node_modules\@funeste38\nezlephant\src\rubik.cjs
============================
============================
     1: const crypto = require('crypto');
     2: const { PNG } = require('pngjs');
     3: 
     4: function makePermutation(count, key) {
     5:   const hash = crypto.createHash('sha256').update(key).digest();
     6:   const arr = Array.from({ length: count }, (_, i) => i);
     7:   let idx = 0;
     8:   for (let i = count - 1; i > 0; i--) {
     9:     const b = hash[idx++ % hash.length];
    10:     const j = b % (i + 1);
    11:     const tmp = arr[i];
    12:     arr[i] = arr[j];
    13:     arr[j] = tmp;
    14:   }
    15:   return arr;
    16: }
    17: 
    18: function scramblePngBlocks(pngBuf, key, blockSize = 8) {
    19:   const png = PNG.sync.read(pngBuf);
    20:   const { width, height, data } = png;
    21:   const cols = Math.ceil(width / blockSize);
    22:   const rows = Math.ceil(height / blockSize);
    23:   const blockCount = cols * rows;
    24:   const perm = makePermutation(blockCount, key);
    25: 
    26:   const orig = Buffer.from(data); // read-only source
    27:   const out = Buffer.from(data); // start with original so untouched areas remain
    28: 
    29:   for (let srcIndex = 0; srcIndex < blockCount; srcIndex++) {
    30:     const dstIndex = perm[srcIndex];
    31: 
    32:     const srcCol = srcIndex % cols;
    33:     const srcRow = Math.floor(srcIndex / cols);
    34:     const dstCol = dstIndex % cols;
    35:     const dstRow = Math.floor(dstIndex / cols);
    36: 
    37:     const srcX = srcCol * blockSize;
    38:     const srcY = srcRow * blockSize;
    39:     const dstX = dstCol * blockSize;
    40:     const dstY = dstRow * blockSize;
    41: 
    42:     const blockWidth = Math.min(blockSize, width - srcX);
    43:     const blockHeight = Math.min(blockSize, height - srcY);
    44: 
    45:     for (let by = 0; by < blockHeight; by++) {
    46:       const srcOff = ((srcY + by) * width + srcX) * 4;
    47:       const dstOff = ((dstY + by) * width + dstX) * 4;
    48:       const len = blockWidth * 4;
    49:       orig.copy(out, dstOff, srcOff, srcOff + len);
    50:     }
    51:   }
    52: 
    53:   const pngOut = new PNG({ width, height });
    54:   pngOut.data = out;
    55:   return PNG.sync.write(pngOut);
    56: }
    57: 
    58: function unscramblePngBlocks(pngBuf, key, blockSize = 8) {
    59:   const png = PNG.sync.read(pngBuf);
    60:   const { width, height, data } = png;
    61:   const cols = Math.ceil(width / blockSize);
    62:   const rows = Math.ceil(height / blockSize);
    63:   const blockCount = cols * rows;
    64:   const perm = makePermutation(blockCount, key);
    65: 
    66:   const scrambled = Buffer.from(data);
    67:   const out = Buffer.from(data);
    68: 
    69:   for (let srcIndex = 0; srcIndex < blockCount; srcIndex++) {
    70:     const dstIndex = perm[srcIndex];
    71: 
    72:     const srcCol = srcIndex % cols;
    73:     const srcRow = Math.floor(srcIndex / cols);
    74:     const dstCol = dstIndex % cols;
    75:     const dstRow = Math.floor(dstIndex / cols);
    76: 
    77:     const srcX = srcCol * blockSize;
    78:     const srcY = srcRow * blockSize;
    79:     const dstX = dstCol * blockSize;
    80:     const dstY = dstRow * blockSize;
    81: 
    82:     // In scrambled image, the block originally at srcIndex is at dstIndex.
    83:     // So copy from scrambled at dstIndex -> out at srcIndex.
    84:     const scrX = dstX;
    85:     const scrY = dstY;
    86:     const outX = srcX;
    87:     const outY = srcY;
    88: 
    89:     const blockWidth = Math.min(blockSize, width - outX);
    90:     const blockHeight = Math.min(blockSize, height - outY);
    91: 
    92:     for (let by = 0; by < blockHeight; by++) {
    93:       const scrOff = ((scrY + by) * width + scrX) * 4;
    94:       const outOff = ((outY + by) * width + outX) * 4;
    95:       const len = blockWidth * 4;
    96:       scrambled.copy(out, outOff, scrOff, scrOff + len);
    97:     }
    98:   }
    99: 
   100:   const pngOut = new PNG({ width, height });
   101:   pngOut.data = out;
   102:   return PNG.sync.write(pngOut);
   103: }
   104: 
   105: module.exports = { scramblePngBlocks, unscramblePngBlocks, makePermutation };

     1: /**
     2:  * @fileoverview Common error classes
     3:  * @author Nicholas C. Zakas
     4:  */
     5: 
     6: /**
     7:  * Error thrown when a file or directory is not found.
     8:  */
     9: export class NotFoundError extends Error {
    10: 	/**
    11: 	 * Name of the error class.
    12: 	 * @type {string}
    13: 	 */
    14: 	name = "NotFoundError";
    15: 
    16: 	/**
    17: 	 * Error code.
    18: 	 * @type {string}
    19: 	 */
    20: 	code = "ENOENT";
    21: 
    22: 	/**
    23: 	 * Creates a new instance.
    24: 	 * @param {string} message The error message.
    25: 	 */
    26: 	constructor(message) {
    27: 		super(`ENOENT: No such file or directory, ${message}`);
    28: 	}
    29: }

    53: 	}

============================
FILE: node_modules\@humanfs\core\src\hfs.js
============================
============================
     1: /**
     2:  * @fileoverview The main file for the humanfs package.
     3:  * @author Nicholas C. Zakas
     4:  */
     5: 
     6: /* global URL, TextDecoder, TextEncoder */
     7: 
     8: //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
     9: // Types
    10: //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
    11: 
    12: /** @typedef {import("@humanfs/types").HfsImpl} HfsImpl */
    13: /** @typedef {import("@humanfs/types").HfsDirectoryEntry} HfsDirectoryEntry */
    14: /** @typedef {import("@humanfs/types").HfsWalkEntry} HfsWalkEntry */
    15: 
    16: //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
    17: // Helpers
    18: //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
    19: 
    20: const decoder = new TextDecoder();
    21: const encoder = new TextEncoder();
    22: 
    23: /**
    24:  * Error to represent when a method is missing on an impl.
    25:  */
    26: export class NoSuchMethodError extends Error {
    27: 	/**
    28: 	 * Creates a new instance.
    29: 	 * @param {string} methodName The name of the method that was missing.
    30: 	 */
    31: 	constructor(methodName) {
    32: 		super(`Method "${methodName}" does not exist on impl.`);
    33: 	}
    34: }
    35: 
    36: /**
    37:  * Error to represent when a method is not supported on an impl. This happens
    38:  * when a method on `Hfs` is called with one name and the corresponding method
    39:  * on the impl has a different name. (Example: `text()` and `bytes()`.)
    40:  */
    41: export class MethodNotSupportedError extends Error {
    42: 	/**
    43: 	 * Creates a new instance.
    44: 	 * @param {string} methodName The name of the method that was missing.
    45: 	 */
    46: 	constructor(methodName) {
    47: 		super(`Method "${methodName}" is not supported on this impl.`);
    48: 	}
    49: }
    50: 
    51: /**
    52:  * Error to represent when an impl is already set.
    53:  */
    54: export class ImplAlreadySetError extends Error {
    55: 	/**
    56: 	 * Creates a new instance.
    57: 	 */
    58: 	constructor() {
    59: 		super(`Implementation already set.`);
    60: 	}
    61: }
    62: 
    63: /**
    64:  * Asserts that the given path is a valid file path.
    65:  * @param {any} fileOrDirPath The path to check.
    66:  * @returns {void}
    67:  * @throws {TypeError} When the path is not a non-empty string.
    68:  */
    69: function assertValidFileOrDirPath(fileOrDirPath) {
    70: 	if (
    71: 		!fileOrDirPath ||
    72: 		(!(fileOrDirPath instanceof URL) && typeof fileOrDirPath !== "string")
    73: 	) {
    74: 		throw new TypeError("Path must be a non-empty string or URL.");
    75: 	}
    76: }
    77: 
    78: /**
    79:  * Asserts that the given file contents are valid.
    80:  * @param {any} contents The contents to check.
    81:  * @returns {void}
    82:  * @throws {TypeError} When the contents are not a string or ArrayBuffer.
    83:  */
    84: function assertValidFileContents(contents) {
    85: 	if (
    86: 		typeof contents !== "string" &&
    87: 		!(contents instanceof ArrayBuffer) &&
    88: 		!ArrayBuffer.isView(contents)
    89: 	) {
    90: 		throw new TypeError(
    91: 			"File contents must be a string, ArrayBuffer, or ArrayBuffer view.",
    92: 		);
    93: 	}
    94: }
    95: 
    96: /**
    97:  * Converts the given contents to Uint8Array.
    98:  * @param {any} contents The data to convert.
    99:  * @returns {Uint8Array} The converted Uint8Array.
   100:  * @throws {TypeError} When the contents are not a string or ArrayBuffer.
   101:  */
   102: function toUint8Array(contents) {
   103: 	if (contents instanceof Uint8Array) {
   104: 		return contents;
   105: 	}
   106: 
   107: 	if (typeof contents === "string") {
   108: 		return encoder.encode(contents);
   109: 	}
   110: 
   111: 	if (contents instanceof ArrayBuffer) {
   112: 		return new Uint8Array(contents);
   113: 	}
   114: 
   115: 	if (ArrayBuffer.isView(contents)) {
   116: 		const bytes = contents.buffer.slice(
   117: 			contents.byteOffset,
   118: 			contents.byteOffset + contents.byteLength,
   119: 		);
   120: 		return new Uint8Array(bytes);
   121: 	}
   122: 	throw new TypeError(
   123: 		"Invalid contents type. Expected string or ArrayBuffer.",
   124: 	);
   125: }
   126: 
   127: //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
   128: // Exports
   129: //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
   130: 
   131: /**
   132:  * A class representing a log entry.
   133:  */
   134: export class LogEntry {
   135: 	/**
   136: 	 * The type of log entry.
   137: 	 * @type {string}
   138: 	 */
   139: 	type;
   140: 
   141: 	/**
   142: 	 * The data associated with the log entry.
   143: 	 * @type {any}
   144: 	 */
   145: 	data;
   146: 
   147: 	/**
   148: 	 * The time at which the log entry was created.
   149: 	 * @type {number}
   150: 	 */
   151: 	timestamp = Date.now();
   152: 
   153: 	/**
   154: 	 * Creates a new instance.
   155: 	 * @param {string} type The type of log entry.
   156: 	 * @param {any} [data] The data associated with the log entry.
   157: 	 */
   158: 	constructor(type, data) {
   159: 		this.type = type;
   160: 		this.data = data;
   161: 	}
   162: }
   163: 
   164: /**
   165:  * A class representing a file system utility library.
   166:  * @implements {HfsImpl}
   167:  */
   168: export class Hfs {
   169: 	/**
   170: 	 * The base implementation for this instance.
   171: 	 * @type {HfsImpl}
   172: 	 */
   173: 	#baseImpl;
   174: 
   175: 	/**
   176: 	 * The current implementation for this instance.
   177: 	 * @type {HfsImpl}
   178: 	 */
   179: 	#impl;
   180: 
   181: 	/**
   182: 	 * A map of log names to their corresponding entries.
   183: 	 * @type {Map<string,Array<LogEntry>>}
   184: 	 */
   185: 	#logs = new Map();
   186: 
   187: 	/**
   188: 	 * Creates a new instance.
   189: 	 * @param {object} options The options for the instance.
   190: 	 * @param {HfsImpl} options.impl The implementation to use.
   191: 	 */
   192: 	constructor({ impl }) {
   193: 		this.#baseImpl = impl;
   194: 		this.#impl = impl;
   195: 	}
   196: 
   197: 	/**
   198: 	 * Logs an entry onto all currently open logs.
   199: 	 * @param {string} methodName The name of the method being called.
   200: 	 * @param {...*} args The arguments to the method.
   201: 	 * @returns {void}
   202: 	 */
   203: 	#log(methodName, ...args) {
   204: 		for (const logs of this.#logs.values()) {
   205: 			logs.push(new LogEntry("call", { methodName, args }));
   206: 		}
   207: 	}
   208: 
   209: 	/**
   210: 	 * Starts a new log with the given name.
   211: 	 * @param {string} name The name of the log to start;
   212: 	 * @returns {void}
   213: 	 * @throws {Error} When the log already exists.
   214: 	 * @throws {TypeError} When the name is not a non-empty string.
   215: 	 */
   216: 	logStart(name) {
   217: 		if (!name || typeof name !== "string") {
   218: 			throw new TypeError("Log name must be a non-empty string.");
   219: 		}
   220: 
   221: 		if (this.#logs.has(name)) {
   222: 			throw new Error(`Log "${name}" already exists.`);
   223: 		}
   224: 
   225: 		this.#logs.set(name, []);
   226: 	}
   227: 
   228: 	/**
   229: 	 * Ends a log with the given name and returns the entries.
   230: 	 * @param {string} name The name of the log to end.
   231: 	 * @returns {Array<LogEntry>} The entries in the log.
   232: 	 * @throws {Error} When the log does not exist.
   233: 	 */
   234: 	logEnd(name) {
   235: 		if (this.#logs.has(name)) {
   236: 			const logs = this.#logs.get(name);
   237: 			this.#logs.delete(name);
   238: 			return logs;
   239: 		}
   240: 
   241: 		throw new Error(`Log "${name}" does not exist.`);
   242: 	}
   243: 
   244: 	/**
   245: 	 * Determines if the current implementation is the base implementation.
   246: 	 * @returns {boolean} True if the current implementation is the base implementation.
   247: 	 */
   248: 	isBaseImpl() {
   249: 		return this.#impl === this.#baseImpl;
   250: 	}
   251: 
   252: 	/**
   253: 	 * Sets the implementation for this instance.
   254: 	 * @param {object} impl The implementation to use.
   255: 	 * @returns {void}
   256: 	 */
   257: 	setImpl(impl) {
   258: 		this.#log("implSet", impl);
   259: 
   260: 		if (this.#impl !== this.#baseImpl) {
   261: 			throw new ImplAlreadySetError();
   262: 		}
   263: 
   264: 		this.#impl = impl;
   265: 	}
   266: 
   267: 	/**
   268: 	 * Resets the implementation for this instance back to its original.
   269: 	 * @returns {void}
   270: 	 */
   271: 	resetImpl() {
   272: 		this.#log("implReset");
   273: 		this.#impl = this.#baseImpl;
   274: 	}
   275: 
   276: 	/**
   277: 	 * Asserts that the given method exists on the current implementation.
   278: 	 * @param {string} methodName The name of the method to check.
   279: 	 * @returns {void}
   280: 	 * @throws {NoSuchMethodError} When the method does not exist on the current implementation.
   281: 	 */
   282: 	#assertImplMethod(methodName) {
   283: 		if (typeof this.#impl[methodName] !== "function") {
   284: 			throw new NoSuchMethodError(methodName);
   285: 		}
   286: 	}
   287: 
   288: 	/**
   289: 	 * Asserts that the given method exists on the current implementation, and if not,
   290: 	 * throws an error with a different method name.
   291: 	 * @param {string} methodName The name of the method to check.
   292: 	 * @param {string} targetMethodName The name of the method that should be reported
   293: 	 *  as an error when methodName does not exist.
   294: 	 * @returns {void}
   295: 	 * @throws {NoSuchMethodError} When the method does not exist on the current implementation.
   296: 	 */
   297: 	#assertImplMethodAlt(methodName, targetMethodName) {
   298: 		if (typeof this.#impl[methodName] !== "function") {
   299: 			throw new MethodNotSupportedError(targetMethodName);
   300: 		}
   301: 	}
   302: 
   303: 	/**
   304: 	 * Calls the given method on the current implementation.
   305: 	 * @param {string} methodName The name of the method to call.
   306: 	 * @param {...any} args The arguments to the method.
   307: 	 * @returns {any} The return value from the method.
   308: 	 * @throws {NoSuchMethodError} When the method does not exist on the current implementation.
   309: 	 */
   310: 	#callImplMethod(methodName, ...args) {
   311: 		this.#log(methodName, ...args);
   312: 		this.#assertImplMethod(methodName);
   313: 		return this.#impl[methodName](...args);
   314: 	}
   315: 
   316: 	/**
   317: 	 * Calls the given method on the current implementation and doesn't log the call.
   318: 	 * @param {string} methodName The name of the method to call.
   319: 	 * @param {...any} args The arguments to the method.
   320: 	 * @returns {any} The return value from the method.
   321: 	 * @throws {NoSuchMethodError} When the method does not exist on the current implementation.
   322: 	 */
   323: 	#callImplMethodWithoutLog(methodName, ...args) {
   324: 		this.#assertImplMethod(methodName);
   325: 		return this.#impl[methodName](...args);
   326: 	}
   327: 
   328: 	/**
   329: 	 * Calls the given method on the current implementation but logs a different method name.
   330: 	 * @param {string} methodName The name of the method to call.
   331: 	 * @param {string} targetMethodName The name of the method to log.
   332: 	 * @param {...any} args The arguments to the method.
   333: 	 * @returns {any} The return value from the method.
   334: 	 * @throws {NoSuchMethodError} When the method does not exist on the current implementation.
   335: 	 */
   336: 	#callImplMethodAlt(methodName, targetMethodName, ...args) {
   337: 		this.#log(targetMethodName, ...args);
   338: 		this.#assertImplMethodAlt(methodName, targetMethodName);
   339: 		return this.#impl[methodName](...args);
   340: 	}
   341: 
   342: 	/**
   343: 	 * Reads the given file and returns the contents as text. Assumes UTF-8 encoding.
   344: 	 * @param {string|URL} filePath The file to read.
   345: 	 * @returns {Promise<string|undefined>} The contents of the file.
   346: 	 * @throws {NoSuchMethodError} When the method does not exist on the current implementation.
   347: 	 * @throws {TypeError} When the file path is not a non-empty string.
   348: 	 */
   349: 	async text(filePath) {
   350: 		assertValidFileOrDirPath(filePath);
   351: 
   352: 		const result = await this.#callImplMethodAlt("bytes", "text", filePath);
   353: 		return result ? decoder.decode(result) : undefined;
   354: 	}
   355: 
   356: 	/**
   357: 	 * Reads the given file and returns the contents as JSON. Assumes UTF-8 encoding.
   358: 	 * @param {string|URL} filePath The file to read.
   359: 	 * @returns {Promise<any|undefined>} The contents of the file as JSON.
   360: 	 * @throws {NoSuchMethodError} When the method does not exist on the current implementation.
   361: 	 * @throws {SyntaxError} When the file contents are not valid JSON.
   362: 	 * @throws {TypeError} When the file path is not a non-empty string.
   363: 	 */
   364: 	async json(filePath) {
   365: 		assertValidFileOrDirPath(filePath);
   366: 
   367: 		const result = await this.#callImplMethodAlt("bytes", "json", filePath);
   368: 		return result ? JSON.parse(decoder.decode(result)) : undefined;
   369: 	}
   370: 
   371: 	/**
   372: 	 * Reads the given file and returns the contents as an ArrayBuffer.
   373: 	 * @param {string|URL} filePath The file to read.
   374: 	 * @returns {Promise<ArrayBuffer|undefined>} The contents of the file as an ArrayBuffer.
   375: 	 * @throws {NoSuchMethodError} When the method does not exist on the current implementation.
   376: 	 * @throws {TypeError} When the file path is not a non-empty string.
   377: 	 * @deprecated Use bytes() instead.
   378: 	 */
   379: 	async arrayBuffer(filePath) {
   380: 		assertValidFileOrDirPath(filePath);
   381: 
   382: 		const result = await this.#callImplMethodAlt(
   383: 			"bytes",
   384: 			"arrayBuffer",
   385: 			filePath,
   386: 		);
   387: 		return result?.buffer;
   388: 	}
   389: 
   390: 	/**
   391: 	 * Reads the given file and returns the contents as an Uint8Array.
   392: 	 * @param {string|URL} filePath The file to read.
   393: 	 * @returns {Promise<Uint8Array|undefined>} The contents of the file as an Uint8Array.
   394: 	 * @throws {NoSuchMethodError} When the method does not exist on the current implementation.
   395: 	 * @throws {TypeError} When the file path is not a non-empty string.
   396: 	 */
   397: 	async bytes(filePath) {
   398: 		assertValidFileOrDirPath(filePath);
   399: 		return this.#callImplMethod("bytes", filePath);
   400: 	}
   401: 
   402: 	/**
   403: 	 * Writes the given data to the given file. Creates any necessary directories along the way.
   404: 	 * If the data is a string, UTF-8 encoding is used.
   405: 	 * @param {string|URL} filePath The file to write.
   406: 	 * @param {string|ArrayBuffer|ArrayBufferView} contents The data to write.
   407: 	 * @returns {Promise<void>} A promise that resolves when the file is written.
   408: 	 * @throws {NoSuchMethodError} When the method does not exist on the current implementation.
   409: 	 * @throws {TypeError} When the file path is not a non-empty string.
   410: 	 */
   411: 	async write(filePath, contents) {
   412: 		assertValidFileOrDirPath(filePath);
   413: 		assertValidFileContents(contents);
   414: 		this.#log("write", filePath, contents);
   415: 
   416: 		let value = toUint8Array(contents);
   417: 		return this.#callImplMethodWithoutLog("write", filePath, value);
   418: 	}
   419: 
   420: 	/**
   421: 	 * Appends the given data to the given file. Creates any necessary directories along the way.
   422: 	 * If the data is a string, UTF-8 encoding is used.
   423: 	 * @param {string|URL} filePath The file to append to.
   424: 	 * @param {string|ArrayBuffer|ArrayBufferView} contents The data to append.
   425: 	 * @returns {Promise<void>} A promise that resolves when the file is appended to.
   426: 	 * @throws {NoSuchMethodError} When the method does not exist on the current implementation.
   427: 	 * @throws {TypeError} When the file path is not a non-empty string.
   428: 	 * @throws {TypeError} When the file contents are not a string or ArrayBuffer.
   429: 	 * @throws {Error} When the file cannot be appended to.
   430: 	 */
   431: 	async append(filePath, contents) {
   432: 		assertValidFileOrDirPath(filePath);
   433: 		assertValidFileContents(contents);
   434: 		this.#log("append", filePath, contents);
   435: 
   436: 		let value = toUint8Array(contents);
   437: 		return this.#callImplMethodWithoutLog("append", filePath, value);
   438: 	}
   439: 
   440: 	/**
   441: 	 * Determines if the given file exists.
   442: 	 * @param {string|URL} filePath The file to check.
   443: 	 * @returns {Promise<boolean>} True if the file exists.
   444: 	 * @throws {NoSuchMethodError} When the method does not exist on the current implementation.
   445: 	 * @throws {TypeError} When the file path is not a non-empty string.
   446: 	 */
   447: 	async isFile(filePath) {
   448: 		assertValidFileOrDirPath(filePath);
   449: 		return this.#callImplMethod("isFile", filePath);
   450: 	}
   451: 
   452: 	/**
   453: 	 * Determines if the given directory exists.
   454: 	 * @param {string|URL} dirPath The directory to check.
   455: 	 * @returns {Promise<boolean>} True if the directory exists.
   456: 	 * @throws {NoSuchMethodError} When the method does not exist on the current implementation.
   457: 	 * @throws {TypeError} When the directory path is not a non-empty string.
   458: 	 */
   459: 	async isDirectory(dirPath) {
   460: 		assertValidFileOrDirPath(dirPath);
   461: 		return this.#callImplMethod("isDirectory", dirPath);
   462: 	}
   463: 
   464: 	/**
   465: 	 * Creates the given directory.
   466: 	 * @param {string|URL} dirPath The directory to create.
   467: 	 * @returns {Promise<void>} A promise that resolves when the directory is created.
   468: 	 * @throws {NoSuchMethodError} When the method does not exist on the current implementation.
   469: 	 * @throws {TypeError} When the directory path is not a non-empty string.
   470: 	 */
   471: 	async createDirectory(dirPath) {
   472: 		assertValidFileOrDirPath(dirPath);
   473: 		return this.#callImplMethod("createDirectory", dirPath);
   474: 	}
   475: 
   476: 	/**
   477: 	 * Deletes the given file or empty directory.
   478: 	 * @param {string|URL} filePath The file to delete.
   479: 	 * @returns {Promise<boolean>} A promise that resolves when the file or
   480: 	 *   directory is deleted, true if the file or directory is deleted, false
   481: 	 *   if the file or directory does not exist.
   482: 	 * @throws {NoSuchMethodError} When the method does not exist on the current implementation.
   483: 	 * @throws {TypeError} When the file path is not a non-empty string.
   484: 	 */
   485: 	async delete(filePath) {
   486: 		assertValidFileOrDirPath(filePath);
   487: 		return this.#callImplMethod("delete", filePath);
   488: 	}
   489: 
   490: 	/**
   491: 	 * Deletes the given file or directory recursively.
   492: 	 * @param {string|URL} dirPath The directory to delete.
   493: 	 * @returns {Promise<boolean>} A promise that resolves when the file or
   494: 	 *   directory is deleted, true if the file or directory is deleted, false
   495: 	 *   if the file or directory does not exist.
   496: 	 * @throws {NoSuchMethodError} When the method does not exist on the current implementation.
   497: 	 * @throws {TypeError} When the directory path is not a non-empty string.
   498: 	 */
   499: 	async deleteAll(dirPath) {
   500: 		assertValidFileOrDirPath(dirPath);
   501: 		return this.#callImplMethod("deleteAll", dirPath);
   502: 	}
   503: 
   504: 	/**
   505: 	 * Returns a list of directory entries for the given path.
   506: 	 * @param {string|URL} dirPath The path to the directory to read.
   507: 	 * @returns {AsyncIterable<HfsDirectoryEntry>} A promise that resolves with the
   508: 	 *   directory entries.
   509: 	 * @throws {TypeError} If the directory path is not a string or URL.
   510: 	 * @throws {Error} If the directory cannot be read.
   511: 	 */
   512: 	async *list(dirPath) {
   513: 		assertValidFileOrDirPath(dirPath);
   514: 		yield* await this.#callImplMethod("list", dirPath);
   515: 	}
   516: 
   517: 	/**
   518: 	 * Walks a directory using a depth-first traversal and returns the entries
   519: 	 * from the traversal.
   520: 	 * @param {string|URL} dirPath The path to the directory to walk.
   521: 	 * @param {Object} [options] The options for the walk.
   522: 	 * @param {(entry:HfsWalkEntry) => Promise<boolean>|boolean} [options.directoryFilter] A filter function to determine
   523: 	 * 	if a directory's entries should be included in the walk.
   524: 	 * @param {(entry:HfsWalkEntry) => Promise<boolean>|boolean} [options.entryFilter] A filter function to determine if
   525: 	 * 	an entry should be included in the walk.
   526: 	 * @returns {AsyncIterable<HfsWalkEntry>} A promise that resolves with the
   527: 	 * 	directory entries.
   528: 	 * @throws {TypeError} If the directory path is not a string or URL.
   529: 	 * @throws {Error} If the directory cannot be read.
   530: 	 */
   531: 	async *walk(
   532: 		dirPath,
   533: 		{ directoryFilter = () => true, entryFilter = () => true } = {},
   534: 	) {
   535: 		assertValidFileOrDirPath(dirPath);
   536: 		this.#log("walk", dirPath, { directoryFilter, entryFilter });
   537: 
   538: 		// inner function for recursion without additional logging
   539: 		const walk = async function* (
   540: 			dirPath,
   541: 			{ directoryFilter, entryFilter, parentPath = "", depth = 1 },
   542: 		) {
   543: 			let dirEntries;
   544: 
   545: 			try {
   546: 				dirEntries = await this.#callImplMethodWithoutLog(
   547: 					"list",
   548: 					dirPath,
   549: 				);
   550: 			} catch (error) {
   551: 				// if the directory does not exist then return an empty array
   552: 				if (error.code === "ENOENT") {
   553: 					return;
   554: 				}
   555: 
   556: 				// otherwise, rethrow the error
   557: 				throw error;
   558: 			}
   559: 
   560: 			for await (const listEntry of dirEntries) {
   561: 				const walkEntry = {
   562: 					path: listEntry.name,
   563: 					depth,
   564: 					...listEntry,
   565: 				};
   566: 
   567: 				if (parentPath) {
   568: 					walkEntry.path = `${parentPath}/${walkEntry.path}`;
   569: 				}
   570: 
   571: 				// first emit the entry but only if the entry filter returns true
   572: 				let shouldEmitEntry = entryFilter(walkEntry);
   573: 				if (shouldEmitEntry.then) {
   574: 					shouldEmitEntry = await shouldEmitEntry;
   575: 				}
   576: 
   577: 				if (shouldEmitEntry) {
   578: 					yield walkEntry;
   579: 				}
   580: 
   581: 				// if it's a directory then yield the entry and walk the directory
   582: 				if (listEntry.isDirectory) {
   583: 					// if the directory filter returns false, skip the directory
   584: 					let shouldWalkDirectory = directoryFilter(walkEntry);
   585: 					if (shouldWalkDirectory.then) {
   586: 						shouldWalkDirectory = await shouldWalkDirectory;
   587: 					}
   588: 
   589: 					if (!shouldWalkDirectory) {
   590: 						continue;
   591: 					}
   592: 
   593: 					// make sure there's a trailing slash on the directory path before appending
   594: 					const directoryPath =
   595: 						dirPath instanceof URL
   596: 							? new URL(
   597: 									listEntry.name,
   598: 									dirPath.href.endsWith("/")
   599: 										? dirPath.href
   600: 										: `${dirPath.href}/`,
   601: 								)
   602: 							: `${dirPath.endsWith("/") ? dirPath : `${dirPath}/`}${listEntry.name}`;
   603: 
   604: 					yield* walk(directoryPath, {
   605: 						directoryFilter,
   606: 						entryFilter,
   607: 						parentPath: walkEntry.path,
   608: 						depth: depth + 1,
   609: 					});
   610: 				}
   611: 			}
   612: 		}.bind(this);
   613: 
   614: 		yield* walk(dirPath, { directoryFilter, entryFilter });
   615: 	}
   616: 
   617: 	/**
   618: 	 * Returns the size of the given file.
   619: 	 * @param {string|URL} filePath The path to the file to read.
   620: 	 * @returns {Promise<number>} A promise that resolves with the size of the file.
   621: 	 * @throws {TypeError} If the file path is not a string or URL.
   622: 	 * @throws {Error} If the file cannot be read.
   623: 	 */
   624: 	async size(filePath) {
   625: 		assertValidFileOrDirPath(filePath);
   626: 		return this.#callImplMethod("size", filePath);
   627: 	}
   628: 
   629: 	/**
   630: 	 * Returns the last modified timestamp of the given file or directory.
   631: 	 * @param {string|URL} fileOrDirPath The path to the file or directory.
   632: 	 * @returns {Promise<Date|undefined>} A promise that resolves with the last modified date
   633: 	 *  or undefined if the file or directory does not exist.
   634: 	 * @throws {TypeError} If the path is not a string or URL.
   635: 	 */
   636: 	async lastModified(fileOrDirPath) {
   637: 		assertValidFileOrDirPath(fileOrDirPath);
   638: 		return this.#callImplMethod("lastModified", fileOrDirPath);
   639: 	}
   640: 
   641: 	/**
   642: 	 * Copys a file from one location to another.
   643: 	 * @param {string|URL} source The path to the file to copy.
   644: 	 * @param {string|URL} destination The path to the new file.
   645: 	 * @returns {Promise<void>} A promise that resolves when the file is copied.
   646: 	 * @throws {TypeError} If the file path is not a string or URL.
   647: 	 * @throws {Error} If the file cannot be copied.
   648: 	 */
   649: 	async copy(source, destination) {
   650: 		assertValidFileOrDirPath(source);
   651: 		assertValidFileOrDirPath(destination);
   652: 		return this.#callImplMethod("copy", source, destination);
   653: 	}
   654: 
   655: 	/**
   656: 	 * Copies a file or directory from one location to another.
   657: 	 * @param {string|URL} source The path to the file or directory to copy.
   658: 	 * @param {string|URL} destination The path to copy the file or directory to.
   659: 	 * @returns {Promise<void>} A promise that resolves when the file or directory is
   660: 	 * copied.
   661: 	 * @throws {TypeError} If the directory path is not a string or URL.
   662: 	 * @throws {Error} If the directory cannot be copied.
   663: 	 */
   664: 	async copyAll(source, destination) {
   665: 		assertValidFileOrDirPath(source);
   666: 		assertValidFileOrDirPath(destination);
   667: 		return this.#callImplMethod("copyAll", source, destination);
   668: 	}
   669: 
   670: 	/**
   671: 	 * Moves a file from the source path to the destination path.
   672: 	 * @param {string|URL} source The location of the file to move.
   673: 	 * @param {string|URL} destination The destination of the file to move.
   674: 	 * @returns {Promise<void>} A promise that resolves when the move is complete.
   675: 	 * @throws {TypeError} If the file or directory paths are not strings.
   676: 	 * @throws {Error} If the file or directory cannot be moved.
   677: 	 */
   678: 	async move(source, destination) {
   679: 		assertValidFileOrDirPath(source);
   680: 		assertValidFileOrDirPath(destination);
   681: 		return this.#callImplMethod("move", source, destination);
   682: 	}
   683: 
   684: 	/**
   685: 	 * Moves a file or directory from one location to another.
   686: 	 * @param {string|URL} source The path to the file or directory to move.
   687: 	 * @param {string|URL} destination The path to move the file or directory to.
   688: 	 * @returns {Promise<void>} A promise that resolves when the file or directory is
   689: 	 * moved.
   690: 	 * @throws {TypeError} If the source is not a string or URL.
   691: 	 * @throws {TypeError} If the destination is not a string or URL.
   692: 	 * @throws {Error} If the file or directory cannot be moved.
   693: 	 */
   694: 	async moveAll(source, destination) {
   695: 		assertValidFileOrDirPath(source);
   696: 		assertValidFileOrDirPath(destination);
   697: 		return this.#callImplMethod("moveAll", source, destination);
   698: 	}
   699: }

     2:  * @fileoverview API entrypoint for hfs/core
     3:  * @author Nicholas C. Zakas

     5:

     7: export { Path } from "./path.js";
     8: export * from "./errors.js";


============================
FILE: node_modules\@humanfs\core\src\path.js
============================
============================
     1: /**
     2:  * @fileoverview The Path class.
     3:  * @author Nicholas C. Zakas
     4:  */
     5: 
     6: /* globals URL */
     7: 
     8: //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
     9: // Types
    10: //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
    11: 
    12: /** @typedef{import("@humanfs/types").HfsImpl} HfsImpl */
    13: /** @typedef{import("@humanfs/types").HfsDirectoryEntry} HfsDirectoryEntry */
    14: 
    15: //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
    16: // Helpers
    17: //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
    18: 
    19: /**
    20:  * Normalizes a path to use forward slashes.
    21:  * @param {string} filePath The path to normalize.
    22:  * @returns {string} The normalized path.
    23:  */
    24: function normalizePath(filePath) {
    25: 	let startIndex = 0;
    26: 	let endIndex = filePath.length;
    27: 
    28: 	if (/[a-z]:\//i.test(filePath)) {
    29: 		startIndex = 3;
    30: 	}
    31: 
    32: 	if (filePath.startsWith("./")) {
    33: 		startIndex = 2;
    34: 	}
    35: 
    36: 	if (filePath.startsWith("/")) {
    37: 		startIndex = 1;
    38: 	}
    39: 
    40: 	if (filePath.endsWith("/")) {
    41: 		endIndex = filePath.length - 1;
    42: 	}
    43: 
    44: 	return filePath.slice(startIndex, endIndex).replace(/\\/g, "/");
    45: }
    46: 
    47: /**
    48:  * Asserts that the given name is a non-empty string, no equal to "." or "..",
    49:  * and does not contain a forward slash or backslash.
    50:  * @param {string} name The name to check.
    51:  * @returns {void}
    52:  * @throws {TypeError} When name is not valid.
    53:  */
    54: function assertValidName(name) {
    55: 	if (typeof name !== "string") {
    56: 		throw new TypeError("name must be a string");
    57: 	}
    58: 
    59: 	if (!name) {
    60: 		throw new TypeError("name cannot be empty");
    61: 	}
    62: 
    63: 	if (name === ".") {
    64: 		throw new TypeError(`name cannot be "."`);
    65: 	}
    66: 
    67: 	if (name === "..") {
    68: 		throw new TypeError(`name cannot be ".."`);
    69: 	}
    70: 
    71: 	if (name.includes("/") || name.includes("\\")) {
    72: 		throw new TypeError(
    73: 			`name cannot contain a slash or backslash: "${name}"`,
    74: 		);
    75: 	}
    76: }
    77: 
    78: //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
    79: // Exports
    80: //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
    81: 
    82: export class Path {
    83: 	/**
    84: 	 * The steps in the path.
    85: 	 * @type {Array<string>}
    86: 	 */
    87: 	#steps;
    88: 
    89: 	/**
    90: 	 * Creates a new instance.
    91: 	 * @param {Iterable<string>} [steps] The steps to use for the path.
    92: 	 * @throws {TypeError} When steps is not iterable.
    93: 	 */
    94: 	constructor(steps = []) {
    95: 		if (typeof steps[Symbol.iterator] !== "function") {
    96: 			throw new TypeError("steps must be iterable");
    97: 		}
    98: 
    99: 		this.#steps = [...steps];
   100: 		this.#steps.forEach(assertValidName);
   101: 	}
   102: 
   103: 	/**
   104: 	 * Adds steps to the end of the path.
   105: 	 * @param  {...string} steps The steps to add to the path.
   106: 	 * @returns {void}
   107: 	 */
   108: 	push(...steps) {
   109: 		steps.forEach(assertValidName);
   110: 		this.#steps.push(...steps);
   111: 	}
   112: 
   113: 	/**
   114: 	 * Removes the last step from the path.
   115: 	 * @returns {string} The last step in the path.
   116: 	 */
   117: 	pop() {
   118: 		return this.#steps.pop();
   119: 	}
   120: 
   121: 	/**
   122: 	 * Returns an iterator for steps in the path.
   123: 	 * @returns {IterableIterator<string>} An iterator for the steps in the path.
   124: 	 */
   125: 	steps() {
   126: 		return this.#steps.values();
   127: 	}
   128: 
   129: 	/**
   130: 	 * Returns an iterator for the steps in the path.
   131: 	 * @returns {IterableIterator<string>} An iterator for the steps in the path.
   132: 	 */
   133: 	[Symbol.iterator]() {
   134: 		return this.steps();
   135: 	}
   136: 
   137: 	/**
   138: 	 * Retrieves the name (the last step) of the path.
   139: 	 * @type {string}
   140: 	 */
   141: 	get name() {
   142: 		return this.#steps[this.#steps.length - 1];
   143: 	}
   144: 
   145: 	/**
   146: 	 * Sets the name (the last step) of the path.
   147: 	 * @type {string}
   148: 	 */
   149: 	set name(value) {
   150: 		assertValidName(value);
   151: 		this.#steps[this.#steps.length - 1] = value;
   152: 	}
   153: 
   154: 	/**
   155: 	 * Retrieves the size of the path.
   156: 	 * @type {number}
   157: 	 */
   158: 	get size() {
   159: 		return this.#steps.length;
   160: 	}
   161: 
   162: 	/**
   163: 	 * Returns the path as a string.
   164: 	 * @returns {string} The path as a string.
   165: 	 */
   166: 	toString() {
   167: 		return this.#steps.join("/");
   168: 	}
   169: 
   170: 	/**
   171: 	 * Creates a new path based on the argument type. If the argument is a string,
   172: 	 * it is assumed to be a file or directory path and is converted to a Path
   173: 	 * instance. If the argument is a URL, it is assumed to be a file URL and is
   174: 	 * converted to a Path instance. If the argument is a Path instance, it is
   175: 	 * copied into a new Path instance. If the argument is an array, it is assumed
   176: 	 * to be the steps of a path and is used to create a new Path instance.
   177: 	 * @param {string|URL|Path|Array<string>} pathish The value to convert to a Path instance.
   178: 	 * @returns {Path} A new Path instance.
   179: 	 * @throws {TypeError} When pathish is not a string, URL, Path, or Array.
   180: 	 * @throws {TypeError} When pathish is a string and is empty.
   181: 	 */
   182: 	static from(pathish) {
   183: 		if (typeof pathish === "string") {
   184: 			if (!pathish) {
   185: 				throw new TypeError("argument cannot be empty");
   186: 			}
   187: 
   188: 			return Path.fromString(pathish);
   189: 		}
   190: 
   191: 		if (pathish instanceof URL) {
   192: 			return Path.fromURL(pathish);
   193: 		}
   194: 
   195: 		if (pathish instanceof Path || Array.isArray(pathish)) {
   196: 			return new Path(pathish);
   197: 		}
   198: 
   199: 		throw new TypeError("argument must be a string, URL, Path, or Array");
   200: 	}
   201: 
   202: 	/**
   203: 	 * Creates a new Path instance from a string.
   204: 	 * @param {string} fileOrDirPath The file or directory path to convert.
   205: 	 * @returns {Path} A new Path instance.
   206: 	 * @deprecated Use Path.from() instead.
   207: 	 */
   208: 	static fromString(fileOrDirPath) {
   209: 		return new Path(normalizePath(fileOrDirPath).split("/"));
   210: 	}
   211: 
   212: 	/**
   213: 	 * Creates a new Path instance from a URL.
   214: 	 * @param {URL} url The URL to convert.
   215: 	 * @returns {Path} A new Path instance.
   216: 	 * @throws {TypeError} When url is not a URL instance.
   217: 	 * @throws {TypeError} When url.pathname is empty.
   218: 	 * @throws {TypeError} When url.protocol is not "file:".
   219: 	 * @deprecated Use Path.from() instead.
   220: 	 */
   221: 	static fromURL(url) {
   222: 		if (!(url instanceof URL)) {
   223: 			throw new TypeError("url must be a URL instance");
   224: 		}
   225: 
   226: 		if (!url.pathname || url.pathname === "/") {
   227: 			throw new TypeError("url.pathname cannot be empty");
   228: 		}
   229: 
   230: 		if (url.protocol !== "file:") {
   231: 			throw new TypeError(`url.protocol must be "file:"`);
   232: 		}
   233: 
   234: 		// Remove leading slash in pathname
   235: 		return new Path(normalizePath(url.pathname.slice(1)).split("/"));
   236: 	}
   237: }


============================

     1: /**
