============================
FILE: qflush\src\chain\smartChain.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { logger } from "../utils/logger";
     2: import { runDetect } from "../commands/detect";
     3: import { runConfig } from "../commands/config";
     4: import { runPurge } from "../commands/purge";
     5: import { runKill } from "../commands/kill";
     6: import { runStart } from "../commands/start";
     7: import { runExodia } from "../commands/exodia";
     8: 
     9: const ORDER = ["detect", "config", "purge", "kill", "start", "exodia"];
    10: 
    11: export type QFlashOptions = {
    12:   global?: Record<string, any>;
    13:   modulePaths?: Record<string, string>;
    14:   tokens?: Record<string, string>;
    15:   flags?: Record<string, boolean | string>;
    16:   detected?: Record<string, any>;
    17:   services?: string[];
    18: };
    19: 
    20: function parseArgs(argv: string[]) {
    21:   const cmds: string[] = [];
    22:   const flags: Record<string, boolean | string> = {};
    23:   const modulePaths: Record<string, string> = {};
    24:   const tokens: Record<string, string> = {};
    25:   const services: string[] = [];
    26: 
    27:   let currentService: string | undefined;
    28:   let i = 0;
    29:   while (i < argv.length) {
    30:     const a = argv[i];
    31:     if (!a.startsWith("-")) {
    32:       cmds.push(a.toLowerCase());
    33:       i++;
    34:       continue;
    35:     }
    36:     const clean = a.replace(/^--?/, "");
    37: 
    38:     if (clean === "service" || clean === "s") {
    39:       const next = argv[i + 1];
    40:       if (next && !next.startsWith("-")) {
    41:         currentService = next.toLowerCase();
    42:         services.push(currentService);
    43:         i += 2;
    44:         continue;
    45:       } else {
    46:         i++;
    47:         continue;
    48:       }
    49:     }
    50: 
    51:     if (clean === "path") {
    52:       const next = argv[i + 1];
    53:       if (next && !next.startsWith("-")) {
    54:         if (currentService) modulePaths[currentService] = next;
    55:         i += 2;
    56:         continue;
    57:       }
    58:       i++;
    59:       continue;
    60:     }
    61: 
    62:     if (clean === "token") {
    63:       const next = argv[i + 1];
    64:       if (next && !next.startsWith("-")) {
    65:         if (currentService) tokens[currentService] = next;
    66:         i += 2;
    67:         continue;
    68:       }
    69:       i++;
    70:       continue;
    71:     }
    72: 
    73:     const kv = clean.split("=");
    74:     if (kv.length === 2) {
    75:       flags[kv[0]] = kv[1];
    76:       i++;
    77:       continue;
    78:     }
    79: 
    80:     const next = argv[i + 1];
    81:     if (next && !next.startsWith("-")) {
    82:       flags[clean] = next;
    83:       i += 2;
    84:       continue;
    85:     }
    86:     flags[clean] = true;
    87:     i++;
    88:   }
    89: 
    90:   return { cmds, flags, modulePaths, tokens, services };
    91: }
    92: 
    93: export function buildPipeline(argv: string[]) {
    94:   const { cmds, flags, modulePaths, tokens, services } = parseArgs(argv);
    95:   const unique = Array.from(new Set(cmds));
    96:   const known = unique.filter((c) => ORDER.includes(c));
    97: 
    98:   if (known.length === 0)
    99:     return {
   100:       pipeline: ["detect", "config", "start"],
   101:       options: { flags, modulePaths, tokens, global: {} as any, services },
   102:     };
   103: 
   104:   // build set with dependencies
   105:   const set = new Set<string>(known);
   106:   // dependencies mapping
   107:   const deps: Record<string, string[]> = {
   108:     start: ["config"],
   109:     config: ["detect"],
   110:     purge: ["detect"],
   111:   };
   112: 
   113:   // add dependencies recursively
   114:   function addDeps(cmd: string) {
   115:     const ds = deps[cmd] || [];
   116:     for (const d of ds) {
   117:       if (!set.has(d)) {
   118:         set.add(d);
   119:         addDeps(d);
   120:       }
   121:     }
   122:   }
   123:   for (const k of Array.from(set)) addDeps(k);
   124: 
   125:   let final: string[] = [];
   126: 
   127:   // Flag-driven transformations
   128:   if (flags["fresh"]) {
   129:     set.add("purge");
   130:     // ensure purge runs before start
   131:   }
   132:   if (flags["force"]) {
   133:     // make sure kill runs before start
   134:     set.add("kill");
   135:   }
   136: 
   137:   const requestedKill = known.includes("kill");
   138: 
   139:   if (requestedKill) {
   140:     // put kill first if user explicitly requested it
   141:     final.push("kill");
   142:     for (const k of ORDER) {
   143:       if (k === "kill") continue;
   144:       if (set.has(k)) final.push(k);
   145:     }
   146:   } else {
   147:     for (const k of ORDER) {
   148:       if (set.has(k)) final.push(k);
   149:     }
   150:   }
   151: 
   152:   // remove duplicates and preserve order
   153:   final = final.filter((v, i) => final.indexOf(v) === i);
   154: 
   155:   logger.info(`SmartChain built pipeline: ${final.join(" -> ")}`);
   156:   const options: QFlashOptions = { global: {}, flags, modulePaths, tokens, services };
   157:   return { pipeline: final, options };
   158: }
   159: 
   160: export async function executePipeline(pipeline: string[], options: QFlashOptions) {
   161:   for (const step of pipeline) {
   162:     logger.info(`Executing pipeline step: ${step}`);
   163:     switch (step) {
   164:       case "detect": {
   165:         const detected = await runDetect(options);
   166:         options.detected = detected || {};
   167:         if (detected && typeof detected === "object") {
   168:           options.modulePaths = { ...(options.modulePaths || {}), ...(detected.paths || {}) };
   169:         }
   170:         break;
   171:       }
   172:       case "config":
   173:         await runConfig(options);
   174:         break;
   175:       case "purge":
   176:         await runPurge(options);
   177:         break;
   178:       case "kill":
   179:         await runKill(options);
   180:         break;
   181:       case "start":
   182:         await runStart(options);
   183:         break;
   184:       case "exodia":
   185:         await runExodia(options);
   186:         break;
   187:       default:
   188:         logger.warn(`Unknown pipeline step: ${step}`);
   189:     }
   190:   }
   191: }

FILE: qflush\src\cli\help.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { logger } from "../utils/logger";
     2: 
     3: export function showHelp() {
     4:   logger.info(`qflash - Funesterie orchestrator`);
     5:   console.log(`
     6: Usage:
     7:   qflash [command] [options]
     8: 
     9: Commands:
    10:   start        Launch selected services (default: detect → config → start)
    11:   kill         Kill running services
    12:   purge        Clear caches, logs and sessions
    13:   inspect      Show running services and ports
    14:   config       Generate missing .env/config files
    15: 
    16: Options (examples):
    17:   --service rome --path D:/rome --token ABC123     Target a specific service and give path/token
    18:   --service nezlephant --service freeland          Target multiple services
    19:   --dev --fresh                                    Global flags (dev mode, fresh start)
    20:   --force                                          Force restart semantics (implies kill before start)
    21: 
    22: Examples:
    23:   qflash start --service rome --path D:/rome
    24:   qflash start --service nezlephant --service freeland --fresh
    25:   qflash config --service freeland
    26:   qflash purge --fresh
    27: 
    28: `);
    29: }


============================
FILE: qflush\src\commands\compose.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { readCompose } from '../compose/parser';
     2: import { logger } from '../utils/logger';
     3: import { runStart } from './start';
     4: import { startProcess, listRunning } from '../supervisor';
     5: import { runPurge } from './purge';
     6: import fs from 'fs';
     7: import { Tail } from 'tail';
     8: 
     9: export async function runCompose(argv: string[]) {
    10:   const sub = argv[0];
    11:   const compose = readCompose();
    12:   if (!compose) {
    13:     logger.error('No funesterie.yml or funesterie.fcl found');
    14:     return;
    15:   }
    16:   if (sub === 'up') {
    17:     // support --background flag
    18:     const bg = argv.includes('--background') || argv.includes('-b');
    19:     const modules = Object.keys(compose.modules);
    20:     for (const m of modules) {
    21:       const def = compose.modules[m];
    22:       logger.info(`Bringing up ${m} from ${def.path || 'package'}`);
    23:       if (bg) {
    24:         // start in background using supervisor
    25:         const logPath = `${process.cwd()}/.qflash/logs/${m}.log`;
    26:         startProcess(m, def.path || m, [], { cwd: def.path || process.cwd(), detached: true, logPath });
    27:       } else {
    28:         await runStart({ services: [m], modulePaths: { [m]: def.path }, flags: {} } as any);
    29:       }
    30:     }
    31:     return;
    32:   }
    33:   if (sub === 'down') {
    34:     logger.info('Bringing down all modules');
    35:     await runPurge();
    36:     return;
    37:   }
    38:   if (sub === 'restart') {
    39:     const name = argv[1];
    40:     if (!name) {
    41:       logger.info('Specify module to restart');
    42:       return;
    43:     }
    44:     // naive: stop and start
    45:     const running = listRunning();
    46:     if (running.find(r => r.name === name)) {
    47:       // stop
    48:       await import('../supervisor').then(s => s.stopProcess(name));
    49:     }
    50:     const def = compose.modules[name];
    51:     if (!def) { logger.info('Unknown module'); return; }
    52:     await runStart({ services: [name], modulePaths: { [name]: def.path }, flags: {} } as any);
    53:     return;
    54:   }
    55:   if (sub === 'logs') {
    56:     const name = argv[1];
    57:     if (!name) { logger.info('Specify module name'); return; }
    58:     const logFile = `${process.cwd()}/.qflash/logs/${name}.log`;
    59:     if (!fs.existsSync(logFile)) { logger.info('No log file found'); return; }
    60:     const t = new Tail(logFile, { fromBeginning: false, retry: true });
    61:     t.on('line', (data: any) => console.log(data));
    62:     t.on('error', (err: any) => console.error(err));
    63:     return;
    64:   }
    65:   logger.info('Usage: qflash compose [up|down|restart|logs]');
    66: }


============================
FILE: qflush\src\commands\config.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { promises as fs } from "fs";
     2: import { logger } from "../utils/logger";
     3: import { resolvePaths } from "../utils/paths";
     4: import { QFlashOptions } from "../chain/smartChain";
     5: 
     6: export async function runConfig(opts?: QFlashOptions) {
     7:   logger.info("qflash: generating default configs...");
     8:   const detected = opts?.detected || {};
     9:   const paths = resolvePaths(detected);
    10:   for (const key of Object.keys(paths)) {
    11:     const p = paths[key];
    12:     if (!p) continue;
    13:     const envFile = `${p}/.env`;
    14:     try {
    15:       await fs.access(envFile);
    16:       logger.info(`${key}: .env already exists`);
    17:     } catch {
    18:       const content = `# ${key} default env\nPORT=3000\nTOKEN=changeme\n`;
    19:       await fs.mkdir(p, { recursive: true });
    20:       await fs.writeFile(envFile, content, { encoding: "utf8" });
    21:       logger.success(`Created ${envFile}`);
    22:     }
    23:   }
    24: }


============================
FILE: qflush\src\commands\detect.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { detectModules } from "../utils/detect";
     2: import { logger } from "../utils/logger";
     3: import { QFlashOptions } from "../chain/smartChain";
     4: 
     5: export async function runDetect(_opts?: QFlashOptions) {
     6:   logger.info("qflash: detecting modules...");
     7:   const detected = await detectModules();
     8:   for (const k of Object.keys(detected)) {
     9:     const v = detected[k];
    10:     logger.info(`${k}: ${v.running ? 'running' : 'stopped'}`);
    11:   }
    12:   // return a normalized object
    13:   return { detected, paths: {} };
    14: }

FILE: qflush\src\commands\doctor.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { logger } from '../utils/logger';
     2: import { detectModules } from '../utils/detect';
     3: import { httpProbe } from '../utils/health';
     4: import { SERVICE_MAP } from '../utils/paths';
     5: import { ensurePackageInstalled } from '../utils/exec';
     6: 
     7: export async function runDoctor(argv: string[] = []) {
     8:   const fix = argv.includes('--fix') || argv.includes('-f');
     9: 
    10:   logger.info('qflash: running doctor checks...');
    11:   const detected = await detectModules();
    12:   for (const k of Object.keys(detected)) {
    13:     const v = detected[k];
    14:     logger.info(`${k}: installed=${v.installed} running=${v.running} path=${v.path || 'n/a'}`);
    15:     if (v.bin && v.path) {
    16:       logger.info(`  bin: ${v.bin}`);
    17:     }
    18:   }
    19: 
    20:   // check node version
    21:   logger.info(`Node version: ${process.version}`);
    22: 
    23:   // simple http check example
    24:   const httpOk = await httpProbe('http://localhost:80', 500);
    25:   logger.info(`HTTP localhost:80 reachable: ${httpOk}`);
    26: 
    27:   if (fix) {
    28:     logger.info('Doctor fix: attempting to install missing Funeste38 packages...');
    29:     for (const name of Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP)) {
    30:       const pkg = SERVICE_MAP[name].pkg;
    31:       const detectedInfo = detected[name];
    32:       if (!detectedInfo || !detectedInfo.installed) {
    33:         logger.info(`Installing ${pkg} for service ${name}...`);
    34:         const ok = ensurePackageInstalled(pkg);
    35:         if (ok) logger.success(`Installed ${pkg}`);
    36:         else logger.warn(`Failed to install ${pkg}`);
    37:       } else {
    38:         logger.info(`${pkg} already installed`);
    39:       }
    40:     }
    41:   }
    42: 
    43:   logger.info('Doctor checks complete');
    44: }

============================
FILE: qflush\src\commands\inspect.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { logger } from "../utils/logger";
     2: import { detectModules } from "../utils/detect";
     3: import { listRunning } from "../supervisor";
     4: import { QFlashOptions } from "../chain/smartChain";
     5: 
     6: export async function runInspect(opts?: QFlashOptions) {
     7:   logger.info("qflash: inspecting ecosystem...");
     8:   const detected = opts?.detected || (await detectModules());
     9:   for (const key of Object.keys(detected)) {
    10:     const v = detected[key];
    11:     logger.info(`${key}: ${v.running ? `running (pid=${v.pid || 'unknown'})` : 'stopped'}`);
    12:     if (v.port) logger.info(`  port: ${v.port}`);
    13:     if (v.installed) logger.info(`  installed: true`);
    14:   }
    15:   const running = listRunning();
    16:   if (running.length) {
    17:     logger.info("Supervisor running processes:");
    18:     for (const r of running) logger.info(`  ${r.name}: pid=${r.pid} cmd=${r.cmd}`);
    19:   }
    20: }


============================
FILE: qflush\src\commands\kill.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { logger } from "../utils/logger";
     2: import { findAndKill } from "../utils/detect";
     3: import { stopAll } from "../supervisor";
     4: import { QFlashOptions } from "../chain/smartChain";
     5: 
     6: export async function runKill(_opts?: QFlashOptions) {
     7:   logger.info("qflash: killing modules...");
     8:   const killed = await findAndKill();
     9:   stopAll();
    10:   logger.info(`Killed ${killed.length} processes`);
    11: }


============================
FILE: qflush\src\commands\purge.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { logger } from "../utils/logger";
     2: import { resolvePaths } from "../utils/paths";
     3: import { rimrafSync } from "../utils/exec";
     4: import { clearState } from "../supervisor";
     5: import { QFlashOptions } from "../chain/smartChain";
     6: 
     7: export async function runPurge(opts?: QFlashOptions) {
     8:   logger.info("qflash: purging caches, logs, sessions and supervisor state...");
     9:   const paths = resolvePaths(opts?.detected || {});
    10:   const targets = [] as string[];
    11:   for (const key of Object.keys(paths)) {
    12:     const p = paths[key];
    13:     if (!p) continue;
    14:     targets.push(`${p}/.cache`);
    15:     targets.push(`${p}/logs`);
    16:     targets.push(`${p}/tmp`);
    17:     targets.push(`${p}/sessions`);
    18:   }
    19:   for (const t of targets) {
    20:     try {
    21:       rimrafSync(t);
    22:       logger.success(`Removed ${t}`);
    23:     } catch (err) {
    24:       logger.warn(`Failed to remove ${t}: ${err}`);
    25:     }
    26:   }
    27:   // clear supervisor state
    28:   clearState();
    29:   logger.info("Purge complete.");
    30: }


============================
FILE: qflush\src\commands\start.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { detectModules } from "../utils/detect";
     2: import { logger } from "../utils/logger";
     3: import { spawnSafe, ensurePackageInstalled, pathExists, rebuildInstructionsFor } from "../utils/exec";
     4: import { resolvePaths, SERVICE_MAP } from "../utils/paths";
     5: import { QFlashOptions } from "../chain/smartChain";
     6: import { resolvePackagePath, readPackageJson } from "../utils/package";
     7: import { startProcess } from "../supervisor";
     8: import { waitForService } from "../utils/health";
     9: 
    10: export async function runStart(opts?: QFlashOptions) {
    11:   logger.info("qflash: starting modules...");
    12:   const detected = opts?.detected || (await detectModules());
    13:   const paths = resolvePaths(detected);
    14: 
    15:   const services = opts?.services && opts.services.length ? opts.services : Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP);
    16:   const flags = opts?.flags || {};
    17: 
    18:   const waitForStart = Boolean(flags["wait"] || flags["--wait"] || false);
    19:   const doRestart = Boolean(flags["restart"] || flags["--restart"] || flags["force"] || false);
    20:   const maxRestarts = typeof flags["restartCount"] === "number" ? (flags["restartCount"] as number) : 3;
    21: 
    22:   const procs: Promise<void>[] = [];
    23: 
    24:   for (const mod of services) {
    25:     const promise = (async () => {
    26:       const p = (opts?.modulePaths && opts.modulePaths[mod]) || paths[mod];
    27:       const pkg = SERVICE_MAP[mod] && SERVICE_MAP[mod].pkg;
    28: 
    29:       // resolve package path (local node_modules or provided path)
    30:       let pkgPath = p;
    31:       if (!pkgPath && pkg) pkgPath = resolvePackagePath(pkg);
    32: 
    33:       if (!pkgPath && pkg) {
    34:         const ok = ensurePackageInstalled(pkg);
    35:         if (!ok) {
    36:           logger.warn(`${mod} not found and failed to install ${pkg}, skipping`);
    37:           return;
    38:         }
    39:         pkgPath = resolvePackagePath(pkg);
    40:       }
    41: 
    42:       if (!pkgPath) {
    43:         logger.warn(`${mod} path and package not found, skipping`);
    44:         return;
    45:       }
    46: 
    47:       const pkgJson = readPackageJson(pkgPath);
    48: 
    49:       // choose how to run: package bin if present, else npx <pkg>
    50:       let runCmd: { cmd: string; args: string[]; cwd?: string } | null = null;
    51:       if (pkgJson && pkgJson.bin) {
    52:         const binEntry = typeof pkgJson.bin === "string" ? pkgJson.bin : Object.values(pkgJson.bin)[0];
    53:         const binPath = require("path").join(pkgPath, binEntry);
    54: 
    55:         // prefer running via node when bin is a JS file inside package
    56:         if (binPath.endsWith(".js") && pathExists(binPath)) {
    57:           runCmd = { cmd: process.execPath, args: [binPath], cwd: pkgPath };
    58:         } else if (pathExists(binPath)) {
    59:           runCmd = { cmd: binPath, args: [], cwd: pkgPath };
    60:         } else {
    61:           logger.warn(`${mod} bin entry not found at ${binPath}. ${rebuildInstructionsFor(pkgPath)}`);
    62:           return;
    63:         }
    64:       } else if (pkg) {
    65:         // fallback to npx but warn about potential npx execution failures
    66:         logger.warn(`${mod} has no local bin; will run via npx which may fail if package not globally installed.`);
    67:         runCmd = { cmd: "npx", args: [pkg], cwd: process.cwd() };
    68:       }
    69: 
    70:       if (!runCmd) {
    71:         logger.warn(`${mod} has no runnable entry, skipping`);
    72:         return;
    73:       }
    74: 
    75:       let restarts = 0;
    76: 
    77:       const spawnOnce = (): Promise<void> => {
    78:         return new Promise((resolve) => {
    79:           logger.info(`Launching ${mod} -> ${runCmd!.cmd} ${runCmd!.args.join(" ")}`);
    80: 
    81:           // use supervisor to manage and persist process
    82:           const child = startProcess(mod, runCmd!.cmd, runCmd!.args, { cwd: runCmd!.cwd });
    83: 
    84:           if (waitForStart) {
    85:             // try to wait for a health endpoint if provided in flags
    86:             const svcUrl = flags["health-url"] || flags["health"];
    87:             const svcPort = flags["health-port"] || undefined;
    88:             if (svcUrl) {
    89:               waitForService(svcUrl as string, svcPort as any).then((ok) => {
    90:                 if (ok) logger.success(`${mod} passed health check`);
    91:                 else logger.warn(`${mod} failed health check`);
    92:                 resolve();
    93:               });
    94:             } else {
    95:               // wait for spawn via PID persistence
    96:               setTimeout(() => {
    97:                 logger.info(`${mod} started (delayed wait).`);
    98:                 resolve();
    99:               }, 2000);
   100:             }
   101:           } else {
   102:             resolve();
   103:           }
   104: 
   105:           // child exit handled by supervisor
   106:         });
   107:       };
   108: 
   109:       // start the first time and optionally wait
   110:       await spawnOnce();
   111: 
   112:       // restart logic handled by supervisor-level events, keep simple here
   113:     })();
   114: 
   115:     procs.push(promise);
   116:   }
   117: 
   118:   await Promise.all(procs);
   119: 
   120:   logger.success("qflash: start sequence initiated for selected modules");
   121: }


============================
FILE: qflush\src\compose\fclParser.ts
============================
============================
     1: import fs from 'fs';
     2: 
     3: function parseValue(raw: string): any {
     4:   const v = raw.trim();
     5:   if (v.startsWith('[') && v.endsWith(']')) {
     6:     // simple list parser
     7:     const inside = v.slice(1, -1).trim();
     8:     if (!inside) return [];
     9:     return inside.split(',').map(x => x.trim().replace(/^"|"$/g, ''));
    10:   }
    11:   if (/^\d+$/.test(v)) return Number(v);
    12:   return v.replace(/^"|"$/g, '');
    13: }
    14: 
    15: export function readFCL(file = 'funesterie.fcl') {
    16:   try {
    17:     const raw = fs.readFileSync(file, 'utf8');
    18:     const lines = raw.split(/\r?\n/);
    19:     const out: any = { project: {}, env: {}, service: {}, pipeline: {} };
    20:     let current: { section?: string, name?: string } = {};
    21:     for (let line of lines) {
    22:       line = line.trim();
    23:       if (!line || line.startsWith('#') || line.startsWith('//')) continue;
    24:       if (line.startsWith('@')) {
    25:         const parts = line.split(/	|\s+/).filter(Boolean);
    26:         const sec = parts[0].slice(1);
    27:         const name = parts[1] || undefined;
    28:         current = { section: sec, name };
    29:         if (name) {
    30:           if (!out[sec]) out[sec] = {};
    31:           out[sec][name] = out[sec][name] || {};
    32:         }
    33:         continue;
    34:       }
    35:       const eq = line.indexOf('=');
    36:       if (eq === -1) continue;
    37:       const key = line.slice(0, eq).trim();
    38:       const val = parseValue(line.slice(eq + 1));
    39:       if (current.section) {
    40:         if (current.name) {
    41:           out[current.section][current.name][key] = val;
    42:         } else {
    43:           out[current.section][key] = val;
    44:         }
    45:       }
    46:     }
    47:     return out;
    48:   } catch (err) {
    49:     return null;
    50:   }
    51: }


============================
FILE: qflush\src\compose\parser.ts
============================
============================
     1: import fs from 'fs';
     2: import yaml from 'js-yaml';
     3: import { readFCL } from './fclParser';
     4: 
     5: export type ModuleDef = {
     6:   path?: string;
     7:   port?: number;
     8:   token?: string;
     9:   env?: Record<string,string>;
    10: };
    11: 
    12: export type ComposeFile = {
    13:   modules: Record<string, ModuleDef>;
    14: };
    15: 
    16: export function readCompose(file = 'funesterie.yml'): ComposeFile | null {
    17:   try {
    18:     if (fs.existsSync('funesterie.fcl')) {
    19:       const fcl = readFCL('funesterie.fcl');
    20:       if (fcl && fcl.service) {
    21:         const modules: Record<string, ModuleDef> = {};
    22:         for (const k of Object.keys(fcl.service)) {
    23:           const s = fcl.service[k];
    24:           modules[k] = { path: s.path, port: s.port, token: s.token, env: s.env };
    25:         }
    26:         return { modules };
    27:       }
    28:     }
    29:     if (!fs.existsSync(file)) return null;
    30:     const raw = fs.readFileSync(file, 'utf8');
    31:     const doc = yaml.load(raw) as any;
    32:     if (!doc || !doc.modules) return null;
    33:     return { modules: doc.modules } as ComposeFile;
    34:   } catch (err) {
    35:     return null;
    36:   }
    37: }


============================
FILE: qflush\src\daemon\qflashd.ts
============================
============================
     1: import http from 'http';
     2: import { listRunning, startProcess, stopProcess, stopAll } from '../supervisor';
     3: import { logger } from '../utils/logger';
     4: 
     5: const PORT = process.env.QFLASHD_PORT ? Number(process.env.QFLASHD_PORT) : 4500;
     6: 
     7: const server = http.createServer(async (req, res) => {
     8:   res.setHeader('Content-Type', 'application/json');
     9:   if (req.url === '/status') {
    10:     const running = listRunning();
    11:     res.end(JSON.stringify({ running }));
    12:     return;
    13:   }
    14:   if (req.url && req.url.startsWith('/stop')) {
    15:     const name = req.url.split('/')[2];
    16:     if (name) {
    17:       const ok = stopProcess(name);
    18:       res.end(JSON.stringify({ ok }));
    19:       return;
    20:     }
    21:     stopAll();
    22:     res.end(JSON.stringify({ ok: true }));
    23:     return;
    24:   }
    25:   res.statusCode = 404;
    26:   res.end(JSON.stringify({ error: 'not found' }));
    27: });
    28: 
    29: server.listen(PORT, () => logger.success(`qflashd running on http://localhost:${PORT}`));

FILE: qflush\src\index.ts
============================
============================
     1: #!/usr/bin/env node
     2: import { buildPipeline, executePipeline } from "./chain/smartChain";
     3: import { showHelp } from "./cli/help";
     4: import { runCompose } from "./commands/compose";
     5: import { runDoctor } from "./commands/doctor";
     6: 
     7: const argv = process.argv.slice(2);
     8: if (argv.includes("--help") || argv.includes("-h")) {
     9:   showHelp();
    10:   process.exit(0);
    11: }
    12: 
    13: const first = argv[0];
    14: if (first === 'compose') {
    15:   void runCompose(argv.slice(1));
    16:   process.exit(0);
    17: }
    18: if (first === 'doctor') {
    19:   void runDoctor(argv.slice(1));
    20:   process.exit(0);
    21: }
    22: if (first === 'daemon') {
    23:   // start qflashd in-process
    24:   void import('./daemon/qflashd').then((m) => {
    25:     // module starts itself and logs
    26:   }).catch((err) => { console.error('failed to start daemon', err); process.exit(1); });
    27:   process.exit(0);
    28: }
    29: 
    30: const { pipeline, options } = buildPipeline(argv);
    31: 
    32: executePipeline(pipeline, options).catch((err) => {
    33:   console.error("qflash: fatal", err);
    34:   process.exit(1);
    35: });

FILE: qflush\src\supervisor\index.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { spawn } from 'child_process';
     2: import { writeFileSync, existsSync, mkdirSync, readFileSync, unlinkSync, createWriteStream } from 'fs';
     3: import { join } from 'path';
     4: import { logger } from '../utils/logger';
     5: 
     6: type ProcRecord = {
     7:   name: string;
     8:   pid: number;
     9:   cmd: string;
    10:   args: string[];
    11:   cwd?: string;
    12:   log?: string;
    13:   detached?: boolean;
    14: };
    15: 
    16: const STATE_DIR = join(process.cwd(), '.qflash');
    17: const LOGS_DIR = join(STATE_DIR, 'logs');
    18: const STATE_FILE = join(STATE_DIR, 'services.json');
    19: let procs: Record<string, ProcRecord> = {};
    20: 
    21: function ensureStateDir() {
    22:   if (!existsSync(STATE_DIR)) mkdirSync(STATE_DIR, { recursive: true });
    23:   if (!existsSync(LOGS_DIR)) mkdirSync(LOGS_DIR, { recursive: true });
    24: }
    25: 
    26: function persist() {
    27:   try {
    28:     ensureStateDir();
    29:     writeFileSync(STATE_FILE, JSON.stringify(procs, null, 2), 'utf8');
    30:   } catch (err) {
    31:     logger.warn(`Failed to persist supervisor state: ${err}`);
    32:   }
    33: }
    34: 
    35: function load() {
    36:   try {
    37:     if (existsSync(STATE_FILE)) {
    38:       const raw = readFileSync(STATE_FILE, 'utf8');
    39:       procs = JSON.parse(raw);
    40:     }
    41:   } catch (err) {
    42:     logger.warn(`Failed to load supervisor state: ${err}`);
    43:   }
    44: }
    45: 
    46: load();
    47: 
    48: export function listRunning() {
    49:   return Object.values(procs);
    50: }
    51: 
    52: export function startProcess(name: string, cmd: string, args: string[] = [], opts: any = {}) {
    53:   ensureStateDir();
    54:   logger.info(`supervisor: starting ${name} -> ${cmd} ${args.join(' ')}`);
    55: 
    56:   const logFile = opts.logPath || join(LOGS_DIR, `${name}.log`);
    57:   const outStream = createWriteStream(logFile, { flags: 'a' });
    58: 
    59:   const spawnOpts: any = { cwd: opts.cwd || process.cwd(), shell: true };
    60: 
    61:   // decide stdio based on detached/background
    62:   if (opts.detached) {
    63:     spawnOpts.detached = true;
    64:     // ignore stdin, pipe stdout/stderr to log
    65:     spawnOpts.stdio = ['ignore', 'pipe', 'pipe'];
    66:   } else {
    67:     spawnOpts.stdio = ['ignore', 'pipe', 'pipe'];
    68:   }
    69: 
    70:   const child = spawn(cmd, args, spawnOpts);
    71: 
    72:   if (child.stdout) child.stdout.pipe(outStream);
    73:   if (child.stderr) child.stderr.pipe(outStream);
    74: 
    75:   child.on('error', (err) => logger.error(`supervisor: ${name} process error ${err.message}`));
    76:   child.on('exit', (code) => {
    77:     logger.warn(`supervisor: ${name} exited with ${code}`);
    78:     if (procs[name]) delete procs[name];
    79:     persist();
    80:   });
    81: 
    82:   // if detached, allow process to continue after this parent exits
    83:   if (spawnOpts.detached) {
    84:     try { child.unref(); } catch {}
    85:   }
    86: 
    87:   procs[name] = { name, pid: child.pid || -1, cmd, args, cwd: opts.cwd, log: logFile, detached: !!spawnOpts.detached };
    88:   persist();
    89:   return child;
    90: }
    91: 
    92: export function stopProcess(name: string) {
    93:   const entry = procs[name];
    94:   if (!entry) return false;
    95:   try {
    96:     process.kill(entry.pid, 'SIGTERM');
    97:     try { delete procs[name]; persist(); } catch {}
    98:     return true;
    99:   } catch (err) {
   100:     logger.warn(`supervisor: failed to kill ${name} pid=${entry.pid} (${err})`);
   101:     return false;
   102:   }
   103: }
   104: 
   105: export function stopAll() {
   106:   const names = Object.keys(procs);
   107:   for (const n of names) {
   108:     stopProcess(n);
   109:   }
   110:   try {
   111:     if (existsSync(STATE_FILE)) unlinkSync(STATE_FILE);
   112:   } catch {}
   113: }
   114: 
   115: export function clearState() {
   116:   procs = {};
   117:   try { if (existsSync(STATE_FILE)) unlinkSync(STATE_FILE); } catch {}
   118: }


============================
FILE: qflush\src\tests\smartchain.test.ts
============================

     1: import { buildPipeline } from "../chain/smartChain";
     2: 
     3: function assertEqual(a: any, b: any, msg?: string) {
     4:   if (JSON.stringify(a) !== JSON.stringify(b)) throw new Error(msg || `Assertion failed: ${JSON.stringify(a)} !== ${JSON.stringify(b)}`);
     5: }
     6: 
     7: function runTests() {
     8:   assertEqual(buildPipeline(["start"]).pipeline, ["detect","config","start"]);
     9:   assertEqual(buildPipeline(["kill","start"]).pipeline, ["kill","detect","config","start"]);
    10:   assertEqual(buildPipeline(["purge","start"]).pipeline, ["detect","config","purge","start"]);
    11:   assertEqual(buildPipeline(["config","start","detect"]).pipeline, ["detect","config","start"]);
    12:   assertEqual(buildPipeline(["exodia","start"]).pipeline, ["detect","config","start","exodia"]);
    13:   console.log("SmartChain tests passed");
    14: }
    15: 
    16: runTests();

============================
FILE: qflush\src\utils\detect.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { exec } from "child_process";
     2: import { logger } from "./logger";
     3: import { SERVICE_MAP } from "./paths";
     4: import { resolvePackagePath } from "./package";
     5: 
     6: export async function detectModules() {
     7:   const out: Record<string, any> = {};
     8:   for (const name of Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP))
     9:     out[name] = { running: false, installed: false, path: undefined, bin: undefined };
    10: 
    11:   for (const name of Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP)) {
    12:     try {
    13:       const pkgPath = resolvePackagePath(SERVICE_MAP[name].pkg);
    14:       if (pkgPath) {
    15:         out[name].installed = true;
    16:         out[name].path = pkgPath;
    17:         try {
    18:           const pkgJson = require(require('path').join(pkgPath, 'package.json'));
    19:           if (pkgJson && pkgJson.bin) {
    20:             out[name].bin = typeof pkgJson.bin === 'string' ? pkgJson.bin : Object.values(pkgJson.bin)[0];
    21:           }
    22:         } catch {}
    23:       }
    24:     } catch {}
    25:   }
    26: 
    27:   await new Promise<void>((resolve) => {
    28:     exec(process.platform === "win32" ? "tasklist" : "ps aux", (err, stdout) => {
    29:       if (err) {
    30:         logger.warn(`Failed to list processes: ${err.message}`);
    31:         return resolve();
    32:       }
    33:       const s = stdout.toString();
    34:       for (const name of Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP)) {
    35:         const regex = new RegExp(name, "i");
    36:         if (regex.test(s)) {
    37:           out[name].running = true;
    38:         }
    39:       }
    40:       resolve();
    41:     });
    42:   });
    43:   return out;
    44: }
    45: 
    46: export async function findAndKill() {
    47:   const names = Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP);
    48:   const killed: number[] = [];
    49:   for (const n of names) {
    50:     try {
    51:       if (process.platform === "win32") {
    52:         exec(`taskkill /IM ${n}.exe /F`, (err) => {});
    53:       } else {
    54:         exec(`pkill -f ${n}`, (err) => {});
    55:       }
    56:     } catch (err) {
    57:       // ignore
    58:     }
    59:   }
    60:   return killed;
    61: }


============================
FILE: qflush\src\utils\exec.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { spawn } from "child_process";
     2: import { logger } from "./logger";
     3: import { unlinkSync, existsSync, rmSync } from "fs";
     4: import { execSync } from "child_process";
     5: 
     6: export function spawnSafe(command: string, args: string[] = [], opts: any = {}) {
     7:   try {
     8:     const proc = spawn(command, args, { stdio: "inherit", shell: true, ...opts });
     9:     proc.on("error", (err) => logger.error(`Process error: ${err.message}`));
    10:     return proc;
    11:   } catch (err: any) {
    12:     logger.error(`Failed to spawn ${command}: ${err.message}`);
    13:     throw err;
    14:   }
    15: }
    16: 
    17: export function rimrafSync(path: string) {
    18:   if (!path) return;
    19:   if (!existsSync(path)) return;
    20:   try {
    21:     rmSync(path, { recursive: true, force: true });
    22:   } catch (err) {
    23:     // fallback
    24:     try {
    25:       unlinkSync(path);
    26:     } catch {}
    27:   }
    28: }
    29: 
    30: export function isPackageInstalled(pkgName: string) {
    31:   try {
    32:     execSync(`npm ls ${pkgName} --depth=0`, { stdio: "ignore" });
    33:     return true;
    34:   } catch {
    35:     return false;
    36:   }
    37: }
    38: 
    39: export function ensurePackageInstalled(pkgName: string) {
    40:   if (isPackageInstalled(pkgName)) return true;
    41:   logger.info(`Installing missing package ${pkgName}...`);
    42:   try {
    43:     execSync(`npm install -g ${pkgName}`, { stdio: "inherit" });
    44:     return true;
    45:   } catch (err: any) {
    46:     logger.warn(`Failed to install ${pkgName}: ${err.message}`);
    47:     return false;
    48:   }
    49: }
    50: 
    51: // Helpers for CLI pre-launch checks
    52: export function pathExists(pathStr: string) {
    53:   return !!pathStr && existsSync(pathStr);
    54: }
    55: 
    56: export function rebuildInstructionsFor(pkgPath?: string) {
    57:   if (!pkgPath) return `Rebuild the package (cd <pkg> && npm install && npm run build && npm install -g .)`;
    58:   return `Rebuild the package:\n  cd ${pkgPath}\n  npm install\n  npm run build\n  npm install -g .`;
    59: }


============================
FILE: qflush\src\utils\health.ts
============================
============================
     1: import http from 'http';
     2: import net from 'net';
     3: import { logger } from './logger';
     4: 
     5: export async function httpProbe(url: string, timeout = 2000): Promise<boolean> {
     6:   return new Promise((resolve) => {
     7:     const req = http.get(url, (res) => {
     8:       res.resume();
     9:       resolve(Boolean(res.statusCode && res.statusCode < 400));
    10:     });
    11:     req.on('error', () => resolve(false));
    12:     req.setTimeout(timeout, () => {
    13:       req.destroy();
    14:       resolve(false);
    15:     });
    16:   });
    17: }
    18: 
    19: export async function tcpProbe(host: string, port: number, timeout = 2000): Promise<boolean> {
    20:   return new Promise((resolve) => {
    21:     const s = new net.Socket();
    22:     let done = false;
    23:     s.setTimeout(timeout);
    24:     s.on('connect', () => {
    25:       done = true;
    26:       s.destroy();
    27:       resolve(true);
    28:     });
    29:     s.on('error', () => { if (!done) { done = true; resolve(false); } });
    30:     s.on('timeout', () => { if (!done) { done = true; s.destroy(); resolve(false); } });
    31:     s.connect(port, host);
    32:   });
    33: }
    34: 
    35: export async function waitForService(urlOrHost: string, port?: number, timeout = 5000) {
    36:   const start = Date.now();
    37:   while (Date.now() - start < timeout) {
    38:     let ok = false;
    39:     if (typeof port === 'number') {
    40:       ok = await tcpProbe(urlOrHost, port, 1000);
    41:     } else if (urlOrHost.startsWith('http')) {
    42:       ok = await httpProbe(urlOrHost, 1000);
    43:     }
    44:     if (ok) return true;
    45:     await new Promise((r) => setTimeout(r, 500));
    46:   }
    47:   return false;
    48: }

FILE: qflush\src\utils\logger.ts
============================
============================
     1: export const logger = {
     2:   info: (msg: string) => console.log(`\x1b[36m[QFLASH]\x1b[0m ${msg}`),
     3:   warn: (msg: string) => console.log(`\x1b[33m[QFLASH]\x1b[0m ${msg}`),
     4:   error: (msg: string) => console.error(`\x1b[31m[QFLASH]\x1b[0m ${msg}`),
     5:   success: (msg: string) => console.log(`\x1b[32m[QFLASH]\x1b[0m ${msg}`),
     6: };


============================
FILE: qflush\src\utils\package.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { join } from "path";
     2: import { existsSync } from "fs";
     3: import { readFileSync } from "fs";
     4: 
     5: export function resolvePackagePath(pkgName: string) {
     6:   try {
     7:     const resolved = require.resolve(pkgName);
     8:     // walk up to package root
     9:     let dir = resolved;
    10:     while (dir && !existsSync(join(dir, "package.json"))) {
    11:       const p = require("path").dirname(dir);
    12:       if (p === dir) break;
    13:       dir = p;
    14:     }
    15:     if (existsSync(join(dir, "package.json"))) return dir;
    16:   } catch {}
    17:   // fallback: node_modules path
    18:   const guess = join(process.cwd(), "node_modules", pkgName);
    19:   if (existsSync(join(guess, "package.json"))) return guess;
    20:   return undefined;
    21: }
    22: 
    23: export function readPackageJson(pkgPath: string) {
    24:   try {
    25:     const content = readFileSync(join(pkgPath, "package.json"), "utf8");
    26:     return JSON.parse(content);
    27:   } catch {
    28:     return null;
    29:   }
    30: }


============================
FILE: qflush\src\utils\paths.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { existsSync } from "fs";
     2: import { join } from "path";
     3: 
     4: // Map service names to npm package names and local folder candidates
     5: export const SERVICE_MAP: Record<string, { pkg: string; candidates: string[] }> = {
     6:   rome: { pkg: "@funeste38/rome", candidates: ["./rome", "./Rome"] },
     7:   nezlephant: { pkg: "@funeste38/nezlephant", candidates: ["./nezlephant", "./Nezlephant"] },
     8:   envaptex: { pkg: "@funeste38/envaptex", candidates: ["./envaptex", "./Envaptex"] },
     9:   freeland: { pkg: "@funeste38/freeland", candidates: ["./freeland", "./Freeland"] },
    10:   bat: { pkg: "@funeste38/bat", candidates: ["./bat", "./BAT"] },
    11: };
    12: 
    13: export function resolvePaths(detected: any = {}) {
    14:   const out: Record<string, string | undefined> = {};
    15:   for (const key of Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP)) {
    16:     if (detected && detected[key] && detected[key].path) {
    17:       out[key] = detected[key].path;
    18:       continue;
    19:     }
    20:     const tries = SERVICE_MAP[key].candidates;
    21:     for (const t of tries) {
    22:       const p = join(process.cwd(), t);
    23:       if (existsSync(p)) {
    24:         out[key] = p;
    25:         break;
    26:       }
    27:     }
    28:   }
    29:   return out;
    30: }


============================
FILE: qflush\src\utils\tokens.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { randomBytes } from "crypto";
     2: 
     3: export function generateToken(len = 24) {
     4:   return randomBytes(len).toString("hex");
     5: }
     6: 
     7: export function resolveTokens(existing: Record<string, any> = {}) {
     8:   const out: Record<string, string> = {};
     9:   for (const name of ["A-11", "SPYDER", "BAT", "KEYKEY", "NEZLEPHANT"]) {
    10:     out[name] = existing[name] || generateToken(12);
    11:   }
    12:   return out;
    13: }

     4:   "description": "Lightweight qflush runner variant for CI (disables supervisor and heavy services)",
     5:   "bin": {
     6:     "qflush-runner": "bin/qflush-runner.js"
     7:   },
     8:   "files": [
     9:     "bin"
    10:   ],
    11:   "dependencies": {
    12:     "@funeste38/qflush": "3.1.4"
    13:   },
    14:   "license": "SEE LICENSE IN LICENSE-FUNESTERIE.txt"
    15: }


============================
FILE: scripts\cleanup-actions.ps1
============================
============================
     1: # cleanup-actions.ps1
     2: # Cancel in-progress/queued workflow runs and close PRs from a feature branch
     3: Param(
     4:   [string]$Repo = 'jEFFLEZ/qflush',
     5:   [string]$FeatureBranch = 'feat/tools-encoders'
     6: )
     7: 
     8: if (-not $env:ACTIONS_TOKEN) {
     9:   Write-Output 'NO_TOKEN'
    10:   exit 2
    11: }
    12: 
    13: $headers = @{ Authorization = 'Bearer ' + $env:ACTIONS_TOKEN; Accept = 'application/vnd.github+json'; 'User-Agent' = 'cleanup-script' }
    14: 
    15: try {
    16:   Write-Output "Listing workflow runs for repo $Repo..."
    17:   $url = "https://api.github.com/repos/$Repo/actions/runs?per_page=200"
    18:   $resp = Invoke-RestMethod -Uri $url -Headers $headers -Method Get -ErrorAction Stop
    19:   $runs = $resp.workflow_runs
    20:   $toCancel = $runs | Where-Object { $_.status -in @('in_progress','queued') }
    21:   if ($toCancel.Count -eq 0) { Write-Output 'No in_progress/queued runs to cancel.' } else {
    22:     foreach ($r in $toCancel) {
    23:       Write-Output "Cancelling run id=$($r.id) name='$($r.name)' branch=$($r.head_branch)"
    24:       Invoke-RestMethod -Uri "https://api.github.com/repos/$Repo/actions/runs/$($r.id)/cancel" -Method Post -Headers $headers -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
    25:     }
    26:   }
    27: 
    28:   Write-Output "Checking PRs with head=$Repo.Split('/')[0]:$FeatureBranch..."
    29:   $owner = $Repo.Split('/')[0]
    30:   $prsUrl = "https://api.github.com/repos/$Repo/pulls?head=$owner`:$FeatureBranch"
    31:   $prs = Invoke-RestMethod -Uri $prsUrl -Headers $headers -Method Get -ErrorAction Stop
    32:   if ($prs.Count -eq 0) { Write-Output 'No PRs found for feature branch.' } else {
    33:     foreach ($p in $prs) {
    34:       Write-Output "Closing PR #$($p.number): $($p.title)"
    35:       Invoke-RestMethod -Uri "https://api.github.com/repos/$Repo/pulls/$($p.number)" -Method Patch -Headers $headers -Body (@{ state='closed' } | ConvertTo-Json) -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
    36:       # optional: delete remote branch ref
    37:       try {
    38:         Write-Output "Deleting remote ref heads/$FeatureBranch"
    39:         Invoke-RestMethod -Uri "https://api.github.com/repos/$Repo/git/refs/heads/$FeatureBranch" -Method Delete -Headers $headers -ErrorAction Stop
    40:       } catch {
    41:         Write-Output "Failed to delete remote ref (maybe already deleted): $($_.Exception.Message)"
    42:       }
    43:     }
    44:   }
    45: 
    46:   Write-Output 'Done. Summary:'
    47:   $remaining = Invoke-RestMethod -Uri $url -Headers $headers -Method Get
    48:   $remaining.workflow_runs | Where-Object { $_.status -in @('in_progress','queued') } | Select-Object id,name,status,head_branch | ConvertTo-Json -Depth 3
    49: 
    50: } catch {
    51:   Write-Error "Error during cleanup: $($_.Exception.Message)"
    52:   if ($_.Exception.Response) {
    53:     try { $txt = $_.Exception.Response.GetResponseStream() | New-Object System.IO.StreamReader | ForEach-Object { $_.ReadToEnd() }; Write-Output $txt } catch {}
    54:   }
    55:   exit 1
    56: }


============================
FILE: scripts\cleanup-qflush.ps1
============================
============================
     1: # Cleanup script to replace remaining `qflush` references with `qflush`
     2: # Usage: run from repo root: powershell -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -File .\scripts\cleanup-qflush.ps1
     3: $ErrorActionPreference = 'Stop'
     4: 
     5: Write-Output "Running cleanup-qflush.ps1"
     6: $root = Get-Location
     7: Write-Output "Repo root: $root"
     8: 
     9: # Files/dirs to ignore (substring match) and file patterns
    10: $ignoreDirs = @('.git','node_modules','.venv','.vscode','dist','out','release','.release')
    11: $ignoreExts = @('\.log$','\.tgz$','\.zip$','\.vsix$','\.png$','\.jpg$','\.jpeg$','\.gif$','\.bin$','\.exe$')
    12: $ignorePattern = (($ignoreDirs | ForEach-Object { [regex]::Escape($_) }) + $ignoreExts) -join '|'
    13: 
    14: # Collect files (exclude ignored dirs and file patterns)
    15: Write-Output "Scanning files..."
    16: $files = Get-ChildItem -Path $root -Recurse -File -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue | Where-Object { $_.FullName -notmatch $ignorePattern }
    17: $changed = 0
    18: $renamed = 0
    19: 
    20: foreach ($f in $files) {
    21:     try {
    22:         $text = Get-Content -Raw -LiteralPath $f.FullName -ErrorAction Stop
    23:     } catch {
    24:         # cannot read file as text (binary or locked), skip
    25:         continue
    26:     }
    27:     if ($null -eq $text -or $text -eq '') { continue }
    28:     try {
    29:         # case-insensitive replacement
    30:         $new = [regex]::Replace($text, 'qflush', 'qflush', 'IgnoreCase')
    31:     } catch {
    32:         # regex failed for this content, skip
    33:         continue
    34:     }
    35:     if ($new -ne $text) {
    36:         try { Set-Content -LiteralPath $f.FullName -Value $new -Encoding UTF8 -ErrorAction Stop } catch { Write-Output "Failed to write file: $($f.FullName) : $_"; continue }
    37:         Write-Output "Patched: $($f.FullName)"
    38:         $changed++
    39:     }
    40: }
    41: 
    42: # rename files/dirs containing qflush (case-insensitive)
    43: Write-Output "Renaming files/dirs containing 'qflush' in name..."
    44: $items = Get-ChildItem -Path $root -Recurse -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue | Where-Object { $_.Name -match '(?i)qflush' -and ($_.FullName -notmatch $ignorePattern) } | Sort-Object -Property FullName -Descending
    45: foreach ($it in $items) {
    46:     $old = $it.FullName
    47:     $parent = Split-Path $old -Parent
    48:     $newName = $it.Name -replace '(?i)qflush','qflush'
    49:     $newPath = Join-Path $parent $newName
    50:     if ($old -ieq $newPath) { continue }
    51:     try {
    52:         Rename-Item -LiteralPath $old -NewName $newName -ErrorAction Stop
    53:         Write-Output "Renamed: $old -> $newPath"
    54:         $renamed++
    55:     } catch {
    56:         Write-Output "Failed to rename: $old -> $newPath : $_"
    57:     }
    58: }
    59: 
    60: if ($changed -gt 0 -or $renamed -gt 0) {
    61:     Write-Output "Staging changes and committing..."
    62:     try {
    63:         git add -A
    64:         git commit -m "chore(repo): replace qflush -> qflush and normalize names"
    65:     } catch {
    66:         Write-Output "git commit returned non-zero or nothing to commit: $_"
    67:     }
    68:     # push if upstream configured
    69:     try {
    70:         git rev-parse --abbrev-ref --symbolic-full-name '@{u}' > $null 2>&1
    71:         try { git push } catch { Write-Output 'git push failed, please push manually.' }
    72:     } catch {
    73:         Write-Output 'No upstream configured for current branch; please push manually.'
    74:     }
    75: }
    76: 
    77: Write-Output "Done. Files patched: $changed, renamed: $renamed"
    78: 


============================
FILE: scripts\create-pr.ps1
============================
============================
     1: Param(
     2:   [string]$HeadBranch = 'feat/tools-encoders',
     3:   [string]$BaseBranch = 'main',
     4:   [string]$Title = 'feat(tools): add encoders and css encoder/decoder',
     5:   [string]$Body = 'Add tools: tools/rgba_brotli_oc8.py, tools/css_encode.js, tools/css_decode.js.'
     6: )
     7: 
     8: if (-not $env:ACTIONS_TOKEN) {
     9:   Write-Error 'ACTIONS_TOKEN environment variable not set.'
    10:   exit 2
    11: }
    12: 
    13: $token = $env:ACTIONS_TOKEN
    14: $payload = @{ title = $Title; head = $HeadBranch; base = $BaseBranch; body = $Body } | ConvertTo-Json -Depth 6
    15: 
    16: $headers = @{ Authorization = "Bearer $token"; Accept = 'application/vnd.github+json'; 'User-Agent' = 'qflush-bot' }
    17: 
    18: try {
    19:   $resp = Invoke-RestMethod -Uri 'https://api.github.com/repos/jEFFLEZ/qflush/pulls' -Method Post -Headers $headers -Body $payload -ContentType 'application/json' -ErrorAction Stop
    20:   Write-Output "PR created: $($resp.html_url)"
    21: } catch {
    22:   Write-Error "Failed to create PR: $($_.Exception.Message)"
    23:   if ($_.Exception.Response) {
    24:     try { $text = $_.Exception.Response.GetResponseStream() | New-Object System.IO.StreamReader | ForEach-Object { $_.ReadToEnd() }; Write-Output $text } catch {}
    25:   }
    26:   exit 1
    27: }


============================
FILE: scripts\fix-install-qflush.ps1
============================
============================
     1: # Fix + (re)install @funeste38/qflush v3.1.2 and create working shims
     2: # Usage: exécuter dans un PowerShell lancé en Administrateur depuis la racine du repo
     3: $ErrorActionPreference = 'Stop'
     4: 
     5: # 0) check admin
     6: $principal = [Security.Principal.WindowsPrincipal][Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity]::GetCurrent()
     7: if (-not $principal.IsInRole([Security.Principal.WindowsBuiltInRole]::Administrator)) {
     8:   Write-Error "Exécutez ce script en tant qu'administrateur."
     9:   exit 1
    10: }
    11: 
    12: # 1) variables
    13: $repoRoot = (Get-Location).Path      # utilise répertoire courant
    14: $pkgName = '@funeste38/qflush'
    15: $githubTag = 'github:jEFFLEZ/qflush#v3.1.2'
    16: $appNpm = Join-Path $env:APPDATA 'npm'
    17: $groot = (& npm root -g).Trim()
    18: 
    19: # 2) cleanup anciens shims / paquets
    20: Write-Output "Removing old global packages and shims (if any)..."
    21: try { npm uninstall -g $pkgName @funeste38/qflush 2>$null } catch {}
    22: Get-ChildItem $appNpm -Filter 'qflush*' -File -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue | ForEach-Object { Remove-Item $_.FullName -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue }
    23: 
    24: # 3) if repo present, build & pack
    25: $tgzToInstall = $null
    26: if (Test-Path $repoRoot) {
    27:   Write-Output "Repo found at $repoRoot — building..."
    28:   Push-Location $repoRoot
    29:   try {
    30:     npm ci
    31:     npm run build
    32:     npm pack | Out-Null
    33:     $tgz = Get-ChildItem -Path $repoRoot -Filter '*.tgz' -File | Sort-Object LastWriteTime -Descending | Select-Object -First 1
    34:     if ($tgz) { $tgzToInstall = $tgz.FullName; Write-Output "Packed TGZ: $tgzToInstall" }
    35:   } finally { Pop-Location }
    36: }
    37: 
    38: # 4) install (prefer local tgz if present)
    39: if ($tgzToInstall) {
    40:   Write-Output "Installing from local tgz..."
    41:   npm install -g $tgzToInstall
    42: } else {
    43:   Write-Output "Installing from GitHub tag $githubTag..."
    44:   npm install -g $githubTag
    45: }
    46: 
    47: # 5) determine dist and package.json paths (prefer global package, fallback local repo)
    48: $pkgGlobalDir = Join-Path $groot ('@funeste38\qflush')
    49: $distPath = $null; $pkgJson = $null
    50: if (Test-Path (Join-Path $pkgGlobalDir 'dist\index.js')) {
    51:   $distPath = Join-Path $pkgGlobalDir 'dist\index.js'
    52:   $pkgJson  = Join-Path $pkgGlobalDir 'package.json'
    53:   Write-Output "Using global package dist: $distPath"
    54: } elseif (Test-Path (Join-Path $repoRoot 'dist\index.js')) {
    55:   $distPath = Join-Path $repoRoot 'dist\index.js'
    56:   $pkgJson  = Join-Path $repoRoot 'package.json'
    57:   Write-Output "Using local repo dist: $distPath"
    58: } else {
    59:   Write-Error "Impossible de trouver dist/index.js ni global ni local. Assurez-vous que build a réussi."
    60:   exit 2
    61: }
    62: 
    63: # 6) prepare paths for require() inside node -e -> use forward slashes to avoid JS escape issues
    64: $pkgJsonForRequire = ($pkgJson -replace '\\','/')
    65: 
    66: # 7) ensure appNpm exists and is in PATH for session
    67: if (-not (Test-Path $appNpm)) { New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $appNpm | Out-Null }
    68: if ((($env:PATH) -split ';') -notcontains $appNpm) {
    69:   $env:PATH = "$appNpm;$env:PATH"
    70:   Write-Output "Added $appNpm to PATH for this session."
    71: }
    72: 
    73: # 8) write robust shims (cmd + powershell) and wrapper
    74: $cmdPath = Join-Path $appNpm 'qflush.cmd'
    75: $ps1Path = Join-Path $appNpm 'qflush.ps1'
    76: $wrapperPath = Join-Path $appNpm 'qflush-cli.js'
    77: 
    78: # wrapper JS content
    79: $wrapperContent = @'
    80: const fs = require("fs");
    81: const path = require("path");
    82: const { spawn } = require("child_process");
    83: 
    84: function exists(p){ try { return p && fs.existsSync(p); } catch { return false; } }
    85: 
    86: const candidates = [
    87:   path.join(process.env.APPDATA || "", "npm", "node_modules", "@funeste38", "qflush"),
    88:   path.join(__dirname, "node_modules", "@funeste38", "qflush"),
    89:   path.join(process.cwd(), "node_modules", "@funeste38", "qflush"),
    90:   path.join(process.cwd())
    91: ];
    92: 
    93: let pkgDir = null;
    94: for (const c of candidates) {
    95:   if (exists(c)) { pkgDir = c; break; }
    96: }
    97: 
    98: let pkgJsonPath = pkgDir ? path.join(pkgDir, "package.json") : null;
    99: let distPath = pkgDir ? path.join(pkgDir, "dist", "index.js") : null;
   100: if (!pkgJsonPath || !exists(pkgJsonPath)) pkgJsonPath = path.join(process.cwd(), "package.json");
   101: if (!distPath || !exists(distPath)) {
   102:   const localDist = path.join(process.cwd(), "dist", "index.js");
   103:   if (exists(localDist)) distPath = localDist;
   104: }
   105: 
   106: const argv = process.argv.slice(2);
   107: if (argv[0] === "--version" || argv[0] === "-v") {
   108:   try {
   109:     const pkg = require(pkgJsonPath);
   110:     console.log(pkg && pkg.version ? pkg.version : "unknown");
   111:   } catch (e) {
   112:     console.log("unknown");
   113:   }
   114:   process.exit(0);
   115: }
   116: 
   117: if (!distPath || !exists(distPath)) {
   118:   console.error('qflush: dist not found. Run `npm run build` in the repo or install the package globally.');
   119:   process.exit(1);
   120: }
   121: 
   122: const child = spawn(process.execPath, [distPath, ...argv], { stdio: 'inherit' });
   123: child.on('exit', (code) => process.exit(code));
   124: '@
   125: 
   126: Set-Content -Path $wrapperPath -Value $wrapperContent -Encoding UTF8 -Force
   127: 
   128: $cmdContent = @"
   129: @echo off
   130: if "%1"=="--version" goto version
   131: if "%1"=="-v" goto version
   132: node "%APPDATA%\npm\qflush-cli.js" %*
   133: goto end
   134: :version
   135: node "%APPDATA%\npm\qflush-cli.js" --version
   136: :end
   137: "@
   138: 
   139: $ps1Content = @"
   140: param([Parameter(ValueFromRemainingArguments=`$true)] `$args)
   141: `$first = if (`$args.Length -gt 0) { `$args[0] } else { '' }
   142: if (`$first -eq '--version' -or `$first -eq '-v') {
   143:   node `"$env:APPDATA\npm\qflush-cli.js`" --version
   144:   exit 0
   145: }
   146: & node `"$env:APPDATA\npm\qflush-cli.js`" @args
   147: "@
   148: 
   149: Set-Content -Path $cmdPath -Value $cmdContent -Encoding ASCII -Force
   150: Set-Content -Path $ps1Path -Value $ps1Content -Encoding UTF8 -Force
   151: 
   152: Write-Output "Shims written:"
   153: Write-Output " - $cmdPath"
   154: Write-Output " - $ps1Path"
   155: Write-Output " - $wrapperPath"
   156: 
   157: # 9) final checks
   158: Write-Output "`nContents of $appNpm (qflush*):"
   159: Get-ChildItem $appNpm -Filter 'qflush*' -File | Select-Object Name,FullName | Format-Table
   160: 
   161: Write-Output "`nAttempting to run: qflush --version (same session)"
   162: try { qflush --version | Write-Output } catch { Write-Output 'qflush not recognized in this session — rouvrir le shell si nécessaire' }
   163: 
   164: Write-Output "`nIf qflush n'est toujours pas trouvé: fermez puis rouvrez PowerShell (Developer PowerShell) et exécutez `qflush --version`."


============================
FILE: scripts\import-env-to-secrets.ps1
============================
============================
     1: <#
     2: Import .env file and store secrets encrypted under %USERPROFILE%\.qflush\secrets.json using DPAPI (Windows)
     3: Usage:
     4:   pwsh -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -File .\scripts\import-env-to-secrets.ps1 -EnvPath "$env:USERPROFILE\Desktop\.env" [-Quiet]
     5: 
     6: This script detects common secret variable names (NPM_TOKEN, GUMROAD_TOKEN, COPILOT_HMAC_SECRET, REDIS_URL, etc.) and stores only those values encrypted.
     7: #>
     8: param(
     9:   [string]$EnvPath = "$env:USERPROFILE\Desktop\.env",
    10:   [switch]$RestrictFileAcl,
    11:   [switch]$Quiet
    12: )
    13: 
    14: function Log([string]$msg) {
    15:   if ($Quiet) { Write-Verbose $msg } else { Write-Host $msg }
    16: }
    17: 
    18: if (-not (Test-Path $EnvPath)) {
    19:   Write-Error "Env file not found: $EnvPath"
    20:   exit 2
    21: }
    22: 
    23: # canonical secret keys we care about
    24: $canonical = @{
    25:   'NPM_TOKEN' = 'NPM_TOKEN'
    26:   'GUMROAD_TOKEN' = 'GUMROAD_TOKEN'
    27:   'QFLUSH_TOKEN' = 'QFLUSH_TOKEN'
    28:   'REDIS_URL' = 'REDIS_URL'
    29:   'COPILOT_HMAC_SECRET' = 'COPILOT_HMAC_SECRET'
    30:   'COPILOT_WEBHOOK_URL' = 'WEBHOOK_URL'
    31:   'COPILOT_BRIDGE_URL' = 'COPILOT_BRIDGE_URL'
    32:   'GUMROAD_TOKEN_FILE' = 'GUMROAD_TOKEN_FILE'
    33: }
    34: 
    35: function NormalizeKey([string]$k) {
    36:   if (-not $k) { return $null }
    37:   $u = $k.Trim().ToUpper()
    38:   if ($canonical.ContainsKey($u)) { return $canonical[$u] }
    39:   # common heuristics
    40:   if ($u -match '(^|_)NPM(_|$|TOKEN)') { return 'NPM_TOKEN' }
    41:   if ($u -match 'GUMROAD') { return 'GUMROAD_TOKEN' }
    42:   if ($u -match 'COPILOT' -and $u -match 'HMAC|SECRET|KEY') { return 'COPILOT_HMAC_SECRET' }
    43:   if ($u -match 'COPILOT' -and $u -match 'WEBHOOK') { return 'WEBHOOK_URL' }
    44:   if ($u -match 'REDIS') { return 'REDIS_URL' }
    45:   if ($u -match 'QFLUSH' -and $u -match 'TOKEN') { return 'QFLUSH_TOKEN' }
    46:   # if the key contains TOKEN or SECRET, treat as secret
    47:   if ($u -match 'TOKEN|SECRET|KEY|PASSWORD|PASS') { return $u }
    48:   return $null
    49: }
    50: 
    51: # read lines robustly
    52: $all = Get-Content -Path $EnvPath -ErrorAction Stop
    53: $map = @{}
    54: 
    55: foreach ($line in $all) {
    56:   $trim = $line.Trim()
    57:   if ([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($trim)) { continue }
    58:   if ($trim.StartsWith('#')) { continue }
    59:   # support KEY=VALUE and export KEY=VALUE
    60:   if ($trim -match '^(?:export\s+)?([A-Za-z_][A-Za-z0-9_]*)\s*=\s*(.*)$') {
    61:     $key = $matches[1]
    62:     $val = $matches[2]
    63:     # strip optional surrounding quotes
    64:     if ($val.Length -ge 2 -and (($val.StartsWith('"') -and $val.EndsWith('"')) -or ($val.StartsWith("'") -and $val.EndsWith("'")))) {
    65:       $val = $val.Substring(1, $val.Length-2)
    66:     }
    67:     $canon = NormalizeKey $key
    68:     if (-not $canon) { continue } # skip non-secret vars
    69:     # skip boolean flags and numeric ports
    70:     if ($val -match '^(?:0|1|true|false)$' -or $val -match '^[0-9]+$') { continue }
    71:     try {
    72:       $secure = ConvertTo-SecureString $val -AsPlainText -Force
    73:       $enc = $secure | ConvertFrom-SecureString
    74:       $map[$canon] = $enc
    75:       Log "Queued secret: $canon"
    76:     } catch {
    77:       $err = ($_ | Out-String).Trim()
    78:       if ($Quiet) { Write-Verbose ("Failed to encrypt {0}: {1}" -f $key, $err) } else { Write-Warning ("Failed to encrypt {0}: {1}" -f $key, $err) }
    79:     }
    80:   }
    81: }
    82: 
    83: if ($map.Count -eq 0) {
    84:   Log 'No secrets detected in the .env file.'
    85:   exit 0
    86: }
    87: 
    88: $dir = Join-Path $env:USERPROFILE '.qflush'
    89: if (-not (Test-Path $dir)) { New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $dir | Out-Null }
    90: $file = Join-Path $dir 'secrets.json'
    91: try {
    92:   $existing = @{}
    93:   if (Test-Path $file) {
    94:     try {
    95:       $raw = Get-Content $file -Raw -ErrorAction Stop
    96:       $parsed = $raw | ConvertFrom-Json -ErrorAction Stop
    97:       if ($parsed -ne $null) {
    98:         foreach ($p in $parsed.PSObject.Properties) { $existing[$p.Name] = $p.Value }
    99:       }
   100:     } catch {
   101:       $existing = @{}
   102:     }
   103:   }
   104: 
   105:   foreach ($k in $map.Keys) { $existing[$k] = $map[$k] }
   106: 
   107:   $outObj = [ordered]@{}
   108:   foreach ($name in $existing.Keys) { $outObj[$name] = $existing[$name] }
   109: 
   110:   $outObj | ConvertTo-Json -Depth 5 | Set-Content -Path $file -Encoding UTF8
   111:   Log "Saved encrypted secrets to $file"
   112:   if ($RestrictFileAcl) {
   113:     try {
   114:       icacls $file /inheritance:r /grant:r "$env:USERNAME:(R,W)" | Out-Null
   115:       Log "Restricted ACL on $file to user $env:USERNAME"
   116:     } catch {
   117:       $err2 = ($_ | Out-String).Trim()
   118:       if ($Quiet) { Write-Verbose ("Failed to set ACL: {0}" -f $err2) } else { Write-Warning ("Failed to set ACL: {0}" -f $err2) }
   119:     }
   120:   }
   121: } catch {
   122:   $err3 = ($_ | Out-String).Trim()
   123:   if ($Quiet) { Write-Verbose ("Failed to write secrets file: {0}" -f $err3) } else { Write-Error ("Failed to write secrets file: {0}" -f $err3) }
   124:   exit 3
   125: }
   126: 
   127: Log 'Done.'


============================
FILE: scripts\install-and-publish.ps1
============================
============================
     1: <#
     2: PowerShell helper to install qflush locally and build + publish the VS Code extension to Azure Marketplace.
     3: Usage (run as Administrator PowerShell) from repo root (D:\qflush):
     4: 
     5: Set-ExecutionPolicy -Scope Process -ExecutionPolicy RemoteSigned
     6: .\scripts\install-and-publish.ps1
     7: 
     8: The script will:
     9:  - install node deps and build the project
    10:  - install the CLI globally (npm install -g .)
    11:  - build the VS Code extension
    12:  - package the VSIX and publish it to Azure DevOps Marketplace using tfx (prompts for PAT)
    13: 
    14: You will be prompted for a Personal Access Token (PAT). Do not paste it here.
    15: #>
    16: 
    17: function To-UnsecureString([securestring] $s) {
    18:   $bstr = [System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal]::SecureStringToBSTR($s)
    19:   try { [System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal]::PtrToStringBSTR($bstr) } finally { [System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal]::ZeroFreeBSTR($bstr) }
    20: }
    21: 
    22: Write-Host "Installing project dependencies and building..." -ForegroundColor Cyan
    23: npm install --no-audit --no-fund
    24: if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) { Write-Error "npm install failed"; exit 1 }
    25: 
    26: npm run build
    27: if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) { Write-Error "npm run build failed"; exit 1 }
    28: 
    29: Write-Host "Installing qflush CLI globally (requires admin)..." -ForegroundColor Cyan
    30: npm install -g .
    31: if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) { Write-Error "npm install -g . failed"; exit 1 }
    32: 
    33: Write-Host "Building VS Code extension..." -ForegroundColor Cyan
    34: Push-Location extensions/vscode-npz
    35: npm ci --no-audit --no-fund
    36: if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) { Write-Error "npm ci failed in extension"; Pop-Location; exit 1 }
    37: 
    38: npm run build
    39: if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) { Write-Error "Extension build failed"; Pop-Location; exit 1 }
    40: 
    41: # ensure tfx is installed
    42: Write-Host "Ensuring tfx-cli is installed..." -ForegroundColor Cyan
    43: npm install -g tfx-cli@0.7.0
    44: if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) { Write-Error "Failed to install tfx-cli"; Pop-Location; exit 1 }
    45: 
    46: # create vsix
    47: Write-Host "Packaging VSIX..." -ForegroundColor Cyan
    48: try {
    49:   tfx extension create --manifest-globs vss-extension.json --output-path .. | Write-Host
    50: } catch {
    51:   Write-Warning "tfx extension create returned non-zero but will continue if vsix exists"
    52: }
    53: 
    54: # find vsix
    55: $vsix = Get-ChildItem -Path .. -Filter *.vsix | Sort-Object LastWriteTime -Descending | Select-Object -First 1
    56: if (-not $vsix) { Write-Error "VSIX not found in repo root"; Pop-Location; exit 1 }
    57: 
    58: Write-Host "VSIX packaged: $($vsix.Name)" -ForegroundColor Green
    59: 
    60: # prompt for PAT
    61: $patSec = Read-Host -AsSecureString "Enter Azure DevOps PAT (will not echo)"
    62: $pat = To-UnsecureString $patSec
    63: 
    64: if (-not $pat) { Write-Error "No PAT provided"; Pop-Location; exit 1 }
    65: 
    66: # publish
    67: $publisher = 'funesterie'
    68: Write-Host "Publishing $($vsix.Name) to Marketplace as publisher $publisher..." -ForegroundColor Cyan
    69: $cmd = "tfx extension publish --manifest-globs vss-extension.json --publisher $publisher --token $pat --service-url https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/"
    70: Write-Host $cmd
    71: Invoke-Expression $cmd
    72: 
    73: if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) { Write-Error "tfx publish failed"; Pop-Location; exit 1 }
    74: 
    75: Write-Host "Publish command finished. Check Marketplace publisher and pipeline for status." -ForegroundColor Green
    76: 
    77: Pop-Location
    78: # zero the token variable
    79: $pat = $null
    80: [System.GC]::Collect()
    81: [System.GC]::WaitForPendingFinalizers()
    82: Write-Host "Done." -ForegroundColor Green


============================
FILE: scripts\migrate-to-qflush.ps1
============================
============================
     1: param([string]$ProjectPath = '.')
     2: Set-Location $ProjectPath
     3: 
     4: Write-Host "Installing @funeste38/qflush..."
     5: npm install @funeste38/qflush --save
     6: 
     7: Get-ChildItem -Path . -Recurse -Include *.ts,*.js,*.tsx,*.jsx | ForEach-Object {
     8:   (Get-Content $_.FullName) -replace "from '@funeste38/rome'", "from '@funeste38/qflush'" | Set-Content $_.FullName
     9: }
    10: Write-Host "Migration done. Please review and run tests."
