     2: # Usage: .\scripts\open-copilot-cli.ps1
     3: 
     4: $repoUrl = "https://github.com/github/copilot-cli"
     5: try {
     6:   Start-Process -FilePath $repoUrl -ErrorAction Stop | Out-Null
     7: } catch {
     8:   Write-Host "Open this URL in your browser: $repoUrl"
     9: }


============================
FILE: scripts\prepare-and-run-token-windows.ps1
============================
============================
     1: <#
     2: PowerShell helper to convert a private key to unencrypted PEM, upload it to GitHub Actions secrets
     3: and run the `get-installation-token.yml` workflow, then download the artifact.
     4: 
     5: Usage (PowerShell):
     6:   .\scripts\prepare-and-run-token-windows.ps1 -KeyPath 'D:\keys\private.pem' -AppId 2326697 -InstallationId 95833021 -Repo 'jEFFLEZ/qflush'
     7: 
     8: Requirements:
     9:  - gh CLI authenticated (gh auth login)
    10:  - ssh-keygen / openssl available in PATH (Git for Windows provides ssh-keygen)
    11:  - The script will fail if the private key is encrypted and cannot be converted without the passphrase.
    12: #>
    13: [CmdletBinding()]
    14: param(
    15:   [Parameter(Mandatory=$true)] [string] $KeyPath,
    16:   [Parameter(Mandatory=$true)] [string] $AppId,
    17:   [Parameter(Mandatory=$true)] [string] $InstallationId,
    18:   [Parameter(Mandatory=$false)] [string] $Repo = 'jEFFLEZ/qflush',
    19:   [switch] $DryRun
    20: )
    21: 
    22: function Write-ErrAndExit($msg){ Write-Error $msg; exit 1 }
    23: 
    24: if (-not (Test-Path $KeyPath)) { Write-ErrAndExit "Key file not found: $KeyPath" }
    25: 
    26: $work = Join-Path -Path (Get-Location) -ChildPath "tmp-pem"
    27: if (Test-Path $work) { Remove-Item -Recurse -Force $work }
    28: New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $work | Out-Null
    29: 
    30: $dest = Join-Path $work 'private-unencrypted.pem'
    31: Copy-Item -Path $KeyPath -Destination $dest -Force
    32: 
    33: # Detect header
    34: $head = ((Get-Content -Raw $dest) -split "\r?\n" | Select-Object -First 2) -join "`n"
    35: Write-Host "Key header: $head"
    36: 
    37: # If OPENSSH header, try conversion using ssh-keygen
    38: if ($head -match 'BEGIN OPENSSH PRIVATE KEY') {
    39:   Write-Host "Converting OpenSSH key to PEM via ssh-keygen..."
    40:   $conv = & ssh-keygen -p -f $dest -m PEM -N "" 2>&1
    41:   if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) {
    42:     Write-Host $conv
    43:     Write-ErrAndExit "ssh-keygen conversion failed or key is encrypted. Convert locally with passphrase or produce an unencrypted PEM."
    44:   }
    45: }
    46: 
    47: # Check for ENCRYPTED marker
    48: $contents = Get-Content -Raw $dest
    49: if ($contents -match 'ENCRYPTED' -or $contents -match 'Proc-Type: 4,ENCRYPTED') {
    50:   Write-ErrAndExit "Private key appears encrypted. You must supply an unencrypted PEM. Use openssl/ssh-keygen locally to decrypt."
    51: }
    52: 
    53: # Validate PEM header
    54: if (-not ($contents -match '-----BEGIN (RSA |)PRIVATE KEY-----')) {
    55:   Write-ErrAndExit "Resulting key does not appear to be a PEM private key. Inspect $dest"
    56: }
    57: 
    58: if ($DryRun) { Write-Host "Dry run: prepared key is at $dest"; exit 0 }
    59: 
    60: # Set secrets via gh
    61: Write-Host "Setting repository secrets (APP_ID, INSTALLATION_ID, PRIVATE_KEY_PEM) for $Repo"
    62: $pk = Get-Content -Raw $dest
    63: # Use gh secret set
    64: gh secret set APP_ID --body $AppId --repo $Repo
    65: if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) { Write-ErrAndExit "Failed to set APP_ID secret" }
    66: gh secret set INSTALLATION_ID --body $InstallationId --repo $Repo
    67: if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) { Write-ErrAndExit "Failed to set INSTALLATION_ID secret" }
    68: # PRIVATE_KEY_PEM: ensure newlines preserved
    69: # Use temporary file approach
    70: $tempFile = [System.IO.Path]::GetTempFileName()
    71: Set-Content -Path $tempFile -Value $pk -NoNewline
    72: gh secret set PRIVATE_KEY_PEM --body (Get-Content -Raw $tempFile) --repo $Repo
    73: if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) { Write-ErrAndExit "Failed to set PRIVATE_KEY_PEM secret" }
    74: Remove-Item $tempFile -Force
    75: 
    76: Write-Host "Secrets set. Triggering workflow..."
    77: $run = gh workflow run get-installation-token.yml --repo $Repo
    78: if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) { Write-ErrAndExit "Failed to trigger workflow" }
    79: 
    80: # List latest runs and pick one for the workflow
    81: Start-Sleep -Seconds 3
    82: # get most recent run id (databaseId)
    83: $runId = gh run list --workflow="get-installation-token.yml" --repo $Repo --limit 1 --json databaseId --jq '.[0].databaseId' 2>$null
    84: if (-not $runId) { Write-ErrAndExit "Failed to get run id" }
    85: Write-Host "Triggered run id: $runId"
    86: 
    87: # Poll run status until completed or timeout
    88: $timeoutMinutes = 5
    89: $waitSeconds = 5
    90: $elapsed = 0
    91: $maxSeconds = $timeoutMinutes * 60
    92: while ($elapsed -lt $maxSeconds) {
    93:   $status = gh run view $runId --repo $Repo --json status,conclusion --jq '.status' 2>$null
    94:   if ($status -eq 'completed') { break }
    95:   Start-Sleep -Seconds $waitSeconds
    96:   $elapsed += $waitSeconds
    97: }
    98: 
    99: $status = gh run view $runId --repo $Repo --json status,conclusion --jq '.status' 2>$null
   100: $conclusion = gh run view $runId --repo $Repo --json status,conclusion --jq '.conclusion' 2>$null
   101: Write-Host "Run status: $status conclusion: $conclusion"
   102: 
   103: if ($status -ne 'completed') { Write-ErrAndExit "Run did not complete in time (timeout $timeoutMinutes minutes)" }
   104: if ($conclusion -ne 'success') { Write-ErrAndExit "Run completed but not successful: $conclusion" }
   105: 
   106: # Download artifact to D:\keys
   107: $destDir = 'D:\keys'
   108: if (-not (Test-Path $destDir)) { New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $destDir | Out-Null }
   109: Write-Host "Downloading artifact installation-token to $destDir"
   110: # remove existing extracted folder to avoid zip extraction conflicts
   111: $extractedDir = Join-Path $destDir 'installation-token'
   112: if (Test-Path $extractedDir) {
   113:   Write-Host "Removing existing artifact extraction folder $extractedDir"
   114:   Remove-Item -Recurse -Force $extractedDir
   115: }
   116: # remove existing root token file to avoid gh extraction error
   117: $rootTokenPath = Join-Path $destDir 'token.txt'
   118: if (Test-Path $rootTokenPath) {
   119:   Write-Host "Removing existing token file $rootTokenPath to allow artifact extraction"
   120:   Remove-Item -Force $rootTokenPath
   121: }
   122: # remove existing installation-repos.json to avoid gh extraction error
   123: $rootReposPath = Join-Path $destDir 'installation-repos.json'
   124: if (Test-Path $rootReposPath) {
   125:   Write-Host "Removing existing API result file $rootReposPath to allow artifact extraction"
   126:   Remove-Item -Force $rootReposPath
   127: }
   128: 
   129: gh run download $runId --repo $Repo --name installation-token --dir $destDir
   130: if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) { Write-ErrAndExit "Failed to download artifact" }
   131: 
   132: # artifact may be extracted into $destDir\\installation-token\\token.txt or token may already exist at $destDir\\token.txt
   133: $artifactTokenPath = Join-Path $extractedDir 'token.txt'
   134: $rootTokenPath = Join-Path $destDir 'token.txt'
   135: if (Test-Path $artifactTokenPath) {
   136:   Copy-Item -Path $artifactTokenPath -Destination $rootTokenPath -Force
   137:   Write-Host "Token saved to $rootTokenPath"
   138: } elseif (Test-Path $rootTokenPath) {
   139:   Write-Host "Token already present at $rootTokenPath"
   140: } else {
   141:   Write-ErrAndExit "Token file not found at $artifactTokenPath or $rootTokenPath"
   142: }
   143: 
   144: # also copy installation-repos.json to D:\\keys if present (either in extractedDir or root)
   145: $artifactReposPath = Join-Path $extractedDir 'installation-repos.json'
   146: $rootReposPath = Join-Path $destDir 'installation-repos.json'
   147: if (Test-Path $artifactReposPath) {
   148:   Copy-Item -Path $artifactReposPath -Destination $rootReposPath -Force
   149:   Write-Host "API result saved to $rootReposPath"
   150: } elseif (Test-Path $rootReposPath) {
   151:   Write-Host "API result already present at $rootReposPath"
   152: } else {
   153:   Write-Host "installation-repos.json not found in artifact."
   154: }
   155: 
   156: Write-Host "Done."


============================
FILE: scripts\run-with-timeout.ps1
============================
============================
     1: <#
     2: PowerShell wrapper: run a command with a timeout.
     3: Usage:
     4:   pwsh ./scripts/run-with-timeout.ps1 -Cmd "node dist/index.js start" -TimeoutSec 12
     5: Options:
     6:   -Quiet (default)  -> do not write to host
     7:   -Noisy            -> enable console output
     8:   -LogFile <path>   -> append logs to file
     9: #>
    10: param(
    11:   [Parameter(Mandatory=$true)][string]$Cmd,
    12:   [int]$TimeoutSec = 10,
    13:   [switch]$Noisy,
    14:   [string]$LogFile = ''
    15: )
    16: 
    17: # By default be quiet to avoid spamming UIs (unless -Noisy provided)
    18: $Quiet = -not $Noisy
    19: 
    20: function Log([string]$msg) {
    21:   if ($LogFile -and $LogFile.Trim()) {
    22:     try { Add-Content -Path $LogFile -Value ("$(Get-Date -Format o) ``: ``" + $msg) -Encoding UTF8 -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue } catch { }
    23:   }
    24:   if (-not $Quiet) { Write-Host $msg }
    25:   else { Write-Verbose $msg }
    26: }
    27: 
    28: Log "[run-with-timeout] starting command: $Cmd"
    29: $process = Start-Process pwsh -ArgumentList "-NoProfile","-NoLogo","-Command",$Cmd -PassThru -WindowStyle Hidden
    30: 
    31: Start-Sleep -Seconds $TimeoutSec
    32: 
    33: if (-not $process.HasExited) {
    34:     Log "[run-with-timeout] timeout reached ($TimeoutSec s) -> attempting graceful stop (Ctrl+C equivalent)"
    35:     try {
    36:         $null = $process.CloseMainWindow()
    37:     } catch {}
    38:     Start-Sleep -Seconds 1
    39:     if (-not $process.HasExited) {
    40:         Log "[run-with-timeout] still running -> forcing kill"
    41:         try { Stop-Process -Id $process.Id -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue } catch {}
    42:     }
    43: }
    44: 
    45: # return exit code if available
    46: if ($process -and $process.HasExited) { exit $process.ExitCode } else { exit 0 }


============================
FILE: scripts\set-secrets.ps1
============================
============================
     1: param(
     2:   [string]$Repo = '',
     3:   [switch]$PersistLocal,
     4:   [switch]$Quiet,
     5:   [switch]$NoPrompt
     6: )
     7: 
     8: # PowerShell script to set secrets using gh CLI or write to .env.local
     9: # If -PersistLocal is set, secrets are also stored encrypted under $env:USERPROFILE\.qflush\secrets.json
    10: # Usage: .\scripts\set-secrets.ps1 -Repo 'owner/repo' -PersistLocal
    11: 
    12: $VerbosePreference = 'SilentlyContinue'
    13: if (-not $Quiet) { $VerbosePreference = 'Continue' }
    14: 
    15: if (-not $Repo) {
    16:   try { $u = git remote get-url github 2>$null } catch { $u = $null }
    17:   if (-not $u) { try { $u = git remote get-url origin 2>$null } catch { $u = $null } }
    18:   if ($u) { $Repo = ($u -replace '.*?/([^/]+/[^/]+)(\.git)?$','$1') }
    19: }
    20: if (-not $Repo) { Write-Error 'Repo not provided and could not be detected. Provide -Repo owner/repo.'; exit 2 }
    21: 
    22: $secrets = @('NPM_TOKEN','GUMROAD_TOKEN','QFLUSH_TOKEN','REDIS_URL','COPILOT_HMAC_SECRET','WEBHOOK_URL','GUMROAD_TOKEN_FILE')
    23: 
    24: $gh = Get-Command gh -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
    25: if ($gh) { $useGh = $true } else { $useGh = $false }
    26: 
    27: # helper: persist encrypted secret locally
    28: function Save-LocalSecret([string]$key, [string]$val) {
    29:   try {
    30:     $dir = Join-Path $env:USERPROFILE '.qflush'
    31:     if (-not (Test-Path $dir)) { New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $dir | Out-Null }
    32:     $file = Join-Path $dir 'secrets.json'
    33:     $enc = (ConvertTo-SecureString $val -AsPlainText -Force | ConvertFrom-SecureString)
    34:     $obj = @{}
    35:     if (Test-Path $file) {
    36:       try { $obj = Get-Content $file -Raw | ConvertFrom-Json } catch { $obj = @{} }
    37:     }
    38:     $obj.$key = $enc
    39:     $obj | ConvertTo-Json -Depth 5 | Set-Content -Path $file -Encoding UTF8
    40:     Write-Verbose "Saved ${key} to ${file} (encrypted)"
    41:   } catch {
    42:     Write-Warning "Failed to save local secret ${key}: $_"
    43:   }
    44: }
    45: 
    46: foreach ($key in $secrets) {
    47:   # dynamic env var read
    48:   try { $val = [System.Environment]::GetEnvironmentVariable($key) } catch { $val = $null }
    49:   if (-not $val) {
    50:     if ($NoPrompt) { Write-Verbose "Skipping ${key} (no prompt)"; continue }
    51:     $val = Read-Host "Provide value for ${key} (leave empty to skip)"
    52:   }
    53:   if (-not $val) { Write-Verbose "Skipping ${key}"; continue }
    54:   if ($useGh) {
    55:     try {
    56:       gh secret set $key --body $val --repo $Repo
    57:       Write-Verbose "Set ${key} as GitHub secret in ${Repo}"
    58:     } catch {
    59:       Write-Warning "gh secret set failed for ${key}: $_ - falling back to local file"
    60:       # fallback to local
    61:       if (-not (Test-Path '.env.local')) { New-Item -ItemType File -Path '.env.local' | Out-Null }
    62:       # remove any existing line for the key
    63:       (Get-Content .env.local) -replace "^${key}=.*$","" | Set-Content .env.local
    64:       Add-Content .env.local "${key}=${val}"
    65:     }
    66:   } else {
    67:     Write-Verbose "gh not available — writing ${key} to .env.local"
    68:     if (-not (Test-Path .env.local)) { New-Item -ItemType File -Path '.env.local' | Out-Null }
    69:     # remove any existing line for the key
    70:     (Get-Content .env.local) -replace "^${key}=.*$","" | Set-Content .env.local
    71:     Add-Content .env.local "${key}=${val}"
    72:   }
    73: 
    74:   if ($PersistLocal) {
    75:     Save-LocalSecret -key $key -val $val
    76:   } else {
    77:     if ($NoPrompt) { Write-Verbose "NoPersist set, skipping Save-LocalSecret for ${key}"; continue }
    78:     # Ask user whether to persist locally
    79:     $yn = Read-Host "Persist ${key} locally encrypted under %USERPROFILE%\\.qflush? (y/N)"
    80:     if ($yn -and $yn.ToLower().StartsWith('y')) {
    81:       Save-LocalSecret -key $key -val $val
    82:     }
    83:   }
    84: }
    85: 
    86: Write-Verbose 'Done.'


============================
FILE: scripts\setup-runner-env.ps1
============================
============================
     1: <#
     2: Setup runner environment variables to avoid port collisions for qflush and spyder.
     3: Run this script on the self-hosted runner (PowerShell as Administrator recommended).
     4: #>
     5: 
     6: param(
     7:     [int]$QflushPort = 43421,
     8:     [int]$SpyderAdminPort = 4022,
     9:     [switch]$MachineScope
    10: )
    11: 
    12: function Is-Admin {
    13:     $current = [Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity]::GetCurrent()
    14:     $principal = New-Object Security.Principal.WindowsPrincipal($current)
    15:     return $principal.IsInRole([Security.Principal.WindowsBuiltInRole]::Administrator)
    16: }
    17: 
    18: Write-Host "Setting runner env: QFLUSHD_PORT=$QflushPort, QFLUSH_SPYDER_ADMIN_PORT=$SpyderAdminPort (MachineScope=$MachineScope)"
    19: 
    20: try {
    21:     if ($MachineScope.IsPresent -and -not (Is-Admin)) {
    22:         Write-Warning "Machine scope requested but script is not running as Administrator. Re-run as admin to set machine-level variables. Falling back to user-level setx."
    23:     }
    24: 
    25:     if ($MachineScope.IsPresent -and (Is-Admin)) {
    26:         setx /M QFLUSHD_PORT $QflushPort | Out-Null
    27:         setx /M QFLUSH_SPYDER_ADMIN_PORT $SpyderAdminPort | Out-Null
    28:         Write-Host "Persisted machine-level variables QFLUSHD_PORT and QFLUSH_SPYDER_ADMIN_PORT"
    29:     } else {
    30:         setx QFLUSHD_PORT $QflushPort | Out-Null
    31:         setx QFLUSH_SPYDER_ADMIN_PORT $SpyderAdminPort | Out-Null
    32:         Write-Host "Persisted user-level variables QFLUSHD_PORT and QFLUSH_SPYDER_ADMIN_PORT"
    33:     }
    34: 
    35:     # also write a helper .qflush/spyder.env in runner home for quick reference
    36:     try {
    37:         $homeQflush = Join-Path $env:USERPROFILE '.qflush'
    38:         if (-not (Test-Path $homeQflush)) { New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $homeQflush | Out-Null }
    39:         $envFile = Join-Path $homeQflush 'spyder.env'
    40:         "SPYDER_ADMIN_PORT=$SpyderAdminPort`nQFLUSHD_PORT=$QflushPort`n" | Out-File -FilePath $envFile -Encoding utf8 -Force
    41:         Write-Host "Wrote $envFile"
    42:     } catch {
    43:         Write-Warning "Failed to write .qflush/spyder.env: $_"
    44:     }
    45: 
    46:     Write-Host "To apply machine-level changes you may need to restart the runner service or the machine."
    47:     Write-Host "Current effective values (session): QFLUSHD_PORT=$($env:QFLUSHD_PORT) QFLUSH_SPYDER_ADMIN_PORT=$($env:QFLUSH_SPYDER_ADMIN_PORT)"
    48: } catch {
    49:     Write-Error "Failed to set runner env: $_"
    50:     exit 1
    51: }


============================
FILE: scripts\setup-windows-agent.ps1
============================
============================
     1: <#
     2: PowerShell helper to download and configure an Azure DevOps self-hosted agent on Windows.
     3: Usage (run as Administrator PowerShell):
     4:   PS> .\setup-windows-agent.ps1 -OrganizationUrl "https://dev.azure.com/funesterie" -Pool "self-hosted" -AgentName "qflush-agent"
     5: 
     6: You will be prompted for a PAT if not provided via -PatSecure.
     7: #>
     8: param(
     9:   [string]$OrganizationUrl = "https://dev.azure.com/funesterie",
    10:   [string]$Pool = "self-hosted",
    11:   [string]$AgentName = "qflush-agent",
    12:   [securestring]$PatSecure = $null,
    13:   [string]$AgentPackageUrl = "https://vstsagentpackage.azureedge.net/agent/2.220.1/vsts-agent-win-x64-2.220.1.zip",
    14:   [string]$InstallDir = "C:\azagent"
    15: )
    16: 
    17: function To-UnsecureString([securestring] $s) {
    18:   $bstr = [System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal]::SecureStringToBSTR($s)
    19:   try { [System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal]::PtrToStringBSTR($bstr) } finally { [System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal]::ZeroFreeBSTR($bstr) }
    20: }
    21: 
    22: if (-not $PatSecure) {
    23:   Write-Host "Enter a Personal Access Token (PAT) with 'Marketplace (publish)' and 'Agent Pools (read & manage)' scopes:" -ForegroundColor Yellow
    24:   $PatSecure = Read-Host -AsSecureString "PAT"
    25: }
    26: 
    27: $Pat = To-UnsecureString $PatSecure
    28: 
    29: if (-not (Test-Path $InstallDir)) { New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $InstallDir | Out-Null }
    30: Push-Location $InstallDir
    31: 
    32: $zip = Join-Path $InstallDir "agent.zip"
    33: Write-Host "Downloading agent package from $AgentPackageUrl ..."
    34: Invoke-WebRequest -Uri $AgentPackageUrl -OutFile $zip -UseBasicParsing
    35: 
    36: Write-Host "Extracting package..."
    37: Expand-Archive -Path $zip -DestinationPath $InstallDir -Force
    38: Remove-Item $zip -Force
    39: 
    40: # Find the agent folder (the zip extracts into the current folder files)
    41: $agentExe = Join-Path $InstallDir 'config.cmd'
    42: if (-not (Test-Path $agentExe)) {
    43:   Write-Host "Could not find config.cmd in $InstallDir. Listing files:" -ForegroundColor Red
    44:   Get-ChildItem -Path $InstallDir -Recurse | Select-Object -First 50 | Format-List
    45:   Pop-Location
    46:   exit 1
    47: }
    48: 
    49: Write-Host "Configuring agent (unattended)..."
    50: $argList = "--unattended --url `"$OrganizationUrl`" --auth pat --token `"$Pat`" --pool `"$Pool`" --agent `"$AgentName`" --acceptTeeEula"
    51: Write-Host ".\config.cmd $argList"
    52: 
    53: # Run config.cmd
    54: & .\config.cmd --unattended --url $OrganizationUrl --auth pat --token $Pat --pool $Pool --agent $AgentName --acceptTeeEula
    55: 
    56: if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) {
    57:   Write-Host "Agent configuration failed (exit $LASTEXITCODE). Check output above." -ForegroundColor Red
    58:   Pop-Location
    59:   exit $LASTEXITCODE
    60: }
    61: 
    62: Write-Host "Agent configured. Test run interactively with: .\run.cmd" -ForegroundColor Green
    63: Write-Host "To install as a service (recommended), follow the Azure DevOps agent pool UI instructions or run the service install script from this folder (if provided)." -ForegroundColor Yellow
    64: 
    65: Pop-Location
    66: Write-Host "Done. Agent should appear in Azure DevOps Agent Pools as online." -ForegroundColor Green


============================
FILE: scripts\store-secret.ps1
============================
============================
     1: <#
     2: store-secret.ps1
     3: Securely read a token from terminal and store it as a GitHub Actions repository secret using gh CLI.
     4: Requirements:
     5:  - GitHub CLI (`gh`) installed and authenticated (run `gh auth login` first)
     6:  - You must have admin permissions on the target repository
     7: Usage:
     8:   PowerShell> .\scripts\store-secret.ps1 -Repo "owner/repo" -Name "ACTIONS_TOKEN"
     9: 
    10: This script reads the token securely (no echo), writes to a tempfile, calls `gh secret set` with the file
    11: and removes the tempfile immediately.
    12: #>
    13: param(
    14:   [Parameter(Mandatory=$true)]
    15:   [string]$Repo,
    16:   [Parameter(Mandatory=$true)]
    17:   [string]$Name
    18: )
    19: 
    20: if (-not (Get-Command gh -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue)) {
    21:   Write-Error "gh CLI not found. Install and authenticate with 'gh auth login' before running this script."
    22:   exit 2
    23: }
    24: 
    25: try {
    26:   $secure = Read-Host -AsSecureString -Prompt "Paste secret value (input hidden)"
    27:   $plain = [System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal]::PtrToStringAuto([System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal]::SecureStringToBSTR($secure))
    28:   $tmp = Join-Path -Path $env:TEMP -ChildPath ([System.Guid]::NewGuid().ToString() + '.secret')
    29:   Set-Content -Path $tmp -Value $plain -NoNewline -Force
    30:   # Use gh to set the secret from file
    31:   $cmd = "gh secret set $Name --repo $Repo --body-file $tmp"
    32:   Write-Host "Setting secret '$Name' in repo '$Repo'..."
    33:   $res = & gh secret set $Name --repo $Repo --body-file $tmp 2>&1
    34:   Write-Host $res
    35: } finally {
    36:   if (Test-Path $tmp) { Remove-Item -Force $tmp }
    37:   if ($null -ne $plain) { $plain = $null }
    38: }
    39: 
    40: Write-Host "Done. Secret stored (or an error was printed above)."

============================
FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\node_modules\@funeste38\bat\src\bat.ts
============================
============================
     1: export type RequestClass = 'short' | 'normal' | 'slow' | 'timeout';
     2: 
     3: export interface BatOptions { baselineMs?: number; alpha?: number }
     4: 
     5: export class Bat {
     6:   baselineMs: number;
     7:   alpha: number;
     8:   private counter = 0;
     9:   private inFlight = new Map<string, { startedAt: number; attempts: number }>();
    10: 
    11:   constructor(opts: BatOptions = {}) {
    12:     this.baselineMs = opts.baselineMs ?? 500;
    13:     this.alpha = opts.alpha ?? 0.2;
    14:   }
    15: 
    16:   start(key: string) {
    17:     const id = `${key}:${++this.counter}`;
    18:     this.inFlight.set(id, { startedAt: Date.now(), attempts: 1 });
    19:     return id;
    20:   }
    21: 
    22:   stop(id: string) {
    23:     const rec = this.inFlight.get(id);
    24:     if (!rec) return null;
    25:     const rtt = Date.now() - rec.startedAt;
    26:     this.baselineMs = (1 - this.alpha) * this.baselineMs + this.alpha * rtt;
    27:     this.inFlight.delete(id);
    28:     return { rtt, cls: this.classify(rtt), attempts: rec.attempts } as { rtt: number; cls: RequestClass; attempts: number };
    29:   }
    30: 
    31:   classify(rtt: number): RequestClass {
    32:     if (rtt < this.baselineMs * 0.5) return 'short';
    33:     if (rtt < this.baselineMs * 1.5) return 'normal';
    34:     if (rtt < this.baselineMs * 3) return 'slow';
    35:     return 'timeout';
    36:   }
    37: 
    38:   markRetry(id: string) {
    39:     const rec = this.inFlight.get(id);
    40:     if (!rec) return null;
    41:     rec.attempts += 1;
    42:     rec.startedAt = Date.now();
    43:     return rec;
    44:   }
    45: 
    46:   listInFlight() { return [...this.inFlight.entries()]; }
    47: }


============================
FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\node_modules\@funeste38\bat\src\batWings.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { defaultProfiles, WingProfile } from './profiles';
     2: 
     3: export type RequestClass = 'short' | 'normal' | 'slow' | 'timeout';
     4: 
     5: export class BatWings {
     6:   state = {
     7:     rate: 1,
     8:     retries: 0,
     9:     safeMode: false
    10:   } as { rate: number; retries: number; safeMode: boolean };
    11: 
    12:   consecutiveTimeouts = 0;
    13:   readonly maxTimeouts = 3;
    14:   private lastAdjustAt = Date.now();
    15:   private profile: WingProfile = defaultProfiles.chat;
    16: 
    17:   selectProfile(type: string) {
    18:     this.profile = (defaultProfiles as any)[type] ?? defaultProfiles.chat;
    19:     return this.profile;
    20:   }
    21: 
    22:   applyProfile(echoClass: RequestClass) {
    23:     const profile = this.profile;
    24:     // small cooldown to avoid thrashing
    25:     const now = Date.now();
    26:     if (now - this.lastAdjustAt < 50) return;
    27:     this.lastAdjustAt = now;
    28: 
    29:     if (echoClass === 'short') this.state.rate = Math.min(3, this.state.rate + profile.rateGain);
    30:     if (echoClass === 'normal') this.state.rate = this.state.rate; // stable
    31:     if (echoClass === 'slow') this.state.rate = Math.max(0.2, this.state.rate + profile.rateLoss);
    32:     if (echoClass === 'timeout') {
    33:       this.state.rate = Math.max(0.1, this.state.rate + profile.rateLoss * 3);
    34:       this.consecutiveTimeouts++;
    35:     }
    36: 
    37:     // clamp
    38:     this.state.rate = Math.max(0.2, Math.min(3, this.state.rate));
    39:   }
    40: 
    41:   adjustRate(cls: RequestClass) {
    42:     // legacy fallback to keep compatibility
    43:     this.applyProfile(cls);
    44:   }
    45: 
    46:   computeTimeout(baseline: number) {
    47:     return Math.max(50, Math.round(baseline * (this.profile.timeoutFactor ?? 1)));
    48:   }
    49: 
    50:   shouldRetry(attempts: number) {
    51:     return attempts < (this.profile.maxRetries ?? 0);
    52:   }
    53: 
    54:   shouldAbort(): boolean {
    55:     return this.consecutiveTimeouts >= this.maxTimeouts || this.state.safeMode;
    56:   }
    57: 
    58:   resetTimeouts() {
    59:     this.consecutiveTimeouts = 0;
    60:   }
    61: 
    62:   drop(id: string) {
    63:     // placeholder for drop action: in a real system we'd cancel network requests
    64:     // here we just log
    65:     // eslint-disable-next-line no-console
    66:     console.warn(`BatWings.drop: dropping ${id}`);
    67:   }
    68: 
    69:   async emergencyRecovery() {
    70:     // simple unsync recovery: wait, then reset rate and timeouts
    71:     // eslint-disable-next-line no-console
    72:     console.warn('BatWings: emergency recovery — pausing briefly');
    73:     await new Promise((r) => setTimeout(r, 300));
    74:     this.state.rate = 1;
    75:     this.resetTimeouts();
    76:     // eslint-disable-next-line no-console
    77:     console.warn('BatWings: recovery complete');
    78:   }
    79: }

FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\node_modules\@funeste38\bat\src\demo.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { EchoRadar, wrapEcho, BatWings, Instinct } from './index';
     2: import { Fangs, Channel } from './fangs';
     3: 
     4: const types = ['chat', 'heavy', 'critical', 'echo', 'file', 'system'];
     5: 
     6: async function fakeCall(text: string) {
     7:   // random delay between 10ms and 2000ms
     8:   const delay = 10 + Math.random() * 1990;
     9:   await new Promise((res) => setTimeout(res, delay));
    10:   if (Math.random() < 0.1) throw { status: 502, message: 'random fail' };
    11:   // random short payloads sometimes
    12:   if (Math.random() < 0.15) return '';
    13:   const gen = Array.from({ length: Math.floor(Math.random() * 200) + 5 }, () => 'x').join('');
    14:   return { echoed: text, delay, gen };
    15: }
    16: 
    17: function formatError(err: unknown): string | undefined {
    18:   if (!err) return undefined;
    19:   if (typeof err === 'string') return err;
    20:   if (err instanceof Error) return err.message;
    21:   if (typeof err === 'object') {
    22:     try {
    23:       const anyErr = err as any;
    24:       return anyErr && (anyErr.message ? String(anyErr.message) : JSON.stringify(anyErr));
    25:     } catch {
    26:       return String(err);
    27:     }
    28:   }
    29:   return String(err);
    30: }
    31: 
    32: async function demoFangs() {
    33:   // demonstrate Instinct first
    34:   const instinct = new Instinct({
    35:     defaults: { A11_PATH: 'D:/A11', API_TOKEN: 'DEV_TOKEN' },
    36:     config: { API_HOST: 'api.funesterie.me' }
    37:   });
    38: 
    39:   const sampleCmd = 'start-server --path={A11_PATH} --host={API_HOST} --token={API_TOKEN}';
    40:   console.log('Slots detected:', instinct.detectSlots(sampleCmd));
    41:   const filled = instinct.fill(sampleCmd);
    42:   console.log('Filled command:', filled.cmd);
    43:   if (filled.missing.length) console.log('Missing slots:', filled.missing);
    44: 
    45:   const channels: Channel[] = [
    46:     { id: 'local', kind: 'local', endpoint: 'http://127.0.0.1:3000', weight: 2, stats: { rttAvg: 300, errors: 0, inFlight: 0 } },
    47:     { id: 'tunnel', kind: 'proxy', endpoint: 'https://api.funesterie.me', weight: 1, stats: { rttAvg: 800, errors: 0, inFlight: 0 } }
    48:   ];
    49:   const fangs = new Fangs({ maxConcurrency: 4, channels });
    50: 
    51:   // mock bridge that uses channel info
    52:   const bridge = {
    53:     askA11Raw: async (channel: any, text: string) => {
    54:       // simulate network time influenced by channel rttAvg
    55:       await new Promise((r) => setTimeout(r, Math.max(10, channel.stats.rttAvg / 10)));
    56:       if (Math.random() < 0.05) throw { status: 502 };
    57:       return { from: channel.id, text };
    58:     }
    59:   };
    60: 
    61:   for (let i = 0; i < 20; i++) {
    62:     const type = types[i % types.length] as any;
    63:     try {
    64:       const { channel, result } = await fangs.run(type, async (ch) => bridge.askA11Raw(ch, `hello ${i}`));
    65:       console.log(i, 'used', channel.id, 'result', result);
    66:     } catch (e) {
    67:       console.warn(i, 'failed', formatError(e));
    68:     }
    69:   }
    70: }
    71: 
    72: async function main() {
    73:   await demoFangs();
    74: }
    75: 
    76: main().catch((e) => console.error(e));

FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\node_modules\@funeste38\bat\src\ears.ts
============================
============================
     1: export type OriginGuess = 'local' | 'remote' | 'cached' | 'error';
     2: 
     3: export interface EarsResult { signalStrength: number; origin: OriginGuess; isNoise: boolean }
     4: 
     5: export class Ears {
     6:   ignoreShortBytes = 5;
     7: 
     8:   ignore(result: any, error?: any) {
     9:     if (error) {
    10:       const status = (error && ((error as any).status || (error as any).statusCode)) as number | undefined;
    11:       if (status && [429, 502, 503].includes(status)) return true;
    12:       return false;
    13:     }
    14:     if (result == null) return true;
    15:     if (typeof result === 'string') {
    16:       const s = result.trim();
    17:       if (s === '' || s === 'null' || s === 'undefined') return true;
    18:       if (s.length < this.ignoreShortBytes) return true;
    19:     }
    20:     if (typeof result === 'object') {
    21:       try {
    22:         const str = JSON.stringify(result);
    23:         if (str === '{}' || str === '[]' || str.length < this.ignoreShortBytes) return true;
    24:       } catch { return false; }
    25:     }
    26:     return false;
    27:   }
    28: 
    29:   evaluate(result: any, rtt: number, error?: any): EarsResult {
    30:     const isNoise = this.ignore(result, error);
    31:     if (error) return { signalStrength: 0, origin: 'error', isNoise: true };
    32: 
    33:     let len = 0;
    34:     if (typeof result === 'string') len = result.length;
    35:     else if (result && typeof result === 'object') {
    36:       try { len = JSON.stringify(result).length; } catch { len = 0; }
    37:     }
    38: 
    39:     let score = Math.max(0, Math.min(100, 50 + Math.min(40, Math.round((len / 1000) * 40)) - (rtt > 1500 ? 30 : (rtt > 500 ? 10 : 0))));
    40:     if (len < 20) score = Math.max(0, score - 20);
    41: 
    42:     const origin = error ? 'error' : (len < 50 && rtt < 100 ? 'cached' : (rtt < 200 ? 'local' : (rtt < 1000 ? 'remote' : 'remote')));
    43:     return { signalStrength: score, origin, isNoise };
    44:   }
    45: }


============================
FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\node_modules\@funeste38\bat\src\fangs.ts
============================
============================
     1: export type RequestType = 'chat' | 'heavy' | 'critical' | 'echo' | 'file' | 'system';
     2: export type ChannelKind = 'local' | 'proxy' | 'remote' | 'mock';
     3: 
     4: export interface ChannelStats { rttAvg: number; errors: number; inFlight: number }
     5: export interface Channel { id: string; kind: ChannelKind; endpoint: string; proxy?: string; weight: number; stats: ChannelStats }
     6: export interface FangsOptions { maxConcurrency?: number; channels: Channel[] }
     7: 
     8: export class Fangs {
     9:   private channels: Channel[];
    10:   private maxConcurrency: number;
    11:   private semaphore = 0;
    12:   private rr = 0;
    13: 
    14:   constructor(opts: FangsOptions) { this.channels = opts.channels.slice(); this.maxConcurrency = opts.maxConcurrency ?? 4; }
    15: 
    16:   chooseChannel(type: RequestType): Channel {
    17:     const live = this.channels.filter(c => c.stats.errors < 5);
    18:     if (!live.length) throw new Error('No available channel');
    19:     if (type === 'echo') return live.reduce((best, c) => c.stats.rttAvg < best.stats.rttAvg ? c : best);
    20:     if (type === 'heavy') return live.reduce((best, c) => c.stats.inFlight < best.stats.inFlight ? c : best);
    21:     const total = live.reduce((s, c) => s + (c.weight || 1), 0);
    22:     let pick = this.rr % total;
    23:     for (const c of live) { const w = c.weight || 1; if (pick < w) { this.rr = (this.rr + 1) % total; return c; } pick -= w; }
    24:     return live[0];
    25:   }
    26: 
    27:   trackStart(channelId: string) { const ch = this.channels.find(c => c.id === channelId); if (ch) ch.stats.inFlight++; }
    28:   trackEnd(channelId: string, rtt: number, ok: boolean) { const ch = this.channels.find(c => c.id === channelId); if (!ch) return; ch.stats.inFlight = Math.max(0, ch.stats.inFlight - 1); ch.stats.rttAvg = ch.stats.rttAvg === 0 ? rtt : (0.8 * ch.stats.rttAvg + 0.2 * rtt); if (!ok) ch.stats.errors++; }
    29: 
    30:   async run<T>(type: RequestType, fn: (channel: Channel) => Promise<T>): Promise<{ channel: Channel; result: T }> {
    31:     while (this.semaphore >= this.maxConcurrency) await new Promise(r => setTimeout(r, 10));
    32:     this.semaphore++;
    33:     const channel = this.chooseChannel(type);
    34:     this.trackStart(channel.id);
    35:     try { const res = await fn(channel); this.trackEnd(channel.id, 0, true); return { channel, result: res }; }
    36:     catch (e) { this.trackEnd(channel.id, 0, false); throw e; }
    37:     finally { this.semaphore = Math.max(0, this.semaphore - 1); }
    38:   }
    39: }


============================
FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\node_modules\@funeste38\bat\src\heart.ts
============================
============================
     1: export type HeartCallback = () => void;
     2: 
     3: export class Heart {
     4:   intervalMs: number;
     5:   private timer: any = null;
     6:   private callbacks: HeartCallback[] = [];
     7:   running = false;
     8: 
     9:   constructor(intervalMs = 1000) { this.intervalMs = intervalMs; }
    10:   start() { if (this.running) return; this.running = true; this.timer = setInterval(() => this.tick(), this.intervalMs); }
    11:   stop() { if (!this.running) return; clearInterval(this.timer); this.timer = null; this.running = false; }
    12:   onTick(cb: HeartCallback) { this.callbacks.push(cb); }
    13:   private tick() { for (const cb of this.callbacks) { try { cb(); } catch {} } }
    14:   reset() { this.stop(); this.start(); }
    15: }


============================
FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\node_modules\@funeste38\bat\src\hormones.ts
============================
============================
     1: export class Hormones {
     2:   stress = 0; private decayMs = 5000; private lastUpdate = Date.now();
     3:   inc(amount = 5) { this.updateDecay(); this.stress = Math.min(100, this.stress + amount); return this.stress; }
     4:   dec(amount = 5) { this.updateDecay(); this.stress = Math.max(0, this.stress - amount); return this.stress; }
     5:   private updateDecay() { const now = Date.now(); const delta = now - this.lastUpdate; if (delta > this.decayMs) { const steps = Math.floor(delta / this.decayMs); this.stress = Math.max(0, this.stress - steps * 2); this.lastUpdate = now; } }
     6:   setStress(v:number){ this.stress = Math.max(0, Math.min(100, v)); }
     7: }


============================
FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\node_modules\@funeste38\bat\src\immune.ts
============================
============================
     1: export class Immune {
     2:   private blacklist = new Map<string, number>();
     3:   private penaltyMs = 30000;
     4:   isBlacklisted(channelId: string) { const until = this.blacklist.get(channelId); if (!until) return false; if (Date.now() > until) { this.blacklist.delete(channelId); return false; } return true; }
     5:   blacklistChannel(channelId: string, durationMs?: number) { const until = Date.now() + (durationMs ?? this.penaltyMs); this.blacklist.set(channelId, until); }
     6:   unblacklist(channelId: string) { this.blacklist.delete(channelId); }
     7:   prune() { for (const [k, until] of this.blacklist.entries()) if (Date.now() > until) this.blacklist.delete(k); }
     8:   list() { return Array.from(this.blacklist.entries()).map(([id, until]) => ({ id, until })); }
     9: }


============================
FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\node_modules\@funeste38\bat\src\index.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { BatWings } from './batWings';
     2: 
     3: export type RequestClass = 'short' | 'normal' | 'slow' | 'timeout';
     4: export type OriginGuess = 'local' | 'remote' | 'cached' | 'error';
     5: 
     6: export interface EchoRadarOptions {
     7:   baselineMs?: number;
     8:   alpha?: number;
     9:   maxAttempts?: number;
    10:   noiseFilter?: NoiseFilter;
    11: }
    12: 
    13: export interface NoiseFilter {
    14:   ignore(result: any, error?: any): boolean;
    15: }
    16: 
    17: interface InFlight {
    18:   id: string;
    19:   key: string;
    20:   startedAt: number;
    21:   attempts: number;
    22: }
    23: 
    24: const defaultNoiseFilter: NoiseFilter = {
    25:   ignore(result: any, error?: any) {
    26:     if (error) {
    27:       const status = (error && ((error as any).status || (error as any).statusCode)) as number | undefined;
    28:       if (status && [429, 502, 503].includes(status)) return true;
    29:       return false;
    30:     }
    31:     if (result == null) return true;
    32:     if (typeof result === 'string') {
    33:       const s = result.trim();
    34:       if (s === '' || s === 'null' || s === 'undefined') return true;
    35:       if (s.length < 5) return true;
    36:     }
    37:     if (typeof result === 'object') {
    38:       try {
    39:         const str = JSON.stringify(result);
    40:         if (str === '{}' || str === '[]' || str.length < 5) return true;
    41:       } catch {
    42:         return false;
    43:       }
    44:     }
    45:     return false;
    46:   }
    47: };
    48: 
    49: function computeSignalStrength(result: any, error: any, rtt: number): number {
    50:   if (error) return 0;
    51:   let score = 50;
    52:   let len = 0;
    53:   if (typeof result === 'string') len = result.length;
    54:   else if (result && typeof result === 'object') {
    55:     try { len = JSON.stringify(result).length; } catch { len = 0; }
    56:   } else if (typeof result === 'number' || typeof result === 'boolean') len = 1;
    57: 
    58:   // reward longer meaningful payloads
    59:   score += Math.min(40, Math.round((len / 1000) * 40));
    60:   if (len < 20) score -= 20;
    61: 
    62:   // penalize high latency
    63:   if (rtt > 1500) score -= 30;
    64:   else if (rtt > 500) score -= 10;
    65: 
    66:   score = Math.max(0, Math.min(100, score));
    67:   return score;
    68: }
    69: 
    70: function guessOrigin(rtt: number, len: number, error: any): OriginGuess {
    71:   if (error) return 'error';
    72:   if (len < 50 && rtt < 100) return 'cached';
    73:   if (rtt < 200) return 'local';
    74:   if (rtt < 1000) return 'remote';
    75:   return 'remote';
    76: }
    77: 
    78: function timeoutPromise<T>(p: Promise<T>, ms: number): Promise<T> {
    79:   let timer: any;
    80:   return Promise.race([
    81:     p,
    82:     new Promise<T>((_, rej) => {
    83:       timer = setTimeout(() => rej(new Error('timeout')), ms);
    84:     })
    85:   ]).finally(() => clearTimeout(timer));
    86: }
    87: 
    88: export class EchoRadar {
    89:   baselineMs: number;
    90:   alpha: number;
    91:   maxAttempts: number;
    92:   noiseFilter: NoiseFilter;
    93:   private inFlight = new Map<string, InFlight>();
    94:   private counter = 0;
    95: 
    96:   constructor(opts: EchoRadarOptions = {}) {
    97:     this.baselineMs = opts.baselineMs ?? 500;
    98:     this.alpha = opts.alpha ?? 0.2;
    99:     this.maxAttempts = opts.maxAttempts ?? 2;
   100:     this.noiseFilter = opts.noiseFilter ?? defaultNoiseFilter;
   101:   }
   102: 
   103:   start(key: string): string {
   104:     const id = `${key}:${++this.counter}`;
   105:     this.inFlight.set(id, {
   106:       id,
   107:       key,
   108:       startedAt: Date.now(),
   109:       attempts: 1
   110:     });
   111:     return id;
   112:   }
   113: 
   114:   stop(id: string): { rtt: number; cls: RequestClass; attempts: number } | null {
   115:     const rec = this.inFlight.get(id);
   116:     if (!rec) return null;
   117:     const rtt = Date.now() - rec.startedAt;
   118: 
   119:     this.baselineMs =
   120:       (1 - this.alpha) * this.baselineMs + this.alpha * rtt;
   121: 
   122:     this.inFlight.delete(id);
   123:     return { rtt, cls: this.classify(rtt), attempts: rec.attempts };
   124:   }
   125: 
   126:   classify(rtt: number): RequestClass {
   127:     if (rtt < this.baselineMs * 0.5) return 'short';
   128:     if (rtt < this.baselineMs * 1.5) return 'normal';
   129:     if (rtt < this.baselineMs * 3) return 'slow';
   130:     return 'timeout';
   131:   }
   132: 
   133:   getTimeoutThreshold(): number {
   134:     return this.baselineMs * 3;
   135:   }
   136: 
   137:   listInFlight() {
   138:     return [...this.inFlight.values()];
   139:   }
   140: 
   141:   markRetry(id: string): InFlight | null {
   142:     const rec = this.inFlight.get(id);
   143:     if (!rec) return null;
   144:     rec.attempts += 1;
   145:     rec.startedAt = Date.now();
   146:     if (rec.attempts > this.maxAttempts) {
   147:       this.inFlight.delete(id);
   148:     }
   149:     return rec;
   150:   }
   151: }
   152: 
   153: // Helper pour wrapper une fonction async
   154: export function wrapEcho<TArgs extends any[], TResult>(
   155:   key: string,
   156:   radar: EchoRadar,
   157:   fn: (...args: TArgs) => Promise<TResult>,
   158:   wings?: BatWings,
   159:   requestType?: string
   160: ) {
   161:   return async (...args: TArgs): Promise<{
   162:     result: TResult | null;
   163:     rtt: number;
   164:     cls: RequestClass;
   165:     attempts: number;
   166:     error?: unknown;
   167:     isNoise: boolean;
   168:     signalStrength: number;
   169:     originGuess: OriginGuess;
   170:     dropped?: boolean;
   171:   }> => {
   172:     if (wings && requestType) wings.selectProfile(requestType);
   173: 
   174:     const id = radar.start(key);
   175:     let result: TResult | null = null;
   176:     let error: any = undefined;
   177:     let attempts = 0;
   178:     let dropped = false;
   179: 
   180:     while (true) {
   181:       attempts++;
   182:       try {
   183:         const timeoutMs = wings ? wings.computeTimeout(radar.baselineMs) : radar.getTimeoutThreshold();
   184:         result = await timeoutPromise(fn(...args), timeoutMs) as TResult;
   185:         const echo = radar.stop(id)!;
   186:         const isNoise = radar.noiseFilter.ignore(result, undefined);
   187:         const len = typeof result === 'string' ? result.length : (result ? JSON.stringify(result).length : 0);
   188:         const signalStrength = computeSignalStrength(result, undefined, echo.rtt);
   189:         const originGuess = guessOrigin(echo.rtt, len, undefined);
   190: 
   191:         if (wings) {
   192:           wings.applyProfile(echo.cls);
   193:           if (wings.shouldAbort()) {
   194:             wings.drop(id);
   195:             dropped = true;
   196:             return { result, ...echo, isNoise, signalStrength, originGuess, dropped };
   197:           }
   198:         }
   199: 
   200:         return { result, ...echo, isNoise, signalStrength, originGuess, attempts };
   201:       } catch (err) {
   202:         error = err;
   203:         // if wings suggest retry based on profile
   204:         attempts = Math.max(1, attempts);
   205:         const shouldRetry = wings ? wings.shouldRetry(attempts) : attempts < radar.maxAttempts;
   206:         const echo = radar.stop(id) || { rtt: 0, cls: 'timeout' as RequestClass, attempts };
   207:         const isNoise = radar.noiseFilter.ignore(null, error);
   208:         const signalStrength = computeSignalStrength(null, error, echo.rtt);
   209:         const originGuess = guessOrigin(echo.rtt, 0, error);
   210: 
   211:         if (wings) {
   212:           wings.applyProfile(echo.cls);
   213:           if (wings.shouldAbort()) {
   214:             wings.drop(id);
   215:             // fire recovery asynchronously
   216:             // eslint-disable-next-line @typescript-eslint/no-floating-promises
   217:             wings.emergencyRecovery();
   218:             return { result: null, error, ...echo, isNoise, signalStrength, originGuess, dropped: true };
   219:           }
   220:         }
   221: 
   222:         if (!shouldRetry) {
   223:           return { result: null, error, ...echo, isNoise, signalStrength, originGuess };
   224:         }
   225: 
   226:         // prepare for next attempt
   227:         if (wings) wings.state.retries = attempts;
   228:         radar.markRetry(id);
   229:         // small backoff
   230:         await new Promise((r) => setTimeout(r, 50 * attempts));
   231:         continue;
   232:       }
   233:     }
   234:   };
   235: }
   236: 
   237: export { BatWings };
   238: export { Bat } from './bat';
   239: export { Ears } from './ears';
   240: export { Wings } from './wings';
   241: export { Fangs } from './fangs';
   242: export { Inversion } from './inversion';
   243: export { Heart } from './heart';
   244: export { Memory } from './memory';
   245: export { Hormones } from './hormones';
   246: export { Immune } from './immune';
   247: export { Sleep } from './sleep';
   248: export { Instinct } from './instinct';
   249: export * from './types';
   250: export * from './profiles';

FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\node_modules\@funeste38\bat\src\instinct.ts
============================
============================
     1: export interface InstinctOptions {
     2:   defaults?: Record<string, string>;
     3:   config?: Record<string, string>;
     4:   envPriority?: ('env'|'config'|'defaults')[];
     5: }
     6: 
     7: export class Instinct {
     8:   defaults: Record<string,string>;
     9:   config: Record<string,string>;
    10:   envPriority: ('env'|'config'|'defaults')[];
    11: 
    12:   constructor(opts: InstinctOptions = {}){
    13:     this.defaults = opts.defaults ?? {};
    14:     this.config = opts.config ?? {};
    15:     this.envPriority = opts.envPriority ?? ['env','config','defaults'];
    16:   }
    17: 
    18:   detectSlots(cmd: string): string[] {
    19:     const re = /\{([A-Z0-9_\-]+)\}/g;
    20:     const out: string[] = [];
    21:     let m: RegExpExecArray | null;
    22:     while ((m = re.exec(cmd)) !== null) {
    23:       out.push(m[1]);
    24:     }
    25:     return Array.from(new Set(out));
    26:   }
    27: 
    28:   resolveSlot(name: string): string | undefined {
    29:     for (const src of this.envPriority) {
    30:       if (src === 'env' && (process.env as any)[name]) return (process.env as any)[name];
    31:       if (src === 'config' && this.config[name]) return this.config[name];
    32:       if (src === 'defaults' && this.defaults[name]) return this.defaults[name];
    33:     }
    34:     return undefined;
    35:   }
    36: 
    37:   fill(cmd: string): { cmd: string; missing: string[] } {
    38:     const slots = this.detectSlots(cmd);
    39:     const missing: string[] = [];
    40:     let filled = cmd;
    41:     for (const s of slots) {
    42:       const val = this.resolveSlot(s);
    43:       if (val === undefined) { missing.push(s); continue; }
    44:       const re = new RegExp(`\\{${s}\\}`,'g');
    45:       filled = filled.replace(re, val);
    46:     }
    47:     return { cmd: filled, missing };
    48:   }
    49: }

FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\node_modules\@funeste38\bat\src\integrations\spyderAdapter.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { EchoRadar, BatWings } from '../index';
     2: import { Fangs, Channel } from '../fangs';
     3: 
     4: export interface SpyderBridge {
     5:   askA11Raw: (channel: Channel, text: string) => Promise<any>;
     6:   type?: string; // request type for wings profiles
     7: }
     8: 
     9: export function createSpyderAdapter(bridge: SpyderBridge, fangs?: Fangs) {
    10:   const radar = new EchoRadar();
    11:   const wings = new BatWings();
    12: 
    13:   async function callA11(text: string) {
    14:     const directChannel: Channel = { id: 'direct', kind: 'local', endpoint: '', weight: 1, stats: { rttAvg: 0, errors: 0, inFlight: 0 } };
    15:     // simple passthrough to the provided bridge
    16:     return bridge.askA11Raw(directChannel, text);
    17:   }
    18: 
    19:   async function askA11Multi(type: string, text: string) {
    20:     if (!fangs) throw new Error('Fangs instance required for multi-channel calls');
    21:     const { channel, result } = await fangs.run(type as any, async (ch) => {
    22:       // askA11Raw expects (channel, text)
    23:       return bridge.askA11Raw(ch, text);
    24:     });
    25:     return { channel, result };
    26:   }
    27: 
    28:   return { callA11, askA11Multi, radar, wings };
    29: }

FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\node_modules\@funeste38\bat\src\memory.ts
============================
============================
     1: export interface MemorySignal { time: number; id?: string; cls?: string; rtt?: number; signal?: number; origin?: string; err?: any }
     2: 
     3: export class Memory {
     4:   private size: number;
     5:   private ring: MemorySignal[] = [];
     6:   constructor(size = 50) { this.size = Math.max(1, size); }
     7:   push(sig: MemorySignal) { this.ring.push(sig); if (this.ring.length > this.size) this.ring.shift(); }
     8:   last(n = 10) { return this.ring.slice(Math.max(0, this.ring.length - n)); }
     9:   clear() { this.ring = []; }
    10:   find(predicate: (s: MemorySignal) => boolean) { return this.ring.find(predicate); }
    11: }

FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\node_modules\@funeste38\bat\src\profiles.ts
============================
============================
     1: export interface WingProfile {
     2:   rateGain: number;
     3:   rateLoss: number;
     4:   maxRetries: number;
     5:   timeoutFactor: number;
     6:   aggressiveness?: number; // 0..1
     7: }
     8: 
     9: export const defaultProfiles: Record<string, WingProfile> = {
    10:   echo:     { rateGain: 0.3,  rateLoss: -0.3, maxRetries: 0, timeoutFactor: 0.5, aggressiveness: 1 },
    11:   chat:     { rateGain: 0.1,  rateLoss: -0.1, maxRetries: 2, timeoutFactor: 1.0, aggressiveness: 0.5 },
    12:   heavy:    { rateGain: 0.2,  rateLoss: -0.05,maxRetries: 3, timeoutFactor: 2.0, aggressiveness: 0.8 },
    13:   critical: { rateGain: 0.05, rateLoss: -0.4, maxRetries: 0, timeoutFactor: 0.8, aggressiveness: 0.1 },
    14:   file:     { rateGain: 0.05, rateLoss: -0.05,maxRetries: 1, timeoutFactor: 3.0, aggressiveness: 0.3 },
    15:   system:   { rateGain: 0,    rateLoss: -0.3, maxRetries: 0, timeoutFactor: 0.6, aggressiveness: 0.2 }
    16: };

FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\node_modules\@funeste38\bat\src\sleep.ts
============================
============================
     1: export class Sleep {
     2:   sleeping = false;
     3:   async sleep(ms = 2000) { if (this.sleeping) return; this.sleeping = true; await new Promise((r) => setTimeout(r, ms)); this.sleeping = false; }
     4:   async sleepAndReset(ms = 2000, resetFn?: () => void) { await this.sleep(ms); if (resetFn) resetFn(); }
     5: }

     2: export type ChannelKind = 'local' | 'proxy' | 'remote' | 'mock';
     3: export interface ChannelStats { rttAvg: number; errors: number; inFlight: number }

FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\node_modules\@funeste38\bat\src\wings.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { defaultProfiles } from './profiles';
     2: import { RequestClass } from './bat';
     3: 
     4: export class Wings {
     5:   state = { rate: 1, retries: 0, safeMode: false } as { rate: number; retries: number; safeMode: boolean };
     6:   consecutiveTimeouts = 0;
     7:   readonly maxTimeouts = 3;
     8:   private lastAdjustAt = Date.now();
     9:   private profile: any = defaultProfiles.chat;
    10: 
    11:   selectProfile(type: string) { this.profile = (defaultProfiles as any)[type] ?? defaultProfiles.chat; return this.profile; }
    12: 
    13:   applyProfile(echoClass: RequestClass) {
    14:     const profile = this.profile;
    15:     const now = Date.now();
    16:     if (now - this.lastAdjustAt < 50) return;
    17:     this.lastAdjustAt = now;
    18: 
    19:     if (echoClass === 'short') this.state.rate = Math.min(3, this.state.rate + profile.rateGain);
    20:     if (echoClass === 'normal') this.state.rate = this.state.rate;
    21:     if (echoClass === 'slow') this.state.rate = Math.max(0.2, this.state.rate + profile.rateLoss);
    22:     if (echoClass === 'timeout') { this.state.rate = Math.max(0.1, this.state.rate + profile.rateLoss * 3); this.consecutiveTimeouts++; }
    23: 
    24:     this.state.rate = Math.max(0.2, Math.min(3, this.state.rate));
    25:   }
    26: 
    27:   computeTimeout(baseline: number) { return Math.max(50, Math.round(baseline * (this.profile.timeoutFactor ?? 1))); }
    28:   shouldRetry(attempts: number) { return attempts < (this.profile.maxRetries ?? 0); }
    29:   shouldAbort() { return this.consecutiveTimeouts >= this.maxTimeouts || this.state.safeMode; }
    30:   resetTimeouts() { this.consecutiveTimeouts = 0; }
    31:   reset() { this.state.rate = 1; this.resetTimeouts(); this.state.retries = 0; this.state.safeMode = false; }
    32: }

    53:     "prepublishOnly": "npm run-s -n build test"
    54:   },
    55:   "homepage": "https://github.com/jridgewell/sourcemaps/tree/main/packages/sourcemap-codec",
    56:   "repository": {
    57:     "type": "git",
    58:     "url": "git+https://github.com/jridgewell/sourcemaps.git",
    59:     "directory": "packages/sourcemap-codec"
    60:   },
    61:   "author": "Justin Ridgewell <justin@ridgewell.name>",
    62:   "license": "MIT"
    63: }


============================
FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\node_modules\@jridgewell\sourcemap-codec\src\scopes.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { StringReader, StringWriter } from './strings';
     2: import { comma, decodeInteger, encodeInteger, hasMoreVlq, semicolon } from './vlq';
     3: 
     4: const EMPTY: any[] = [];
     5: 
     6: type Line = number;
     7: type Column = number;
     8: type Kind = number;
     9: type Name = number;
    10: type Var = number;
    11: type SourcesIndex = number;
    12: type ScopesIndex = number;
    13: 
    14: type Mix<A, B, O> = (A & O) | (B & O);
    15: 
    16: export type OriginalScope = Mix<
    17:   [Line, Column, Line, Column, Kind],
    18:   [Line, Column, Line, Column, Kind, Name],
    19:   { vars: Var[] }
    20: >;
    21: 
    22: export type GeneratedRange = Mix<
    23:   [Line, Column, Line, Column],
    24:   [Line, Column, Line, Column, SourcesIndex, ScopesIndex],
    25:   {
    26:     callsite: CallSite | null;
    27:     bindings: Binding[];
    28:     isScope: boolean;
    29:   }
    30: >;
    31: export type CallSite = [SourcesIndex, Line, Column];
    32: type Binding = BindingExpressionRange[];
    33: export type BindingExpressionRange = [Name] | [Name, Line, Column];
    34: 
    35: export function decodeOriginalScopes(input: string): OriginalScope[] {
    36:   const { length } = input;
    37:   const reader = new StringReader(input);
    38:   const scopes: OriginalScope[] = [];
    39:   const stack: OriginalScope[] = [];
    40:   let line = 0;
    41: 
    42:   for (; reader.pos < length; reader.pos++) {
    43:     line = decodeInteger(reader, line);
    44:     const column = decodeInteger(reader, 0);
    45: 
    46:     if (!hasMoreVlq(reader, length)) {
    47:       const last = stack.pop()!;
    48:       last[2] = line;
    49:       last[3] = column;
    50:       continue;
    51:     }
    52: 
    53:     const kind = decodeInteger(reader, 0);
    54:     const fields = decodeInteger(reader, 0);
    55:     const hasName = fields & 0b0001;
    56: 
    57:     const scope: OriginalScope = (
    58:       hasName ? [line, column, 0, 0, kind, decodeInteger(reader, 0)] : [line, column, 0, 0, kind]
    59:     ) as OriginalScope;
    60: 
    61:     let vars: Var[] = EMPTY;
    62:     if (hasMoreVlq(reader, length)) {
    63:       vars = [];
    64:       do {
    65:         const varsIndex = decodeInteger(reader, 0);
    66:         vars.push(varsIndex);
    67:       } while (hasMoreVlq(reader, length));
    68:     }
    69:     scope.vars = vars;
    70: 
    71:     scopes.push(scope);
    72:     stack.push(scope);
    73:   }
    74: 
    75:   return scopes;
    76: }
    77: 
    78: export function encodeOriginalScopes(scopes: OriginalScope[]): string {
    79:   const writer = new StringWriter();
    80: 
    81:   for (let i = 0; i < scopes.length; ) {
    82:     i = _encodeOriginalScopes(scopes, i, writer, [0]);
    83:   }
    84: 
    85:   return writer.flush();
    86: }
    87: 
    88: function _encodeOriginalScopes(
    89:   scopes: OriginalScope[],
    90:   index: number,
    91:   writer: StringWriter,
    92:   state: [
    93:     number, // GenColumn
    94:   ],
    95: ): number {
    96:   const scope = scopes[index];
    97:   const { 0: startLine, 1: startColumn, 2: endLine, 3: endColumn, 4: kind, vars } = scope;
    98: 
    99:   if (index > 0) writer.write(comma);
   100: 
   101:   state[0] = encodeInteger(writer, startLine, state[0]);
   102:   encodeInteger(writer, startColumn, 0);
   103:   encodeInteger(writer, kind, 0);
   104: 
   105:   const fields = scope.length === 6 ? 0b0001 : 0;
   106:   encodeInteger(writer, fields, 0);
   107:   if (scope.length === 6) encodeInteger(writer, scope[5], 0);
   108: 
   109:   for (const v of vars) {
   110:     encodeInteger(writer, v, 0);
   111:   }
   112: 
   113:   for (index++; index < scopes.length; ) {
   114:     const next = scopes[index];
   115:     const { 0: l, 1: c } = next;
   116:     if (l > endLine || (l === endLine && c >= endColumn)) {
   117:       break;
   118:     }
   119:     index = _encodeOriginalScopes(scopes, index, writer, state);
   120:   }
   121: 
   122:   writer.write(comma);
   123:   state[0] = encodeInteger(writer, endLine, state[0]);
   124:   encodeInteger(writer, endColumn, 0);
   125: 
   126:   return index;
   127: }
   128: 
   129: export function decodeGeneratedRanges(input: string): GeneratedRange[] {
   130:   const { length } = input;
   131:   const reader = new StringReader(input);
   132:   const ranges: GeneratedRange[] = [];
   133:   const stack: GeneratedRange[] = [];
   134: 
   135:   let genLine = 0;
   136:   let definitionSourcesIndex = 0;
   137:   let definitionScopeIndex = 0;
   138:   let callsiteSourcesIndex = 0;
   139:   let callsiteLine = 0;
   140:   let callsiteColumn = 0;
   141:   let bindingLine = 0;
   142:   let bindingColumn = 0;
   143: 
   144:   do {
   145:     const semi = reader.indexOf(';');
   146:     let genColumn = 0;
   147: 
   148:     for (; reader.pos < semi; reader.pos++) {
   149:       genColumn = decodeInteger(reader, genColumn);
   150: 
   151:       if (!hasMoreVlq(reader, semi)) {
   152:         const last = stack.pop()!;
   153:         last[2] = genLine;
   154:         last[3] = genColumn;
   155:         continue;
   156:       }
   157: 
   158:       const fields = decodeInteger(reader, 0);
   159:       const hasDefinition = fields & 0b0001;
   160:       const hasCallsite = fields & 0b0010;
   161:       const hasScope = fields & 0b0100;
   162: 
   163:       let callsite: CallSite | null = null;
   164:       let bindings: Binding[] = EMPTY;
   165:       let range: GeneratedRange;
   166:       if (hasDefinition) {
   167:         const defSourcesIndex = decodeInteger(reader, definitionSourcesIndex);
   168:         definitionScopeIndex = decodeInteger(
   169:           reader,
   170:           definitionSourcesIndex === defSourcesIndex ? definitionScopeIndex : 0,
   171:         );
   172: 
   173:         definitionSourcesIndex = defSourcesIndex;
   174:         range = [genLine, genColumn, 0, 0, defSourcesIndex, definitionScopeIndex] as GeneratedRange;
   175:       } else {
   176:         range = [genLine, genColumn, 0, 0] as GeneratedRange;
   177:       }
   178: 
   179:       range.isScope = !!hasScope;
   180: 
   181:       if (hasCallsite) {
   182:         const prevCsi = callsiteSourcesIndex;
   183:         const prevLine = callsiteLine;
   184:         callsiteSourcesIndex = decodeInteger(reader, callsiteSourcesIndex);
   185:         const sameSource = prevCsi === callsiteSourcesIndex;
   186:         callsiteLine = decodeInteger(reader, sameSource ? callsiteLine : 0);
   187:         callsiteColumn = decodeInteger(
   188:           reader,
   189:           sameSource && prevLine === callsiteLine ? callsiteColumn : 0,
   190:         );
   191: 
   192:         callsite = [callsiteSourcesIndex, callsiteLine, callsiteColumn];
   193:       }
   194:       range.callsite = callsite;
   195: 
   196:       if (hasMoreVlq(reader, semi)) {
   197:         bindings = [];
   198:         do {
   199:           bindingLine = genLine;
   200:           bindingColumn = genColumn;
   201:           const expressionsCount = decodeInteger(reader, 0);
   202:           let expressionRanges: BindingExpressionRange[];
   203:           if (expressionsCount < -1) {
   204:             expressionRanges = [[decodeInteger(reader, 0)]];
   205:             for (let i = -1; i > expressionsCount; i--) {
   206:               const prevBl = bindingLine;
   207:               bindingLine = decodeInteger(reader, bindingLine);
   208:               bindingColumn = decodeInteger(reader, bindingLine === prevBl ? bindingColumn : 0);
   209:               const expression = decodeInteger(reader, 0);
   210:               expressionRanges.push([expression, bindingLine, bindingColumn]);
   211:             }
   212:           } else {
   213:             expressionRanges = [[expressionsCount]];
   214:           }
   215:           bindings.push(expressionRanges);
   216:         } while (hasMoreVlq(reader, semi));
   217:       }
   218:       range.bindings = bindings;
   219: 
   220:       ranges.push(range);
   221:       stack.push(range);
   222:     }
   223: 
   224:     genLine++;
   225:     reader.pos = semi + 1;
   226:   } while (reader.pos < length);
   227: 
   228:   return ranges;
   229: }
   230: 
   231: export function encodeGeneratedRanges(ranges: GeneratedRange[]): string {
   232:   if (ranges.length === 0) return '';
   233: 
   234:   const writer = new StringWriter();
   235: 
   236:   for (let i = 0; i < ranges.length; ) {
   237:     i = _encodeGeneratedRanges(ranges, i, writer, [0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0]);
   238:   }
   239: 
   240:   return writer.flush();
   241: }
   242: 
   243: function _encodeGeneratedRanges(
   244:   ranges: GeneratedRange[],
   245:   index: number,
   246:   writer: StringWriter,
   247:   state: [
   248:     number, // GenLine
   249:     number, // GenColumn
   250:     number, // DefSourcesIndex
   251:     number, // DefScopesIndex
   252:     number, // CallSourcesIndex
   253:     number, // CallLine
   254:     number, // CallColumn
   255:   ],
   256: ): number {
   257:   const range = ranges[index];
   258:   const {
   259:     0: startLine,
   260:     1: startColumn,
   261:     2: endLine,
   262:     3: endColumn,
   263:     isScope,
   264:     callsite,
   265:     bindings,
   266:   } = range;
   267: 
   268:   if (state[0] < startLine) {
   269:     catchupLine(writer, state[0], startLine);
   270:     state[0] = startLine;
   271:     state[1] = 0;
   272:   } else if (index > 0) {
   273:     writer.write(comma);
   274:   }
   275: 
   276:   state[1] = encodeInteger(writer, range[1], state[1]);
   277: 
   278:   const fields =
   279:     (range.length === 6 ? 0b0001 : 0) | (callsite ? 0b0010 : 0) | (isScope ? 0b0100 : 0);
   280:   encodeInteger(writer, fields, 0);
   281: 
   282:   if (range.length === 6) {
   283:     const { 4: sourcesIndex, 5: scopesIndex } = range;
   284:     if (sourcesIndex !== state[2]) {
   285:       state[3] = 0;
   286:     }
   287:     state[2] = encodeInteger(writer, sourcesIndex, state[2]);
   288:     state[3] = encodeInteger(writer, scopesIndex, state[3]);
   289:   }
   290: 
   291:   if (callsite) {
   292:     const { 0: sourcesIndex, 1: callLine, 2: callColumn } = range.callsite!;
   293:     if (sourcesIndex !== state[4]) {
   294:       state[5] = 0;
   295:       state[6] = 0;
   296:     } else if (callLine !== state[5]) {
   297:       state[6] = 0;
   298:     }
   299:     state[4] = encodeInteger(writer, sourcesIndex, state[4]);
   300:     state[5] = encodeInteger(writer, callLine, state[5]);
   301:     state[6] = encodeInteger(writer, callColumn, state[6]);
   302:   }
   303: 
   304:   if (bindings) {
   305:     for (const binding of bindings) {
   306:       if (binding.length > 1) encodeInteger(writer, -binding.length, 0);
   307:       const expression = binding[0][0];
   308:       encodeInteger(writer, expression, 0);
   309:       let bindingStartLine = startLine;
   310:       let bindingStartColumn = startColumn;
   311:       for (let i = 1; i < binding.length; i++) {
   312:         const expRange = binding[i];
   313:         bindingStartLine = encodeInteger(writer, expRange[1]!, bindingStartLine);
   314:         bindingStartColumn = encodeInteger(writer, expRange[2]!, bindingStartColumn);
   315:         encodeInteger(writer, expRange[0]!, 0);
   316:       }
   317:     }
   318:   }
   319: 
   320:   for (index++; index < ranges.length; ) {
   321:     const next = ranges[index];
   322:     const { 0: l, 1: c } = next;
   323:     if (l > endLine || (l === endLine && c >= endColumn)) {
   324:       break;
   325:     }
   326:     index = _encodeGeneratedRanges(ranges, index, writer, state);
   327:   }
   328: 
   329:   if (state[0] < endLine) {
   330:     catchupLine(writer, state[0], endLine);
   331:     state[0] = endLine;
   332:     state[1] = 0;
   333:   } else {
   334:     writer.write(comma);
   335:   }
   336:   state[1] = encodeInteger(writer, endColumn, state[1]);
   337: 
   338:   return index;
   339: }
   340: 
   341: function catchupLine(writer: StringWriter, lastLine: number, line: number) {
   342:   do {
   343:     writer.write(semicolon);
   344:   } while (++lastLine < line);
   345: }


============================
FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\node_modules\@jridgewell\sourcemap-codec\src\sourcemap-codec.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { comma, decodeInteger, encodeInteger, hasMoreVlq, semicolon } from './vlq';
     2: import { StringWriter, StringReader } from './strings';
     3: 
     4: export {
     5:   decodeOriginalScopes,
     6:   encodeOriginalScopes,
     7:   decodeGeneratedRanges,
     8:   encodeGeneratedRanges,
     9: } from './scopes';
    10: export type { OriginalScope, GeneratedRange, CallSite, BindingExpressionRange } from './scopes';
    11: 
    12: export type SourceMapSegment =
    13:   | [number]
    14:   | [number, number, number, number]
    15:   | [number, number, number, number, number];
    16: export type SourceMapLine = SourceMapSegment[];
    17: export type SourceMapMappings = SourceMapLine[];
    18: 
    19: export function decode(mappings: string): SourceMapMappings {
    20:   const { length } = mappings;
    21:   const reader = new StringReader(mappings);
    22:   const decoded: SourceMapMappings = [];
    23:   let genColumn = 0;
    24:   let sourcesIndex = 0;
    25:   let sourceLine = 0;
    26:   let sourceColumn = 0;
    27:   let namesIndex = 0;
    28: 
    29:   do {
    30:     const semi = reader.indexOf(';');
    31:     const line: SourceMapLine = [];
    32:     let sorted = true;
    33:     let lastCol = 0;
    34:     genColumn = 0;
    35: 
    36:     while (reader.pos < semi) {
    37:       let seg: SourceMapSegment;
    38: 
    39:       genColumn = decodeInteger(reader, genColumn);
    40:       if (genColumn < lastCol) sorted = false;
    41:       lastCol = genColumn;
    42: 
    43:       if (hasMoreVlq(reader, semi)) {
    44:         sourcesIndex = decodeInteger(reader, sourcesIndex);
    45:         sourceLine = decodeInteger(reader, sourceLine);
    46:         sourceColumn = decodeInteger(reader, sourceColumn);
    47: 
    48:         if (hasMoreVlq(reader, semi)) {
    49:           namesIndex = decodeInteger(reader, namesIndex);
    50:           seg = [genColumn, sourcesIndex, sourceLine, sourceColumn, namesIndex];
    51:         } else {
    52:           seg = [genColumn, sourcesIndex, sourceLine, sourceColumn];
    53:         }
    54:       } else {
    55:         seg = [genColumn];
    56:       }
    57: 
    58:       line.push(seg);
    59:       reader.pos++;
    60:     }
    61: 
    62:     if (!sorted) sort(line);
    63:     decoded.push(line);
    64:     reader.pos = semi + 1;
    65:   } while (reader.pos <= length);
    66: 
    67:   return decoded;
    68: }
    69: 
    70: function sort(line: SourceMapSegment[]) {
    71:   line.sort(sortComparator);
    72: }
    73: 
    74: function sortComparator(a: SourceMapSegment, b: SourceMapSegment): number {
    75:   return a[0] - b[0];
    76: }
    77: 
    78: export function encode(decoded: SourceMapMappings): string;
    79: export function encode(decoded: Readonly<SourceMapMappings>): string;
    80: export function encode(decoded: Readonly<SourceMapMappings>): string {
    81:   const writer = new StringWriter();
    82:   let sourcesIndex = 0;
    83:   let sourceLine = 0;
    84:   let sourceColumn = 0;
    85:   let namesIndex = 0;
    86: 
    87:   for (let i = 0; i < decoded.length; i++) {
    88:     const line = decoded[i];
    89:     if (i > 0) writer.write(semicolon);
    90:     if (line.length === 0) continue;
    91: 
    92:     let genColumn = 0;
    93: 
    94:     for (let j = 0; j < line.length; j++) {
    95:       const segment = line[j];
    96:       if (j > 0) writer.write(comma);
    97: 
    98:       genColumn = encodeInteger(writer, segment[0], genColumn);
    99: 
   100:       if (segment.length === 1) continue;
   101:       sourcesIndex = encodeInteger(writer, segment[1], sourcesIndex);
   102:       sourceLine = encodeInteger(writer, segment[2], sourceLine);
   103:       sourceColumn = encodeInteger(writer, segment[3], sourceColumn);
   104: 
   105:       if (segment.length === 4) continue;
   106:       namesIndex = encodeInteger(writer, segment[4], namesIndex);
   107:     }
   108:   }
   109: 
   110:   return writer.flush();
   111: }


============================
FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\node_modules\@jridgewell\sourcemap-codec\src\strings.ts
============================
============================
     1: const bufLength = 1024 * 16;
     2: 
     3: // Provide a fallback for older environments.
     4: const td =
     5:   typeof TextDecoder !== 'undefined'
     6:     ? /* #__PURE__ */ new TextDecoder()
     7:     : typeof Buffer !== 'undefined'
     8:       ? {
     9:           decode(buf: Uint8Array): string {
    10:             const out = Buffer.from(buf.buffer, buf.byteOffset, buf.byteLength);
    11:             return out.toString();
    12:           },
    13:         }
    14:       : {
    15:           decode(buf: Uint8Array): string {
    16:             let out = '';
    17:             for (let i = 0; i < buf.length; i++) {
    18:               out += String.fromCharCode(buf[i]);
    19:             }
    20:             return out;
    21:           },
    22:         };
    23: 
    24: export class StringWriter {
    25:   pos = 0;
    26:   private out = '';
    27:   private buffer = new Uint8Array(bufLength);
    28: 
    29:   write(v: number): void {
    30:     const { buffer } = this;
    31:     buffer[this.pos++] = v;
    32:     if (this.pos === bufLength) {
    33:       this.out += td.decode(buffer);
    34:       this.pos = 0;
    35:     }
    36:   }
    37: 
    38:   flush(): string {
    39:     const { buffer, out, pos } = this;
    40:     return pos > 0 ? out + td.decode(buffer.subarray(0, pos)) : out;
    41:   }
    42: }
    43: 
    44: export class StringReader {
    45:   pos = 0;
    46:   declare private buffer: string;
    47: 
    48:   constructor(buffer: string) {
    49:     this.buffer = buffer;
    50:   }
    51: 
    52:   next(): number {
    53:     return this.buffer.charCodeAt(this.pos++);
    54:   }
    55: 
    56:   peek(): number {
    57:     return this.buffer.charCodeAt(this.pos);
    58:   }
    59: 
    60:   indexOf(char: string): number {
    61:     const { buffer, pos } = this;
    62:     const idx = buffer.indexOf(char, pos);
    63:     return idx === -1 ? buffer.length : idx;
    64:   }
    65: }


============================
FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\node_modules\@jridgewell\sourcemap-codec\src\vlq.ts
============================
============================
     1: import type { StringReader, StringWriter } from './strings';
     2: 
     3: export const comma = ','.charCodeAt(0);
     4: export const semicolon = ';'.charCodeAt(0);
     5: 
     6: const chars = 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz0123456789+/';
     7: const intToChar = new Uint8Array(64); // 64 possible chars.
     8: const charToInt = new Uint8Array(128); // z is 122 in ASCII
     9: 
    10: for (let i = 0; i < chars.length; i++) {
    11:   const c = chars.charCodeAt(i);
    12:   intToChar[i] = c;
    13:   charToInt[c] = i;
    14: }
    15: 
    16: export function decodeInteger(reader: StringReader, relative: number): number {
    17:   let value = 0;
    18:   let shift = 0;
    19:   let integer = 0;
    20: 
    21:   do {
    22:     const c = reader.next();
    23:     integer = charToInt[c];
    24:     value |= (integer & 31) << shift;
    25:     shift += 5;
    26:   } while (integer & 32);
    27: 
    28:   const shouldNegate = value & 1;
    29:   value >>>= 1;
    30: 
    31:   if (shouldNegate) {
    32:     value = -0x80000000 | -value;
    33:   }
    34: 
    35:   return relative + value;
    36: }
    37: 
    38: export function encodeInteger(builder: StringWriter, num: number, relative: number): number {
    39:   let delta = num - relative;
    40: 
    41:   delta = delta < 0 ? (-delta << 1) | 1 : delta << 1;
    42:   do {
    43:     let clamped = delta & 0b011111;
    44:     delta >>>= 5;
    45:     if (delta > 0) clamped |= 0b100000;
    46:     builder.write(intToChar[clamped]);
    47:   } while (delta > 0);
    48: 
    49:   return num;
    50: }
    51: 
    52: export function hasMoreVlq(reader: StringReader, max: number) {
    53:   if (reader.pos >= max) return false;
    54:   return reader.peek() !== comma;
    55: }


============================
FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\node_modules\@jridgewell\trace-mapping\package.json
