     1: {
     2:   "name": "@jridgewell/trace-mapping",
     3:   "version": "0.3.9",
     4:   "description": "Trace the original position through a source map",
     5:   "keywords": [
     6:     "source",
     7:     "map"
     8:   ],
     9:   "main": "dist/trace-mapping.umd.js",
    10:   "module": "dist/trace-mapping.mjs",
    11:   "typings": "dist/types/trace-mapping.d.ts",
    12:   "files": [
    13:     "dist"
    14:   ],
    15:   "exports": {
    16:     ".": {
    17:       "browser": "./dist/trace-mapping.umd.js",
    18:       "require": "./dist/trace-mapping.umd.js",
    19:       "import": "./dist/trace-mapping.mjs"
    20:     },
    21:     "./package.json": "./package.json"
    22:   },
    23:   "author": "Justin Ridgewell <justin@ridgewell.name>",
    24:   "repository": {
    25:     "type": "git",
    26:     "url": "git+https://github.com/jridgewell/trace-mapping.git"
    27:   },
    28:   "license": "MIT",
    29:   "scripts": {
    30:     "benchmark": "run-s build:rollup benchmark:*",
    31:     "benchmark:install": "cd benchmark && npm install",
    32:     "benchmark:only": "node benchmark/index.mjs",
    33:     "build": "run-s -n build:*",
    34:     "build:rollup": "rollup -c rollup.config.js",
    35:     "build:ts": "tsc --project tsconfig.build.json",
    36:     "lint": "run-s -n lint:*",
    37:     "lint:prettier": "npm run test:lint:prettier -- --write",
    38:     "lint:ts": "npm run test:lint:ts -- --fix",
    39:     "prebuild": "rm -rf dist",
    40:     "prepublishOnly": "npm run preversion",
    41:     "preversion": "run-s test build",
    42:     "test": "run-s -n test:lint test:only",
    43:     "test:debug": "ava debug",
    44:     "test:lint": "run-s -n test:lint:*",
    45:     "test:lint:prettier": "prettier --check '{src,test}/**/*.ts' '**/*.md'",
    46:     "test:lint:ts": "eslint '{src,test}/**/*.ts'",
    47:     "test:only": "c8 ava",
    48:     "test:watch": "ava --watch"
    49:   },
    50:   "devDependencies": {
    51:     "@rollup/plugin-typescript": "8.3.0",
    52:     "@typescript-eslint/eslint-plugin": "5.10.0",

     5:   "version": "4.0.5",
     6:   "repository": {
     7:     "type": "git",
     8:     "url": "git://github.com/form-data/form-data.git"
     9:   },
    10:   "main": "./lib/form_data",
    11:   "browser": "./lib/browser",
    12:   "typings": "./index.d.ts",
    13:   "scripts": {
    14:     "pretest": "npm run lint",
    15:     "pretests-only": "rimraf coverage test/tmp",
    16:     "tests-only": "istanbul cover test/run.js",
    17:     "posttests-only": "istanbul report lcov text",
    18:     "test": "npm run tests-only",
    19:     "posttest": "npx npm@'>=10.2' audit --production",
    20:     "lint": "eslint --ext=js,mjs .",
    21:     "report": "istanbul report lcov text",
    22:     "ci-lint": "is-node-modern 8 && npm run lint || is-node-not-modern 8",
    23:     "ci-test": "npm run tests-only && npm run browser && npm run report",
    24:     "predebug": "rimraf coverage test/tmp",
    25:     "debug": "verbose=1 ./test/run.js",
    26:     "browser": "browserify -t browserify-istanbul test/run-browser.js | obake --coverage",
    27:     "check": "istanbul check-coverage coverage/coverage*.json",
    28:     "files": "pkgfiles --sort=name",
    29:     "get-version": "node -e \"console.log(require('./package.json').version)\"",
    30:     "update-readme": "sed -i.bak 's/\\/master\\.svg/\\/v'$(npm --silent run get-version)'.svg/g' README.md",
    31:     "postupdate-readme": "mv README.md.bak READ.ME.md.bak",
    32:     "restore-readme": "mv READ.ME.md.bak README.md",
    33:     "prepublish": "not-in-publish || npm run prepublishOnly",
    34:     "prepack": "npm run update-readme",
    35:     "postpack": "npm run restore-readme",
    36:     "version": "auto-changelog && git add CHANGELOG.md",
    37:     "postversion": "auto-changelog && git add CHANGELOG.md && git commit --no-edit --amend && git tag -f \"v$(node -e \"console.log(require('./package.json').version)\")\""
    38:   },
    39:   "engines": {
    40:     "node": ">= 6"
    41:   },
    42:   "dependencies": {

FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\admin\server.ts
============================
============================
     1: import http from 'http';
     2: import { Collector } from '../utils/collector';
     3: import { listDecoders } from '../protocol/decoder';
     4: 
     5: export function createAdminServer(port: number, collector: Collector, getState: () => any) {
     6:   const server = http.createServer((req: http.IncomingMessage, res: http.ServerResponse) => {
     7:     if (!req.url) {
     8:       res.writeHead(400);
     9:       res.end('bad request');
    10:       return;
    11:     }
    12: 
    13:     if (req.url === '/metrics') {
    14:       res.writeHead(200, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
    15:       res.end(JSON.stringify(collector.snapshot()));
    16:       return;
    17:     }
    18: 
    19:     if (req.url === '/memory') {
    20:       const state = getState();
    21:       res.writeHead(200, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
    22:       res.end(JSON.stringify({ ram: state.ram.records, cache: state.cache.records, dead: state.dead.snapshots }));
    23:       return;
    24:     }
    25: 
    26:     if (req.url === '/graph') {
    27:       const state = getState();
    28:       res.writeHead(200, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
    29:       res.end(JSON.stringify({ nodes: Array.from(state.web.nodes.entries()), edges: state.web.edges }));
    30:       return;
    31:     }
    32: 
    33:     if (req.url === '/decoders') {
    34:       res.writeHead(200, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
    35:       res.end(JSON.stringify({ decoders: listDecoders() }));
    36:       return;
    37:     }
    38: 
    39:     if (req.url === '/status') {
    40:       res.writeHead(200, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
    41:       res.end(JSON.stringify({ ok: true }));
    42:       return;
    43:     }
    44: 
    45:     res.writeHead(404);
    46:     res.end('not found');
    47:   });
    48: 
    49:   server.listen(port, '127.0.0.1');
    50:   return server;
    51: }


============================
FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\analyze\score.ts
============================
============================
     1: export interface ScoreContext {
     2:   checksumOk: boolean;
     3:   decodeOk: boolean;
     4:   responseOk: boolean;
     5: }
     6: 
     7: export function computeScore(ctx: ScoreContext): number {
     8:   let s = 0;
     9:   if (ctx.checksumOk) s += 1;
    10:   if (ctx.decodeOk) s += 1;
    11:   if (ctx.responseOk) s += 1;
    12:   return s;
    13: }


============================
FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\cli.ts
============================
============================
     1: #!/usr/bin/env node
     2: import { nlToProlog } from './parser/semantic.js';
     3: import { PrologEngine } from './logic/prologEngine.js';
     4: 
     5: const engine = new PrologEngine();
     6: 
     7: const input = process.argv.slice(2).join(' ');
     8: if (!input) {
     9:   console.log('Usage: spyder-cli "some sentence"');
    10:   process.exit(1);
    11: }
    12: 
    13: const fact = nlToProlog(input);
    14: console.log('Prolog fact:', fact);
    15: engine.assert(fact);
    16: console.log('Query back exists?', engine.query(fact));

     1: {
     2:   "tcpPort": 4000,

     4:   "host": "127.0.0.1",
     5:   "checksum": "xor",
     6:   "scoreThreshold": 2,
     7:   "snapshotIntervalMs": 60000,
     8:   "a11Endpoint": "http://127.0.0.1:3000/v1/chat/completions",
     9:   "echoTimeoutMs": 2000,
    10:   "longRequestThresholdMs": 1000,
    11:   "maxRetries": 1,
    12:   "plugins": ["@funeste38/bat"],
    13:   "allowInternet": true,
    14:   "httpProxy": "",
    15:   "languages": ["en","fr","es","zh","ru"]
    16: }


============================
FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\graph\web.ts
============================
============================
     1: export type NodeType = 'message' | 'concept';
     2: 
     3: export interface Node {
     4:   id: string;
     5:   type: NodeType;
     6:   payloadRef?: string;
     7: }
     8: 
     9: export type RelationType = 'sequence' | 'cause' | 'combo';
    10: 
    11: export interface Edge {
    12:   from: string;
    13:   to: string;
    14:   relation: RelationType;
    15:   weight: number;
    16: }
    17: 
    18: export class SpiderWeb {
    19:   nodes = new Map<string, Node>();
    20:   edges: Edge[] = [];
    21: 
    22:   addNode(node: Node) {
    23:     this.nodes.set(node.id, node);
    24:   }
    25: 
    26:   addEdge(from: string, to: string, relation: RelationType) {
    27:     const existing = this.edges.find(
    28:       e => e.from === from && e.to === to && e.relation === relation
    29:     );
    30:     if (existing) {
    31:       existing.weight += 1;
    32:     } else {
    33:       this.edges.push({ from, to, relation, weight: 1 });
    34:     }
    35:   }
    36: }


============================
FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\index.ts
============================
============================
     1: import * as net from 'net';
     2: import config from './config/default.json';
     3: import { log, logError } from './utils/logger';
     4: import {
     5:   PacketType,
     6:   parsePacket,
     7:   serializePacket
     8: } from './protocol/packet';
     9: import { decodePayload, registerDecoder } from './protocol/decoder';
    10: import { RamMemory } from './memory/ram';
    11: import { CacheMemory } from './memory/cache';
    12: import { DeadMemory } from './memory/dead';
    13: import { SpiderWeb } from './graph/web';
    14: import { computeScore } from './analyze/score';
    15: import { askA11 } from './teacher/bridge';
    16: import { elapsedMs, classifyLatency } from './utils/metrics';
    17: import { loadPlugins } from './plugins/loader';
    18: import { Collector } from './utils/collector';
    19: import { createAdminServer } from './admin/server';
    20: import { loadLanguageDecoders } from './lang/loader';
    21: 
    22: const ram = new RamMemory();
    23: const cache = new CacheMemory();
    24: const dead = new DeadMemory();
    25: const web = new SpiderWeb();
    26: const collector = new Collector();
    27: 
    28: let exchangeCounter = 0;
    29: 
    30: const spyderCtx = {
    31:   web,
    32:   ram,
    33:   cache,
    34:   dead,
    35:   config,
    36:   registerDecoder,
    37:   askA11,
    38:   log,
    39:   logError
    40: };
    41: 
    42: // load plugins (non-blocking)
    43: loadPlugins(spyderCtx as any).catch(e => logError('plugin loader failed', e));
    44: 
    45: // load language decoders
    46: loadLanguageDecoders().catch(e => logError('language loader failed', e));
    47: 
    48: // start admin server
    49: const admin = createAdminServer((config as any).adminPort || 4001, collector, () => ({ web, ram, cache, dead }));
    50: log('Admin server listening on', (config as any).adminPort || 4001);
    51: 
    52: async function callA11WithRetry(text: string, maxRetries: number, timeoutMs: number) {
    53:   let attempts = 0;
    54:   const start = Date.now();
    55:   while (attempts <= maxRetries) {
    56:     attempts += 1;
    57:     try {
    58:       const before = Date.now();
    59:       const resp = await askA11((config as any).a11Endpoint, text);
    60:       const latency = Date.now() - before;
    61:       collector.inc('requests_total');
    62:       collector.observe('latency_ms', latency);
    63:       return { resp: resp.text, attempts, latency, timedOut: false };
    64:     } catch (e) {
    65:       collector.inc('requests_error');
    66:       if (attempts > maxRetries) {
    67:         return { resp: 'ERROR_A11', attempts, latency: Date.now() - start, timedOut: true };
    68:       }
    69:       // else retry
    70:     }
    71:   }
    72:   return { resp: 'ERROR_A11', attempts: 0, latency: 0, timedOut: true };
    73: }
    74: 
    75: const server = net.createServer((socket: any) => {
    76:   log('Client connected');
    77: 
    78:   socket.on('data', async (data: any) => {
    79:     try {
    80:       const packet = parsePacket(new Uint8Array(data));
    81:       if (!packet) {
    82:         logError('Invalid packet structure');
    83:         collector.inc('invalid_packet');
    84:         return;
    85:       }
    86: 
    87:       const checksumOk = packet.checksum >= 0;
    88: 
    89:       if (packet.type === PacketType.Question) {
    90:         const decoded = await decodePayload(packet.payload).catch(() => null);
    91:         const decodeOk = decoded !== null;
    92: 
    93:         const text =
    94:           typeof decoded === 'string'
    95:             ? decoded
    96:             : JSON.stringify(decoded);
    97: 
    98:         log('Q:', text);
    99: 
   100:         // call A-11 with retries and measure latency
   101:         const start = Date.now();
   102:         const call = await callA11WithRetry(text, (config as any).maxRetries, (config as any).echoTimeoutMs);
   103:         const latency = call.latency;
   104:         const classification = call.timedOut
   105:           ? 'timeout'
   106:           : classifyLatency(latency, (config as any).longRequestThresholdMs);
   107: 
   108:         const responseText = call.resp;
   109:         const payloadBytes = new TextEncoder().encode(responseText);
   110:         const answerPacket = serializePacket({
   111:           type: PacketType.Answer,
   112:           payload: payloadBytes,
   113:           checksum: 0
   114:         });
   115: 
   116:         socket.write(Buffer.from(answerPacket));
   117: 
   118:         const score = computeScore({ checksumOk, decodeOk, responseOk: !call.timedOut });
   119: 
   120:         const id = `ex-${++exchangeCounter}`;
   121:         ram.add({
   122:           id,
   123:           question: packet,
   124:           answer: parsePacket(answerPacket)!,
   125:           score,
   126:           timestamp: Date.now(),
   127:           latencyMs: latency,
   128:           classification: classification as any,
   129:           attempts: call.attempts
   130:         });
   131: 
   132:         if ((config as any).scoreThreshold && score >= (config as any).scoreThreshold) {
   133:           const last = ram.getLast();
   134:           if (last) cache.promote(last);
   135:         }
   136: 
   137:         // graphe simple : question -> réponse
   138:         web.addNode({ id: `${id}-q`, type: 'message' });
   139:         web.addNode({ id: `${id}-a`, type: 'message' });
   140:         web.addEdge(`${id}-q`, `${id}-a`, 'sequence');
   141:       }
   142:     } catch (e) {
   143:       logError('Error handling data', e);
   144:     }
   145:   });
   146: 
   147:   socket.on('close', () => {
   148:     log('Client disconnected');
   149:   });
   150: });
   151: 
   152: server.listen((config as any).tcpPort, (config as any).host, () => {
   153:   log(`SPYDER TCP listening on ${(config as any).host}:${(config as any).tcpPort}`);
   154: });
   155: 
   156: // snapshot périodique
   157: setInterval(() => {
   158:   if (cache.records.length > 0) {
   159:     dead.snapshot(cache.records);
   160:     cache.clear();
   161:     log('Snapshot saved to dead memory');
   162:   }
   163: }, (config as any).snapshotIntervalMs);

FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\lang\detect.ts
============================
============================
     1: let franc: any;
     2: try {
     3:   franc = require('franc');
     4: } catch (e) {
     5:   franc = undefined;
     6: }
     7: 
     8: export function detectLanguage(text: string): string {
     9:   if (!text || text.trim().length === 0) return 'unknown';
    10: 
    11:   // Quick explicit-range heuristics for common scripts
    12:   try {
    13:     // Cyrillic range
    14:     if (/[\u0400-\u04FF\u0500-\u052F\u2DE0-\u2DFF\uA640-\uA69F]/.test(text)) return 'ru';
    15:     // Arabic range
    16:     if (/[\u0600-\u06FF\u0750-\u077F]/.test(text)) return 'ar';
    17:     // Han (CJK Unified Ideographs)
    18:     if (/[\u4E00-\u9FFF]/.test(text)) return 'zh';
    19:     // Devanagari
    20:     if (/[\u0900-\u097F]/.test(text)) return 'hi';
    21:     // Hiragana/Katakana
    22:     if (/[\u3040-\u30FF]/.test(text)) return 'ja';
    23:   } catch (e) {
    24:     // ignore
    25:   }
    26: 
    27:   if (!franc) return 'unknown';
    28:   try {
    29:     const code = franc(text, { minLength: 3 });
    30:     if (!code || code === 'und') return 'unknown';
    31:     const map: any = { eng: 'en', fra: 'fr', spa: 'es', cmn: 'zh', rus: 'ru', deu: 'de', jpn: 'ja', ara: 'ar', por: 'pt', ita: 'it', hin: 'hi' };
    32:     return map[code] || 'unknown';
    33:   } catch (e) {
    34:     return 'unknown';
    35:   }
    36: }

FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\lang\loader.ts

     1: import path from 'path';
     2: import { registerDecoder } from '../protocol/decoder';
     3: import config from '../config/default.json';
     4: 
     5: export async function loadLanguageDecoders() {
     6:   const langs: string[] = (config as any).languages || [];
     7:   for (const l of langs) {
     8:     try {
     9:       const p = `./decoders/${l}`;
    10:       const mod = await import(p);
    11:       if (mod && mod.default) {
    12:         registerDecoder(l, mod.default);
    13:         console.log('Loaded language decoder', l);
    14:       }
    15:     } catch (e) {
    16:       console.warn('Failed to load language decoder', l, e);
    17:     }
    18:   }
    19: }

FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\logic\prologEngine.ts
============================
============================
     1: // Minimal Prolog-like in-memory engine for simple facts and queries
     2: 
     3: export class PrologEngine {
     4:   facts: string[] = [];
     5: 
     6:   assert(fact: string) {
     7:     // store fact as raw string
     8:     this.facts.push(fact.trim());
     9:   }
    10: 
    11:   query(q: string): boolean {
    12:     // naive: check if exact fact exists
    13:     const norm = q.trim();
    14:     return this.facts.includes(norm);
    15:   }
    16: }

FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\memory\memory.ts
============================
============================
     1: function simpleId() {
     2:   // simple random hex id without using padStart to avoid lib issues
     3:   const n = Math.floor(Math.random() * 0xffffffff);
     4:   const s = n.toString(16);
     5:   return 'i' + ('00000000' + s).slice(-8);
     6: }
     7: 
     8: export type SpyderMessage = {
     9:   id: string;
    10:   bits: Uint8Array;
    11:   type: number;
    12:   valid: boolean;
    13:   score: number;
    14:   timestamp: number;
    15: };
    16: 
    17: export class SpyderMemory {
    18:   ram: SpyderMessage[] = [];
    19:   cache: SpyderMessage[] = [];
    20:   dead: SpyderMessage[][] = [];
    21: 
    22:   add(msg: Omit<SpyderMessage, 'id' | 'timestamp'>) {
    23:     const m: SpyderMessage = { ...msg, id: simpleId(), timestamp: Date.now() } as SpyderMessage;
    24:     this.ram.push(m);
    25:     if (m.valid && m.score >= 2) {
    26:       this.cache.push(m);
    27:     }
    28:   }
    29: 
    30:   snapshot() {
    31:     this.dead.push([...this.cache]);
    32:     this.cache = [];
    33:   }
    34: }

FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\memory\ram.ts
============================

     1: import type { SpyderPacket } from '../protocol/packet';
     2: 
     3: export interface ExchangeRecord {
     4:   id: string;
     5:   question: SpyderPacket;
     6:   answer?: SpyderPacket;
     7:   score: number;
     8:   timestamp: number;
     9:   latencyMs?: number;
    10:   classification?: 'short' | 'long' | 'timeout';
    11:   attempts?: number;
    12: }
    13: 
    14: export class RamMemory {
    15:   records: ExchangeRecord[] = [];
    16: 
    17:   add(record: ExchangeRecord) {
    18:     this.records.push(record);
    19:   }
    20: 
    21:   getLast(): ExchangeRecord | undefined {
    22:     return this.records[this.records.length - 1];
    23:   }
    24: }

FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\parser\semantic.ts
============================
============================
     1: // Very small NL -> Prolog-like translator for demo purposes
     2: 
     3: export function nlToProlog(input: string): string {
     4:   // naive: "X loves Y" -> loves(x,y).
     5:   const s = input.trim().toLowerCase();
     6:   const words = s.split(/\s+/);
     7:   if (words.length === 3 && words[1] === 'loves') {
     8:     return `${words[1]}(${words[0]},${words[2]}).`;
     9:   }
    10:   // fallback: turn sentence into predicate with tokens
    11:   const pred = 'sent';
    12:   const args = words.map(w => w.replace(/[^a-z0-9]/g, '')).join(',');
    13:   return `${pred}(${args}).`;
    14: }

FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\plugins\loader.ts
============================
============================
     1: import path from 'path';
     2: 
     3: import { PluginRegister, SpyderContext } from './plugin-api';
     4: 
     5: export async function loadPlugins(ctx: SpyderContext) {
     6:   const plugins: string[] = (ctx.config && ctx.config.plugins) || [];
     7:   for (const p of plugins) {
     8:     try {
     9:       let mod: any;
    10:       if (p.startsWith('.') || p.startsWith('/')) {
    11:         // local plugin
    12:         const full = path.resolve(p);
    13:         mod = await import(full);
    14:       } else {
    15:         // npm package
    16:         mod = await import(p);
    17:       }
    18:       const reg: PluginRegister = mod.default || mod.register;
    19:       if (reg) await reg(ctx);
    20:       ctx.log('Loaded plugin', p);
    21:     } catch (e) {
    22:       ctx.logError('Failed loading plugin', p, e);
    23:     }
    24:   }
    25: }

     1: import { SpiderWeb } from '../graph/web';
     2: import { RamMemory } from '../memory/ram';
     3: import { CacheMemory } from '../memory/cache';
     4: import { DeadMemory } from '../memory/dead';
     5: 
     6: export type SpyderContext = {
     7:   web: SpiderWeb;
     8:   ram: RamMemory;
     9:   cache: CacheMemory;
    10:   dead: DeadMemory;
    11:   config: any;
    12:   registerDecoder: (prefix: string, fn: (input: Uint8Array) => Promise<any>) => void;
    13:   askA11: (endpoint: string, text: string) => Promise<any>;
    14:   log: (...args: any[]) => void;
    15:   logError: (...args: any[]) => void;
    16: };

FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\protocol\decoder.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { detectLanguage } from '../lang/detect';
     2: 
     3: type DecoderFn = (input: Uint8Array) => Promise<any>;
     4: 
     5: const registry = new Map<string, DecoderFn>();
     6: 
     7: export function registerDecoder(prefix: string, fn: DecoderFn) {
     8:   registry.set(prefix, fn);
     9: }
    10: 
    11: export function listDecoders() {
    12:   return Array.from(registry.keys());
    13: }
    14: 
    15: // Décodeur texte brut par défaut
    16: async function defaultDecoder(input: Uint8Array): Promise<string> {
    17:   return new TextDecoder().decode(input);
    18: }
    19: 
    20: export async function decodePayload(input: Uint8Array): Promise<any> {
    21:   const text = new TextDecoder().decode(input);
    22: 
    23:   const idx = text.indexOf(':');
    24:   if (idx > 0) {
    25:     const prefix = text.slice(0, idx);
    26:     const rest = text.slice(idx + 1);
    27: 
    28:     const fn = registry.get(prefix);
    29:     if (fn) {
    30:       try {
    31:         console.debug('[decoder] using prefix decoder', prefix);
    32:         return await fn(new TextEncoder().encode(rest));
    33:       } catch (e) {
    34:         console.warn('[decoder] prefix decoder error', prefix, e);
    35:         return null;
    36:       }
    37:     } else {
    38:       console.warn('[decoder] no decoder registered for prefix', prefix);
    39:     }
    40:   }
    41: 
    42:   // no prefix -> detect language and dispatch
    43:   const lang = detectLanguage(text);
    44:   console.debug('[decoder] detected language', lang, 'from text:', text.slice(0, 64));
    45:   const fn = registry.get(lang);
    46:   if (fn) {
    47:     try {
    48:       return await fn(input);
    49:     } catch (e) {
    50:       console.warn('[decoder] language decoder error', lang, e);
    51:       return null;
    52:     }
    53:   } else {
    54:     console.warn('[decoder] no decoder registered for detected language', lang);
    55:   }
    56: 
    57:   return defaultDecoder(input);
    58: }
    59: 
    60: // Exemple d'enregistrement
    61: // registerDecoder('nez', async (bytes) => { ... });


============================
FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\protocol\packet.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { computeChecksum } from '../utils/checksum';
     2: 
     3: export const SPYDER_HEADER = 0x5e; // 0x5P "style" :P
     4: 
     5: export enum PacketType {
     6:   Question = 1,
     7:   Answer = 2,
     8:   Meta = 3
     9: }
    10: 
    11: export interface SpyderPacket {
    12:   type: PacketType;
    13:   payload: Uint8Array;
    14:   checksum: number;
    15: }
    16: 
    17: export function serializePacket(packet: SpyderPacket): Uint8Array {
    18:   const length = packet.payload.length;
    19:   const buffer = new Uint8Array(1 + 1 + 2 + length + 1);
    20:   let offset = 0;
    21: 
    22:   buffer[offset++] = SPYDER_HEADER;
    23:   buffer[offset++] = packet.type;
    24:   buffer[offset++] = (length >> 8) & 0xff;
    25:   buffer[offset++] = length & 0xff;
    26: 
    27:   buffer.set(packet.payload, offset);
    28:   offset += length;
    29: 
    30:   const cs = computeChecksum(buffer.subarray(0, offset));
    31:   buffer[offset] = cs;
    32: 
    33:   return buffer;
    34: }
    35: 
    36: export function parsePacket(buffer: Uint8Array): SpyderPacket | null {
    37:   if (buffer.length < 1 + 1 + 2 + 1) return null;
    38:   let offset = 0;
    39:   const header = buffer[offset++];
    40:   if (header !== SPYDER_HEADER) return null;
    41: 
    42:   const type = buffer[offset++];
    43:   const length = (buffer[offset++] << 8) | buffer[offset++];
    44: 
    45:   if (buffer.length < 1 + 1 + 2 + length + 1) return null;
    46: 
    47:   const payload = buffer.subarray(4, 4 + length);
    48:   const checksum = buffer[4 + length];
    49: 
    50:   const computed = computeChecksum(buffer.subarray(0, 4 + length));
    51:   if (computed !== checksum) {
    52:     return {
    53:       type: type as PacketType,
    54:       payload,
    55:       checksum: -1
    56:     };
    57:   }
    58: 
    59:   return {
    60:     type: type as PacketType,
    61:     payload,
    62:     checksum
    63:   };
    64: }


============================
FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\teacher\bridge.ts
============================
============================
     1: import axios from 'axios';
     2: import config from '../config/default.json';
     3: 
     4: interface A11Response {
     5:   text: string;
     6: }
     7: 
     8: export async function askA11(
     9:   endpoint: string,
    10:   messageText: string
    11: ): Promise<A11Response> {
    12:   if (!(config as any).allowInternet) {
    13:     throw new Error('Internet access disabled by configuration');
    14:   }
    15: 
    16:   const body = {
    17:     model: 'a11-phi3',
    18:     messages: [{ role: 'user', content: messageText }],
    19:     stream: false,
    20:   };
    21: 
    22:   const axiosOpts: any = {
    23:     headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' },
    24:     timeout: 10000,
    25:   };
    26:   if ((config as any).httpProxy) {
    27:     axiosOpts.proxy = (config as any).httpProxy;
    28:   }
    29: 
    30:   const res = await axios.post(endpoint, body, axiosOpts);
    31: 
    32:   const text =
    33:     res.data?.choices?.[0]?.message?.content ?? JSON.stringify(res.data);
    34: 
    35:   return { text };
    36: }

     7: declare var console: any;

============================
FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\utils\checksum.ts
============================
============================
     1: export type ChecksumAlgo = 'xor';
     2: 
     3: export function xorChecksum(buffer: Uint8Array | Buffer): number {
     4:   let x = 0;
     5:   for (let i = 0; i < buffer.length; i++) x ^= buffer[i];
     6:   return x & 0xff;
     7: }
     8: 
     9: export function computeChecksum(
    10:   buffer: Uint8Array | Buffer,
    11:   algo: ChecksumAlgo = 'xor'
    12: ): number {
    13:   switch (algo) {
    14:     case 'xor':
    15:     default:
    16:       return xorChecksum(buffer);
    17:   }
    18: }


============================
FILE: spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\utils\collector.ts
============================
============================
     1: type Counters = { [k: string]: number };
     2: 
     3: export class Collector {
     4:   counters: Counters = {};
     5:   histograms: { [k: string]: number[] } = {};
     6: 
     7:   inc(name: string, value = 1) {
     8:     this.counters[name] = (this.counters[name] || 0) + value;
     9:   }
    10: 
    11:   observe(name: string, v: number) {
    12:     this.histograms[name] = this.histograms[name] || [];
    13:     this.histograms[name].push(v);
    14:   }
    15: 
    16:   snapshot() {
    17:     return {
    18:       counters: { ...this.counters },
    19:       histograms: { ...this.histograms }
    20:     };
    21:   }
    22: }

     3: }
     4: 
     5: export function logError(...args: any[]) {
     6:   console.error('[SPYDER:ERR]', ...args);

     1: export function elapsedMs(start: number): number {
     2:   return Date.now() - start;
     3: }
     4: 
     5: export function isLongRequest(ms: number, threshold: number): boolean {
     6:   return ms >= threshold;
     7: }
     8: 
     9: export function classifyLatency(ms: number, threshold: number) {
    10:   return isLongRequest(ms, threshold) ? 'long' : 'short';
    11: }

============================
FILE: spyder\node_modules\@funeste38\freeland\src\index.ts
============================
============================
     1: export type Decoder = (input: string) => Promise<string> | string;
     2: 
     3: const registry = new Map<string, Decoder>();
     4: 
     5: export function registerSystem(prefix: string, decoder: Decoder) {
     6:   registry.set(prefix, decoder);
     7: }
     8: 
     9: export async function decodeSystemValue(raw: string): Promise<string> {
    10:   for (const [prefix, decoder] of registry) {
    11:     if (raw.startsWith(prefix)) {
    12:       const tail = raw.slice(prefix.length);
    13:       const res = decoder(tail);
    14:       return res instanceof Promise ? await res : res;
    15:     }
    16:   }
    17:   // fallback: return raw
    18:   return raw;
    19: }
    20: 
    21: // built-ins
    22: registerSystem('json:', (s) => JSON.parse(s));
    23: registerSystem('b64:', (s) => Buffer.from(s, 'base64').toString('utf8'));
    24: registerSystem('file:', (s) => {
    25:   // simple sync read
    26:   const fs = require('fs');
    27:   const path = require('path');
    28:   const p = path.resolve(s);
    29:   return fs.readFileSync(p, 'utf8');
    30: });
    31: registerSystem('nez:', (s) => `nez:${s}`);

     3:   try {
     4:     return buf.toString('utf8');
     5:   } catch (e) {
     6:     return '';
     7:   }

    12: exports.decodeFromOC8Png = oc8.decodeFromOC8Png;
    13: exports.crc8 = oc8.crc8;

============================
FILE: spyder\node_modules\@funeste38\nezlephant\src\oc8.cjs
============================
============================
     1: const { PNG } = require('pngjs');
     2: 
     3: function crc8(buf) {
     4:   let crc = 0;
     5:   for (let i = 0; i < buf.length; i++) {
     6:     crc ^= buf[i];
     7:     for (let j = 0; j < 8; j++) {
     8:       crc = (crc & 0x80) ? ((crc << 1) ^ 0x07) & 0xff : (crc << 1) & 0xff;
     9:     }
    10:   }
    11:   return crc & 0xff;
    12: }
    13: 
    14: function encodeToOC8Png(payload, width = 0, height = 0) {
    15:   const len = payload.length;
    16:   if (width === 0 || height === 0) {
    17:     const pixels = Math.ceil(len / 3);
    18:     width = Math.ceil(Math.sqrt(pixels));
    19:     height = Math.ceil(pixels / width);
    20:   }
    21:   const pixelCount = width * height;
    22:   const pixels = Buffer.alloc(pixelCount * 4, 0);
    23:   for (let i = 0; i < pixelCount; i++) {
    24:     const offPayload = i * 3;
    25:     const r = payload[offPayload] || 0;
    26:     const g = payload[offPayload + 1] || 0;
    27:     const b = payload[offPayload + 2] || 0;
    28:     const c = crc8(Buffer.from([r, g, b]));
    29:     const po = i * 4;
    30:     pixels[po] = r;
    31:     pixels[po + 1] = g;
    32:     pixels[po + 2] = b;
    33:     pixels[po + 3] = c;
    34:   }
    35:   const png = new PNG({ width, height });
    36:   png.data = pixels;
    37:   return PNG.sync.write(png);
    38: }
    39: 
    40: function decodeFromOC8Png(pngBuf) {
    41:   const png = PNG.sync.read(pngBuf);
    42:   const data = png.data;
    43:   const out = [];
    44:   for (let i = 0; i < data.length; i += 4) {
    45:     const r = data[i];
    46:     const g = data[i + 1];
    47:     const b = data[i + 2];
    48:     const c = data[i + 3];
    49:     if (crc8(Buffer.from([r, g, b])) !== c) break;
    50:     out.push(r, g, b);
    51:   }
    52:   while (out.length && out[out.length - 1] === 0) out.pop();
    53:   return Buffer.from(out);
    54: }
    55: 
    56: module.exports = { crc8, encodeToOC8Png, decodeFromOC8Png };

     1: const c = require('./oc8.cjs');
     2: export const crc8 = c.crc8;
     3: export const encodeToOC8Png = c.encodeToOC8Png;
     4: export const decodeFromOC8Png = c.decodeFromOC8Png;


============================
FILE: spyder\node_modules\@funeste38\nezlephant\src\rubik.cjs
============================
============================
     1: const crypto = require('crypto');
     2: const { PNG } = require('pngjs');
     3: 
     4: function makePermutation(count, key) {
     5:   const hash = crypto.createHash('sha256').update(key).digest();
     6:   const arr = Array.from({ length: count }, (_, i) => i);
     7:   let idx = 0;
     8:   for (let i = count - 1; i > 0; i--) {
     9:     const b = hash[idx++ % hash.length];
    10:     const j = b % (i + 1);
    11:     const tmp = arr[i];
    12:     arr[i] = arr[j];
    13:     arr[j] = tmp;
    14:   }
    15:   return arr;
    16: }
    17: 
    18: function scramblePngBlocks(pngBuf, key, blockSize = 8) {
    19:   const png = PNG.sync.read(pngBuf);
    20:   const { width, height, data } = png;
    21:   const cols = Math.ceil(width / blockSize);
    22:   const rows = Math.ceil(height / blockSize);
    23:   const blockCount = cols * rows;
    24:   const perm = makePermutation(blockCount, key);
    25: 
    26:   const orig = Buffer.from(data); // read-only source
    27:   const out = Buffer.from(data); // start with original so untouched areas remain
    28: 
    29:   for (let srcIndex = 0; srcIndex < blockCount; srcIndex++) {
    30:     const dstIndex = perm[srcIndex];
    31: 
    32:     const srcCol = srcIndex % cols;
    33:     const srcRow = Math.floor(srcIndex / cols);
    34:     const dstCol = dstIndex % cols;
    35:     const dstRow = Math.floor(dstIndex / cols);
    36: 
    37:     const srcX = srcCol * blockSize;
    38:     const srcY = srcRow * blockSize;
    39:     const dstX = dstCol * blockSize;
    40:     const dstY = dstRow * blockSize;
    41: 
    42:     const blockWidth = Math.min(blockSize, width - srcX);
    43:     const blockHeight = Math.min(blockSize, height - srcY);
    44: 
    45:     for (let by = 0; by < blockHeight; by++) {
    46:       const srcOff = ((srcY + by) * width + srcX) * 4;
    47:       const dstOff = ((dstY + by) * width + dstX) * 4;
    48:       const len = blockWidth * 4;
    49:       orig.copy(out, dstOff, srcOff, srcOff + len);
    50:     }
    51:   }
    52: 
    53:   const pngOut = new PNG({ width, height });
    54:   pngOut.data = out;
    55:   return PNG.sync.write(pngOut);
    56: }
    57: 
    58: function unscramblePngBlocks(pngBuf, key, blockSize = 8) {
    59:   const png = PNG.sync.read(pngBuf);
    60:   const { width, height, data } = png;
    61:   const cols = Math.ceil(width / blockSize);
    62:   const rows = Math.ceil(height / blockSize);
    63:   const blockCount = cols * rows;
    64:   const perm = makePermutation(blockCount, key);
    65: 
    66:   const scrambled = Buffer.from(data);
    67:   const out = Buffer.from(data);
    68: 
    69:   for (let srcIndex = 0; srcIndex < blockCount; srcIndex++) {
    70:     const dstIndex = perm[srcIndex];
    71: 
    72:     const srcCol = srcIndex % cols;
    73:     const srcRow = Math.floor(srcIndex / cols);
    74:     const dstCol = dstIndex % cols;
    75:     const dstRow = Math.floor(dstIndex / cols);
    76: 
    77:     const srcX = srcCol * blockSize;
    78:     const srcY = srcRow * blockSize;
    79:     const dstX = dstCol * blockSize;
    80:     const dstY = dstRow * blockSize;
    81: 
    82:     // In scrambled image, the block originally at srcIndex is at dstIndex.
    83:     // So copy from scrambled at dstIndex -> out at srcIndex.
    84:     const scrX = dstX;
    85:     const scrY = dstY;
    86:     const outX = srcX;
    87:     const outY = srcY;
    88: 
    89:     const blockWidth = Math.min(blockSize, width - outX);
    90:     const blockHeight = Math.min(blockSize, height - outY);
    91: 
    92:     for (let by = 0; by < blockHeight; by++) {
    93:       const scrOff = ((scrY + by) * width + scrX) * 4;
    94:       const outOff = ((outY + by) * width + outX) * 4;
    95:       const len = blockWidth * 4;
    96:       scrambled.copy(out, outOff, scrOff, scrOff + len);
    97:     }
    98:   }
    99: 
   100:   const pngOut = new PNG({ width, height });
   101:   pngOut.data = out;
   102:   return PNG.sync.write(pngOut);
   103: }
   104: 
   105: module.exports = { scramblePngBlocks, unscramblePngBlocks, makePermutation };

============================
FILE: spyder\spyder\src\index.ts
============================
============================
     1: import * as net from 'net';
     2: import { encodePacket, decodePacket } from './protocol/packet';
     3: import { SpyderMemory } from './memory/memory';
     4: import { sendToA11 } from './teacher/bridge';
     5: 
     6: const PORT = 4000;
     7: const memory = new SpyderMemory();
     8: 
     9: const server = net.createServer((socket: any) => {
    10:   console.log('Client connected');
    11:   socket.on('data', async (data: any) => {
    12:     try {
    13:       const buf = Uint8Array.from(data);
    14:       const pkt = decodePacket(buf);
    15:       if (!pkt) return;
    16:       const valid = pkt.checksum !== 0;
    17:       const score = valid ? 2 : 0;
    18:       memory.add({ bits: pkt.payload, type: pkt.type, valid, score });
    19:       if (pkt.type === 1) {
    20:         const resp = await sendToA11(pkt.payload);
    21:         const out = encodePacket(2 as any, resp);
    22:         const sendBuf = Buffer.from(out);
    23:         socket.write(sendBuf);
    24:         memory.add({ bits: resp, type: 2, valid: resp.length > 0, score: resp.length > 0 ? 2 : 0 });
    25:       }
    26:     } catch (e) {
    27:       // ignore errors in MVP
    28:     }
    29:   });
    30:   socket.on('close', () => console.log('Client disconnected'));
    31: });
    32: 
    33: server.listen(PORT, '127.0.0.1', () => console.log(`SPYDER listening on ${PORT}`));


============================
FILE: spyder\spyder\src\memory\memory.ts
============================
============================
     1: function simpleId() {
     2:   const n = Math.floor(Math.random() * 0xffffffff);
     3:   const s = n.toString(16);
     4:   return 'i' + ('00000000' + s).slice(-8);
     5: }
     6: 
     7: export type SpyderMessage = {
     8:   id: string;
     9:   bits: Uint8Array;
    10:   type: number;
    11:   valid: boolean;
    12:   score: number;
    13:   timestamp: number;
    14: };
    15: 
    16: export class SpyderMemory {
    17:   ram: SpyderMessage[] = [];
    18:   cache: SpyderMessage[] = [];
    19:   dead: SpyderMessage[][] = [];
    20: 
    21:   add(msg: Omit<SpyderMessage, 'id' | 'timestamp'>) {
    22:     const m: SpyderMessage = { ...msg, id: simpleId(), timestamp: Date.now() } as SpyderMessage;
    23:     this.ram.push(m);
    24:     if (m.valid && m.score >= 2) this.cache.push(m);
    25:   }
    26: 
    27:   snapshot() {
    28:     this.dead.push([...this.cache]);
    29:     this.cache = [];
    30:   }
    31: }


============================
FILE: spyder\spyder\src\protocol\packet.ts
============================
============================
     1: export type PacketType = 1 | 2 | 3;
     2: 
     3: export interface Packet {
     4:   header: number; // 1 byte
     5:   type: PacketType; // 1 byte
     6:   length: number; // 2 bytes
     7:   payload: Uint8Array;
     8:   checksum: number; // 1 byte
     9: }
    10: 
    11: const HEADER = 0x5A;
    12: 
    13: export function encodePacket(type: PacketType, payload: Uint8Array): Uint8Array {
    14:   const length = payload.length;
    15:   const buffer = new Uint8Array(1 + 1 + 2 + length + 1);
    16:   buffer[0] = HEADER;
    17:   buffer[1] = type;
    18:   buffer[2] = (length >> 8) & 0xff;
    19:   buffer[3] = length & 0xff;
    20:   buffer.set(payload, 4);
    21:   let checksum = 0;
    22:   for (let i = 0; i < 4 + length; i++) checksum ^= buffer[i];
    23:   buffer[4 + length] = checksum;
    24:   return buffer;
    25: }
    26: 
    27: export function decodePacket(buf: Uint8Array): Packet | null {
    28:   if (buf.length < 5) return null;
    29:   if (buf[0] !== HEADER) return null;
    30:   const type = buf[1] as PacketType;
    31:   const length = (buf[2] << 8) | buf[3];
    32:   if (buf.length < 4 + length + 1) return null;
    33:   const payload = buf.slice(4, 4 + length);
    34:   const checksum = buf[4 + length];
    35:   let cs = 0;
    36:   for (let i = 0; i < 4 + length; i++) cs ^= buf[i];
    37:   const valid = cs === checksum;
    38:   return { header: buf[0], type, length, payload, checksum: valid ? checksum : 0 };
    39: }


============================
FILE: spyder\spyder\src\teacher\bridge.ts
============================
============================
     1: import http from 'http';
     2: 
     3: function concatUint8(arr: Uint8Array[]) {
     4:   let total = 0;
     5:   for (const a of arr) total += a.length;
     6:   const out = new Uint8Array(total);
     7:   let offs = 0;
     8:   for (const a of arr) {
     9:     out.set(a, offs);
    10:     offs += a.length;
    11:   }
    12:   return out;
    13: }
    14: 
    15: function uint8ToBase64(u8: Uint8Array): string {
    16:   const G = (globalThis as any);
    17:   if (G && G.Buffer) return G.Buffer.from(u8).toString('base64');
    18:   let binary = '';
    19:   for (let i = 0; i < u8.length; i++) binary += String.fromCharCode(u8[i]);
    20:   if (typeof btoa !== 'undefined') return btoa(binary);
    21:   throw new Error('No base64 encoder available');
    22: }
    23: 
    24: function base64ToUint8(b64: string): Uint8Array {
    25:   const G = (globalThis as any);
    26:   if (G && G.Buffer) return Uint8Array.from(G.Buffer.from(b64, 'base64'));
    27:   if (typeof atob !== 'undefined') {
    28:     const bin = atob(b64);
    29:     const u8 = new Uint8Array(bin.length);
    30:     for (let i = 0; i < bin.length; i++) u8[i] = bin.charCodeAt(i);
    31:     return u8;
    32:   }
    33:   throw new Error('No base64 decoder available');
    34: }
    35: 
    36: export async function sendToA11(payload: Uint8Array): Promise<Uint8Array> {
    37:   const bodyObj = { data: uint8ToBase64(payload) };
    38:   const data = JSON.stringify(bodyObj);
    39:   const enc = new TextEncoder();
    40:   const dataLen = enc.encode(data).length;
    41: 
    42:   const options = {
    43:     hostname: '127.0.0.1',
    44:     port: 5000,
    45:     path: '/ask',
    46:     method: 'POST',
    47:     headers: {
    48:       'Content-Type': 'application/json',
    49:       'Content-Length': String(dataLen),
    50:     },
    51:     timeout: 5000,
    52:   } as const;
    53: 
    54:   return new Promise((resolve) => {
    55:     const req = http.request(options, (res: any) => {
    56:       const chunks: Uint8Array[] = [];
    57:       res.on('data', (c: any) => {
    58:         try {
    59:           chunks.push(Uint8Array.from(c));
    60:         } catch (e) {
    61:           // ignore
    62:         }
    63:       });
    64:       res.on('end', () => {
    65:         try {
    66:           const all = concatUint8(chunks);
    67:           const text = new TextDecoder('utf-8').decode(all);
    68:           const json = JSON.parse(text);
    69:           if (json && json.data) {
    70:             resolve(base64ToUint8(json.data));
    71:             return;
    72:           }
    73:         } catch (e) {
    74:           // fallthrough
    75:         }
    76:         resolve(new Uint8Array());
    77:       });
    78:     });
    79: 
    80:     req.on('error', () => resolve(new Uint8Array()));
    81:     req.on('timeout', () => { req.destroy(); resolve(new Uint8Array()); });
    82:     req.write(data);
    83:     req.end();
    84:   });
    85: }

FILE: src\chain\smartChain.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x8CD4FC
     2: 
     3: import { logger } from "../utils/logger.js";
     4: import { runDetect } from "../commands/detect.js";
     5: import { runConfig } from "../commands/config.js";
     6: import { runPurge } from "../commands/purge.js";
     7: import { runKill } from "../commands/kill.js";
     8: import { runStart } from "../commands/start.js";
     9: import { runExodia } from "../commands/exodia.js";
    10: 
    11: const ORDER = ["detect", "config", "purge", "kill", "start", "exodia"];
    12: 
    13: export type qflushOptions = {
    14:   global?: Record<string, any>;
    15:   modulePaths?: Record<string, string>;
    16:   tokens?: Record<string, string>;
    17:   flags?: Record<string, boolean | string>;
    18:   detected?: Record<string, any>;
    19:   services?: string[];
    20: };
    21: 
    22: function parseArgs(argv: string[]) {
    23:   const cmds: string[] = [];
    24:   const flags: Record<string, boolean | string> = {};
    25:   const modulePaths: Record<string, string> = {};
    26:   const tokens: Record<string, string> = {};
    27:   const services: string[] = [];
    28: 
    29:   let currentService: string | undefined;
    30:   let i = 0;
    31:   while (i < argv.length) {
    32:     const a = argv[i];
    33:     if (!a.startsWith("-")) {
    34:       cmds.push(a.toLowerCase());
    35:       i++;
    36:       continue;
    37:     }
    38:     const clean = a.replace(/^--?/, "");
    39: 
    40:     if (clean === "service" || clean === "s") {
    41:       const next = argv[i + 1];
    42:       if (next && !next.startsWith("-")) {
    43:         currentService = next.toLowerCase();
    44:         services.push(currentService);
    45:         i += 2;
    46:         continue;
    47:       } else {
    48:         i++;
    49:         continue;
    50:       }
    51:     }
    52: 
    53:     if (clean === "path") {
    54:       const next = argv[i + 1];
    55:       if (next && !next.startsWith("-")) {
    56:         if (currentService) modulePaths[currentService] = next;
    57:         i += 2;
    58:         continue;
    59:       }
    60:       i++;
    61:       continue;
    62:     }
    63: 
    64:     if (clean === "token") {
    65:       const next = argv[i + 1];
    66:       if (next && !next.startsWith("-")) {
    67:         if (currentService) tokens[currentService] = next;
    68:         i += 2;
    69:         continue;
    70:       }
    71:       i++;
    72:       continue;
    73:     }
    74: 
    75:     const kv = clean.split("=");
    76:     if (kv.length === 2) {
    77:       flags[kv[0]] = kv[1];
    78:       i++;
    79:       continue;
    80:     }
    81: 
    82:     const next = argv[i + 1];
    83:     if (next && !next.startsWith("-")) {
    84:       flags[clean] = next;
    85:       i += 2;
    86:       continue;
    87:     }
    88:     flags[clean] = true;
    89:     i++;
    90:   }
    91: 
    92:   return { cmds, flags, modulePaths, tokens, services };
    93: }
    94: 
    95: export function buildPipeline(argv: string[]) {
    96:   const { cmds, flags, modulePaths, tokens, services } = parseArgs(argv);
    97:   const unique = Array.from(new Set(cmds));
    98:   const known = unique.filter((c) => ORDER.includes(c));
    99: 
   100:   if (known.length === 0)
   101:     return {
   102:       pipeline: ["detect", "config", "start"],
   103:       options: { flags, modulePaths, tokens, global: {} as any, services },
   104:     };
   105: 
   106:   // build set with dependencies
   107:   const set = new Set<string>(known);
   108:   // dependencies mapping
   109:   const deps: Record<string, string[]> = {
   110:     start: ["config"],
   111:     config: ["detect"],
   112:     purge: ["detect"],
   113:   };
   114: 
   115:   // add dependencies recursively
   116:   function addDeps(cmd: string) {
   117:     const ds = deps[cmd] || [];
   118:     for (const d of ds) {
   119:       if (!set.has(d)) {
   120:         set.add(d);
   121:         addDeps(d);
   122:       }
   123:     }
   124:   }
   125:   for (const k of Array.from(set)) addDeps(k);
   126: 
   127:   let final: string[] = [];
   128: 
   129:   // Flag-driven transformations
   130:   if (flags["fresh"]) {
   131:     set.add("purge");
   132:     // ensure purge runs before start
   133:   }
   134:   if (flags["force"]) {
   135:     // make sure kill runs before start
   136:     set.add("kill");
   137:   }
   138: 
   139:   const requestedKill = known.includes("kill");
   140: 
   141:   if (requestedKill) {
   142:     // put kill first if user explicitly requested it
   143:     final.push("kill");
   144:     for (const k of ORDER) {
   145:       if (k === "kill") continue;
   146:       if (set.has(k)) final.push(k);
   147:     }
   148:   } else {
   149:     for (const k of ORDER) {
   150:       if (set.has(k)) final.push(k);
   151:     }
   152:   }
   153: 
   154:   // remove duplicates and preserve order
   155:   final = final.filter((v, i) => final.indexOf(v) === i);
   156: 
   157:   logger.info(`SmartChain built pipeline: ${final.join(" -> ")}`);
   158:   const options: qflushOptions = { global: {}, flags, modulePaths, tokens, services };
   159:   return { pipeline: final, options };
   160: }
   161: 
   162: export async function executePipeline(pipeline: string[], options: qflushOptions) {
   163:   for (const step of pipeline) {
   164:     logger.info(`Executing pipeline step: ${step}`);
   165:     switch (step) {
   166:       case "detect": {
   167:         const detected = await runDetect(options);
   168:         options.detected = detected || {};
   169:         if (detected && typeof detected === "object") {
   170:           options.modulePaths = { ...(options.modulePaths || {}), ...(detected.paths || {}) };
   171:         }
   172:         break;
   173:       }
   174:       case "config":
   175:         await runConfig(options);
   176:         break;
   177:       case "purge":
   178:         await runPurge(options);
   179:         break;
   180:       case "kill":
   181:         await runKill(options);
   182:         break;
   183:       case "start":
   184:         await runStart(options);
   185:         break;
   186:       case "exodia":
   187:         await runExodia(options);
   188:         break;
   189:       default:
   190:         logger.warn(`Unknown pipeline step: ${step}`);
   191:     }
   192:   }
   193: }
   194:

FILE: src\cli\help.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x1DEEBD
     2: 
     3: import alias from '../utils/alias.js';
     4: const logger = alias.importUtil('@utils/logger') || alias.importUtil('../utils/logger') || console;
     5: 
     6: export function showHelp() {
     7:   logger.info(`qflush - Funesterie orchestrator`);
     8:   console.log(`
     9: Usage:
    10:   qflush [command] [options]
    11: 
    12: Commands:
    13:   start        Launch selected services (default: detect → config → start)
    14:   kill         Kill running services
    15:   purge        Clear caches, logs and sessions
    16:   inspect      Show running services and ports
    17:   config       Generate missing .env/config files
    18:   secret import  Import secrets from a .env file into local encrypted store (Windows DPAPI)
    19: 
    20: Options (examples):
    21:   --service rome --path D:/rome --token ABC123     Target a specific service and give path/token
    22:   --service nezlephant --service freeland          Target multiple services
    23:   --dev --fresh                                    Global flags (dev mode, fresh start)
    24:   --force                                          Force restart semantics (implies kill before start)
    25: 
    26: Examples:
    27:   qflush start --service rome --path D:/rome
    28:   qflush start --service nezlephant --service freeland --fresh
    29:   qflush config --service freeland
    30:   qflush purge --fresh
    31: 
    32: Scripts & helpers:
    33:   node scripts/detach.js [--quiet] <command>   # spawn detached process (use --quiet to suppress output)
    34:   ./scripts/run-with-timeout.sh <sec> <cmd>    # run command with timeout (POSIX)
    35:   pwsh ./scripts/run-with-timeout.ps1 -Cmd "node dist/index.js start" -TimeoutSec 12  # PowerShell watchdog (quiet by default)
    36:   qflush secret import [--env <path>] [--no-acl]   # import .env and store encrypted locally
    37: 
    38: `);
    39: }
