FILE: src\commands\a11-key.ts
============================
============================
     1: import * as fs from 'fs';
     2: import * as path from 'path';
     3: 
     4: const CFG = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'a11.config.json');
     5: 
     6: function ensureDir() {
     7:   const dir = path.dirname(CFG);
     8:   if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
     9: }
    10: 
    11: export default async function runA11Key(argv: string[] = []) {
    12:   const sub = argv[0] || 'status';
    13: 
    14:   if (sub === 'set') {
    15:     // usage: qflush a11-key set --server http://127.0.0.1:3000 --ollama http://127.0.0.1:11434 --model llama3.1:8b --timeout 60000
    16:     const opts: any = {};
    17:     for (let i = 1; i < argv.length; i++) {
    18:       const a = argv[i];
    19:       if (a === '--server') opts.serverUrl = argv[++i];
    20:       else if (a === '--ollama') opts.ollamaUrl = argv[++i];
    21:       else if (a === '--model') opts.defaultModel = argv[++i];
    22:       else if (a === '--timeout') opts.timeoutMs = Number(argv[++i]);
    23:       else if (a === '--enabled') opts.enabled = argv[++i] === 'true';
    24:     }
    25:     ensureDir();
    26:     const cfg = Object.assign({ enabled: true, serverUrl: 'http://127.0.0.1:3000', ollamaUrl: 'http://127.0.0.1:11434', defaultModel: 'llama3.1:8b', timeoutMs: 60000 }, opts);
    27:     try {
    28:       fs.writeFileSync(CFG, JSON.stringify(cfg, null, 2), 'utf8');
    29:       console.log('A11 config saved to .qflush/a11.config.json');
    30:       return 0;
    31:     } catch (e) {
    32:       console.error('failed to save a11 config', e);
    33:       return 3;
    34:     }
    35:   }
    36: 
    37:   if (sub === 'test') {
    38:     try {
    39:       if (!fs.existsSync(CFG)) { console.error('no config found at .qflush/a11.config.json'); return 4; }
    40:       const cfg = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(CFG, 'utf8'));
    41:       const url = (cfg.serverUrl || 'http://127.0.0.1:3000').replace(/\/$/, '') + '/v1/health';
    42:       const fetch = (global as any).fetch || (await import('node-fetch')).default;
    43:       const res = await fetch(url, { method: 'GET', timeout: cfg.timeoutMs || 60000 });
    44:       if (res.ok) {
    45:         const txt = await res.text();
    46:         console.log('A-11 server healthy:', res.status, txt);
    47:         return 0;
    48:       }
    49:       console.error('A-11 health check failed:', res.status, await res.text());
    50:       return 5;
    51:     } catch (e) {
    52:       console.error('A-11 health check error:', String(e));
    53:       return 6;
    54:     }
    55:   }
    56: 
    57:   if (sub === 'status') {
    58:     if (!fs.existsSync(CFG)) { console.log('A-11 not configured'); return 0; }
    59:     try {
    60:       const cfg = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(CFG, 'utf8'));
    61:       console.log('A-11 config :', JSON.stringify(cfg, null, 2));
    62:       return 0;
    63:     } catch (e) { console.error('failed to read config', e); return 2; }
    64:   }
    65: 
    66:   console.log('usage: qflush a11-key [set --server <url> --ollama <url> --model <m> --timeout <ms> | test | status]');
    67:   return 1;
    68: }


============================
FILE: src\commands\a11.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0xA11A11
     2: 
     3: import { spawn } from 'child_process';
     4: import * as fs from 'fs';
     5: import * as path from 'path';
     6: 
     7: async function resolveFetch() {
     8:   if (typeof (globalThis as any).fetch === 'function') return (globalThis as any).fetch;
     9:   try {
    10:     const m = await import('node-fetch');
    11:     return (m && (m as any).default) || m;
    12:   } catch (e) {
    13:     try {
    14:       // eslint-disable-next-line @typescript-eslint/no-var-requires
    15:       const undici = require('undici');
    16:       if (undici && typeof undici.fetch === 'function') return undici.fetch;
    17:     } catch (_) {}
    18:   }
    19:   return undefined;
    20: }
    21: 
    22: const CFG_PATH = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'a11.config.json');
    23: 
    24: function loadCfg() {
    25:   try {
    26:     if (!fs.existsSync(CFG_PATH)) return null;
    27:     return JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(CFG_PATH, 'utf8'));
    28:   } catch (e) { return null; }
    29: }
    30: 
    31: export default async function runA11(argv: string[] = []) {
    32:   const sub = argv[0] || 'status';
    33:   const cfg = loadCfg();
    34:   if (!cfg || !cfg.enabled) {
    35:     console.log('A-11 not enabled or not configured (see .qflush/a11.config.json)');
    36:     return 0;
    37:   }
    38: 
    39:   if (sub === 'start') {
    40:     if (!cfg.startCommand) { console.error('no startCommand configured for A-11'); return 1; }
    41:     try {
    42:       const parts = cfg.startCommand.split(' ');
    43:       const proc = spawn(parts[0], parts.slice(1), { cwd: cfg.path || process.cwd(), detached: true, stdio: 'ignore', shell: true });
    44:       proc.unref();
    45:       if (cfg.pidFile) fs.writeFileSync(cfg.pidFile, String(proc.pid), 'utf8');
    46:       console.log('A-11 start invoked (detached).');
    47:       return 0;
    48:     } catch (e) {
    49:       console.error('failed to start A-11:', String(e));
    50:       return 1;
    51:     }
    52:   }
    53: 
    54:   if (sub === 'stop') {
    55:     if (cfg.pidFile && fs.existsSync(cfg.pidFile)) {
    56:       try {
    57:         const pid = Number(fs.readFileSync(cfg.pidFile, 'utf8'));
    58:         try { process.kill(pid); } catch (e) {}
    59:         try { fs.unlinkSync(cfg.pidFile); } catch (e) {}
    60:         console.log('A-11 stop requested (pid ' + pid + ').');
    61:         return 0;
    62:       } catch (e) { console.error('failed to stop A-11', String(e)); return 1; }
    63:     }
    64:     console.log('no pidFile for A-11; cannot stop cleanly');
    65:     return 0;
    66:   }
    67: 
    68:   // status
    69:   if (cfg.healthUrl) {
    70:     try {
    71:       const fetch = await resolveFetch();
    72:       if (!fetch) throw new Error('fetch not available');
    73:       const res = await fetch(cfg.healthUrl, { method: 'GET' });
    74:       if (res.ok) { console.log('A-11 healthy'); return 0; }
    75:       console.log('A-11 unhealthy, status', res.status);
    76:       return 2;
    77:     } catch (e) {
    78:       console.log('A-11 health check failed:', String(e));
    79:       return 3;
    80:     }
    81:   }
    82: 
    83:   // fallback: check pid
    84:   if (cfg.pidFile && fs.existsSync(cfg.pidFile)) {
    85:     try {
    86:       const pid = Number(fs.readFileSync(cfg.pidFile,'utf8'));
    87:       try { process.kill(pid, 0); console.log('A-11 running (pid', pid + ')'); return 0; } catch (e) { console.log('A-11 not running'); return 3; }
    88:     } catch (e) { console.log('A-11 check failed', String(e)); return 3; }
    89:   }
    90: 
    91:   console.log('A-11 not running (no healthUrl or pidFile)');
    92:   return 3;
    93: }


============================
FILE: src\commands\apply.ts
============================
============================
     1: // src/commands/apply.ts
     2: import * as fs from 'fs';
     3: import * as path from 'path';
     4: import logger from '../utils/logger.js';
     5: import { decodeCortexPacketFromPng } from '../cortex/pngCodec.js';
     6: import { CortexPacket } from '../cortex/types.js';
     7: import { applyCortexPacket } from '../cortex/applyPacket.js';
     8: import { safeWriteFileSync, safeAppendFileSync } from '../utils/safe-fs.js';
     9: 
    10: declare const require: any;
    11: 
    12: export default async function runApply(argv: string[] = []) {
    13:   try {
    14:     const approveAll = argv.includes('--approve') || argv.includes('-a');
    15:     const approveIdArg = argv.find(a => a.startsWith('--approve-id='));
    16:     const approveId = approveIdArg ? approveIdArg.split('=')[1] : null;
    17: 
    18:     const qflushDir = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush');
    19:     if (!fs.existsSync(qflushDir)) fs.mkdirSync(qflushDir, { recursive: true });
    20: 
    21:     // Ensure logs directory and essential log files exist to avoid ENOENT in tests/runner
    22:     try {
    23:       const logsDir = path.join(qflushDir, 'logs');
    24:       if (!fs.existsSync(logsDir)) fs.mkdirSync(logsDir, { recursive: true });
    25:       const spyLog = path.join(logsDir, 'spyder.log');
    26:       if (!fs.existsSync(spyLog)) safeWriteFileSync(spyLog, '', 'utf8');
    27:       const qflushOut = path.join(logsDir, 'qflushd.out');
    28:       if (!fs.existsSync(qflushOut)) safeWriteFileSync(qflushOut, '', 'utf8');
    29:       const qflushErr = path.join(logsDir, 'qflushd.err');
    30:       if (!fs.existsSync(qflushErr)) safeWriteFileSync(qflushErr, '', 'utf8');
    31:     } catch (e) {
    32:       logger.warn('Failed to create .qflush/logs files: ' + String(e));
    33:     }
    34: 
    35:     // 1) Ensure spyder.config.json exists
    36:     const spyCfgPath = path.join(qflushDir, 'spyder.config.json');
    37:     if (!fs.existsSync(spyCfgPath)) {
    38:       const defaultCfg = { enabled: false, frequency: 'passive', routes: [] };
    39:       safeWriteFileSync(spyCfgPath, JSON.stringify(defaultCfg, null, 2), 'utf8');
    40:       logger.info('Created default .qflush/spyder.config.json');
    41:     } else {
    42:       logger.info('.qflush/spyder.config.json already present');
    43:     }
    44: 
    45:     // 2) Synchronize cortex/PacketRouter mapping
    46:     let cortexRoutes: Record<string, boolean> = {};
    47:     try {
    48:       // require router module to discover known actions
    49:       const router = require('../cortex/router');
    50:       const keys = router && router.cortexActions ? Object.keys(router.cortexActions) : [];
    51:       for (const k of keys) cortexRoutes[k] = true; // default enable known actions
    52:     } catch (e) {
    53:       logger.warn('Could not require cortex/router to sync routes: ' + String(e));
    54:     }
    55: 
    56:     const cortexRoutesPath = path.join(qflushDir, 'cortex.routes.json');
    57:     try {
    58:       safeWriteFileSync(cortexRoutesPath, JSON.stringify({ cortexActions: cortexRoutes }, null, 2), 'utf8');
    59:       logger.info('Wrote .qflush/cortex.routes.json');
    60:     } catch (e) {
    61:       logger.warn('Failed to write cortex.routes.json: ' + String(e));
    62:     }
    63: 
    64:     // 3) Generate supporting files if missing
    65:     const lastPath = path.join(qflushDir, 'cortex.last.json');
    66:     const cachePath = path.join(qflushDir, 'spyder.cache.json');
    67:     try { if (!fs.existsSync(lastPath)) safeWriteFileSync(lastPath, JSON.stringify({ initializedAt: new Date().toISOString() }, null, 2), 'utf8'); } catch (e) {}
    68:     try { if (!fs.existsSync(cachePath)) safeWriteFileSync(cachePath, JSON.stringify({ createdAt: new Date().toISOString(), items: [] }, null, 2), 'utf8'); } catch (e) {}
    69: 
    70:     // 4) Scan incoming JSON and PNG packets
    71:     const incomingJsonDir = path.join(qflushDir, 'incoming', 'json');
    72:     const incomingPngDir = path.join(qflushDir, 'incoming', 'png');
    73:     const collected: { pkt: CortexPacket; src?: string }[] = [];
    74: 
    75:     if (fs.existsSync(incomingJsonDir)) {
    76:       for (const f of fs.readdirSync(incomingJsonDir)) {
    77:         if (!f.endsWith('.json')) continue;
    78:         try {
    79:           const raw = fs.readFileSync(path.join(incomingJsonDir, f), 'utf8');
    80:           const j = JSON.parse(raw) as CortexPacket;
    81:           if (j && j.kind === 'cortex-packet') {
    82:             collected.push({ pkt: j, src: path.join(incomingJsonDir, f) });
    83:             logger.info('Queued incoming JSON packet: ' + (j.id || '[no-id]'));
    84:           } else {
    85:             logger.warn('Skipping JSON not matching cortex-packet: ' + f);
    86:           }
    87:         } catch (e) {
    88:           logger.warn('Failed to parse incoming json ' + f + ': ' + String(e));
    89:         }
    90:       }
    91:     }
    92: 
    93:     if (fs.existsSync(incomingPngDir)) {
    94:       for (const f of fs.readdirSync(incomingPngDir)) {
    95:         if (!f.endsWith('.png')) continue;
    96:         try {
    97:           const pkt = await decodeCortexPacketFromPng(path.join(incomingPngDir, f));
    98:           collected.push({ pkt, src: path.join(incomingPngDir, f) });
    99:           logger.info('Decoded incoming PNG packet: ' + (pkt.id || '[no-id]'));
   100:         } catch (e) {
   101:           logger.warn('Failed to decode incoming png ' + f + ': ' + String(e));
   102:         }
   103:       }
   104:     }
   105: 
   106:     // Apply collected packets
   107:     const processedDir = path.join(qflushDir, 'processed');
   108:     if (!fs.existsSync(processedDir)) fs.mkdirSync(processedDir, { recursive: true });
   109:     for (const entry of collected) {
   110:       const pkt = entry.pkt;
   111:       try {
   112:         // if approve flags present, inject into packet payload when AUTO-PATCH
   113:         if (approveAll) {
   114:           try { if (!pkt.payload) pkt.payload = {}; (pkt.payload as any).approve = true; } catch (e) {}
   115:         }
   116:         if (approveId && pkt.id === approveId) {
   117:           try { if (!pkt.payload) pkt.payload = {}; (pkt.payload as any).approve = true; } catch (e) {}
   118:         }
   119: 
   120:         logger.info('Applying packet: ' + pkt.type + ' ' + (pkt.id || ''));
   121:         await applyCortexPacket(pkt);
   122:         const last = { appliedAt: new Date().toISOString(), packet: pkt };
   123:         safeWriteFileSync(lastPath, JSON.stringify(last, null, 2), 'utf8');
   124: 
   125:         // archive original source file into dated folder
   126:         try {
   127:           if (entry.src && fs.existsSync(entry.src)) {
   128:             const m = new Date();
   129:             const y = m.getFullYear();
   130:             const mm = String(m.getMonth() + 1).padStart(2, '0');
   131:             const archiveDir = path.join(processedDir, `${y}-${mm}`);
   132:             if (!fs.existsSync(archiveDir)) fs.mkdirSync(archiveDir, { recursive: true });
   133:             const base = path.basename(entry.src);
   134:             const dest = path.join(archiveDir, `${Date.now()}-${base}`);
   135:             try { fs.renameSync(entry.src, dest); } catch (e) { fs.copyFileSync(entry.src, dest); try { fs.unlinkSync(entry.src); } catch(e){} }
   136:             // write metadata
   137:             try { safeWriteFileSync(dest + '.applied.json', JSON.stringify({ appliedAt: new Date().toISOString(), packetId: pkt.id || null }, null, 2), 'utf8'); } catch (e) {}
   138:           } else {
   139:             // if no src, write packet copy
   140:             const id = pkt.id || (`manual-${Date.now()}`);
   141:             const target = path.join(processedDir, `${id}.json`);
   142:             safeWriteFileSync(target, JSON.stringify(pkt, null, 2), 'utf8');
   143:           }
   144:         } catch (e) { /* ignore */ }
   145:       } catch (e) {
   146:         logger.warn('Failed to apply packet: ' + String(e));
   147:         // move to failed folder if source exists
   148:         try {
   149:           if (entry.src && fs.existsSync(entry.src)) {
   150:             const failDir = path.join(qflushDir, 'failed');
   151:             const m = new Date();
   152:             const y = m.getFullYear();
   153:             const mm = String(m.getMonth() + 1).padStart(2, '0');
   154:             const archiveDir = path.join(failDir, `${y}-${mm}`);
   155:             if (!fs.existsSync(archiveDir)) fs.mkdirSync(archiveDir, { recursive: true });
   156:             const base = path.basename(entry.src);
   157:             const dest = path.join(archiveDir, `${Date.now()}-${base}`);
   158:             try { fs.renameSync(entry.src, dest); } catch (e) { fs.copyFileSync(entry.src, dest); try { fs.unlinkSync(entry.src); } catch(e){} }
   159:             try { safeWriteFileSync(dest + '.error.json', JSON.stringify({ error: String(e), when: new Date().toISOString() }, null, 2), 'utf8'); } catch (e) {}
   160:           }
   161:         } catch (_) {}
   162:       }
   163:     }
   164: 
   165:     // 5) Ensure that SPYDER is wired into lifecycle: update spyder.config.json.routes with cortexRoutes keys
   166:     try {
   167:       const raw = fs.readFileSync(spyCfgPath, 'utf8');
   168:       const spyCfg = JSON.parse(raw || '{}');
   169:       spyCfg.routes = Object.keys(cortexRoutes);
   170:       safeWriteFileSync(spyCfgPath, JSON.stringify(spyCfg, null, 2), 'utf8');
   171:       logger.info('Updated spyder.config.json routes');
   172:     } catch (e) {
   173:       logger.warn('Failed to update spyder.config.json routes: ' + String(e));
   174:     }
   175: 
   176:     // cleanup old archives (keep default 6 months unless configured)
   177:     try {
   178:       const archiveUtils = require('../utils/archive');
   179:       const keep = process.env.QFLUSH_ARCHIVE_KEEP_MONTHS ? Number(process.env.QFLUSH_ARCHIVE_KEEP_MONTHS) : 6;
   180:       try {
   181:         archiveUtils.cleanupDatedArchives(path.join(qflushDir, 'processed'), keep);
   182:       } catch (e) {}
   183:       try {
   184:         archiveUtils.cleanupDatedArchives(path.join(qflushDir, 'failed'), keep);
   185:       } catch (e) {}
   186:     } catch (e) {}
   187: 
   188:     logger.success('qflush apply complete — SPYDER initialized and cortex routes synchronized');
   189:     return 0;
   190:   } catch (e) {
   191:     console.error('qflush apply failed', e);
   192:     return 1;
   193:   }
   194: }


============================
FILE: src\commands\checksum.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0xA0F9B4
     2: 
     3: import alias from '../utils/alias.js';
     4: const fetch = alias.importUtil('../utils/fetch') || alias.importUtil('@utils/fetch') || (globalThis as any).fetch;
     5: const logger = alias.importUtil('@utils/logger') || alias.importUtil('../utils/logger') || console;
     6: 
     7: const DAEMON = process.env.QFLUSH_DAEMON || 'http://localhost:4500';
     8: 
     9: async function postJson(url: string, body: any): Promise<any> {
    10:   const res = await fetch(url, { method: 'POST', headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' }, body: JSON.stringify(body) } as any);
    11:   const json: any = await res.json();
    12:   return json;
    13: }
    14: 
    15: async function getJson(url: string): Promise<any> {
    16:   const res = await fetch(url);
    17:   const json: any = await res.json();
    18:   return json;
    19: }
    20: 
    21: export default async function runChecksum(argv: string[] = []) {
    22:   const sub = argv[0];
    23:   if (!sub) {
    24:     logger.info('Usage: qflush checksum <store|verify|list|clear>');
    25:     return 1;
    26:   }
    27: 
    28:   if (sub === 'store') {
    29:     const id = argv[1];
    30:     const checksum = argv[2];
    31:     const ttlArg = argv.find((a) => a.startsWith('--ttl='));
    32:     const ttlMs = ttlArg ? Number(ttlArg.split('=')[1]) : undefined;
    33:     if (!id || !checksum) {
    34:       logger.error('Usage: qflush checksum store <id> <checksum> [--ttl=ms]');
    35:       return 1;
    36:     }
    37:     const body: any = { id, checksum };
    38:     if (ttlMs) body.ttlMs = ttlMs;
    39:     const res = await postJson(`${DAEMON.replace(/\/$/, '')}/npz/checksum/store`, body);
    40:     logger.info(`store => ${JSON.stringify(res)}`);
    41:     return 0;
    42:   }
    43: 
    44:   if (sub === 'verify') {
    45:     const id = argv[1];
    46:     const checksum = argv[2];
    47:     if (!id || !checksum) {
    48:       logger.error('Usage: qflush checksum verify <id> <checksum>');
    49:       return 1;
    50:     }
    51:     const res: any = await postJson(`${DAEMON.replace(/\/$/, '')}/npz/checksum/verify`, { id, checksum });
    52:     if (res && (res as any).success) {
    53:       logger.success('verify: OK');
    54:       return 0;
    55:     }
    56:     logger.error(`verify failed: ${JSON.stringify(res)}`);
    57:     return 2;
    58:   }
    59: 
    60:   if (sub === 'list') {
    61:     const res = await getJson(`${DAEMON.replace(/\/$/, '')}/npz/checksum/list`);
    62:     logger.info(JSON.stringify(res, null, 2));
    63:     return 0;
    64:   }
    65: 
    66:   if (sub === 'clear') {
    67:     const res = await fetch(`${DAEMON.replace(/\/$/, '')}/npz/checksum/clear`, { method: 'DELETE' } as any);
    68:     const j: any = await res.json();
    69:     logger.info(JSON.stringify(j));
    70:     return 0;
    71:   }
    72: 
    73:   logger.error('Unknown checksum command');
    74:   return 1;
    75: }


============================
FILE: src\commands\compose.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0xD0CF40
     2: 
     3: import alias from '../utils/alias.js';
     4: const logger = alias.importUtil('@utils/logger') || alias.importUtil('../utils/logger') || console;
     5: import { readCompose } from '../compose/parser.js';
     6: import { runStart } from './start.js';
     7: import { startProcess, listRunning, stopProcess } from '../supervisor.js';
     8: import { runPurge } from './purge.js';
     9: import fs from 'fs';
    10: import { Tail } from 'tail';
    11: 
    12: export async function runCompose(argv: string[]) {
    13:   const sub = argv[0];
    14:   const compose = readCompose();
    15:   if (!compose) {
    16:     logger.error('No funesterie.yml or funesterie.fcl found');
    17:     return;
    18:   }
    19:   if (sub === 'up') {
    20:     // support --background flag
    21:     const bg = argv.includes('--background') || argv.includes('-b');
    22:     const modules = Object.keys(compose.modules);
    23:     for (const m of modules) {
    24:       const def = compose.modules[m];
    25:       logger.info(`Bringing up ${m} from ${def.path || 'package'}`);
    26:       if (bg) {
    27:         // start in background using supervisor
    28:         const logPath = `${process.cwd()}/.qflush/logs/${m}.log`;
    29:         startProcess(m, def.path || m, [], { cwd: def.path || process.cwd(), detached: true, logPath });
    30:       } else {
    31:         await runStart({ services: [m], modulePaths: { [m]: def.path }, flags: {} } as any);
    32:       }
    33:     }
    34:     return;
    35:   }
    36:   if (sub === 'down') {
    37:     logger.info('Bringing down all modules');
    38:     await runPurge();
    39:     return;
    40:   }
    41:   if (sub === 'restart') {
    42:     const name = argv[1];
    43:     if (!name) {
    44:       logger.info('Specify module to restart');
    45:       return;
    46:     }
    47:     // naive: stop and start
    48:     const running = listRunning();
    49:     if (running.find(r => r.name === name)) {
    50:       // stop
    51:       await stopProcess(name);
    52:     }
    53:     const def = compose.modules[name];
    54:     if (!def) { logger.info('Unknown module'); return; }
    55:     await runStart({ services: [name], modulePaths: { [name]: def.path }, flags: {} } as any);
    56:     return;
    57:   }
    58:   if (sub === 'logs') {
    59:     const name = argv[1];
    60:     if (!name) { logger.info('Specify module name'); return; }
    61:     const logFile = `${process.cwd()}/.qflush/logs/${name}.log`;
    62:     if (!fs.existsSync(logFile)) { logger.info('No log file found'); return; }
    63:     const t = new Tail(logFile, { fromBeginning: false });
    64:     t.on('line', (data: any) => console.log(data));
    65:     t.on('error', (err: any) => console.error(err));
    66:     return;
    67:   }
    68:   logger.info('Usage: qflush compose [up|down|restart|logs]');
    69: }


============================
FILE: src\commands\config.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x130555
     2: 
     3: import { promises as fs } from "fs";
     4: import { logger } from "../utils/logger.js";
     5: import { resolvePaths } from "../utils/paths.js";
     6: import { qflushOptions } from "../chain/smartChain.js";
     7: 
     8: export async function runConfig(opts?: qflushOptions) {
     9:   logger.info("qflush: generating default configs...");
    10:   const detected = opts?.detected || {};
    11:   const paths = resolvePaths(detected);
    12:   for (const key of Object.keys(paths)) {
    13:     const p = paths[key];
    14:     if (!p) continue;
    15:     const envFile = `${p}/.env`;
    16:     try {
    17:       await fs.access(envFile);
    18:       logger.info(`${key}: .env already exists`);
    19:     } catch {
    20:       const content = `# ${key} default env\nPORT=3000\nTOKEN=changeme\n`;
    21:       await fs.mkdir(p, { recursive: true });
    22:       await fs.writeFile(envFile, content, { encoding: "utf8" });
    23:       logger.success(`Created ${envFile}`);
    24:     }
    25:   }
    26: }
    27: 


============================
FILE: src\commands\copilot-bridge.ts
============================
============================
     1: #!/usr/bin/env node
     2: // ROME-TAG: 0x10C74C
     3: 
     4: import * as fs from 'fs';
     5: import * as path from 'path';
     6: 
     7: async function resolveFetch() {
     8:   // prefer global
     9:   if (typeof (globalThis as any).fetch === 'function') return (globalThis as any).fetch;
    10:   try {
    11:     const m = await import('node-fetch');
    12:     return (m && (m as any).default) || m;
    13:   } catch (e) {
    14:     try {
    15:       // eslint-disable-next-line @typescript-eslint/no-var-requires
    16:       const undici = require('undici');
    17:       if (undici && typeof undici.fetch === 'function') return undici.fetch;
    18:     } catch (_) {}
    19:   }
    20:   throw new Error('No fetch implementation available (install node-fetch or undici)');
    21: }
    22: 
    23: export default async function runCopilotBridge(args: string[]) {
    24:   const cfgPath = '.qflush/copilot.json';
    25:   if (!fs.existsSync(cfgPath)) { console.error('copilot not configured'); return 1; }
    26:   const cfg = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(cfgPath,'utf8'));
    27:   if (args[0] === 'send-snapshot') {
    28:     const state = { /* minimal snapshot */ };
    29:     try {
    30:       const fetch = await resolveFetch();
    31:       await fetch(cfg.webhookUrl, { method: 'POST', body: JSON.stringify({ type: 'engine_snapshot', snapshot: state }), headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' } });
    32:       console.log('sent');
    33:     } catch (e) { console.error('failed', e); return 2; }
    34:     return 0;
    35:   }
    36:   console.log('copilot-bridge: noop');
    37:   return 0;
    38: }


============================
FILE: src\commands\copilot.ts
============================
============================
     1: #!/usr/bin/env node
     2: // ROME-TAG: 0x5293A0
     3: 
     4: import fetch from '../utils/fetch.js';
     5: import * as readline from 'readline';
     6: 
     7: async function postMessage(msg: string) {
     8:   try {
     9:     const res = await fetch(`${process.env.QFLUSH_DAEMON || 'http://localhost:4500'}/copilot/message`, { method: 'POST', body: JSON.stringify({ message: msg }), headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' } } as any);
    10:     const j = await res.json();
    11:     console.log('sent', j);
    12:   } catch (e) { console.error('send failed', e); }
    13: }
    14: 
    15: export default async function runCopilot(args: string[]) {
    16:   if (args.includes('--stream')) {
    17:     // open SSE stream
    18:     const EventSource = require('eventsource');
    19:     const es = new EventSource(`${process.env.QFLUSH_DAEMON || 'http://localhost:4500'}/copilot/stream`);
    20:     es.onmessage = (ev: any) => { console.log('copilot event', ev.data); };
    21:     es.onerror = (e: any) => { console.error('SSE error', e); es.close(); };
    22:     return 0;
    23:   }
    24:   const rl = readline.createInterface({ input: process.stdin, output: process.stdout });
    25:   rl.question('message> ', async (answer) => { await postMessage(answer); rl.close(); process.exit(0); });
    26:   return 0;
    27: }

FILE: src\commands\detect.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x9C32F0
     2: 
     3: import { detectModules } from "../utils/detect.js";
     4: import { logger } from "../utils/logger.js";
     5: import { qflushOptions } from "../chain/smartChain.js";
     6: 
     7: export async function runDetect(_opts?: qflushOptions) {
     8:   logger.info("qflush: detecting modules...");
     9:   const detected = await detectModules();
    10:   for (const k of Object.keys(detected)) {
    11:     const v = detected[k];
    12:     logger.info(`${k}: ${v.running ? 'running' : 'stopped'}`);
    13:   }
    14:   // return a normalized object
    15:   return { detected, paths: {} };
    16: }
    17:

FILE: src\commands\doctor.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0xED1E50
     2: 
     3: import alias from '../utils/alias.js';
     4: const logger = alias.importUtil('@utils/logger') || alias.importUtil('../utils/logger') || console;
     5: import { detectModules } from '../utils/detect.js';
     6: import { httpProbe } from '../utils/health.js';
     7: import { SERVICE_MAP } from '../utils/paths.js';
     8: import { ensurePackageInstalled } from '../utils/exec.js';
     9: 
    10: export async function runDoctor(argv: string[] = []) {
    11:   const fix = argv.includes('--fix') || argv.includes('-f');
    12: 
    13:   logger.info('qflush: running doctor checks...');
    14:   const detected = await detectModules();
    15:   for (const k of Object.keys(detected)) {
    16:     const v = detected[k];
    17:     logger.info(`${k}: installed=${v.installed} running=${v.running} path=${v.path || 'n/a'}`);
    18:     if (v.bin && v.path) {
    19:       logger.info(`  bin: ${v.bin}`);
    20:     }
    21:   }
    22: 
    23:   // check node version
    24:   logger.info(`Node version: ${process.version}`);
    25: 
    26:   // simple http check example
    27:   const httpOk = await httpProbe('http://localhost:80', 500);
    28:   logger.info(`HTTP localhost:80 reachable: ${httpOk}`);
    29: 
    30:   if (fix) {
    31:     logger.info('Doctor fix: attempting to install missing Funeste38 packages...');
    32:     for (const name of Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP)) {
    33:       const pkg = SERVICE_MAP[name].pkg;
    34:       const detectedInfo = detected[name];
    35:       if (!detectedInfo || !detectedInfo.installed) {
    36:         logger.info(`Installing ${pkg} for service ${name}...`);
    37:         const ok = ensurePackageInstalled(pkg);
    38:         if (ok) logger.success(`Installed ${pkg}`);
    39:         else logger.warn(`Failed to install ${pkg}`);
    40:       } else {
    41:         logger.info(`${pkg} already installed`);
    42:       }
    43:     }
    44:   }
    45: 
    46:   logger.info('Doctor checks complete');
    47: }


============================
FILE: src\commands\engine.ts
============================
============================
     1: #!/usr/bin/env node
     2: // ROME-TAG: 0xE2F4A9
     3: 
     4: import { loadRomeIndexFromDisk } from '../rome/index-loader.js';
     5: import { evaluateIndex } from '../rome/engine.js';
     6: import { executeAction } from '../rome/executor.js';
     7: 
     8: export default async function runEngine(args: string[]) {
     9:   const dry = args.includes('--dry-run') || args.includes('--dry');
    10:   const idx = loadRomeIndexFromDisk();
    11:   const actions = evaluateIndex(idx);
    12:   console.log('Engine actions:', actions);
    13:   if (dry) {
    14:     console.log('Running in dry-run mode, simulating actions...');
    15:     for (const a of actions) {
    16:       try {
    17:         // simulate by calling executeAction with dryRun
    18:         const actionString = String((a as any).action ?? a);
    19:         const res = await executeAction(actionString, { path: (a as any).path || null, dryRun: true });
    20:         console.log('Simulate', a, '->', res);
    21:       } catch (e) {
    22:         console.warn('simulate failed', e);
    23:       }
    24:     }
    25:   }
    26:   return 0;
    27: }

FILE: src\commands\freeze.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { freezeAll } from '../supervisor.js';
     2: 
     3: export default async function runFreeze(argv: string[] = []) {
     4:   // parse --health=<url>
     5:   let healthUrl: string | null = null;
     6:   for (const a of argv) {
     7:     if (a.startsWith('--health=')) {
     8:       healthUrl = a.split('=')[1];
     9:       break;
    10:     }
    11:     if (a === '--health') {
    12:       const idx = argv.indexOf(a);
    13:       if (idx >= 0 && idx < argv.length - 1) healthUrl = argv[idx + 1];
    14:       break;
    15:     }
    16:   }
    17: 
    18:   if (!healthUrl) {
    19:     freezeAll('manual');
    20:     console.log('QFLUSH frozen (manual)');
    21:     return 0;
    22:   }
    23: 
    24:   freezeAll('manual', {
    25:     autoResume: true,
    26:     resumeCheck: {
    27:       url: healthUrl,
    28:       intervalMs: 3000,
    29:       timeoutMs: 120000,
    30:     },
    31:   });
    32: 
    33:   console.log(`QFLUSH frozen + auto-resume active (health=${healthUrl})`);
    34:   return 0;
    35: }

FILE: src\commands\inspect.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0xEA570C
     2: 
     3: import { logger } from "../utils/logger.js";
     4: import { detectModules } from "../utils/detect.js";
     5: import { listRunning } from "../supervisor.js";
     6: import { qflushOptions } from "../chain/smartChain.js";
     7: 
     8: export async function runInspect(opts?: qflushOptions) {
     9:   logger.info("qflush: inspecting ecosystem...");
    10:   const detected = opts?.detected || (await detectModules());
    11:   for (const key of Object.keys(detected)) {
    12:     const v = detected[key];
    13:     logger.info(`${key}: ${v.running ? `running (pid=${v.pid || 'unknown'})` : 'stopped'}`);
    14:     if (v.port) logger.info(`  port: ${v.port}`);
    15:     if (v.installed) logger.info(`  installed: true`);
    16:   }
    17:   const running = listRunning();
    18:   if (running.length) {
    19:     logger.info("Supervisor running processes:");
    20:     for (const r of running) logger.info(`  ${r.name}: pid=${r.pid} cmd=${r.cmd}`);
    21:   }
    22: }
    23:

     3: import license from '../utils/license.js';
     4: 
     5: export default async function runLicenseActivate(args: string[]) {
     6:   const key = args[0];
     7:   const product = args[1] || process.env.GUMROAD_PRODUCT_MONTHLY;
     8:   if (!key) {
     9:     console.error('usage: qflush license:activate <key> [product_id]');
    10:     return 1;
    11:   }
    12:   try {
    13:     const res = await license.activateLicense(key, product);
    14:     if (res.ok) {
    15:       console.log('License activated:', res.license);
    16:       return 0;
    17:     }
    18:     console.error('Activation failed:', res.error);
    19:     return 2;
    20:   } catch (e) {
    21:     console.error('Activation error:', e);
    22:     return 3;
    23:   }
    24: }

============================
FILE: src\commands\license.ts
============================
============================
     1: /* ROME-TAG: 0xF45330 */
     2: import alias from '../utils/alias.js';
     3: const logger = alias.importUtil('@utils/logger') || alias.importUtil('../utils/logger') || console;
     4: import gumroad from '../utils/gumroad-license.js';
     5: import { getSecret } from '../utils/secrets.js';
     6: 
     7: export async function runLicense(argv: string[] = []) {
     8:   const sub = argv[0];
     9:   if (!sub) {
    10:     logger.info('Usage: qflush license activate <key> [--product=<id>]');
    11:     return 1;
    12:   }
    13: 
    14:   if (sub === 'activate') {
    15:     const key = argv[1];
    16:     if (!key) {
    17:       logger.error('No license key provided. Usage: qflush license activate <key> [--product=<id>]');
    18:       return 1;
    19:     }
    20:     // parse optional --product=ID
    21:     const prodArg = argv.find((a) => a.startsWith('--product='));
    22:     const productId = prodArg ? prodArg.split('=')[1] : process.env.GUMROAD_PRODUCT_ID || process.env.GUMROAD_PRODUCT_YEARLY || process.env.GUMROAD_PRODUCT_MONTHLY;
    23:     const token = getSecret('GUMROAD_TOKEN', { fileEnv: 'GUMROAD_TOKEN_FILE' });
    24:     if (!token) {
    25:       logger.error('GUMROAD_TOKEN not set (env or file). Set it to perform activation.');
    26:       return 1;
    27:     }
    28:     if (!productId) {
    29:       logger.warn('No product id provided, continuing with provided key verification (Gumroad may accept product lookup).');
    30:     }
    31:     try {
    32:       const rec = await gumroad.activateLicense(productId as string, key, token);
    33:       logger.success(`License activated. Expires: ${rec.expiresAt ? new Date(rec.expiresAt).toISOString() : 'subscription/never'}`);
    34:       return 0;
    35:     } catch (err: any) {
    36:       logger.error(`License activation failed: ${err.message || err}`);
    37:       return 2;
    38:     }
    39:   }
    40: 
    41:   if (sub === 'status') {
    42:     const rec = gumroad.loadLicense();
    43:     if (!rec) {
    44:       logger.info('No local license found');
    45:       return 0;
    46:     }
    47:     logger.info(`Local license: key=${rec.key} product=${rec.product_id} expires=${rec.expiresAt ? new Date(rec.expiresAt).toISOString() : 'never'}`);
    48:     return 0;
    49:   }
    50: 
    51:   if (sub === 'clear') {
    52:     gumroad.clearLicense();
    53:     logger.info('Local license cleared');
    54:     return 0;
    55:   }
    56: 
    57:   logger.info('Unknown license command');
    58:   return 1;
    59: }

     1: #!/usr/bin/env node
     2: // ROME-TAG: 0x66F831
     3: 
     4: import { loadLogicRules } from '../rome/logic-loader.js';
     5: import { loadRomeIndexFromDisk } from '../rome/index-loader.js';
     6: import { evaluateRulesForRecord } from '../rome/logic-loader.js';
     7: 
     8: export default async function runLogic(args: string[]) {
     9:   const rules = loadLogicRules();
    10:   console.log('Loaded rules:', rules.map(r=>r.name));
    11:   const idx = loadRomeIndexFromDisk();
    12:   for (const p of Object.values(idx)) {
    13:     const matches = evaluateRulesForRecord(idx, p as any);
    14:     if (matches.length) console.log('Match for', (p as any).path, matches);
    15:   }
    16:   return 0;
    17: }

FILE: src\commands\npz-scores.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0xF933B3
     2: 
     3: import engine from '../utils/npz-engine.js';
     4: import { stringify } from 'csv-stringify/sync';
     5: 
     6: export async function runNpzScores(args: string[] = []) {
     7:   const store = engine.getStore();
     8:   const items = Object.values(store).map((r: any) => ({ laneId: r.laneId, score: r.score, lastSuccess: r.lastSuccess, lastFailure: r.lastFailure }));
     9:   // sort by score asc
    10:   items.sort((a, b) => (a.score as number) - (b.score as number));
    11: 
    12:   if (args.includes('--reset')) {
    13:     engine.resetScores();
    14:     console.log('npz: scores reset');
    15:     return 0;
    16:   }
    17: 
    18:   if (args.includes('--csv')) {
    19:     const records = items.map((it) => ({ laneId: it.laneId, score: it.score, lastSuccess: it.lastSuccess || '', lastFailure: it.lastFailure || '' }));
    20:     const csv = stringify(records, { header: true });
    21:     console.log(csv);
    22:     return 0;
    23:   }
    24: 
    25:   console.log(JSON.stringify(items, null, 2));
    26:   return 0;
    27: }
    28: 
    29: export default runNpzScores;


============================
FILE: src\commands\purge.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x263C6D
     2: 
     3: import { logger } from "../utils/logger.js";
     4: import { resolvePaths } from "../utils/paths.js";
     5: import { rimrafSync } from "../utils/exec.js";
     6: import { clearState } from "../supervisor.js";
     7: import { qflushOptions } from "../chain/smartChain.js";
     8: 
     9: export async function runPurge(opts?: qflushOptions) {
    10:   logger.info("qflush: purging caches, logs, sessions and supervisor state...");
    11:   const paths = resolvePaths(opts?.detected || {});
    12:   const targets = [] as string[];
    13:   for (const key of Object.keys(paths)) {
    14:     const p = paths[key];
    15:     if (!p) continue;
    16:     targets.push(`${p}/.cache`);
    17:     targets.push(`${p}/logs`);
    18:     targets.push(`${p}/tmp`);
    19:     targets.push(`${p}/sessions`);
    20:   }
    21:   for (const t of targets) {
    22:     try {
    23:       rimrafSync(t);
    24:       logger.success(`Removed ${t}`);
    25:     } catch (err) {
    26:       logger.warn(`Failed to remove ${t}: ${err}`);
    27:     }
    28:   }
    29:   // clear supervisor state
    30:   clearState();
    31:   logger.info("Purge complete.");
    32: }
    33:

FILE: src\commands\resonnance.ts
============================
============================
     1: export default async function runResonnance() {
     2:   // Prefer the in-repo CORTEX resonnance implementation when available
     3:   try {
     4:     // try import cortex resonnance helper
     5:     // eslint-disable-next-line @typescript-eslint/no-var-requires
     6:     const cortexMod = require('../cortex/resonnance');
     7:     if (cortexMod && typeof cortexMod.resonnance === 'function') {
     8:       await cortexMod.resonnance();
     9:       return 0;
    10:     }
    11:   } catch (e) {
    12:     // ignore and fallback to daemon start
    13:   }
    14: 
    15:   // Fallback: start compiled daemon if cortex path not available
    16:   try {
    17:     const port = process.env.QFLUSHD_PORT ? Number(process.env.QFLUSHD_PORT) : 4500;
    18:     // eslint-disable-next-line @typescript-eslint/no-var-requires
    19:     const daemon = require('../../dist/daemon/qflushd');
    20:     if (!daemon || typeof daemon.startServer !== 'function') {
    21:       throw new Error('no resonnance implementation available');
    22:     }
    23:     await daemon.startServer(port);
    24:     console.log('[resonnance] qflushd started on', port);
    25:     return 0;
    26:   } catch (e) {
    27:     console.error('[resonnance] failed to start', e);
    28:     throw e;
    29:   }
    30: }

============================
FILE: src\commands\safe-run.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { spawn } from 'child_process';
     2: 
     3: export default async function runSafeRun(argv: string[] = []) {
     4:   // parse options
     5:   let timeoutSec = 10;
     6:   let detach = false;
     7:   const args: string[] = [];
     8: 
     9:   for (let i = 0; i < argv.length; i++) {
    10:     const a = argv[i];
    11:     if (a === '--detach') {
    12:       detach = true;
    13:       continue;
    14:     }
    15:     if (a === '--timeout' && i < argv.length - 1) {
    16:       const v = Number(argv[i + 1]);
    17:       if (!Number.isNaN(v) && v > 0) timeoutSec = Math.max(1, Math.floor(v));
    18:       i++;
    19:       continue;
    20:     }
    21:     // collect remaining as command args
    22:     args.push(a);
    23:   }
    24: 
    25:   if (args.length === 0) {
    26:     console.log('usage: qflush safe-run [--detach] [--timeout N] <qflush-subcommand> [args...]');
    27:     console.log('example: qflush safe-run --detach start --service rome');
    28:     return 1;
    29:   }
    30: 
    31:   // Default behavior: run the built daemon CLI: node dist/index.js <args...>
    32:   const node = process.execPath;
    33:   const childArgs = ['dist/index.js', ...args];
    34: 
    35:   if (detach) {
    36:     try {
    37:       const c = spawn(node, childArgs, { detached: true, stdio: 'ignore' });
    38:       c.unref();
    39:       console.log(`qflush safe-run: started detached pid=${c.pid}`);
    40:       return 0;
    41:     } catch (e) {
    42:       console.error('safe-run detach failed', e);
    43:       return 2;
    44:     }
    45:   }
    46: 
    47:   // Not detached: run with watchdog timeout
    48:   return await new Promise<number>((resolve) => {
    49:     const child = spawn(node, childArgs, { stdio: 'inherit' as any });
    50:     let finished = false;
    51: 
    52:     const onExit = (code: number | null) => {
    53:       if (finished) return;
    54:       finished = true;
    55:       resolve(code === null ? 0 : code);
    56:     };
    57: 
    58:     child.on('exit', onExit);
    59:     child.on('error', (err) => {
    60:       if (finished) return;
    61:       finished = true;
    62:       console.error('safe-run child error', err);
    63:       resolve(3);
    64:     });
    65: 
    66:     const timer = setTimeout(() => {
    67:       if (finished) return;
    68:       console.warn(`[safe-run] timeout ${timeoutSec}s reached — sending SIGINT to pid=${child.pid}`);
    69:       try { child.kill('SIGINT'); } catch (e) { /* ignore */ }
    70: 
    71:       // wait short then force kill
    72:       setTimeout(() => {
    73:         if (finished) return;
    74:         console.warn(`[safe-run] still running — forcing kill pid=${child.pid}`);
    75:         try { child.kill('SIGTERM'); } catch (e) { try { child.kill(); } catch {} }
    76:       }, 2000);
    77:     }, timeoutSec * 1000);
    78: 
    79:     // clear timer on finish
    80:     (child as any).once && (child as any).once('exit', () => { clearTimeout(timer); });
    81:   });
    82: }


============================
FILE: src\commands\secret-import.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { spawnSync } from 'child_process';
     2: import path from 'path';
     3: 
     4: export default async function runSecretImport(argv: string[] = []) {
     5:   // usage: qflush secret import [--env <path>] [--no-acl]
     6:   let envPath: string | undefined;
     7:   let restrictAcl = true;
     8: 
     9:   for (let i = 0; i < argv.length; i++) {
    10:     const a = argv[i];
    11:     if ((a === '--env' || a === '-e') && i < argv.length - 1) {
    12:       envPath = argv[i + 1];
    13:       i++;
    14:       continue;
    15:     }
    16:     if (a === '--no-acl') {
    17:       restrictAcl = false;
    18:       continue;
    19:     }
    20:   }
    21: 
    22:   // default envPath to Desktop .env
    23:   if (!envPath) {
    24:     const home = process.env.USERPROFILE || process.env.HOME || '';
    25:     envPath = path.join(home, 'Desktop', '.env');
    26:   }
    27: 
    28:   const script = path.join(process.cwd(), 'scripts', 'import-env-to-secrets.ps1');
    29:   const pwsh = process.env.PWSH || 'pwsh';
    30: 
    31:   const args = ['-NoProfile', '-ExecutionPolicy', 'Bypass', '-File', script, '-EnvPath', envPath];
    32:   if (restrictAcl) args.push('-RestrictFileAcl');
    33: 
    34:   console.log('Running import script:', pwsh, args.join(' '));
    35: 
    36:   const res = spawnSync(pwsh, args, { stdio: 'inherit' });
    37:   if (res.error) {
    38:     console.error('Failed to execute import script:', res.error);
    39:     return 2;
    40:   }
    41:   return res.status ?? 0;
    42: }


============================
FILE: src\commands\spyder-secrets.ts
============================
============================
     1: import path from "path";
     2: import { scanFileForSecrets, SecretMatch } from "@funeste38/spyder/decoders/secrets";
     3: 
     4: /**
     5:  * Commande CLI / fonction utilitaire pour scanner un dump texte.
     6:  * Usage programmatique: await spyderSecretsCommand('D:\\qflush\\parts\\qflush-code-dump.txt')
     7:  */
     8: export async function spyderSecretsCommand(dumpPath?: string): Promise<number> {
     9:   const file = dumpPath ?? path.join(process.cwd(), "parts", "qflush-code-dump.txt");
    10:   try {
    11:     const matches: SecretMatch[] = scanFileForSecrets(file);
    12:     if (!matches.length) {
    13:       console.log("[SPYDER] Aucun secret détecté ✅");
    14:       return 0;
    15:     }
    16: 
    17:     console.log(`[SPYDER] ${matches.length} secrets potentiels trouvés :`);
    18:     for (const m of matches) {
    19:       console.log(`- ${m.pattern} @ ligne ${m.line} (index ${m.index}): ${m.snippet}`);
    20:     }
    21:     return 2;
    22:   } catch (err: any) {
    23:     console.error("[SPYDER] Erreur lors du scan:", err.message ?? err);
    24:     return 1;
    25:   }
    26: }
    27: 
    28: // Execution si appelé directement via ts-node/node (ex: node dist/...)
    29: if (require.main === module) {
    30:   const arg = process.argv[2]; // optional dump path
    31:   spyderSecretsCommand(arg).then(code => process.exit(code));
    32: }


============================
FILE: src\commands\spyder.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x5PYD3R
     2: 
     3: import { spawn } from 'child_process';
     4: import * as fs from 'fs';
     5: import * as path from 'path';
     6: 
     7: async function resolveFetch() {
     8:   if (typeof (globalThis as any).fetch === 'function') return (globalThis as any).fetch;
     9:   try {
    10:     const m = await import('node-fetch');
    11:     return (m && (m as any).default) || m;
    12:   } catch (e) {
    13:     try {
    14:       // eslint-disable-next-line @typescript-eslint/no-var-requires
    15:       const undici = require('undici');
    16:       if (undici && typeof undici.fetch === 'function') return undici.fetch;
    17:     } catch (_) {}
    18:   }
    19:   return undefined;
    20: }
    21: 
    22: const CFG_PATH = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'spyder.config.json');
    23: 
    24: function loadCfg() {
    25:   try {
    26:     if (!fs.existsSync(CFG_PATH)) return null;
    27:     return JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(CFG_PATH, 'utf8'));
    28:   } catch (e) { return null; }
    29: }
    30: 
    31: export default async function runSpyder(argv: string[] = []) {
    32:   const sub = (argv && argv[0]) || 'status';
    33:   const cfg: any = loadCfg();
    34:   if (!cfg || !cfg.enabled) {
    35:     console.log('Spyder not enabled or not configured (see .qflush/spyder.config.json)');
    36:     return 0;
    37:   }
    38: 
    39:   if (sub === 'start') {
    40:     if (!cfg.startCommand) { console.error('no startCommand configured for Spyder'); return 1; }
    41:     try {
    42:       const parts = Array.isArray(cfg.startCommand) ? cfg.startCommand : String(cfg.startCommand).split(' ');
    43:       const proc = spawn(parts[0], parts.slice(1), { cwd: cfg.path || process.cwd(), detached: true, stdio: 'ignore', shell: true });
    44:       proc.unref();
    45:       if (cfg.pidFile) fs.writeFileSync(cfg.pidFile, String(proc.pid), 'utf8');
    46:       console.log('Spyder start invoked (detached).');
    47:       return 0;
    48:     } catch (e) {
    49:       console.error('failed to start Spyder:', String(e));
    50:       return 1;
    51:     }
    52:   }
    53: 
    54:   if (sub === 'stop') {
    55:     if (cfg.pidFile && fs.existsSync(cfg.pidFile)) {
    56:       try {
    57:         const pid = Number(fs.readFileSync(cfg.pidFile, 'utf8'));
    58:         try { process.kill(pid); } catch (e) {}
    59:         try { fs.unlinkSync(cfg.pidFile); } catch (e) {}
    60:         console.log('Spyder stop requested (pid ' + pid + ').');
    61:         return 0;
    62:       } catch (e) { console.error('failed to stop Spyder', String(e)); return 1; }
    63:     }
    64:     console.log('no pidFile for Spyder; cannot stop cleanly');
    65:     return 0;
    66:   }
    67: 
    68:   if (sub === 'status') {
    69:     // status
    70:     if (cfg.healthUrl) {
    71:       try {
    72:         const fetch = await resolveFetch();
    73:         if (!fetch) throw new Error('fetch not available');
    74:         const res = await fetch(cfg.healthUrl, { method: 'GET' });
    75:         if (res.ok) { console.log('Spyder healthy'); return 0; }
    76:         console.log('Spyder unhealthy, status', res.status);
    77:         return 2;
    78:       } catch (e) {
    79:         console.log('Spyder health check failed:', String(e));
    80:         return 3;
    81:       }
    82:     }
    83: 
    84:     // fallback: check pid
    85:     if (cfg.pidFile && fs.existsSync(cfg.pidFile)) {
    86:       try {
    87:         const pid = Number(fs.readFileSync(cfg.pidFile,'utf8'));
    88:         try { process.kill(pid, 0); console.log('Spyder running (pid', pid + ')'); return 0; } catch (e) { console.log('Spyder not running'); return 3; }
    89:       } catch (e) { console.log('Spyder check failed', String(e)); return 3; }
    90:     }
    91: 
    92:     console.log('Spyder not running (no healthUrl or pidFile)');
    93:     return 3;
    94:   }
    95: }


============================
FILE: src\commands\start.ts
============================

     1: // ROME-TAG: 0xF73710

     3: import { detectModules } from "../utils/detect.js";
     4: import logger from "../utils/logger.js";
     5: import { ensurePackageInstalled, pathExists, rebuildInstructionsFor } from "../utils/exec.js";
     6: import { resolvePaths, SERVICE_MAP } from "../utils/paths.js";
     7: import { qflushOptions } from "../chain/smartChain.js";
     8: import { resolvePackagePath, readPackageJson } from "../utils/package.js";
     9: import { startProcess } from "../supervisor.js";
    10: import { resolveMerged } from "../supervisor/merged-resolver.js";
    11: import { waitForService } from "../utils/health.js";
    12: import { runCustomsCheck, hasBlockingIssues, ModuleDescriptor } from "../utils/npz-customs.js";

    14: import { spawnSync } from 'node:child_process';

    16: import { startService } from '../services.js';
    17: import net from 'node:net';
