FILE: src\tests\logic-action.test.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x8F4668
     2: 
     3: import { loadLogicRules } from '../rome/logic-loader.js';
     4: import { loadRomeIndexFromDisk } from '../rome/index-loader.js';
     5: import { evaluateAllRules } from '../rome/logic-loader.js';
     6: import { describe, it, expect } from 'vitest';
     7: 
     8: export async function runTests() {
     9:   // ensure rules are loaded
    10:   const rules = loadLogicRules();
    11:   console.log('rules loaded', rules.length);
    12:   const idx = loadRomeIndexFromDisk();
    13:   const actions = evaluateAllRules(idx, Object.keys(idx));
    14:   console.log('evaluateAllRules result', actions);
    15:   if (!Array.isArray(actions)) throw new Error('no actions returned');
    16: }
    17: 
    18: describe('logic-action (stub)', () => {
    19:   it('stub passes', () => {
    20:     expect(true).toBe(true);
    21:   });
    22: });


============================
FILE: src\tests\logic-parser.unit.test.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0xE77814
     2: 
     3: import { buildConditionAst, evaluateConditionExprAST } from '../rome/logic-parser.js';
     4: import { describe, it, expect } from 'vitest';
     5: 
     6: function testExpr(expr: string, ctx: any, expected: boolean) {
     7:   const ast = buildConditionAst(expr);
     8:   const res = evaluateConditionExprAST(ast, ctx);
     9:   if (res !== expected) {
    10:     console.error('test failed', expr, ctx, res, expected);
    11:     throw new Error(`logic-parser test failed: ${expr}`);
    12:   }
    13: }
    14: 
    15: export async function runTests() {
    16:   testExpr('file.type == "module" and file.tagChanged', { file: { type: 'module', tagChanged: true } }, true);
    17:   testExpr('file.type == "module" and not file.tagChanged', { file: { type: 'module', tagChanged: false } }, true);
    18:   testExpr('file.type == "asset" or file.type == "module"', { file: { type: 'module' } }, true);
    19:   console.log('logic-parser unit tests passed');
    20: }
    21: 
    22: describe('logic-parser (stub)', () => {
    23:   it('stub passes', () => {
    24:     expect(true).toBe(true);
    25:   });
    26: });

FILE: src\tests\merged-resolver.test.ts
============================
============================
     1: /// <reference types="vitest" />
     2: import { describe, it, expect, beforeEach, vi } from 'vitest';
     3: import * as merged from '../supervisor/merged-resolver.js';
     4: import * as npz from '../utils/npz.js';
     5: import * as sup from '../supervisor/index.js';
     6: 
     7: describe('merged resolver', () => {
     8:   beforeEach(() => {
     9:     vi.restoreAllMocks();
    10:   });
    11: 
    12:   it('supervisor wins when running candidate exists', async () => {
    13:     // stub supervisor listRunning
    14:     vi.spyOn(sup as any, 'listRunning').mockImplementation(() => [{ name: 'foo', pid: 123, cmd: 'node foo', args: ['start'], cwd: '/tmp' }]);
    15:     const res = await merged.resolveMerged('foo');
    16:     if (process.env.QFLUSH_DISABLE_SUPERVISOR === '1' || process.env.QFLUSH_SAFE_CI === '1' || process.env.NODE_ENV === 'test') {
    17:       // En CI/test, le superviseur est ignoré
    18:       expect(['dlx', 'yellow']).toContain(res.gate);
    19:     } else {
    20:       expect(res.gate).toBe('green');
    21:       expect(res.cmd).toBe('node foo');
    22:     }
    23:   });
    24: 
    25:   it('falls back to npz when supervisor not present', async () => {
    26:     vi.spyOn(sup as any, 'listRunning').mockImplementation(() => []);
    27:     vi.spyOn(npz, 'npzResolve').mockImplementation(() => ({ gate: 'yellow', cmd: process.execPath, args: ['-e'], cwd: process.cwd() } as any));
    28:     const res = await merged.resolveMerged('bar');
    29:     expect(res.gate).toBe('yellow');
    30:     expect(res.cmd).toBe(process.execPath);
    31:   });
    32: 
    33:   it('merges supervisor and default: fill missing fields from default', async () => {
    34:     vi.spyOn(sup as any, 'listRunning').mockImplementation(() => [{ name: 'baz', pid: 234, cmd: '', args: [], cwd: '' }]);
    35:     vi.spyOn(npz, 'npzResolve').mockImplementation(() => ({ gate: 'green', cmd: 'node /pkg/baz', args: ['run'], cwd: '/pkg' } as any));
    36:     const res = await merged.resolveMerged('baz');
    37:     expect(res.gate).toBe('green');
    38:     expect(res.cmd).toBe('node /pkg/baz');
    39:     expect(res.args && res.args[0]).toBe('run');
    40:   });
    41: });

FILE: src\tests\npz-bat-modes.test.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { afterAll, beforeAll, describe, expect, it } from 'vitest';
     2: import { startServer, stopServer } from '../daemon/qflushd.js';
     3: import fs from 'fs';
     4: import path from 'path';
     5: 
     6: const URL = 'http://127.0.0.1:4500';
     7: 
     8: async function resolveFetch() {
     9:   if (typeof (globalThis as any).fetch === 'function') return (globalThis as any).fetch;
    10:   try {
    11:     const m = await import('node-fetch');
    12:     return (m && (m as any).default) || m;
    13:   } catch (e) {
    14:     try {
    15:       // eslint-disable-next-line @typescript-eslint/no-var-requires
    16:       const undici = require('undici');
    17:       if (undici && typeof undici.fetch === 'function') return undici.fetch;
    18:     } catch (_) {}
    19:   }
    20:   throw new Error('No fetch available for tests');
    21: }
    22: 
    23: let fetch: any;
    24: 
    25: beforeAll(async () => {
    26:   process.env.QFLUSH_TOKEN = 'test-token';
    27:   process.env.QFLUSH_SAFE_CI = '1';
    28:   fetch = await resolveFetch();
    29:   // ensure server started
    30:   startServer(4500);
    31: });
    32: 
    33: afterAll(() => {
    34:   try { stopServer(); } catch (e) {}
    35: });
    36: 
    37: describe('NPZ BAT control endpoints (embedded)', () => {
    38:   it('POST /npz/sleep requires token and sets safe mode', async () => {
    39:     // without token header
    40:     const r1 = await fetch(`${URL}/npz/sleep`, { method: 'POST' });
    41:     expect(r1.status).toBe(401);
    42: 
    43:     // with token
    44:     const r2 = await fetch(`${URL}/npz/sleep`, { method: 'POST', headers: { 'x-qflush-token': 'test-token' } });
    45:     expect(r2.status).toBe(200);
    46:     const body = await r2.json();
    47:     expect(body.success).toBe(true);
    48:     expect(body.mode).toBe('sleep');
    49: 
    50:     // verify safe-modes.json exists
    51:     const p = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'safe-modes.json');
    52:     expect(fs.existsSync(p)).toBe(true);
    53:   });
    54: 
    55:   it('POST /npz/wake requires token and clears safe mode', async () => {
    56:     const r = await fetch(`${URL}/npz/wake`, { method: 'POST', headers: { 'x-qflush-token': 'test-token' } });
    57:     expect(r.status).toBe(200);
    58:     const body = await r.json();
    59:     expect(body.success).toBe(true);
    60:     expect(body.mode).toBe('normal');
    61:   });
    62: 
    63:   it('POST /npz/joker-wipe requires token and performs wipe (test mode skip exit)', async () => {
    64:     const r = await fetch(`${URL}/npz/joker-wipe`, { method: 'POST', headers: { 'x-qflush-token': 'test-token' } });
    65:     expect(r.status).toBe(200);
    66:     const body = await r.json();
    67:     expect(body.success).toBe(true);
    68:     expect(body.mode).toBe('joker');
    69:   });
    70: });


============================
FILE: src\tests\rome-index.test.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x2F0688
     2: 
     3: import * as http from 'http';
     4: import { spawn, ChildProcess } from 'child_process';
     5: import fetch from '../utils/fetch.js';
     6: 
     7: const PORT = process.env.QFLUSHD_PORT ? Number(process.env.QFLUSHD_PORT) : 4500;
     8: const BASE = `http://127.0.0.1:${PORT}`;
     9: 
    10: async function waitForJson(path: string, attempts = 20, delayMs = 250) {
    11:   for (let i = 0; i < attempts; i++) {
    12:     try {
    13:       const res = await fetch(`${BASE}${path}`);
    14:       if (!res.ok) throw new Error(`status ${res.status}`);
    15:       const j = await res.json();
    16:       return j;
    17:     } catch (e) {
    18:       // wait and retry
    19:       await new Promise((r) => setTimeout(r, delayMs));
    20:     }
    21:   }
    22:   throw new Error(`failed to fetch JSON ${path} after ${attempts} attempts`);
    23: }
    24: 
    25: async function isReachable(attempts = 5, delayMs = 200) {
    26:   for (let i = 0; i < attempts; i++) {
    27:     try {
    28:       const res = await fetch(`${BASE}/npz/rome-index`);
    29:       if (res.ok) return true;
    30:     } catch (e) {}
    31:     await new Promise((r) => setTimeout(r, delayMs));
    32:   }
    33:   return false;
    34: }
    35: 
    36: export async function runTests() {
    37:   let serverMod: any = null;
    38:   let spawned: ChildProcess | null = null;
    39:   try {
    40:     // Si le service est déjà joignable, skip démarrage
    41:     if (!(await isReachable(100, 200))) {
    42:       try {
    43:         // ensure daemon token available when starting in-process or spawning
    44:         if (!process.env.QFLUSH_TOKEN) process.env.QFLUSH_TOKEN = 'test-token';
    45:         // prefer importing the TS module (no .js) so Vitest can resolve it
    46:         serverMod = await import('../daemon/qflushd.js');
    47:         // start server programmatically on test port
    48:         if (serverMod && typeof serverMod.startServer === 'function') {
    49:           console.log('[rome-index] Démarrage du daemon via startServer');
    50:           await serverMod.startServer(PORT);
    51:         } else {
    52:           // fallback: spawn daemon process from dist (if present)
    53:           try {
    54:             console.log('[rome-index] Démarrage du daemon via spawn');
    55:             // spawn a node helper that requires the dist module and starts the server
    56:             const inline = `require('./dist/daemon/qflushd').startServer(${PORT}).catch(e=>{ console.error(e); process.exit(1); });`;
    57:             spawned = spawn('node', ['-e', inline], {
    58:               env: { ...process.env, QFLUSHD_PORT: String(PORT), QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS: '0' },
    59:               stdio: ['ignore', 'pipe', 'pipe'],
    60:             });
    61:             if (spawned.stdout) spawned.stdout.on('data', (d) => console.log('[qflushd]', d.toString()));
    62:             if (spawned.stderr) spawned.stderr.on('data', (d) => console.error('[qflushd]', d.toString()));
    63:           } catch (e) {
    64:             console.error('[rome-index] Echec du spawn du daemon', e);
    65:           }
    66:         }
    67:       } catch (e) {
    68:         // import failed; try spawning the dist daemon as a last resort
    69:         try {
    70:           console.log('[rome-index] Import du daemon échoué, tentative spawn');
    71:           const inline = `require('./dist/daemon/qflushd').startServer(${PORT}).catch(e=>{ console.error(e); process.exit(1); });`;
    72:           spawned = spawn('node', ['-e', inline], {
    73:             env: { ...process.env, QFLUSHD_PORT: String(PORT), QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS: '0' },
    74:             stdio: ['ignore', 'pipe', 'pipe'],
    75:           });
    76:           if (spawned.stdout) spawned.stdout.on('data', (d) => console.log('[qflushd]', d.toString()));
    77:           if (spawned.stderr) spawned.stderr.on('data', (d) => console.error('[qflushd]', d.toString()));
    78:         } catch (ee) {
    79:           console.error('[rome-index] Echec du spawn du daemon (fallback)', ee);
    80:         }
    81:       }
    82: 
    83:       // give it a moment to start
    84:       await new Promise((r) => setTimeout(r, 400));
    85: 
    86:       // ensure it's reachable before proceeding
    87:       if (!(await isReachable(100, 200))) {
    88:         console.error(`[rome-index] qflushd not reachable at ${BASE} après 100 tentatives`);
    89:         throw new Error(`qflushd not reachable at ${BASE}`);
    90:       } else {
    91:         console.log(`[rome-index] qflushd est bien démarré sur ${BASE}`);
    92:       }
    93:     } else {
    94:       console.log(`[rome-index] qflushd déjà joignable sur ${BASE}`);
    95:     }
    96: 
    97:     const res = await fetch(`${BASE}/npz/rome-index`);
    98:     const j: any = await res.json();
    99:     console.log('rome-index test response:', j && j.count);
   100: 
   101:     const all: any = await waitForJson('/npz/rome-index', 40, 200);
   102:     if (!all || !Array.isArray(all.items)) {
   103:       console.error('invalid index response', all);
   104:       throw new Error('invalid index response');
   105:     }
   106:     console.log('rome-index count=', all.count);
   107: 
   108:     // try filter by type 'daemon' (should return 0 or more)
   109:     const byDaemon: any = await waitForJson('/npz/rome-index?type=daemon', 10, 200);
   110:     if (!byDaemon || !Array.isArray(byDaemon.items)) {
   111:       console.error('invalid filtered response', byDaemon);
   112:       throw new Error('invalid filtered response');
   113:     }
   114:     console.log('rome-index daemon count=', byDaemon.count);
   115:   } finally {
   116:     try { if (serverMod && typeof serverMod.stopServer === 'function') serverMod.stopServer(); } catch (e) {}
   117:     try { if (spawned && typeof spawned.kill === 'function') spawned.kill(); } catch (e) {}
   118:   }
   119: }
   120: 
   121: import { describe, it, expect } from 'vitest';
   122: 
   123: describe('rome-index (stub)', () => {
   124:   it('stub passes', () => {
   125:     expect(true).toBe(true);
   126:   });
   127: });

FILE: src\tests\rome-links.test.ts
============================

     1: /// <reference types="vitest" />
     2: import { resolveRomeToken, computeRomeLinksForFiles, mergeAndWrite, readExistingLinks, romeLinksEmitter } from '../rome/linker.js';
     3: import { describe, it, expect } from 'vitest';
     4: 
     5: const projectRoot = process.cwd();
     6: 
     7: describe('rome linker resolver', () => {
     8:   it('resolves tokens using index', () => {
     9:     // this test relies on existing .qflush/rome-index.json in workspace
    10:     const from = 'src/rome/linker.test.ts';
    11:     const token = 'linker';
    12:     const res = resolveRomeToken(projectRoot, from, token);
    13:     expect(res).toBeDefined();
    14:     expect(res.score).toBeGreaterThanOrEqual(0);
    15:   });
    16: 
    17:   it('emits update on mergeAndWrite', async () => {
    18:     const testLinks = [{ from: 'src/a.ts', line: 1, token: 'a', target: null, score: 0 }];
    19:     await new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
    20:       const handler = (updated: any) => {
    21:         try {
    22:           expect(Array.isArray(updated)).toBe(true);
    23:           romeLinksEmitter.removeListener('updated', handler);
    24:           resolve(undefined);
    25:         } catch (e) {
    26:           reject(e);
    27:         }
    28:       };
    29:       romeLinksEmitter.on('updated', handler);
    30:       mergeAndWrite(projectRoot, testLinks as any);
    31:     });
    32:   });
    33: });

     5: 
     6: function assertEqual(a: any, b: any, msg?: string) {
     7:   if (JSON.stringify(a) !== JSON.stringify(b)) throw new Error(msg || `Assertion failed: ${JSON.stringify(a)} !== ${JSON.stringify(b)}`);
     8: }
     9: 
    10: export async function runTests() {

FILE: src\tests\spyder-admin-port-occupied.test.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { describe, it, expect, vi, beforeEach, afterEach } from 'vitest';
     2: import * as fs from 'node:fs';
     3: import path from 'node:path';
     4: import net from 'node:net';
     5: import os from 'node:os';
     6: 
     7: describe('spyder admin port occupied behavior', () => {
     8:   let tmpDir: string;
     9:   let origCwd: string;
    10:   const OLD_ENV = { ...process.env };
    11:   let server: net.Server | null = null;
    12: 
    13:   beforeEach(() => {
    14:     origCwd = process.cwd();
    15:     tmpDir = fs.mkdtempSync(path.join(os.tmpdir(), 'qflush-test-'));
    16:     process.chdir(tmpDir);
    17:   });
    18: 
    19:   afterEach(() => {
    20:     try { process.chdir(origCwd); } catch {}
    21:     try { fs.rmSync(tmpDir, { recursive: true, force: true }); } catch {}
    22:     process.env = { ...OLD_ENV };
    23:     if (server) {
    24:       try { server.close(); } catch {}
    25:       server = null;
    26:     }
    27:     vi.restoreAllMocks();
    28:   });
    29: 
    30:   it('does not persist spyder config when admin port is already bound', async () => {
    31:     // reserve a port
    32:     const listenPort = 52345;
    33:     server = net.createServer(() => {});
    34:     await new Promise<void>((resolve, reject) => {
    35:       server!.listen(listenPort, '127.0.0.1', (err?: any) => {
    36:         if (err) reject(err); else resolve();
    37:       });
    38:     });
    39: 
    40:     process.env.QFLUSH_SPYDER_ADMIN_PORT = String(listenPort);
    41: 
    42:     // mock startService to avoid side effects
    43:     vi.mock('../../src/services', () => ({ startService: async () => { return; } }));
    44: 
    45:     const { runStart } = await import('../../src/commands/start.js');
    46:     await runStart({ services: ['spyder'] as any, flags: {} as any } as any);
    47: 
    48:     const cfgPath = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'spyder.config.json');
    49:     expect(fs.existsSync(cfgPath)).toBe(false);
    50:   });
    51: });

FILE: src\tests\spyder-admin-port.test.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { describe, it, expect, vi, beforeEach, afterEach } from 'vitest';
     2: import * as fs from 'node:fs';
     3: import path from 'node:path';
     4: import os from 'node:os';
     5: 
     6: describe('spyder admin port persistence', () => {
     7:   let tmpDir: string;
     8:   let origCwd: string;
     9:   const OLD_ENV = { ...process.env };
    10: 
    11:   beforeEach(() => {
    12:     origCwd = process.cwd();
    13:     tmpDir = fs.mkdtempSync(path.join(os.tmpdir(), 'qflush-test-'));
    14:     process.chdir(tmpDir);
    15:   });
    16: 
    17:   afterEach(() => {
    18:     try {
    19:       process.chdir(origCwd);
    20:     } catch {};
    21:     try { fs.rmSync(tmpDir, { recursive: true, force: true }); } catch {};
    22:     process.env = { ...OLD_ENV };
    23:     vi.restoreAllMocks();
    24:   });
    25: 
    26:   it('writes .qflush/spyder.config.json with adminPort when QFLUSH_SPYDER_ADMIN_PORT is set', async () => {
    27:     // Ensure services.startService is mocked so runStart does not try to actually start processes
    28:     vi.mock('../../src/services', () => ({ startService: async () => { return; } }));
    29: 
    30:     process.env.QFLUSH_SPYDER_ADMIN_PORT = '51234';
    31: 
    32:     const { runStart } = await import('../../src/commands/start.js');
    33: 
    34:     // Call runStart asking only for spyder to avoid other modules
    35:     await runStart({ services: ['spyder'] as any, flags: {} as any } as any);
    36: 
    37:     const cfgPath = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'spyder.config.json');
    38:     expect(fs.existsSync(cfgPath)).toBe(true);
    39:     const raw = fs.readFileSync(cfgPath, 'utf8');
    40:     const cfg = JSON.parse(raw || '{}');
    41:     expect(cfg.adminPort).toBe(51234);
    42:   });
    43: });

FILE: src\types\shims.d.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0xDBADFC
     2: 
     3: declare module "@funeste38/nezlephant";
     4: declare module "@funeste38/freeland";
     5: declare module "@funeste38/bat";
     6: declare module "@funeste38/envaptex";
     7: 
     8: // Generic shims
     9: declare module '../utils/*' {

    17: }

============================
FILE: src\utils\alias.ts
============================
============================
     1: import * as fs from 'fs';
     2: import * as path from 'path';
     3: 
     4: const ALIAS_DEBUG = process.env.ALIAS_DEBUG === '1';
     5: function aliasWarn(isAlias: boolean, ...args: any[]) {
     6:   if (isAlias || ALIAS_DEBUG) console.warn('[alias]', ...args);
     7: }
     8: 
     9: // avoid static import of './paths' to prevent TypeScript module resolution issues in some environments
    10: let resolvePaths: any = undefined;
    11: try {
    12:   // require at runtime; if not available, leave undefined
    13:   // use dynamic path to avoid TypeScript module resolution of literal './paths'
    14:   // eslint-disable-next-line @typescript-eslint/no-var-requires
    15:   const p = require(path.join(__dirname, 'paths'));
    16:   resolvePaths = p && p.resolvePaths;
    17: } catch (e) {
    18:   resolvePaths = undefined;
    19: }
    20: 
    21: function tryRequire(filePath: string) {
    22:   try {
    23:     if (fs.existsSync(filePath)) return require(filePath);
    24:   } catch (e) {
    25:     try { return require(filePath); } catch (e) {}
    26:   }
    27:   return undefined;
    28: }
    29: 
    30: function tryRequireVariants(basePath: string) {
    31:   const variants = [".js", ".ts", "/index.js", "/index.ts"];
    32:   for (const v of variants) {
    33:     const p = basePath.endsWith(v) ? basePath : basePath + v;
    34:     const m = tryRequire(p);
    35:     if (m) return (m && m.default) || m;
    36:   }
    37:   return undefined;
    38: }
    39: 
    40: export function importUtil(name: string): any {
    41:   // normalize alias forms such as '@utils/foo' or '#utils/foo' to a simple local name
    42:   let localName = name;
    43:   const aliasMatch = !!(name && (name.startsWith('@utils/') || name.startsWith('#utils/')));
    44:   if (aliasMatch) localName = name.replace(/^(@|#)?utils\//, '');
    45: 
    46:   // prefer spyder local workspace copy when present
    47:   try {
    48:     if (typeof resolvePaths === 'function') {
    49:       const paths = resolvePaths();
    50:       const spy = paths && paths['spyder'];
    51:       if (spy) {
    52:         // common locations inside spyder package layout
    53:         const candidates = [
    54:           path.join(spy, 'apps', 'spyder-core', 'src', 'utils', localName),
    55:           path.join(spy, 'apps', 'spyder-core', 'src', localName),
    56:           path.join(spy, 'src', 'utils', localName),
    57:           path.join(spy, 'src', localName),
    58:           path.join(spy, 'utils', localName),
    59:         ];
    60:         for (const c of candidates) {
    61:           const m = tryRequireVariants(c);
    62:           if (m) return m;
    63:         }
    64:         // try requiring from spyder root via Node resolution (works if spyder is a package)
    65:         try {
    66:           const resolved = require.resolve(localName, { paths: [spy] });
    67:           const m = require(resolved);
    68:           if (m) return (m && m.default) || m;
    69:         } catch (e) { aliasWarn(aliasMatch, 'require.resolve from spyder failed', String(e)); }
    70:       }
    71:     }
    72:   } catch (e) {
    73:     aliasWarn(aliasMatch, 'resolvePaths check failed', String(e));
    74:   }
    75: 
    76:   // If name was an alias like @utils/foo, try local src/utils/<foo>
    77:   if (aliasMatch) {
    78:     try {
    79:       const local = tryRequireVariants(path.join(__dirname, localName));
    80:       if (local) return local;
    81:     } catch (e) { aliasWarn(aliasMatch, 'tryRequireVariants local failed', String(e)); }
    82:   }
    83: 
    84:   // fallback: if a relative path or module name was passed, try requiring directly
    85:   try {
    86:     // try direct file/module
    87:     const m1 = tryRequire(name);
    88:     if (m1) return (m1 && m1.default) || m1;
    89:   } catch (e) { aliasWarn(aliasMatch, 'tryRequire direct failed', String(e)); }
    90: 
    91:   // last resort: require by name (could be from node_modules)
    92:   try {
    93:     const m = require(name);
    94:     return (m && m.default) || m;
    95:   } catch (e) { aliasWarn(aliasMatch, 'final require failed', String(e)); }
    96: 
    97:   return undefined;
    98: }
    99: 
   100: export default { importUtil };


============================
FILE: src\utils\archive.ts
============================
============================
     1: import * as fs from 'fs';
     2: import * as path from 'path';
     3: 
     4: // Remove dated subfolders named YYYY-MM older than keepMonths
     5: export function cleanupDatedArchives(baseDir: string, keepMonths = 6) {
     6:   try {
     7:     if (!fs.existsSync(baseDir)) return;
     8:     const entries = fs.readdirSync(baseDir, { withFileTypes: true });
     9:     const now = new Date();
    10:     for (const e of entries) {
    11:       if (!e.isDirectory()) continue;
    12:       const name = e.name;
    13:       const m = /^([0-9]{4})-([0-9]{2})$/.exec(name);
    14:       if (!m) continue;
    15:       const year = Number(m[1]);
    16:       const month = Number(m[2]);
    17:       if (!year || !month) continue;
    18:       const dirDate = new Date(year, month - 1, 1);
    19:       const monthsDiff = (now.getFullYear() - dirDate.getFullYear()) * 12 + (now.getMonth() - dirDate.getMonth());
    20:       if (monthsDiff > keepMonths) {
    21:         // remove directory recursively
    22:         try {
    23:           fs.rmSync(path.join(baseDir, name), { recursive: true, force: true });
    24:         } catch (e) {
    25:           try {
    26:             // fallback for older Node: use custom rm
    27:             const rimraf = (p: string) => {
    28:               if (!fs.existsSync(p)) return;
    29:               for (const f of fs.readdirSync(p)) {
    30:                 const fp = path.join(p, f);
    31:                 const st = fs.statSync(fp);
    32:                 if (st.isDirectory()) rimraf(fp);
    33:                 else fs.unlinkSync(fp);
    34:               }
    35:               fs.rmdirSync(p);
    36:             };
    37:             rimraf(path.join(baseDir, name));
    38:           } catch (e2) {}
    39:         }
    40:       }
    41:     }
    42:   } catch (e) {
    43:     // ignore errors
    44:   }
    45: }
    46: 
    47: export default { cleanupDatedArchives };


============================
FILE: src\utils\auth.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0xC8C1C0
     2: 
     3: import { Request } from 'express';
     4: 
     5: export function isAdminAuthorized(req: Request): boolean {
     6:   const token = process.env.NPZ_ADMIN_TOKEN;
     7:   const user = process.env.NPZ_ADMIN_USER;
     8:   const pass = process.env.NPZ_ADMIN_PASS;
     9:   const allowIps = (process.env.NPZ_ADMIN_ALLOW_IPS || '').split(',').map(s => s.trim()).filter(Boolean);
    10: 
    11:   // IP allowlist
    12:   if (allowIps.length > 0) {
    13:     const ip = (req.headers['x-forwarded-for'] as string) || req.socket.remoteAddress || '';
    14:     for (const a of allowIps) {
    15:       if (ip && ip.includes(a)) return true;
    16:     }
    17:   }
    18: 
    19:   // x-admin-token header
    20:   const providedToken = (req.headers['x-admin-token'] as string) || (req.query && (req.query as any).token);
    21:   if (token && providedToken && providedToken === token) return true;
    22: 
    23:   // Authorization: Bearer <token>
    24:   const auth = req.headers['authorization'] as string | undefined;
    25:   if (auth && auth.startsWith('Bearer ')) {
    26:     const b = auth.slice(7).trim();
    27:     if (token && b === token) return true;
    28:   }
    29: 
    30:   // Basic auth
    31:   if (auth && auth.startsWith('Basic ')) {
    32:     try {
    33:       const payload = Buffer.from(auth.slice(6), 'base64').toString('utf8');
    34:       const [u, p] = payload.split(':');
    35:       if (user && pass && u === user && p === pass) return true;
    36:     } catch (e) {
    37:       // ignore
    38:     }
    39:   }
    40: 
    41:   return false;
    42: }
    43: 
    44: export default { isAdminAuthorized };


============================
FILE: src\utils\colors.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0xBAEB58
     2: 
     3: // Utilities for Nezlephant color palette and helpers
     4: // Base color shorthand '0c8' -> #00cc88
     5: 
     6: export const NEZLEPHANT = {
     7:   baseHex: '#00cc88', // shorthand 0c8
     8:   jokerHex: '#ff00cc', // Joker accent (magenta-pink)
     9:   neutralHex: '#0f1724', // dark neutral
    10:   whiteHex: '#ffffff',
    11:   blackHex: '#000000',
    12: };
    13: 
    14: function clamp(v: number, a = 0, b = 255) {
    15:   return Math.max(a, Math.min(b, Math.round(v)));
    16: }
    17: 
    18: export function hexToRgb(hex: string): { r: number; g: number; b: number } {
    19:   const h = hex.replace('#', '');
    20:   if (h.length === 3) {
    21:     const r = parseInt(h[0] + h[0], 16);
    22:     const g = parseInt(h[1] + h[1], 16);
    23:     const b = parseInt(h[2] + h[2], 16);
    24:     return { r, g, b };
    25:   }
    26:   const r = parseInt(h.slice(0, 2), 16);
    27:   const g = parseInt(h.slice(2, 4), 16);
    28:   const b = parseInt(h.slice(4, 6), 16);
    29:   return { r, g, b };
    30: }
    31: 
    32: export function rgbToHex(r: number, g: number, b: number): string {
    33:   return `#${[r, g, b].map((n) => clamp(n).toString(16).padStart(2, '0')).join('')}`;
    34: }
    35: 
    36: export function rgba(hex: string, alpha = 1): string {
    37:   const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);
    38:   return `rgba(${r}, ${g}, ${b}, ${alpha})`;
    39: }
    40: 
    41: export function lighten(hex: string, percent = 0.1): string {
    42:   const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);
    43:   const nr = clamp(r + (255 - r) * percent);
    44:   const ng = clamp(g + (255 - g) * percent);
    45:   const nb = clamp(b + (255 - b) * percent);
    46:   return rgbToHex(nr, ng, nb);
    47: }
    48: 
    49: export function darken(hex: string, percent = 0.1): string {
    50:   const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);
    51:   const nr = clamp(r * (1 - percent));
    52:   const ng = clamp(g * (1 - percent));
    53:   const nb = clamp(b * (1 - percent));
    54:   return rgbToHex(nr, ng, nb);
    55: }
    56: 
    57: export function relativeLuminance(hex: string): number {
    58:   const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);
    59:   const srgb = [r / 255, g / 255, b / 255].map((c) => (c <= 0.03928 ? c / 12.92 : Math.pow((c + 0.055) / 1.055, 2.4)));
    60:   return 0.2126 * srgb[0] + 0.7152 * srgb[1] + 0.0722 * srgb[2];
    61: }
    62: 
    63: export function contrastRatio(hexA: string, hexB: string): number {
    64:   const L1 = relativeLuminance(hexA) + 0.05;
    65:   const L2 = relativeLuminance(hexB) + 0.05;
    66:   return Math.max(L1, L2) / Math.min(L1, L2);
    67: }
    68: 
    69: export function readableTextColor(backgroundHex: string, prefer = NEZLEPHANT.whiteHex): string {
    70:   // return white or black depending on contrast
    71:   const whiteContrast = contrastRatio(backgroundHex, NEZLEPHANT.whiteHex);
    72:   const blackContrast = contrastRatio(backgroundHex, NEZLEPHANT.blackHex);
    73:   return whiteContrast >= blackContrast ? NEZLEPHANT.whiteHex : NEZLEPHANT.blackHex;
    74: }
    75: 
    76: export function cssVariables(prefix = 'nez') {
    77:   const base = NEZLEPHANT.baseHex;
    78:   const j = NEZLEPHANT.jokerHex;
    79:   return `:root {\n  --${prefix}-base: ${base};\n  --${prefix}-base-90: ${rgba(base, 0.9)};\n  --${prefix}-base-80: ${rgba(base, 0.8)};\n  --${prefix}-base-60: ${rgba(base, 0.6)};\n  --${prefix}-base-30: ${rgba(base, 0.3)};\n  --${prefix}-light: ${lighten(base, 0.18)};\n  --${prefix}-dark: ${darken(base, 0.18)};\n  --${prefix}-joker: ${j};\n  --${prefix}-bg: ${NEZLEPHANT.neutralHex};\n  --${prefix}-text: ${readableTextColor(NEZLEPHANT.neutralHex)};\n}`;
    80: }
    81: 
    82: // Terminal ANSI truecolor helpers (supports modern terminals)
    83: export function ansiFg(hex: string): string {
    84:   const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);
    85:   return `\x1b[38;2;${r};${g};${b}m`;
    86: }
    87: export function ansiBg(hex: string): string {
    88:   const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);
    89:   return `\x1b[48;2;${r};${g};${b}m`;
    90: }
    91: export const ansiReset = '\x1b[0m';
    92: 
    93: // Preset styled log helpers for Joker + Nezlephant
    94: export function styledLog(title: string, msg: string, opts?: { accent?: 'joker' | 'base' | 'neutral' }) {
    95:   const accent = opts?.accent === 'joker' ? NEZLEPHANT.jokerHex : opts?.accent === 'neutral' ? NEZLEPHANT.neutralHex : NEZLEPHANT.baseHex;
    96:   const bg = ansiBg(darken(accent, 0.15));
    97:   const fg = ansiFg(readableTextColor(darken(accent, 0.15)));
    98:   const accentFg = ansiFg(accent);
    99: 
   100:   // If output is not a TTY or NO_COLOR is set, avoid ANSI color sequences and print plain text
   101:   if (process.env.NO_COLOR || !(process.stdout && process.stdout.isTTY)) {
   102:     process.stdout.write(`[${title}] ${msg}\n`);
   103:     return;
   104:   }
   105: 
   106:   process.stdout.write(`${bg}${fg} [${title}] ${ansiReset} ${accentFg}${msg}${ansiReset}\n`);
   107: }
   108: 
   109: export default {
   110:   NEZLEPHANT,
   111:   hexToRgb,
   112:   rgbToHex,
   113:   rgba,
   114:   lighten,
   115:   darken,
   116:   readableTextColor,
   117:   cssVariables,
   118:   ansiFg,
   119:   ansiBg,
   120:   ansiReset,
   121:   styledLog,
   122: };


============================
FILE: src\utils\detect.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x29A73C
     2: 
     3: import { exec } from "child_process";
     4: import alias from './alias.js';
     5: const logger = alias.importUtil('@utils/logger') || alias.importUtil('./logger') || console;
     6: import { SERVICE_MAP } from "./paths.js";
     7: import { resolvePackagePath } from "./package.js";
     8: 
     9: export async function detectModules() {
    10:   const out: Record<string, any> = {};
    11:   for (const name of Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP))
    12:     out[name] = { running: false, installed: false, path: undefined, bin: undefined };
    13: 
    14:   for (const name of Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP)) {
    15:     try {
    16:       const pkgPath = resolvePackagePath(SERVICE_MAP[name].pkg);
    17:       if (pkgPath) {
    18:         out[name].installed = true;
    19:         out[name].path = pkgPath;
    20:         try {
    21:           const pkgJson = require(require('path').join(pkgPath, 'package.json'));
    22:           if (pkgJson && pkgJson.bin) {
    23:             out[name].bin = typeof pkgJson.bin === 'string' ? pkgJson.bin : Object.values(pkgJson.bin)[0];
    24:           }
    25:         } catch {}
    26:       }
    27:     } catch {}
    28:   }
    29: 
    30:   await new Promise<void>((resolve) => {
    31:     exec(process.platform === "win32" ? "tasklist" : "ps aux", (err, stdout) => {
    32:       if (err) {
    33:         logger.warn(`Failed to list processes: ${err.message}`);
    34:         return resolve();
    35:       }
    36:       const s = stdout.toString();
    37:       for (const name of Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP)) {
    38:         const regex = new RegExp(name, "i");
    39:         if (regex.test(s)) {
    40:           out[name].running = true;
    41:         }
    42:       }
    43:       resolve();
    44:     });
    45:   });
    46:   return out;
    47: }
    48: 
    49: export async function findAndKill() {
    50:   const names = Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP);
    51:   const killed: number[] = [];
    52:   for (const n of names) {
    53:     try {
    54:       if (process.platform === "win32") {
    55:         exec(`taskkill /IM ${n}.exe /F`, (err) => {});
    56:       } else {
    57:         exec(`pkill -f ${n}`, (err) => {});
    58:       }
    59:     } catch (err) {
    60:       // ignore
    61:     }
    62:   }
    63:   return killed;
    64: }


============================
FILE: src\utils\exec.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0xEB40C5
     2: 
     3: import { spawn } from "child_process";
     4: import { logger } from "./logger.js";
     5: import { unlinkSync, existsSync, rmSync } from "fs";
     6: import { execSync } from "child_process";
     7: 
     8: export function spawnSafe(command: string, args: string[] = [], opts: any = {}) {
     9:   try {
    10:     const proc = spawn(command, args, { stdio: "inherit", shell: true, ...opts });
    11:     proc.on("error", (err) => logger.error(`Process error: ${err.message}`));
    12:     return proc;
    13:   } catch (err: any) {
    14:     logger.error(`Failed to spawn ${command}: ${err.message}`);
    15:     throw err;
    16:   }
    17: }
    18: 
    19: export function rimrafSync(path: string) {
    20:   if (!path) return;
    21:   if (!existsSync(path)) return;
    22:   try {
    23:     rmSync(path, { recursive: true, force: true });
    24:   } catch (err) {
    25:     // fallback
    26:     try {
    27:       unlinkSync(path);
    28:     } catch {}
    29:   }
    30: }
    31: 
    32: export function isPackageInstalled(pkgName: string) {
    33:   try {
    34:     execSync(`npm ls ${pkgName} --depth=0`, { stdio: "ignore" });
    35:     return true;
    36:   } catch {
    37:     return false;
    38:   }
    39: }
    40: 
    41: export function ensurePackageInstalled(pkgName: string) {
    42:   if (isPackageInstalled(pkgName)) return true;
    43:   // In CI or when explicitly requested, avoid attempting global npm installs
    44:   const skipInstalls = process.env.QFLUSH_SKIP_GLOBAL_INSTALLS === '1' || process.env.CI === 'true' || process.env.GITHUB_ACTIONS === 'true';
    45:   if (skipInstalls) {
    46:     logger.info(`Skipping global install of ${pkgName} (CI or skip flag set)`);
    47:     return false;
    48:   }
    49:   logger.info(`Installing missing package ${pkgName}...`);
    50:   try {
    51:     execSync(`npm install -g ${pkgName}`, { stdio: "inherit" });
    52:     return true;
    53:   } catch (err: any) {
    54:     logger.warn(`Failed to install ${pkgName}: ${err.message}`);
    55:     return false;
    56:   }
    57: }
    58: 
    59: // Helpers for CLI pre-launch checks
    60: export function pathExists(pathStr: string) {
    61:   return !!pathStr && existsSync(pathStr);
    62: }
    63: 
    64: export function rebuildInstructionsFor(pkgPath?: string) {
    65:   if (!pkgPath) return `Rebuild the package (cd <pkg> && npm install && npm run build && npm install -g .)`;
    66:   return `Rebuild the package:\n  cd ${pkgPath}\n  npm install\n  npm run build\n  npm install -g .`;
    67: }


============================
FILE: src\utils\fetch.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0xF66B59
     2: 
     3: // small wrapper around available fetch implementations
     4: // tries global fetch, then undici, otherwise falls back to node's http(s) for simple requests
     5: import * as http from 'http';
     6: import * as https from 'https';
     7: 
     8: export type FetchInit = { method?: string; headers?: Record<string,string>; body?: any };
     9: 
    10: async function simpleFetch(url: string, init: FetchInit = {}) {
    11:   return new Promise<any>((resolve, reject) => {
    12:     try {
    13:       const u = new URL(url);
    14:       const isHttps = u.protocol === 'https:';
    15:       const lib: any = isHttps ? https : http;
    16:       const opts: any = { method: init.method || 'GET', headers: init.headers || {}, hostname: u.hostname, port: u.port || (isHttps ? 443 : 80), path: u.pathname + (u.search || '') };
    17:       const req = lib.request(opts, (res: any) => {
    18:         const bufs: any[] = [];
    19:         res.on('data', (d: any) => bufs.push(d));
    20:         res.on('end', () => {
    21:           const txt = Buffer.concat(bufs).toString('utf8');
    22:           resolve({ ok: res.statusCode >= 200 && res.statusCode < 400, status: res.statusCode, statusText: res.statusMessage, text: () => Promise.resolve(txt), json: () => Promise.resolve(JSON.parse(txt)), headers: res.headers });
    23:         });
    24:       });
    25:       req.on('error', (e: any) => reject(e));
    26:       if (init.body) req.write(typeof init.body === 'string' ? init.body : JSON.stringify(init.body));
    27:       req.end();
    28:     } catch (e) { reject(e); }
    29:   });
    30: }
    31: 
    32: export async function fetchWrapper(url: string, init?: FetchInit) {
    33:   if (typeof (globalThis as any).fetch === 'function') return (globalThis as any).fetch(url, init as any);
    34:   try {
    35:     // try undici
    36:      
    37:     const undici = require('undici');
    38:     if (undici && typeof undici.fetch === 'function') return undici.fetch(url, init as any);
    39:   } catch (e) {
    40:     // ignore
    41:   }
    42:   return simpleFetch(url, init || {});
    43: }
    44: 
    45: export default fetchWrapper;


============================
FILE: src\utils\fileChecksum.ts
============================
============================
     1: import * as fs from 'fs';
     2: import normalize from './normalize.js';
     3: import * as os from 'os';
     4: import * as path from 'path';
     5: 
     6: // Note: keep local xor implementation to avoid circular import issues
     7: export function xorChecksum(buffer: Uint8Array | Buffer): number {
     8:   let x = 0;
     9:   for (let i = 0; i < buffer.length; i++) x ^= buffer[i];
    10:   return x & 0xff;
    11: }
    12: 
    13: export function checksumBufferIgnoringRomeTag(buf: Buffer | Uint8Array): number {
    14:   // normalize by removing ROME-TAG lines from UTF-8 interpretation
    15:   const text = Buffer.isBuffer(buf) ? buf.toString('utf8') : Buffer.from(buf).toString('utf8');
    16:   const cleaned = normalize.stripRomeTagLines(text);
    17:   const b = Buffer.from(cleaned, 'utf8');
    18:   return xorChecksum(b);
    19: }
    20: 
    21: export function checksumFileIgnoringRomeTag(filePath: string): number {
    22:   const raw = fs.readFileSync(filePath);
    23:   return checksumBufferIgnoringRomeTag(raw);
    24: }
    25: 
    26: // Flexible checksum: try multiple decoding strategies
    27: export async function flexibleChecksumBuffer(buf: Buffer | Uint8Array): Promise<number> {
    28:   const buffer = Buffer.isBuffer(buf) ? buf : Buffer.from(buf);
    29: 
    30:   // 1) PNG detection (PNG file signature: 89 50 4E 47 0D 0A 1A 0A)
    31:   try {
    32:     if (buffer.length >= 8 && buffer[0] === 0x89 && buffer[1] === 0x50 && buffer[2] === 0x4E && buffer[3] === 0x47) {
    33:       // write to temp file and try to decode via existing pngCodec
    34:       try {
    35:         const tmp = path.join(os.tmpdir(), `qflush_cxpk_${Date.now()}_${Math.random().toString(36).slice(2,8)}.png`);
    36:         fs.writeFileSync(tmp, buffer);
    37:         try {
    38:           // dynamic import to avoid circular deps
    39:           const pngCodec = require('../cortex/pngCodec');
    40:           if (pngCodec && typeof pngCodec.decodeCortexPacketFromPng === 'function') {
    41:             const pkt = await pngCodec.decodeCortexPacketFromPng(tmp);
    42:             try { fs.unlinkSync(tmp); } catch (e) { console.warn('[fileChecksum] unlink tmp failed', String(e)); }
    43:             // use payload or whole packet JSON
    44:             const target = pkt && pkt.payload ? pkt.payload : pkt;
    45:             const json = JSON.stringify(target);
    46:             return xorChecksum(Buffer.from(json, 'utf8'));
    47:           }
    48:         } catch (e) {
    49:           try { fs.unlinkSync(tmp); } catch (e2) { console.warn('[fileChecksum] unlink tmp failed', String(e2)); }
    50:           console.warn('[fileChecksum] png decode attempt failed', String(e));
    51:         }
    52:       } catch (e) {
    53:         // ignore and fallback, but record for diagnostics
    54:         console.warn('[fileChecksum] png detection fallback', String(e));
    55:       }
    56:     }
    57:   } catch (e) { console.warn('[fileChecksum] png detection outer error', String(e)); }
    58: 
    59:   // 2) Cortex binary packet (try parse via src/cortex/codec)
    60:   try {
    61:     const codec = require('../cortex/codec');
    62:     if (codec && typeof codec.decodeCortexPacket === 'function') {
    63:       try {
    64:         const parsed = codec.decodeCortexPacket(buffer);
    65:         if (parsed && parsed.payload) {
    66:           const json = typeof parsed.payload === 'string' ? parsed.payload : JSON.stringify(parsed.payload);
    67:           return xorChecksum(Buffer.from(json, 'utf8'));
    68:         }
    69:       } catch (e) {
    70:         // not a cortex binary packet, continue
    71:         console.warn('[fileChecksum] codec decode failed', String(e));
    72:       }
    73:     }
    74:   } catch (e) { console.warn('[fileChecksum] cortex codec require failed', String(e)); }
    75: 
    76:   // 3) fallback to text normalization checksum
    77:   try {
    78:     return checksumBufferIgnoringRomeTag(buffer);
    79:   } catch (e) {
    80:     // last resort: plain xor on raw bytes
    81:     return xorChecksum(buffer);
    82:   }
    83: }
    84: 
    85: export async function flexibleChecksumFile(filePath: string): Promise<number> {
    86:   const raw = fs.readFileSync(filePath);
    87:   return flexibleChecksumBuffer(raw);
    88: }
    89: 
    90: export default { xorChecksum, checksumBufferIgnoringRomeTag, checksumFileIgnoringRomeTag, flexibleChecksumBuffer, flexibleChecksumFile };


============================
FILE: src\utils\gumroad-license.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0xC4BE64
     2: 
     3: import * as fs from 'fs';
     4: import * as path from 'path';
     5: 
     6: async function resolveFetch() {
     7:   if (typeof (globalThis as any).fetch === 'function') return (globalThis as any).fetch;
     8:   try {
     9:     const m = await import('node-fetch');
    10:     return (m && (m as any).default) || m;
    11:   } catch (e) {
    12:     try {
    13:       // eslint-disable-next-line @typescript-eslint/no-var-requires
    14:       const undici = require('undici');
    15:       if (undici && typeof undici.fetch === 'function') return undici.fetch;
    16:     } catch (_) {}
    17:   }
    18:   throw new Error('No fetch implementation available (install node-fetch or undici)');
    19: }
    20: 
    21: const DEFAULT_STORAGE = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'license.json');
    22: 
    23: export type LicenseRecord = {
    24:   key: string;
    25:   product_id: string;
    26:   createdAt: number;
    27:   expiresAt?: number | null;
    28:   recurring?: boolean;
    29:   lastVerified?: number;
    30:   metadata?: Record<string, any>;
    31: };
    32: 
    33: function getStoragePath() {
    34:   return process.env.GUMROAD_LICENSE_PATH || DEFAULT_STORAGE;
    35: }
    36: 
    37: function ensureDir(storagePath: string) {
    38:   const dir = path.dirname(storagePath);
    39:   if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
    40: }
    41: 
    42: export function saveLicense(rec: LicenseRecord) {
    43:   const storage = getStoragePath();
    44:   ensureDir(storage);
    45:   fs.writeFileSync(storage, JSON.stringify(rec, null, 2), 'utf8');
    46: }
    47: 
    48: export function loadLicense(): LicenseRecord | null {
    49:   try {
    50:     const storage = getStoragePath();
    51:     if (!fs.existsSync(storage)) return null;
    52:     const raw = fs.readFileSync(storage, 'utf8');
    53:     return JSON.parse(raw) as LicenseRecord;
    54:   } catch (e) {
    55:     return null;
    56:   }
    57: }
    58: 
    59: export function readTokenFromFile(): string | null {
    60:   const p = process.env.GUMROAD_TOKEN_FILE;
    61:   if (!p) return null;
    62:   try {
    63:     if (!fs.existsSync(p)) return null;
    64:     return fs.readFileSync(p, 'utf8').trim();
    65:   } catch (e) {
    66:     return null;
    67:   }
    68: }
    69: 
    70: export async function verifyWithGumroad(product_id: string, licenseKey: string, token: string) {
    71:   const url = 'https://api.gumroad.com/v2/licenses/verify';
    72:   const body = { product_id, license_key: licenseKey };
    73:   const fetch = await resolveFetch();
    74:   const res = await fetch(url, {
    75:     method: 'POST',
    76:     headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json', Authorization: `Bearer ${token}` },
    77:     body: JSON.stringify(body),
    78:   });
    79:   if (!res.ok) throw new Error(`Gumroad API returned ${res.status}`);
    80:   const json: any = await res.json();
    81:   return json;
    82: }
    83: 
    84: export function isLicenseValid(rec: LicenseRecord | null) {
    85:   if (!rec) return false;
    86:   if (rec.expiresAt && Date.now() > rec.expiresAt) return false;
    87:   return true;
    88: }
    89: 
    90: export async function activateLicense(product_id: string, licenseKey: string, token: string) {
    91:   const data: any = await verifyWithGumroad(product_id, licenseKey, token);
    92:   if (data && data.success) {
    93:     const purchase = (data as any).purchase || {};
    94:     const now = Date.now();
    95:     const recurring = !!purchase.subscription_ended_at || !!purchase.subscription_cancelled_at ? false : !!purchase.subscription_id;
    96:     const expiresAt = recurring ? null : now + 365 * 24 * 3600 * 1000; // 1 year default
    97:     const rec = {
    98:       key: licenseKey,
    99:       product_id,
   100:       createdAt: now,
   101:       expiresAt,
   102:       recurring,
   103:       lastVerified: now,
   104:       metadata: purchase,
   105:     };
   106:     saveLicense(rec as LicenseRecord);
   107:     return rec;
   108:   }
   109:   throw new Error('License verification failed');
   110: }
   111: 
   112: export function clearLicense() {
   113:   try {
   114:     const storage = getStoragePath();
   115:     if (fs.existsSync(storage)) fs.unlinkSync(storage);
   116:   } catch (e) {}
   117: }
   118: 
   119: export default { saveLicense, loadLicense, verifyWithGumroad, activateLicense, isLicenseValid, clearLicense, readTokenFromFile };


============================
FILE: src\utils\health.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x1CA919
     2: 
     3: import http from 'http';
     4: import net from 'net';
     5: import { logger } from './logger.js';
     6: 
     7: export async function httpProbe(url: string, timeout = 2000): Promise<boolean> {
     8:   return new Promise((resolve) => {
     9:     const req = http.get(url, (res) => {
    10:       res.resume();
    11:       resolve(Boolean(res.statusCode && res.statusCode < 400));
    12:     });
    13:     req.on('error', () => resolve(false));
    14:     req.setTimeout(timeout, () => {
    15:       req.destroy();
    16:       resolve(false);
    17:     });
    18:   });
    19: }
    20: 
    21: export async function tcpProbe(host: string, port: number, timeout = 2000): Promise<boolean> {
    22:   return new Promise((resolve) => {
    23:     const s = new net.Socket();
    24:     let done = false;
    25:     s.setTimeout(timeout);
    26:     s.on('connect', () => {
    27:       done = true;
    28:       s.destroy();
    29:       resolve(true);
    30:     });
    31:     s.on('error', () => { if (!done) { done = true; resolve(false); } });
    32:     s.on('timeout', () => { if (!done) { done = true; s.destroy(); resolve(false); } });
    33:     s.connect(port, host);
    34:   });
    35: }
    36: 
    37: export async function waitForService(urlOrHost: string, port?: number, timeout = 5000) {
    38:   const start = Date.now();
    39:   while (Date.now() - start < timeout) {
    40:     let ok = false;
    41:     if (typeof port === 'number') {
    42:       ok = await tcpProbe(urlOrHost, port, 1000);
    43:     } else if (urlOrHost.startsWith('http')) {
    44:       ok = await httpProbe(urlOrHost, 1000);
    45:     }
    46:     if (ok) return true;
    47:     await new Promise((r) => setTimeout(r, 500));
    48:   }
    49:   return false;
    50: }

FILE: src\utils\license.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x3C04E4
     2: 
     3: import * as fs from 'fs';
     4: import * as path from 'path';
     5: // do not statically import node-fetch (may be ESM); use dynamic import when needed
     6: 
     7: const STORE = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'license.json');
     8: 
     9: export type LicenseRecord = {
    10:   key: string;
    11:   product_id?: string;
    12:   valid?: boolean;
    13:   expires_at?: string | null;
    14:   verifiedAt?: number;
    15: };
    16: 
    17: function ensureDir() {
    18:   const dir = path.dirname(STORE);
    19:   if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
    20: }
    21: 
    22: export function readLicense(): LicenseRecord | null {
    23:   try {
    24:     if (!fs.existsSync(STORE)) return null;
    25:     const raw = fs.readFileSync(STORE, 'utf8');
    26:     return JSON.parse(raw) as LicenseRecord;
    27:   } catch (e) {
    28:     return null;
    29:   }
    30: }
    31: 
    32: export function saveLicense(rec: LicenseRecord) {
    33:   try {
    34:     ensureDir();
    35:     fs.writeFileSync(STORE, JSON.stringify(rec, null, 2), 'utf8');
    36:     return true;
    37:   } catch (e) {
    38:     return false;
    39:   }
    40: }
    41: 
    42: async function verifyWithGumroad(key: string, productId?: string) {
    43:   const token = process.env.GUMROAD_TOKEN;
    44:   if (!token) throw new Error('GUMROAD_TOKEN not configured');
    45:   const url = `https://api.gumroad.com/v2/licenses/verify`;
    46:   const body = new URLSearchParams();
    47:   body.append('product_permalink', productId || '');
    48:   body.append('license_key', key);
    49: 
    50:   // Dynamic import to support both CJS and ESM environments
    51:   let fetchFn: any = undefined;
    52:   try {
    53:     const m = await import('node-fetch');
    54:     fetchFn = (m && (m as any).default) || m;
    55:   } catch (e) {
    56:     // node-fetch not available or cannot be imported; try global fetch / undici fallback handled by caller
    57:     try {
    58:       // try undici dynamic require as fallback
    59:       // eslint-disable-next-line @typescript-eslint/no-var-requires
    60:       const undici = require('undici');
    61:       if (undici && typeof undici.fetch === 'function') fetchFn = undici.fetch;
    62:     } catch (_) {
    63:       // ignore
    64:     }
    65:   }
    66: 
    67:   if (!fetchFn && typeof (globalThis as any).fetch === 'function') fetchFn = (globalThis as any).fetch;
    68:   if (!fetchFn) throw new Error('No fetch implementation available (install node-fetch or undici)');
    69: 
    70:   const res = await fetchFn(url, { method: 'POST', body, headers: { Authorization: `Bearer ${token}` } });
    71:   const json: any = await res.json();
    72:   return json;
    73: }
    74: 
    75: export async function activateLicense(key: string, productId?: string) {
    76:   const resp: any = await verifyWithGumroad(key, productId);
    77:   if (resp && (resp as any).success) {
    78:     const purchase = (resp as any).purchase || {};
    79:     const lic = { key, product_id: purchase.product_id || productId, valid: true, expires_at: purchase ? purchase.license_expires_at : null, verifiedAt: Date.now() } as LicenseRecord;
    80:     saveLicense(lic);
    81:     return { ok: true, license: lic, raw: resp };
    82:   }
    83:   // failure
    84:   const lic = { key, product_id: productId, valid: false, verifiedAt: Date.now() } as LicenseRecord;
    85:   saveLicense(lic);
    86:   return { ok: false, error: resp };
    87: }
    88: 
    89: export default { readLicense, saveLicense, activateLicense };
