FILE: src\utils\logger.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x0E71A8
     2: 
     3: import colors from './colors.js';
     4: import * as fs from 'fs';
     5: import * as path from 'path';
     6: 
     7: // Ensure common .qflush logs directory and files exist to avoid ENOENT in tests
     8: try {
     9:   const base = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush');
    10:   const logs = path.join(base, 'logs');
    11:   if (!fs.existsSync(base)) fs.mkdirSync(base, { recursive: true });
    12:   if (!fs.existsSync(logs)) fs.mkdirSync(logs, { recursive: true });
    13:   const common = ['spyder.log', 'qflushd.out', 'qflushd.err'];
    14:   for (const f of common) {
    15:     const p = path.join(logs, f);
    16:     try { if (!fs.existsSync(p)) fs.writeFileSync(p, '', 'utf8'); } catch (_) { /* ignore */ }
    17:   }
    18: } catch (_) {
    19:   // swallow - logger must not throw
    20: }
    21: 
    22: function appendSafe(filename: string, msg: string) {
    23:   try {
    24:     const logsDir = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'logs');
    25:     if (!fs.existsSync(logsDir)) fs.mkdirSync(logsDir, { recursive: true });
    26:     const p = path.join(logsDir, filename);
    27:     try {
    28:       fs.appendFileSync(p, msg + '\n', 'utf8');
    29:     } catch (e) {
    30:       // If append fails (race/ENOENT), try to create the file and retry once
    31:       try {
    32:         try { fs.writeFileSync(p, '', 'utf8'); } catch (_) {}
    33:         try { fs.appendFileSync(p, msg + '\n', 'utf8'); } catch (_) {}
    34:       } catch (e2) {
    35:         // silent fail to avoid throwing during tests
    36:       }
    37:     }
    38:   } catch (e) {
    39:     // ignore
    40:   }
    41: }
    42: 
    43: export const logger = {
    44:   info: (msg: string) => {
    45:     console.log(`\x1b[36m[QFLUSH]\x1b[0m ${msg}`);
    46:     appendSafe('qflushd.out', `[INFO] ${msg}`);
    47:     appendSafe('spyder.log', `[INFO] ${msg}`);
    48:   },
    49:   warn: (msg: string) => {
    50:     console.log(`\x1b[33m[QFLUSH]\x1b[0m ${msg}`);
    51:     appendSafe('qflushd.err', `[WARN] ${msg}`);
    52:     appendSafe('spyder.log', `[WARN] ${msg}`);
    53:   },
    54:   error: (msg: string) => {
    55:     console.error(`\x1b[31m[QFLUSH]\x1b[0m ${msg}`);
    56:     appendSafe('qflushd.err', `[ERROR] ${msg}`);
    57:     appendSafe('spyder.log', `[ERROR] ${msg}`);
    58:   },
    59:   success: (msg: string) => {
    60:     console.log(`\x1b[32m[QFLUSH]\x1b[0m ${msg}`);
    61:     appendSafe('qflushd.out', `[SUCCESS] ${msg}`);
    62:     appendSafe('spyder.log', `[SUCCESS] ${msg}`);
    63:   },
    64:   joker: (title: string, msg: string) => colors.styledLog(title, msg, { accent: 'joker' }),
    65:   nez: (title: string, msg: string) => colors.styledLog(title, msg, { accent: 'base' }),
    66:   neutral: (title: string, msg: string) => colors.styledLog(title, msg, { accent: 'neutral' }),
    67: };
    68: 
    69: export function log(...args: any[]) { console.log('[QFLUSH]', ...args); }
    70: export function info(...args: any[]) { console.info('[QFLUSH]', ...args); }
    71: export function warn(...args: any[]) { console.warn('[QFLUSH]', ...args); }
    72: export function error(...args: any[]) { console.error('[QFLUSH]', ...args); }
    73: export function success(...args: any[]) { console.log('[QFLUSH][OK]', ...args); }
    74: export function nez(tag: string, msg: string) { console.log(`[${tag}]`, msg); }
    75: export function joker(tag: string, msg: string) { console.log(`[JOKER] ${tag}:`, msg); }
    76: 
    77: export default { log, info, warn, error, success, nez, joker };


============================
FILE: src\utils\normalize.ts
============================
============================
     1: import * as fs from 'fs';
     2: 
     3: export function stripRomeTagLines(textOrBuffer: string | Buffer): string {
     4:   const txt = Buffer.isBuffer(textOrBuffer) ? textOrBuffer.toString('utf8') : textOrBuffer;
     5:   const lines = txt.split(/\r?\n/);
     6:   const out = lines.filter(l => !/^\s*\/\/\s*ROME-TAG:/i.test(l));
     7:   return out.join('\n');
     8: }
     9: 
    10: export function stripRomeTagFromFile(filePath: string): string {
    11:   const raw = fs.readFileSync(filePath, 'utf8');
    12:   return stripRomeTagLines(raw);
    13: }
    14: 
    15: export default { stripRomeTagLines, stripRomeTagFromFile };


============================
FILE: src\utils\NPZ_README.md
============================
============================
     1: # NPZ Joker (Gotham Customs) v2.0
     2: 
     3: NPZ ("Joker") is the internal resolver/router used by qflush to start modules and proxy requests across multiple lanes (primary/backup). It provides:
     4: 
     5: - Gate-based resolver for binaries/modules: GREEN (local bin), YELLOW (module), DLX (npx), FAIL
     6: - HTTP proxy router with T0/T1/T2 flow: try primary, fallback, then replay primary with extra header
     7: - Douane (customs) checks before starting modules (env, files, ports)
     8: - Request tracking with `npz_id` and optional Redis store
     9: - Circuit breaker per-host per-lane and adaptive preferred lane ordering
    10: - Prometheus metrics and an admin API
    11: 
    12: ## v2.0 changes
    13: 
    14: - Namespaced keys and metrics via `NPZ_NAMESPACE` to avoid cross-app conflicts
    15: - Redis-backed store optional via `REDIS_URL`
    16: - Prometheus metrics and `/metrics` endpoint
    17: - Admin endpoints protected by `NPZ_ADMIN_TOKEN`
    18: - NPZ integrated as primary resolver for `qflush start` and as middleware in the daemon
    19: 
    20: Usage
    21: 
    22: - Middleware: `npzMiddleware()` to proxy requests via `/proxy` route
    23: - Admin: `/npz/inspect/:id`, `/npz/lanes`, `/npz/preferred/:host`, `/npz/circuit/:host` (protected by `NPZ_ADMIN_TOKEN` header or `?token=`)
    24: - Metrics: `/metrics` endpoint
    25: 
    26: Environment
    27: 
    28: - `REDIS_URL` to enable Redis-backed store
    29: - `NPZ_ADMIN_TOKEN` to protect admin endpoints
    30: - `qflushD_PORT` to set the daemon port
    31: 
    32: Files of interest
    33: 
    34: - `src/utils/npz.ts` - Joker resolver
    35: - `src/utils/npz-router.ts` - HTTP router with lanes and circuit breaker
    36: - `src/utils/npz-customs.ts` - customs scanners
    37: - `src/utils/npz-middleware.ts` - Express middleware for proxying and tracking
    38: - `src/utils/npz-store.ts` - unified store (file or redis)
    39: - `src/utils/npz-store-redis.ts` - Redis-backed store
    40: - `src/utils/npz-metrics.ts` - /metrics middleware
    41: - `src/utils/npz-admin.ts` - admin endpoints
    42: 
    43: Example
    44: 
    45: Start the daemon:
    46: 
    47: ```
    48: REDIS_URL=redis://127.0.0.1:6379 NPZ_ADMIN_TOKEN=secret node dist/daemon/qflushd.js
    49: ```
    50: 
    51: Proxy a request (example):
    52: 
    53: ```
    54: curl -v http://localhost:4500/proxy/api/health
    55: 
    56: 
    57: 


============================
FILE: src\utils\npz-admin.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x332555
     2: 
     3: import express from 'express';
     4: import npzStore from './npz-store.js';
     5: import npzRouter from './npz-router.js';
     6: import engine from './npz-engine.js';
     7: import { stringify } from 'csv-stringify/sync';
     8: import { isAdminAuthorized } from './auth.js';
     9: 
    10: const router = express.Router();
    11: 
    12: function requireToken(req: any, res: any, next: any) {
    13:   if (!isAdminAuthorized(req)) return res.status(401).json({ error: 'unauthorized' });
    14:   next();
    15: }
    16: 
    17: router.use('/npz', requireToken);
    18: 
    19: router.get('/npz/inspect/:id', async (req: any, res: any) => {
    20:   const r = await npzStore.getRequestRecord(req.params.id);
    21:   res.json(r || { error: 'not found' });
    22: });
    23: 
    24: router.get('/npz/lanes', (req: any, res: any) => {
    25:   res.json(npzRouter.DEFAULT_LANES);
    26: });
    27: 
    28: router.get('/npz/preferred/:host', (req: any, res: any) => {
    29:   const host = req.params.host;
    30:   const pref = npzRouter.getPreferredLane(host);
    31:   res.json({ host, preferred: pref });
    32: });
    33: 
    34: router.get('/npz/circuit/:host', (req: any, res: any) => {
    35:   const host = req.params.host;
    36:   const state = npzRouter.getCircuitState(host);
    37:   res.json(state);
    38: });
    39: 
    40: // Admin scores endpoint
    41: router.get('/npz/scores', (req: any, res: any) => {
    42:   try {
    43:     const store = engine.getStore();
    44:     const items = Object.values(store).map((r: any) => ({ laneId: r.laneId, score: r.score, lastSuccess: r.lastSuccess, lastFailure: r.lastFailure }));
    45:     items.sort((a: any, b: any) => a.score - b.score);
    46:     res.json(items);
    47:   } catch (err) {
    48:     res.status(500).json({ error: String(err) });
    49:   }
    50: });
    51: 
    52: router.post('/npz/scores/reset', (req: any, res: any) => {
    53:   try {
    54:     engine.resetScores();
    55:     res.json({ ok: true });
    56:   } catch (err) {
    57:     res.status(500).json({ error: String(err) });
    58:   }
    59: });
    60: 
    61: router.get('/npz/scores.csv', (req: any, res: any) => {
    62:   try {
    63:     const store = engine.getStore();
    64:     const items = Object.values(store).map((r: any) => ({ laneId: r.laneId, score: r.score, lastSuccess: r.lastSuccess, lastFailure: r.lastFailure }));
    65:     items.sort((a: any, b: any) => a.score - b.score);
    66:     const csv = stringify(items, { header: true });
    67:     res.set('Content-Type', 'text/csv');
    68:     res.send(csv);
    69:   } catch (err) {
    70:     res.status(500).json({ error: String(err) });
    71:   }
    72: });
    73: 
    74: export default router;


============================
FILE: src\utils\npz-config.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x925520
     2: 
     3: import crypto from 'crypto';
     4: 
     5: export function getNpzNamespace(): string {
     6:   // allow override
     7:   const env = process.env.NPZ_NAMESPACE;
     8:   if (env && env.trim().length > 0) return env.trim();
     9: 
    10:   const seed = 'npz';
    11:   try {
    12:     // try to require the nezlephant package directly to avoid loading the whole lib index
    13:     // which may pull packages that are not compatible in the runner.
    14:      
    15:     const nez = require('@funeste38/nezlephant');
    16:     if (nez) {
    17:       if (typeof nez.encode === 'function') {
    18:         const out = nez.encode(seed);
    19:         if (typeof out === 'string' && out.length >= 8) return out.slice(0, 8);
    20:       }
    21:       if (typeof nez.hash === 'function') {
    22:         const h = nez.hash(seed);
    23:         if (typeof h === 'string' && h.length >= 8) return h.slice(0, 8);
    24:       }
    25:     }
    26:   } catch (e) {
    27:     // ignore and fallback
    28:   }
    29: 
    30:   // fallback: sha256(seed) and take first 4 bytes (8 hex chars)
    31:   const hash = crypto.createHash('sha256').update(seed).digest('hex').slice(0, 8);
    32:   return hash;
    33: }
    34: 
    35: export default { getNpzNamespace };


============================
FILE: src\utils\npz-customs.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x91FBE1
     2: 
     3: import * as fs from 'fs';
     4: import * as path from 'path';
     5: import * as net from 'net';
     6: import alias from './alias.js';
     7: const logger = alias.importUtil('@utils/logger') || alias.importUtil('./logger') || console;
     8: 
     9: export type ModuleDescriptor = {
    10:   name: string;
    11:   pkg?: string;
    12:   cwd: string;
    13:   requiredEnv?: string[];
    14:   requiredFiles?: string[];
    15:   requiredPorts?: number[];
    16: };
    17: 
    18: export type CustomsIssue = {
    19:   level: 'info' | 'warning' | 'block';
    20:   code: string;
    21:   message: string;
    22: };
    23: 
    24: export type CustomsReport = {
    25:   module: string;
    26:   issues: CustomsIssue[];
    27: };
    28: 
    29: export type CustomsScanner = (mod: ModuleDescriptor) => Promise<CustomsIssue[]>;
    30: 
    31: export const MODULES: ModuleDescriptor[] = [
    32:   { name: 'freeland', pkg: '@funeste38/freeland', cwd: process.cwd(), requiredEnv: ['FREELAND_DB_URL'], requiredFiles: ['freeland.config.json'] },
    33:   { name: 'bat', pkg: '@funeste38/bat', cwd: process.cwd(), requiredEnv: ['BAT_TOKEN'], requiredFiles: ['bat.config.json'] },
    34: ];
    35: 
    36: export const envScanner: CustomsScanner = async (mod) => {
    37:   const issues: CustomsIssue[] = [];
    38:   const required = mod.requiredEnv || [];
    39:   for (const key of required) {
    40:     if (!process.env[key]) {
    41:       issues.push({ level: 'block', code: 'MISSING_ENV', message: `Missing env var: ${key}` });
    42:     }
    43:   }
    44:   return issues;
    45: };
    46: 
    47: export const fileScanner: CustomsScanner = async (mod) => {
    48:   const issues: CustomsIssue[] = [];
    49:   const required = mod.requiredFiles || [];
    50:   for (const rel of required) {
    51:     const full = path.join(mod.cwd, rel);
    52:     if (!fs.existsSync(full)) {
    53:       issues.push({ level: 'warning', code: 'MISSING_FILE', message: `Config file not found: ${rel}` });
    54:     }
    55:   }
    56:   return issues;
    57: };
    58: 
    59: function checkPortInUse(port: number): Promise<boolean> {
    60:   return new Promise((resolve) => {
    61:     const server = net.createServer();
    62:     server.once('error', () => resolve(true));
    63:     server.once('listening', () => {
    64:       server.close(() => resolve(false));
    65:     });
    66:     server.listen(port, '127.0.0.1');
    67:   });
    68: }
    69: 
    70: export const portScanner: CustomsScanner = async (mod) => {
    71:   const issues: CustomsIssue[] = [];
    72:   const ports = mod.requiredPorts || [];
    73:   for (const port of ports) {
    74:     if (await checkPortInUse(port)) {
    75:       issues.push({ level: 'block', code: 'PORT_IN_USE', message: `Port ${port} already in use` });
    76:     }
    77:   }
    78:   return issues;
    79: };
    80: 
    81: const SCANNERS: CustomsScanner[] = [envScanner, fileScanner, portScanner];
    82: 
    83: export async function runCustomsCheck(mod: ModuleDescriptor): Promise<CustomsReport> {
    84:   const issues: CustomsIssue[] = [];
    85:   for (const scanner of SCANNERS) {
    86:     try {
    87:       const res = await scanner(mod);
    88:       if (res && res.length) issues.push(...res);
    89:     } catch (err) {
    90:       logger.warn(`customs: scanner error for ${mod.name} ${err}`);
    91:     }
    92:   }
    93: 
    94:   if (issues.length === 0) {
    95:     logger.info(`[NPZ][CUSTOMS][PASS] ${mod.name} - all clear`);
    96:   } else {
    97:     for (const issue of issues) {
    98:       const tag = issue.level.toUpperCase();
    99:       if (issue.level === 'block') logger.warn(`[NPZ][CUSTOMS][${tag}] ${mod.name} - ${issue.message}`);
   100:       else logger.info(`[NPZ][CUSTOMS][${tag}] ${mod.name} - ${issue.message}`);
   101:     }
   102:   }
   103: 
   104:   return { module: mod.name, issues };
   105: }
   106: 
   107: export function hasBlockingIssues(report: CustomsReport): boolean {
   108:   return report.issues.some((i) => i.level === 'block');
   109: }
   110: 
   111: export default {
   112:   MODULES,
   113:   runCustomsCheck,
   114:   hasBlockingIssues,
   115: };


============================
FILE: src\utils\npz-engine.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x043BA9
     2: 
     3: import { getNpzNamespace } from './npz-config.js';
     4: import fs from 'fs';
     5: import path from 'path';
     6: import logger from './logger.js';
     7: import { Lane } from './npz-router.js';
     8: 
     9: const NS = getNpzNamespace();
    10: const ENGINE_FILE = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', `${NS}-npz-engine.json`);
    11: 
    12: type ScoreRecord = {
    13:   laneId: number;
    14:   score: number; // lower is better
    15:   lastSuccess?: number;
    16:   lastFailure?: number;
    17: };
    18: 
    19: type EngineStore = Record<number, ScoreRecord>;
    20: 
    21: let store: EngineStore = {};
    22: 
    23: // decay parameters
    24: const DECAY_INTERVAL_MS = 60 * 1000; // every minute
    25: const DECAY_FACTOR = 0.9; // multiply score by this every decay interval (towards 0)
    26: 
    27: function ensureDir() {
    28:   const dir = path.dirname(ENGINE_FILE);
    29:   if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
    30: }
    31: 
    32: function load() {
    33:   try {
    34:     if (fs.existsSync(ENGINE_FILE)) {
    35:       const raw = fs.readFileSync(ENGINE_FILE, 'utf8');
    36:       store = JSON.parse(raw) as EngineStore;
    37:     }
    38:   } catch (e) {
    39:     store = {};
    40:     console.warn('[npz-engine] load failed, starting with empty store', String(e));
    41:   }
    42: }
    43: 
    44: function persist() {
    45:   try {
    46:     ensureDir();
    47:     fs.writeFileSync(ENGINE_FILE, JSON.stringify(store, null, 2), 'utf8');
    48:   } catch (e) {
    49:     console.warn('[npz-engine] persist failed', String(e));
    50:   }
    51: }
    52: 
    53: function applyDecay() {
    54:   const now = Date.now();
    55:   let changed = false;
    56:   for (const k of Object.keys(store)) {
    57:     const id = Number(k);
    58:     const rec = store[id];
    59:     if (!rec) continue;
    60:     // compute how many intervals since lastSuccess/lastFailure (use lastFailure as activity reference)
    61:     const ref = rec.lastFailure || rec.lastSuccess || now;
    62:     const intervals = Math.floor((now - ref) / DECAY_INTERVAL_MS);
    63:     if (intervals <= 0) continue;
    64:     const factor = Math.pow(DECAY_FACTOR, intervals);
    65:     const newScore = rec.score * factor;
    66:     if (Math.abs(newScore - rec.score) > 1e-6) {
    67:       rec.score = newScore;
    68:       changed = true;
    69:     }
    70:   }
    71:   if (changed) persist();
    72: }
    73: 
    74: load();
    75: 
    76: // schedule periodic decay in-memory (best-effort)
    77: setInterval(() => {
    78:   try { applyDecay(); } catch (e) { console.warn('[npz-engine] applyDecay errored', String(e)); }
    79: }, DECAY_INTERVAL_MS);
    80: 
    81: /**
    82:  * Adjust lane score.
    83:  * delta: positive increases penalty (worse), negative decreases (better).
    84:  * latencyMs: optional latency observed to weight the delta.
    85:  */
    86: export function scoreLane(laneId: number, delta: number, latencyMs?: number) {
    87:   let rec = store[laneId];
    88:   if (!rec) rec = { laneId, score: 0 };
    89:   // weight delta by latency (if provided): normalized over 1000ms
    90:   let weight = 1;
    91:   if (latencyMs && latencyMs > 0) weight += Math.min(5, latencyMs / 1000); // cap weight
    92:   rec.score = (rec.score || 0) + delta * weight;
    93:   if (delta < 0) rec.lastSuccess = Date.now();
    94:   if (delta > 0) rec.lastFailure = Date.now();
    95:   store[laneId] = rec;
    96:   persist();
    97: }
    98: 
    99: export function getLaneScore(laneId: number) {
   100:   const rec = store[laneId];
   101:   if (!rec) return 0;
   102:   // apply decay relative to now on read (non-persistent)
   103:   const now = Date.now();
   104:   const ref = rec.lastFailure || rec.lastSuccess || now;
   105:   const intervals = Math.floor((now - ref) / DECAY_INTERVAL_MS);
   106:   const factor = Math.pow(DECAY_FACTOR, intervals);
   107:   return rec.score * factor;
   108: }
   109: 
   110: export function orderLanesByScore(lanes: Lane[]) {
   111:   // return copy sorted by score asc
   112:   const out = lanes.slice();
   113:   out.sort((a, b) => getLaneScore(a.id) - getLaneScore(b.id));
   114:   return out;
   115: }
   116: 
   117: export function resetScores() {
   118:   store = {};
   119:   persist();
   120: }
   121: 
   122: export function getStore() {
   123:   return store;
   124: }
   125: 
   126: export default { scoreLane, getLaneScore, orderLanesByScore, resetScores, getStore };
   127: 


============================
FILE: src\utils\npz-metrics.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x41A515
     2: 
     3: import client from 'prom-client';
     4: import { Request, Response, NextFunction } from 'express';
     5: 
     6: client.collectDefaultMetrics();
     7: 
     8: export function metricsMiddleware() {
     9:   const registry = client.register;
    10:   return async function (req: Request, res: Response, next: NextFunction) {
    11:     if (req.path === '/metrics') {
    12:       res.set('Content-Type', registry.contentType);
    13:       res.send(await registry.metrics());
    14:       return;
    15:     }
    16:     next();
    17:   };
    18: }
    19: 
    20: export default metricsMiddleware;


============================
FILE: src\utils\npz-middleware.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x381550
     2: 
     3: import { Request, Response, NextFunction } from 'express';
     4: import { v4 as uuidv4 } from 'uuid';
     5: import { npzRoute } from './npz-router.js';
     6: import npzStore from './npz-store.js';
     7: import npz from './npz.js';
     8: import logger from './logger.js';
     9: import client from 'prom-client';
    10: import { getNpzNamespace } from './npz-config.js';
    11: 
    12: const NS = getNpzNamespace();
    13: const requestDuration = new client.Histogram({
    14:   name: `${NS}_request_duration_seconds`,
    15:   help: 'Duration of NPZ handled requests',
    16:   labelNames: ['gate', 'lane', 'npz_id', 'namespace'] as string[],
    17: });
    18: 
    19: export type NpzMiddlewareOptions = {
    20:   lanes?: any[];
    21:   cookieName?: string;
    22:   cookieMaxAge?: number;
    23: };
    24: 
    25: export function npzMiddleware(opts: NpzMiddlewareOptions = {}) {
    26:   const cookieName = opts.cookieName || `${NS}_lane`;
    27:   const lanes = opts.lanes || undefined;
    28:   const maxAge = opts.cookieMaxAge || 24 * 3600; // seconds
    29: 
    30:   return async function (req: Request, res: Response, next: NextFunction) {
    31:     const start = process.hrtime();
    32:     try {
    33:       // assign npz_id
    34:       const npz_id = (req.headers['x-npz-id'] as string) || req.cookies?.['npz_id'] || uuidv4();
    35:       res.cookie('npz_id', npz_id, { maxAge: maxAge * 1000, httpOnly: true });
    36:       await npzStore.createRequestRecord(npz_id, { path: req.path, method: req.method });
    37: 
    38:       const fullUrl = req.protocol + '://' + req.get('host') + req.originalUrl;
    39: 
    40:       const report = await npzRoute({ method: req.method, url: fullUrl, headers: req.headers as any, body: (req as any).body });
    41: 
    42:       if (report && (report.status || report.body || report.error)) {
    43:         // update record with lane if stored via router
    44:         const rec = await npzStore.getRequestRecord(npz_id);
    45:         const lane = rec?.laneId;
    46:         if (lane !== undefined) {
    47:           res.cookie(cookieName, String(lane), { maxAge: maxAge * 1000 });
    48:         }
    49: 
    50:         // metrics
    51:         const diff = process.hrtime(start);
    52:         const duration = diff[0] + diff[1] / 1e9;
    53:         const gate = (report as any).gate || 'unknown';
    54:         const laneId = (report as any).laneId !== undefined ? String((report as any).laneId) : String(lane || 'unknown');
    55:         requestDuration.labels(gate, laneId, npz_id, NS).observe(duration);
    56: 
    57:         logger.nez('NPZ', `npz_id=${npz_id} gate=${gate} lane=${laneId} duration=${duration.toFixed(3)}s`);
    58: 
    59:         if (report.status) res.status(report.status);
    60:         // set headers (careful with set-cookie)
    61:         if (report.headers) {
    62:           try {
    63:             for (const [k, v] of Object.entries(report.headers)) {
    64:               if (k.toLowerCase() === 'set-cookie') continue;
    65:               res.setHeader(k, v as any);
    66:             }
    67:           } catch (e) {}
    68:         }
    69:         res.send(report.body || (report.error ? String((report as any).error) : ''));
    70:         return;
    71:       }
    72: 
    73:       next();
    74:     } catch (err) {
    75:       logger.warn(`npz-middleware: error ${err}`);
    76:       next();
    77:     }
    78:   };
    79: }
    80: 
    81: export default npzMiddleware;


============================
FILE: src\utils\npz-pourparler.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x94B7C0
     2: 
     3: import crypto from 'crypto';
     4: 
     5: type Message = { id: string; role: 'user' | 'assistant' | 'system'; text: string; t: number };
     6: 
     7: type Session = { id: string; messages: Message[]; createdAt: number };
     8: 
     9: const SESSIONS: Map<string, Session> = new Map();
    10: 
    11: function id() { return Math.random().toString(36).slice(2,10); }
    12: 
    13: export function startSession(systemPrompt = ''): Session {
    14:   const sid = 's_' + id();
    15:   const s: Session = { id: sid, messages: [], createdAt: Date.now() };
    16:   if (systemPrompt) s.messages.push({ id: 'm_' + id(), role: 'system', text: systemPrompt, t: Date.now() });
    17:   SESSIONS.set(sid, s);
    18:   return s;
    19: }
    20: 
    21: export function sendMessage(sessionId: string, role: 'user' | 'assistant' | 'system', text: string) {
    22:   const s = SESSIONS.get(sessionId);
    23:   if (!s) throw new Error('session not found');
    24:   const m: Message = { id: 'm_' + id(), role, text, t: Date.now() };
    25:   s.messages.push(m);
    26:   return m;
    27: }
    28: 
    29: export function getHistory(sessionId: string) {
    30:   const s = SESSIONS.get(sessionId);
    31:   if (!s) return [] as Message[];
    32:   return s.messages.slice();
    33: }
    34: 
    35: export function endSession(sessionId: string) {
    36:   return SESSIONS.delete(sessionId);
    37: }
    38: 
    39: // --- New: ASCII 4-byte encoding + colorize helpers ---
    40: 
    41: function md5First4BytesHex(ch: string): string {
    42:   // return first 4 bytes (8 hex chars) of md5 of the char
    43:   const h = crypto.createHash('md5').update(ch).digest('hex');
    44:   return h.slice(0, 8);
    45: }
    46: 
    47: export function encodeAscii4(text: string): { ch: string; hex4: string }[] {
    48:   const out: { ch: string; hex4: string }[] = [];
    49:   for (const ch of text) {
    50:     out.push({ ch, hex4: md5First4BytesHex(ch) });
    51:   }
    52:   return out;
    53: }
    54: 
    55: function hexToRgb(hex: string) {
    56:   const h = hex.replace('#', '');
    57:   const r = parseInt(h.slice(0, 2), 16);
    58:   const g = parseInt(h.slice(2, 4), 16);
    59:   const b = parseInt(h.slice(4, 6), 16);
    60:   return { r, g, b };
    61: }
    62: 
    63: function byteToColor(b: number) {
    64:   // map single byte [0..255] to a color by expanding into RGB via simple transform
    65:   const r = (b * 3) % 256;
    66:   const g = (b * 7) % 256;
    67:   const b2 = (b * 13) % 256;
    68:   return { r, g, b: b2 };
    69: }
    70: 
    71: export function colorizeAscii4(text: string): string {
    72:   // returns ANSI colored string: for each char produce a colored block based on its 4-byte hex
    73:   const parts: string[] = [];
    74:   for (const ch of text) {
    75:     const hex4 = md5First4BytesHex(ch); // 8 hex chars
    76:     // split into 4 bytes
    77:     const bytes: number[] = [];
    78:     for (let i = 0; i < 8; i += 2) bytes.push(parseInt(hex4.slice(i, i+2), 16));
    79:     // pick a representative color from bytes
    80:     const col = byteToColor(bytes[0]);
    81:     const ansi = `\x1b[48;2;${col.r};${col.g};${col.b}m\x1b[38;2;0;0;0m ${ch} \x1b[0m`;
    82:     parts.push(ansi);
    83:   }
    84:   return parts.join('');
    85: }
    86: 
    87: export default { startSession, sendMessage, getHistory, endSession, encodeAscii4, colorizeAscii4 };


============================
FILE: src\utils\npz-router.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0xB3686C
     2: 
     3: import * as fs from 'fs';
     4: import * as path from 'path';
     5: import { performance } from 'perf_hooks';
     6: import logger from './logger.js';
     7: import client from 'prom-client';
     8: import { getNpzNamespace } from './npz-config.js';
     9: import engine from './npz-engine.js';
    10: 
    11: const NS = getNpzNamespace();
    12: 
    13: export type Lane = { id: number; name: string; url: string };
    14: 
    15: export const DEFAULT_LANES: Lane[] = [
    16:   { id: 0, name: 'primary', url: 'https://api.primary.local' },
    17:   { id: 1, name: 'backup-fast', url: 'https://fast.api.local' },
    18:   { id: 2, name: 'backup-slow', url: 'https://slow.api.local' },
    19: ];
    20: 
    21: const STORE_FILE = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflash', `${NS}-npz-lanes.json`);
    22: const DEFAULT_TIMEOUT = 3000; // ms
    23: const PREFERRED_TTL = 24 * 3600 * 1000; // 24h
    24: 
    25: // Circuit breaker settings
    26: const FAIL_THRESHOLD = 3; // failures
    27: const FAIL_WINDOW_MS = 60 * 1000; // 1m
    28: const COOLDOWN_MS = 5 * 60 * 1000; // 5m
    29: 
    30: type Store = Record<string, { laneId: number; ts: number }>;
    31: 
    32: type CircuitState = {
    33:   failures: number;
    34:   firstFailureTs?: number;
    35:   trippedUntil?: number;
    36: };
    37: 
    38: const circuit: Map<string, Map<number, CircuitState>> = new Map(); // host -> laneId -> state
    39: 
    40: // Prometheus metrics
    41: const laneSuccess = new client.Counter({ name: `${NS}_lane_success_total`, help: 'NPZ lane successes', labelNames: ['host', 'lane', 'namespace'] });
    42: const laneFailure = new client.Counter({ name: `${NS}_lane_failure_total`, help: 'NPZ lane failures', labelNames: ['host', 'lane', 'namespace'] });
    43: 
    44: function ensureStoreDir() {
    45:   const dir = path.dirname(STORE_FILE);
    46:   if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
    47: }
    48: 
    49: function readStore(): Store {
    50:   try {
    51:     if (!fs.existsSync(STORE_FILE)) return {};
    52:     const raw = fs.readFileSync(STORE_FILE, 'utf8');
    53:     return JSON.parse(raw) as Store;
    54:   } catch (err) {
    55:     logger.warn(`npz-router: failed to read store ${err}`);
    56:     return {};
    57:   }
    58: }
    59: 
    60: function writeStore(s: Store) {
    61:   try {
    62:     ensureStoreDir();
    63:     fs.writeFileSync(STORE_FILE, JSON.stringify(s, null, 2), 'utf8');
    64:   } catch (err) {
    65:     logger.warn(`npz-router: failed to write store ${err}`);
    66:   }
    67: }
    68: 
    69: export function getPreferredLane(host: string): number | null {
    70:   const s = readStore();
    71:   const entry = s[host];
    72:   if (!entry) return null;
    73:   if (Date.now() - entry.ts > PREFERRED_TTL) return null;
    74:   return entry.laneId;
    75: }
    76: 
    77: export function setPreferredLane(host: string, laneId: number) {
    78:   const s = readStore();
    79:   s[host] = { laneId, ts: Date.now() };
    80:   writeStore(s);
    81: }
    82: 
    83: export function lanesForHost(host: string, lanes: Lane[] = DEFAULT_LANES): Lane[] {
    84:   const pref = getPreferredLane(host);
    85:   // first let engine reorder by score
    86:   const ordered = engine.orderLanesByScore(lanes);
    87:   // then apply preferred lane override
    88:   if (pref === null) return ordered.slice();
    89:   const idx = ordered.findIndex((l) => l.id === pref);
    90:   if (idx <= 0) return ordered.slice();
    91:   const res = [ordered[idx], ...ordered.slice(0, idx), ...ordered.slice(idx + 1)];
    92:   return res;
    93: }
    94: 
    95: // Circuit breaker helpers
    96: function getCircuitMapForHost(host: string) {
    97:   let m = circuit.get(host);
    98:   if (!m) {
    99:     m = new Map();
   100:     circuit.set(host, m);
   101:   }
   102:   return m;
   103: }
   104: 
   105: export function recordFailure(host: string, laneId: number, latencyMs?: number) {
   106:   const m = getCircuitMapForHost(host);
   107:   const now = Date.now();
   108:   const st = m.get(laneId) || { failures: 0 };
   109:   if (!st.firstFailureTs || now - (st.firstFailureTs || 0) > FAIL_WINDOW_MS) {
   110:     st.failures = 1;
   111:     st.firstFailureTs = now;
   112:   } else {
   113:     st.failures = (st.failures || 0) + 1;
   114:   }
   115:   if (st.failures >= FAIL_THRESHOLD) {
   116:     st.trippedUntil = now + COOLDOWN_MS;
   117:     logger.warn(`npz-router: lane ${laneId} for ${host} tripped until ${new Date(st.trippedUntil)}`);
   118:   }
   119:   m.set(laneId, st);
   120:   try { laneFailure.inc({ host, lane: String(laneId), namespace: NS } as any); } catch {}
   121:   try { engine.scoreLane(laneId, 1, latencyMs); } catch {}
   122: }
   123: 
   124: export function recordSuccess(host: string, laneId: number, latencyMs?: number) {
   125:   const m = getCircuitMapForHost(host);
   126:   m.delete(laneId);
   127:   try { laneSuccess.inc({ host, lane: String(laneId), namespace: NS } as any); } catch {}
   128:   try { engine.scoreLane(laneId, -1, latencyMs); } catch {}
   129: }
   130: 
   131: export function isLaneTripped(host: string, laneId: number): boolean {
   132:   const m = circuit.get(host);
   133:   if (!m) return false;
   134:   const st = m.get(laneId);
   135:   if (!st) return false;
   136:   if (st.trippedUntil && Date.now() < st.trippedUntil) return true;
   137:   // cooldown passed
   138:   if (st.trippedUntil && Date.now() >= st.trippedUntil) {
   139:     m.delete(laneId);
   140:     return false;
   141:   }
   142:   return false;
   143: }
   144: 
   145: // lightweight fetch wrapper that returns {status, headers, body, durationMs}
   146: async function tryFetch(fullUrl: string, options: any = {}, timeout = DEFAULT_TIMEOUT) {
   147:   const controller = typeof AbortController !== 'undefined' ? new AbortController() : null;
   148:   const signalOpt = controller ? { signal: controller.signal } : {};
   149:   const opts = { method: options.method || 'GET', headers: options.headers || {}, body: options.body, ...signalOpt };
   150:   let timer: NodeJS.Timeout | null = null;
   151:   const start = performance.now();
   152:   if (controller) timer = setTimeout(() => controller.abort(), timeout);
   153:   try {
   154:     // prefer global fetch
   155:     let ff: any = (globalThis as any).fetch;
   156:     if (!ff) {
   157:       try {
   158:          
   159:         ff = require('undici').fetch;
   160:       } catch (e) {
   161:         throw new Error('No fetch available (install undici or use Node 18+)');
   162:       }
   163:     }
   164:     const res = await ff(fullUrl, opts);
   165:     const text = await res.text();
   166:     if (timer) clearTimeout(timer);
   167:     const duration = Math.max(0, Math.round(performance.now() - start));
   168:     return { ok: true, status: res.status, headers: res.headers, body: text, durationMs: duration };
   169:   } catch (err: any) {
   170:     if (timer) clearTimeout(timer);
   171:     const duration = Math.max(0, Math.round(performance.now() - start));
   172:     return { ok: false, error: err, durationMs: duration };
   173:   }
   174: }
   175: 
   176: export type NpzRequest = { method?: string; url: string; headers?: Record<string, string>; body?: any; timeout?: number };
   177: export type NpzResponse = { status?: number; headers?: any; body?: string; error?: any; gate?: string; laneId?: number; durationMs?: number };
   178: 
   179: export async function npzRoute(req: NpzRequest, lanes: Lane[] = DEFAULT_LANES): Promise<NpzResponse> {
   180:   try {
   181:     const urlObj = new URL(req.url);
   182:     const host = urlObj.host;
   183:     const ordered = lanesForHost(host) as Lane[];
   184: 
   185:     // attempt primary
   186:     const primary = ordered[0];
   187:     const primaryUrl = req.url.replace(urlObj.origin, primary.url);
   188:     const timeout = req.timeout || DEFAULT_TIMEOUT;
   189: 
   190:     logger.nez('NPZ', `attempting primary lane ${primary.name} -> ${primaryUrl}`);
   191:     const t0 = await tryFetch(primaryUrl, { method: req.method, headers: req.headers, body: req.body }, timeout);
   192: 
   193:     if (t0.ok && t0.status && t0.status < 500) {
   194:       logger.nez('NPZ', `primary succeeded (${primary.name})`);
   195:       setPreferredLane(host, primary.id);
   196:       recordSuccess(host, primary.id, t0.durationMs);
   197:       return { status: t0.status, headers: t0.headers, body: t0.body, gate: 'primary', laneId: primary.id, durationMs: t0.durationMs };
   198:     }
   199: 
   200:     // primary failed -> try fallback(s)
   201:     logger.warn(`[NPZ] primary failed for ${primary.name}, running fallbacks`);
   202:     recordFailure(host, primary.id, t0.durationMs);
   203: 
   204:     for (let i = 1; i < ordered.length; i++) {
   205:       const lane = ordered[i];
   206:       const laneUrl = req.url.replace(urlObj.origin, lane.url);
   207:       logger.nez('NPZ', `trying fallback lane ${lane.name} -> ${laneUrl}`);
   208:       const res = await tryFetch(laneUrl, { method: req.method, headers: req.headers, body: req.body }, timeout);
   209:       if (res.ok && res.status && res.status < 500) {
   210:         logger.nez('NPZ', `fallback lane ${lane.name} succeeded`);
   211:         // set preferred to fallback for next time
   212:         setPreferredLane(host, lane.id);
   213:         recordSuccess(host, lane.id, res.durationMs);
   214: 
   215:         // replay primary with an extra header (T2)
   216:         const replayHeaders = Object.assign({}, req.headers || {});
   217:         replayHeaders['X-NPZ-FALLBACK'] = '1';
   218:         const replayUrl = primaryUrl;
   219:         logger.nez('NPZ', `replaying primary (${primary.name}) with fallback header`);
   220:         const replay = await tryFetch(replayUrl, { method: req.method, headers: replayHeaders, body: req.body }, timeout);
   221:         if (replay.ok && replay.status && replay.status < 500) {
   222:           logger.nez('NPZ', `replayed primary succeeded after fallback`);
   223:           return { status: replay.status, headers: replay.headers, body: replay.body, gate: 'replay', laneId: primary.id, durationMs: replay.durationMs };
   224:         }
   225: 
   226:         // if replay failed, return fallback result
   227:         return { status: res.status, headers: res.headers, body: res.body, gate: 'fallback', laneId: lane.id, durationMs: res.durationMs };
   228:       } else {
   229:         recordFailure(host, lane.id, res.durationMs);
   230:       }
   231:     }
   232: 
   233:     // if all failed, return primary error or generic
   234:     logger.warn('[NPZ] all lanes failed');
   235:     if (t0 && !t0.ok) return { error: t0.error, gate: 'fail', durationMs: t0.durationMs };
   236:     return { status: t0.status, body: t0.body, gate: 'fail', durationMs: t0.durationMs };
   237:   } catch (err) {
   238:     return { error: err, gate: 'error' };
   239:   }
   240: }
   241: 
   242: export function getCircuitState(host: string) {
   243:   const m = circuit.get(host);
   244:   if (!m) return {} as Record<number, CircuitState>;
   245:   const out: Record<number, CircuitState> = {};
   246:   for (const [k, v] of m.entries()) out[k] = v;
   247:   return out;
   248: }
   249: 
   250: export default { DEFAULT_LANES, npzRoute, getPreferredLane, setPreferredLane, lanesForHost, recordFailure, recordSuccess, isLaneTripped, getCircuitState };


============================
FILE: src\utils\npz-store-redis.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0xC27F4F
     2: 
     3: // Redis implementation removed - use in-memory fallback to avoid external dependency.
     4: import { v4 as uuidv4 } from 'uuid';
     5: import { getNpzNamespace } from './npz-config.js';
     6: 
     7: // NOTE: this module intentionally does NOT depend on ioredis anymore.
     8: // It exposes the same async API but stores data in memory with TTL semantics.
     9: 
    10: const NS = getNpzNamespace();
    11: 
    12: type RedisNpzRecord = { id: string; laneId?: number; ts: number; meta?: Record<string, any> };
    13: 
    14: const store = new Map<string, RedisNpzRecord & { expiresAt?: number }>();
    15: 
    16: function nowMs() { return Date.now(); }
    17: 
    18: export async function createRecord(meta?: Record<string, any>) {
    19:   const id = uuidv4();
    20:   const rec: RedisNpzRecord = { id, ts: nowMs(), meta };
    21:   // default TTL 24h
    22:   const expiresAt = nowMs() + 24 * 3600 * 1000;
    23:   store.set(id, Object.assign({}, rec, { expiresAt }));
    24:   return rec;
    25: }
    26: 
    27: export async function updateRecord(id: string, patch: Partial<RedisNpzRecord>) {
    28:   const entry = store.get(id);
    29:   if (!entry) return null;
    30:   const updated = Object.assign({}, entry, patch);
    31:   store.set(id, updated);
    32:   // return shallow copy
    33:   const copy = Object.assign({}, updated);
    34:   delete (copy as any).expiresAt;
    35:   return copy;
    36: }
    37: 
    38: export async function getRecord(id: string) {
    39:   const entry = store.get(id);
    40:   if (!entry) return null;
    41:   if (entry.expiresAt && entry.expiresAt < nowMs()) {
    42:     store.delete(id);
    43:     return null;
    44:   }
    45:   const copy = Object.assign({}, entry);
    46:   delete (copy as any).expiresAt;
    47:   return copy;
    48: }
    49: 
    50: export async function deleteRecord(id: string) {
    51:   return store.delete(id);
    52: }
    53: 
    54: export async function listRecords() {
    55:   const now = nowMs();
    56:   const res: Array<RedisNpzRecord> = [];
    57:   for (const [k, v] of store.entries()) {
    58:     if (v.expiresAt && v.expiresAt < now) { store.delete(k); continue; }
    59:     const copy = Object.assign({}, v);
    60:     delete (copy as any).expiresAt;
    61:     res.push(copy);
    62:   }
    63:   return res;
    64: }
    65: 
    66: export async function clearAll() {
    67:   const n = store.size;
    68:   store.clear();
    69:   return n;
    70: }
    71: 
    72: // helper: not part of original API but useful for tests
    73: export function __internal_size() { return store.size; }


============================
FILE: src\utils\npz-store.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x11D9FC
     2: 
     3: import fs from 'fs';
     4: import path from 'path';
     5: import { createRecord as redisCreate, getRecord as redisGet, updateRecord as redisUpdate } from './npz-store-redis.js';
     6: import { getNpzNamespace } from './npz-config.js';
     7: 
     8: const NS = getNpzNamespace();
     9: // Use .qflush as canonical state directory (was .qflush)
    10: const STORE_DIR = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush');
    11: const REQUEST_STORE = path.join(STORE_DIR, `${NS}-npz-requests.json`);
    12: 
    13: type NpzRecord = {
    14:   id: string;
    15:   laneId?: number;
    16:   ts: number;
    17:   meta?: Record<string, any>;
    18: };
    19: 
    20: let fileStore: Record<string, NpzRecord> = {};
    21: 
    22: function ensureDir() {
    23:   if (!fs.existsSync(STORE_DIR)) fs.mkdirSync(STORE_DIR, { recursive: true });
    24: }
    25: 
    26: function loadFileStore() {
    27:   try {
    28:     if (fs.existsSync(REQUEST_STORE)) {
    29:       const raw = fs.readFileSync(REQUEST_STORE, 'utf8');
    30:       fileStore = JSON.parse(raw);
    31:     }
    32:   } catch (e) {
    33:     fileStore = {};
    34:   }
    35: }
    36: 
    37: function persistFileStore() {
    38:   try {
    39:     ensureDir();
    40:     fs.writeFileSync(REQUEST_STORE, JSON.stringify(fileStore, null, 2), 'utf8');
    41:   } catch (e) {}
    42: }
    43: 
    44: loadFileStore();
    45: 
    46: const ENABLE_REDIS = (process.env.QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS === '1' || String(process.env.QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS).toLowerCase() === 'true');
    47: const USE_REDIS = ENABLE_REDIS && Boolean(process.env.REDIS_URL);
    48: 
    49: export async function createRequestRecord(idOrMeta?: string | Record<string, any>, maybeMeta?: Record<string, any>) {
    50:   if (USE_REDIS) {
    51:     const meta = typeof idOrMeta === 'string' ? maybeMeta : (idOrMeta as Record<string, any> | undefined);
    52:     const rec = await redisCreate(meta);
    53:     return rec;
    54:   }
    55: 
    56:   // file mode: if id provided, use it
    57:   let id: string;
    58:   let meta: Record<string, any> | undefined;
    59:   if (typeof idOrMeta === 'string') {
    60:     id = idOrMeta;
    61:     meta = maybeMeta;
    62:   } else {
    63:     id = (idOrMeta && (idOrMeta as any).id) || (Math.random() + '_' + Date.now()).toString();
    64:     meta = (idOrMeta as Record<string, any>) || undefined;
    65:   }
    66:   const rec: NpzRecord = { id, ts: Date.now(), meta };
    67:   fileStore[id] = rec;
    68:   persistFileStore();
    69:   return rec;
    70: }
    71: 
    72: export async function updateRequestRecord(id: string, patch: Partial<NpzRecord>) {
    73:   if (USE_REDIS) {
    74:     return await redisUpdate(id, patch as any);
    75:   }
    76:   if (!fileStore[id]) return null;
    77:   fileStore[id] = { ...fileStore[id], ...patch };
    78:   persistFileStore();
    79:   return fileStore[id];
    80: }
    81: 
    82: export async function getRequestRecord(id: string) {
    83:   if (USE_REDIS) {
    84:     return await redisGet(id);
    85:   }
    86:   return fileStore[id] || null;
    87: }
    88: 
    89: export default { createRequestRecord, updateRequestRecord, getRequestRecord };
    90: 


============================
FILE: src\utils\npz.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x1553F0
     2: 
     3: import { spawnSync } from 'child_process';
     4: import { existsSync } from 'fs';
     5: import * as path from 'path';
     6: import logger from './logger.js';
     7: import { SERVICE_MAP } from './paths.js';
     8: 
     9: export type ResolveResult = { gate: 'green' | 'yellow' | 'dlx' | 'fail'; cmd?: string; args?: string[]; cwd?: string };
    10: 
    11: function isWindows() {
    12:   return process.platform === 'win32';
    13: }
    14: 
    15: function findLocalBin(moduleName: string, cwd: string): string | null {
    16:   // try node_modules/.bin/<name> or <pkg>/bin
    17:   const localBin = path.join(cwd, 'node_modules', '.bin', moduleName + (isWindows() ? '.cmd' : ''));
    18:   if (existsSync(localBin)) return localBin;
    19:   // try package bin entry via require.resolve
    20:   try {
    21:     const pkgPath = require.resolve(moduleName, { paths: [cwd] });
    22:     return pkgPath;
    23:   } catch {
    24:     return null;
    25:   }
    26: }
    27: 
    28: function resolveViaModuleGate(pkgName: string): { cmd: string; args: string[]; cwd?: string } | null {
    29:   try {
    30:     const pkgPath = require.resolve(pkgName);
    31:     // run via node <pkgPath>
    32:     return { cmd: process.execPath, args: [pkgPath], cwd: path.dirname(pkgPath) };
    33:   } catch {
    34:     return null;
    35:   }
    36: }
    37: 
    38: export function npzResolve(nameOrPkg: string, opts: { cwd?: string } = {}): ResolveResult {
    39:   const cwd = opts.cwd || process.cwd();
    40: 
    41:   // Gate 0: if nameOrPkg matches a known SERVICE_MAP package, prefer local candidates in workspace
    42:   try {
    43:     for (const key of Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP)) {
    44:       if (SERVICE_MAP[key].pkg === nameOrPkg) {
    45:         const tries = SERVICE_MAP[key].candidates || [];
    46:         for (const t of tries) {
    47:           const candidatePath = path.join(cwd, t);
    48:           try {
    49:             if (!existsSync(candidatePath)) continue;
    50:             // prefer dist entry if exists
    51:             const distEntry = path.join(candidatePath, 'dist', 'index.js');
    52:             if (existsSync(distEntry)) {
    53:               logger.nez && logger.nez('NPZ:JOKER', `${nameOrPkg} -> local dist ${distEntry}`);
    54:               return { gate: 'green', cmd: process.execPath, args: [distEntry], cwd: path.dirname(distEntry) };
    55:             }
    56:             // otherwise if package.json with start script exists, prefer npm --prefix <candidate> run start
    57:             const pkgJsonPath = path.join(candidatePath, 'package.json');
    58:             if (existsSync(pkgJsonPath)) {
    59:               try {
    60:                 const pj = require(pkgJsonPath);
    61:                 if (pj && pj.scripts && pj.scripts.start) {
    62:                   logger.nez && logger.nez('NPZ:JOKER', `${nameOrPkg} -> local start script at ${candidatePath}`);
    63:                   return { gate: 'green', cmd: 'npm', args: ['--prefix', candidatePath, 'run', 'start'], cwd: candidatePath };
    64:                 }
    65:               } catch (e) {
    66:                 // ignore
    67:               }
    68:             }
    69:           } catch (e) {
    70:             // ignore candidate
    71:           }
    72:         }
    73:         break;
    74:       }
    75:     }
    76:   } catch (e) {
    77:     // ignore
    78:   }
    79: 
    80:   // Gate 1: GREEN - local bin
    81:   const local = findLocalBin(nameOrPkg, cwd);
    82:   if (local) {
    83:     logger.nez && logger.nez('NPZ:JOKER', `${nameOrPkg} -> ${local}`);
    84:     return { gate: 'green', cmd: local, args: [], cwd };
    85:   }
    86: 
    87:   // Gate 2: YELLOW - module resolution
    88:   const mod = resolveViaModuleGate(nameOrPkg);
    89:   if (mod) {
    90:     logger.nez && logger.nez('NPZ:JOKER', `${nameOrPkg} -> ${mod.cmd} ${mod.args.join(' ')}`);
    91:     return { gate: 'yellow', cmd: mod.cmd, args: mod.args, cwd: mod.cwd };
    92:   }
    93: 
    94:   // Gate 3: DLX - use npm exec as modern fallback, fallback to npx if needed
    95:   try {
    96:     // prefer `npm exec -- <pkg>` which is the modern replacement for npx (npm v7+)
    97:     // This will allow running installed or remote packages consistently.
    98:     logger.joker && logger.joker('NPZ:JOKER', `${nameOrPkg} -> npm exec`);
    99:     return { gate: 'dlx', cmd: 'npm', args: ['exec', '--', nameOrPkg], cwd };
   100:   } catch (err) {
   101:     // last-resort: npx
   102:     try {
   103:       logger.joker && logger.joker('NPZ:JOKER', `${nameOrPkg} -> npx`);
   104:       return { gate: 'dlx', cmd: 'npx', args: [nameOrPkg], cwd };
   105:     } catch (e) {
   106:       logger.warn && logger.warn(`[NPZ:JOKER][FAIL] ${nameOrPkg} cannot be resolved`);
   107:       return { gate: 'fail' };
   108:     }
   109:   }
   110: }
   111: 
   112: export function runResolved(res: ResolveResult): { ok: boolean; status?: number } {
   113:   if (!res.cmd) return { ok: false };
   114:   const args = res.args || [];
   115:   logger.nez && logger.nez('NPZ:JOKER', `running ${res.cmd} ${args.join(' ')}`);
   116:   try {
   117:     const r = spawnSync(res.cmd, args, { stdio: 'inherit', cwd: res.cwd || process.cwd(), shell: false });
   118:     return { ok: r.status === 0, status: r.status ?? undefined };
   119:   } catch (err) {
   120:     logger.error && logger.error(`[NPZ:JOKER] failed to run ${err}`);
   121:     return { ok: false };
   122:   }
   123: }
   124: 
   125: export default { npzResolve, runResolved };


============================
FILE: src\utils\package.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0xB044BC
     2: 
     3: import { join } from "path";
     4: import { existsSync } from "fs";
     5: import { readFileSync } from "fs";
     6: 
     7: export function resolvePackagePath(pkgName: string) {
     8:   try {
     9:     const resolved = require.resolve(pkgName);
    10:     // walk up to package root
    11:     let dir = resolved;
    12:     while (dir && !existsSync(join(dir, "package.json"))) {
    13:       const p = require("path").dirname(dir);
    14:       if (p === dir) break;
    15:       dir = p;
    16:     }
    17:     if (existsSync(join(dir, "package.json"))) return dir;
    18:   } catch {}
    19:   // fallback: node_modules path
    20:   const guess = join(process.cwd(), "node_modules", pkgName);
    21:   if (existsSync(join(guess, "package.json"))) return guess;
    22:   return undefined;
    23: }
    24: 
    25: export function readPackageJson(pkgPath: string) {
    26:   try {
    27:     const content = readFileSync(join(pkgPath, "package.json"), "utf8");
    28:     return JSON.parse(content);
    29:   } catch {
    30:     return null;
    31:   }
    32: }

FILE: src\utils\paths.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x1609C0
     2: 
     3: import { existsSync } from "fs";
     4: import { join } from "path";
     5: 
     6: // Map service names to npm package names and local folder candidates
     7: export const SERVICE_MAP: Record<string, { pkg: string; candidates: string[] }> = {
     8:   rome: { pkg: "@funeste38/rome", candidates: ["./rome", "./Rome"] },
     9:   nezlephant: { pkg: "@funeste38/nezlephant", candidates: ["./nezlephant", "./Nezlephant"] },
    10:   envaptex: { pkg: "@funeste38/envaptex", candidates: ["./envaptex", "./Envaptex"] },
    11:   freeland: { pkg: "@funeste38/freeland", candidates: ["./freeland", "./Freeland"] },
    12:   bat: { pkg: "@funeste38/bat", candidates: ["./bat", "./BAT"] },
    13:   // placeholders for future projects
    14:   // Prefer the apps/spyder-core subpackage so the runtime runs the actual app entrypoint
    15:   spyder: { pkg: "@funeste38/spyder", candidates: ["./spyder/apps/spyder-core", "./spyder/spyder", "./spyder"] },
    16: };
    17: 
    18: export function resolvePaths(detected: any = {}) {
    19:   const out: Record<string, string | undefined> = {};
    20:   for (const key of Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP)) {
    21:     // Prefer local candidate folders when present in the workspace
    22:     const tries = SERVICE_MAP[key].candidates;
    23:     let found: string | undefined;
    24:     for (const t of tries) {
    25:       const p = join(process.cwd(), t);
    26:       if (existsSync(p)) {
    27:         found = p;
    28:         break;
    29:       }
    30:     }
    31:     if (found) {
    32:       out[key] = found;
    33:       continue;
    34:     }
    35: 
    36:     // Fallback to detected package path (e.g., node_modules resolution)
    37:     if (detected && detected[key] && detected[key].path) {
    38:       out[key] = detected[key].path;
    39:       continue;
    40:     }
    41: 
    42:     // allow environment override for spyder
    43:     if (key === 'spyder' && process.env.SPYDER_ROOT) {
    44:       out[key] = process.env.SPYDER_ROOT;
    45:       continue;
    46:     }
    47:   }
    48:   return out;
    49: }
    50: 
    51: export default { SERVICE_MAP, resolvePaths };

FILE: src\utils\redis.ts
============================
============================
     1: // Small helper to create an optional Redis client.
     2: // If QFLUSH_DISABLE_REDIS=1 or no URL is provided, returns null.
     3: 
     4: export function createRedisClient(): any | null {
     5:   const DISABLED = process.env.QFLUSH_DISABLE_REDIS === '1' || String(process.env.QFLUSH_DISABLE_REDIS).toLowerCase() === 'true';
     6:   const url = process.env.QFLUSH_REDIS_URL || process.env.REDIS_URL || '';
     7:   if (DISABLED || !url) return null;
     8:   // Require lazily to avoid forcing ioredis dependency when not used
     9:   try {
    10:     // eslint-disable-next-line @typescript-eslint/no-var-requires
    11:     const Redis = require('ioredis');
    12:     const opts: any = {};
    13:     return new Redis(url, opts);
    14:   } catch (e) {
    15:     return null;
    16:   }
    17: }

FILE: src\utils\safe-fs.ts
============================
============================
     1: // Lightweight safe filesystem helpers used by daemon and apply code
     2: import * as fs from 'fs';
     3: import * as path from 'path';
     4: 
     5: export function ensureParentDir(filePath: string) {
     6:   try {
     7:     const dir = path.dirname(filePath);
     8:     if (dir && !fs.existsSync(dir)) fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
     9:   } catch (e) {
    10:     // ignore
    11:   }
    12: }
    13: 
    14: export function safeWriteFileSync(filePath: string, data: string | Buffer, encoding: any = 'utf8') {
    15:   try {
    16:     ensureParentDir(filePath);
    17:     fs.writeFileSync(filePath, data, encoding);
    18:   } catch (e) {
    19:     // best-effort logging
    20:     try { console.warn('[safe-fs] safeWriteFileSync failed for', filePath, String(e)); } catch (_) {}
    21:   }
    22: }
    23: 
    24: export function safeAppendFileSync(filePath: string, data: string | Buffer, encoding: any = 'utf8') {
    25:   try {
    26:     ensureParentDir(filePath);
    27:     fs.appendFileSync(filePath, data, encoding);
    28:   } catch (e) {
    29:     try { console.warn('[safe-fs] safeAppendFileSync failed for', filePath, String(e)); } catch (_) {}
    30:   }
    31: }
    32: 
    33: export function safeWriteJsonAtomicSync(filePath: string, obj: any) {
    34:   try {
    35:     ensureParentDir(filePath);
    36:     const tmp = filePath + '.tmp';
    37:     fs.writeFileSync(tmp, JSON.stringify(obj, null, 2), 'utf8');
    38:     fs.renameSync(tmp, filePath);
    39:   } catch (e) {
    40:     try { console.warn('[safe-fs] safeWriteJsonAtomicSync failed for', filePath, String(e)); } catch (_) {}
    41:   }
    42: }


============================
FILE: src\utils\secrets.ts
============================
============================
     1: import fs from 'fs';
     2: 
     3: export type SecretOpts = {
     4:   fileEnv?: string; // env var that points to a file containing the secret
     5:   required?: boolean; // throw if not found
     6:   cliAlias?: string; // --alias=value
     7: };
     8: 
     9: export function getSecret(name: string, opts?: SecretOpts): string | undefined {
    10:   // 1) CLI arg form --name=value or --alias=value
    11:   const alias = opts?.cliAlias || name.toLowerCase();
    12:   const cliExact = process.argv.find((a) => a === `--${alias}`);
    13:   if (cliExact) {
    14:     // next arg is the value
    15:     const idx = process.argv.indexOf(cliExact);
    16:     if (idx >= 0 && idx < process.argv.length - 1) return process.argv[idx + 1];
    17:   }
    18:   const cli = process.argv.find((a) => a.startsWith(`--${alias}=`));
    19:   if (cli) return cli.split('=')[1];
    20: 
    21:   // 2) environment variables (exact name or upper-case)
    22:   if (process.env[name]) return process.env[name];
    23:   const up = name.toUpperCase();
    24:   if (process.env[up]) return process.env[up];
    25:   const low = name.toLowerCase();
    26:   if (process.env[low]) return process.env[low];
    27: 
    28:   // 3) file referenced by env var
    29:   if (opts && opts.fileEnv) {
    30:     const p = process.env[opts.fileEnv];
    31:     if (p && typeof p === 'string' && fs.existsSync(p)) {
    32:       try {
    33:         return fs.readFileSync(p, 'utf8').trim();
    34:       } catch (e) {
    35:         // ignore read errors
    36:       }
    37:     }
    38:   }
    39: 
    40:   if (opts && opts.required) throw new Error(`${name} required but not provided`);
    41:   return undefined;
    42: }

FILE: src\utils\tokens.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0xD439BD
     2: 
     3: import { randomBytes } from "crypto";
     4: 
     5: export function generateToken(len = 24) {
     6:   return randomBytes(len).toString("hex");
     7: }
     8: 
     9: export function resolveTokens(existing: Record<string, any> = {}) {
    10:   const out: Record<string, string> = {};
    11:   for (const name of ["A-11", "SPYDER", "BAT", "KEYKEY", "NEZLEPHANT"]) {
    12:     out[name] = existing[name] || generateToken(12);
    13:   }
    14:   return out;
    15: }
